description: LAKE TAHOE, Nev., June 4 Gov. Patrick J. Lucey of Wis consin, contending that the na tion's economy was faltering and the Federal Government's programs were at a standstill, today called upon President Nixon to resign.

title: FUTURE OF RELIEF CONCERN FOR CITY
description: The city is concerned about the future of services for the aged, blind and disabled after Jan. 1, when the Federal Gov ernment will assume a large share of the responsibility for their care.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: 40 Hospitals in Accord on Back Pay

title: Race Discrimination Found In U.S. Fire Departments
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  A staff member of the National Commission on Fire Prevention and Control charged today that there is outrageous racial dis crimination in the nation's fire departments.

title: HASIDIC JEWS' LINES ASSAILED BY BLACKS
description: Black residents of the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn said yesterday that they were determined to remove police barriers that have been erected in the area at the request of Hasidic Jews.

title: Charging Misuse of Data, S.E.C. Also Names 3 Firms
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 The Securities and Exchange Commission brought fraud charges today against Bausch & Lomb, Inc., and three New York investment firms for al leged misuse of inside informa tion involving shares of the Rochester optical company.

title: The Island of A  Bomb Memories
description: TINIAN, Marianas Islands In the movie Twelve O'Clock High, an American visiting England many years after World War II bicycles out to the airstrip from which his bomber squadron flew raids over Germany. All is silent as he gazes at the overgrown runway and looks for some sign of what was before.

title: Chess: Cuellar Off to a Grim Start At the Leningrad Interzonal
description: LENINGRADTo lose at chess is bad enough. No one not the most untried nov ice or the most experienced grandmaster  can truly shrug off a loss and not feel somewhere that he failed be cause of inadequacy. It hurts to lose.

title: Notes on People
description: The resignation of Herbert G. Klein, the White House Communications Director since the start of the first Nixon Administration, was accepted by the President with deepest personal re gret. Mr. Klein, whose resig nation takes effect July 1, will become a vice president with Metromedia, Inc., with headquarters in Los Angeles.

title: 4 Are Found Guilty In Plot to Smuggle Heroin From France
description: Four members of a heroin smuggling ring said to have been principals of the socalled LatinAmerican connection, were convicted by a Federal jury in Brooklyn yesterday of conspiring to import and dis tribute 132 pounds of the nar cotic, valued at $30million.

title: S.E.C. HALTS TRADING OF COASTAL STATES
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (Reu ters)The Securities and Ex change Commission said today that it had suspended trading in the securities of the Coastal States Gas Corporation through June 14.

title: Data on Wiretaps Linked To Haldeman and Mitchell
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate Watergate com mitte heard testimony today that political espionage reports had been prepared for a meeting with former Attorney Gen eral John N. Mitchell and had been sent to the White House office of H. R. Haldeman, then a top Presidential aide.

title: Needham Slates Release Of Central Market Plans
description: In the next 30 to 45 days the New York Stock Exchange will release its proposal for a model central securities mar keting system called Centaur, James J. Needham, chairman of the exchange, said yester day.

title: Jews Who Survived Pogrom of '41 Find Their Rumanian Community Succumbing to Lure of Emigration
description: IASI, Rumania  Like ugly lortifications, vaults of dun con crete hover at the edge of the ??, their arched faces glow ?? blindly over the vineyards. Beneath the vaults lie the bodies of 12,000 Jews, victims of Ger man troops and their Rumanian collaborators in the great po grom of Iasi late in June of 1941.

title: STATE PUTS CURB ON UNIT OF EQUITY
description: WASHINGTON, June 6The New York State Insurance De partment disclosed here today that it had told the Bankers National Life Insurance Com pany, an apparently prosper ous New Jersey subsidiary of the Equity Funding Corpora tion of America, that it would not be permitted to sell insur ance in New York for the present unless it put up $1mil lion in new capital.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Air Force Takes 3 Officers Off Cambodia Runs
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Three Air Force officers op posed to continued American bombing in Cambodia have been taken off B52 bombing runs over that country, Penta gon officials disclosed today.

title: Judge Rules Law on Abortions In Montana Is Unconstitutional
description: MISSOULA, Mont., June 5 (AP)A United States District Court judge has declared Mon tana's entire abortion statute unconstitutional, leaving the state with no prohibition against abortions.

title: Judges Found on Bench Only 52% of Day
description: During a sample week, the State Supreme Court justices handling criminal cases in Man hattan were on the bench an average of 3 hours and 21 minutes a day, or 52 per cent of their, nominal working time, a study by the Economic De velopment Council has found.

title: The Hearings Go On
description: The decision of the Senate's Watergate committee to continue its public hearings is no surprise. There was never much likelihood that the committee would accede to the request of Special Prosecutor Archibald Cox for a threemonth suspension of the hearings.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Ervin Panel Shows Deference to Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 Senator Sam J. Ervin. Jr. seemed to be delighted. His thick, dark eyebrows swooped characteristically up and down like the wings of an eagle in flight. The corners of his lips curled with the hint of a satisfied smile. And he listened intently this after noon to the response of Rob ert A. F. Reisner.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 5World trade continued to boom last year despite international monetary uncertainty during part of the year, the International Monetary. Fund reported today.

title: Virginia Seeks Exemption From '65 Voting Rights Act
description: RICHMOND, June 5 (AP)  The Commonwealth of Virginia (filed a complaint today in United States District Court in Washington seeking to remove itself from the provisions of the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

title: 11 Face Navy Trial For a Strike on Ship Off North Vietnam
description: MANILA, June 5 (AP)  The United States Navy announced today that it would open courtsmartial proceedings to morrow in the cases of 11 men charged with going on strike on a vessel doing minesweep ing off North Vietnam.

title: Senate Panel Refuses to Delay Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate Watergate committee voted unanimously this morning to reject yesterday's request from Archibald Cox, the special prosecutor in the Watergate investigation, that its hearings be suspended.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BORINQUEN The most liv ing Puerto Rican art in town marched up Fifth Avenue in the form of a parade last Sunday, but recognition has not ended with that. Today, the American Museum of Na tural History, 77th Street and Central Park West (873 1300), opens a relatively tiny but tidy display called roots of Puerto Rico in its first floor Education Gallery.

title: Shots From Car Kill a Policeman in Ulster Town
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 5 (UPI)A burst of sub machinegun fire from a pass ing automobile killed a police man in the border town of Enniskillen today. Other gun men dumped a man's blind folded body in Clogher, a vil lage one mile from the border of the Irish Republic, the police said.

title: Records: An Opera by Young Mozart
description: Mozart's comic opera La finta giardiniera is not the sort of work you should hurry out to buy if you don't already own recordings of his mature operas. Composed when he was 18, it betrays a persistent naivet of both musical form and dramatic acuity in relation to his op eratic masterpieces.

title: Market Mood: Anxiety but No Panic
description: Gold keeps climbing: It closed at $126 an ounce in London yesterday, almost double the price at which it started the year. The dollar keeps sinking: It has now lost about onefifth of its value in relation to the West German mark since De cember, 1971. The United States has been suffering from its worst inflation in half a century and its most in tense Presidential crisis in a century. Is panic nigh? The answer seems to be no.

title: Dr. Francis W. Gramlich Dead; Dartmouth Philosophy Professor
description: HANOVER, N. H., June 5 (AP)Dr. Francis W. Gramlich, Stone Professor of Intellectual and Moral Philosophy and for mer chairman of the depart ment at Dartmouth College, died last night at his home. He was 61 years old.

title: Patrolman, 37, Slain In Bronx Gun Duel
description: A 37yearold Transit Au thority patrolman was slain in a shootout with two men yes terday in the waiting room of an IRT elevated subway station in the Bronx, the police said. One of the men was a member of the Black Liberation Army, the police said.

title: JOSEPH A. O'CONNOR
description: ROSLYN, L. I., June 5Jo seph A. O'Connor, a vice presi dent of the investment and bro kerage concern of Mitchell, Hutchins & Co., New York, died Saturday in Sands Point. He was 76 years old and lived here.

title: Cahill Goes Out With Head High
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, June 5  There were tears in the eyes of his wife Betty and two of his daughters wept silently tonight when Gover nor Cahill conceded that he had been beaten in the Re publican primary by his con servative challenger, Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: Ryun's Goal in Garden Is Under4Minute Mile
description: Professional track and field moves into Madison Square Garden for the first time to night at 7:30 with a streamlined format, different objectives but the same challenging statistic  a subfourminute mile.

title: U.S. OFFICIAL SEES STRONGER DOLLAR
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  A high Treasury official told Congress today that on balance I would expect the dollar to strengthen in the world's for. eignexchange markets in the weeks ahead.

title: Middle Class Supports Beame; Badillo Is Strong in Inner City
description: A map of the mayoral vote in the New York City primary  superimposed upon politi cians' perceptions of the city's ethnic mosaicshowed Repre sentative Herman Badillo's strength concentrated in two ethnic belts.

title: The Gold Bug Forty Years After
description: PARISOn June 5, 1933, President Franklin Roosevelt signed a bill abro gating the gold standard and forty years later the effects are still being felt.

title: Embattled White House
description: WASHINGTON, June 5A hand some tall young Marine stands out side the door of the White House Executive Office these days, sweating in the early summer heat. But inside, the White House reception room, with Its grandfather clock and its portrait of John Adams and its telephone that doesn't ring but chimes, is quiet and cool.

title: Parking Regulations Suspended for Holiday
description: The City Department of Traffic announced that alter nate sideofthestreet park ing regulations would be sus pended today and tomorrow in observance of Shabuoth, the Jewish commemoration of the giving of the Ten Com mandments.

title: Conflict Charge Studied In Turner's Fraud Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  The Justice Department is trying to learn whether there is a conflict of interest, in a re port that Jerris Leonard, for mer head of the Law Enforce ment Assistance Administration, is representing Glenn W. Turn er, who was indicted on mail fraud charges May 18.

title: 15 Million Trees Destroyed
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 5 (UPI)  The tornadoes that struck Alabama May 27 de stroyed 15 million trees con taining 1.5 billion board feet of lumber, with a Loss of at $3 million, the Alabama Forestry. Commission estimated yester day.

title: Tender by Liquif in Blocked by Court
description: The Federal District Court in New Jersey issued yesterday temporary restraining order against a tender offer by Liqui fin, A.G.A., of Italy to stock holders of the Ronson Corpo ration.

title: PACT ON SHIPPING SET WITH SOVIET
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)The Commerce Depart ment announced today a new shipping agreement with the Soviet Union that provides for higher Soviet payments to American ships carrying grain and other agricultural commo dities to the Soviet Union.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Profiles of the Republican and Democratic Winners
description: TRENTON, June 5  One of the boasts that Represen tative Charles W. Sandman Jr. likes to make is that he has gotten more Federal aid for his district  Cape May  than any other Congress man in the Northeast.

title: Profiles of the Republican and Democratic Winners
description: TRENTON, June 5  One of the boasts that Represen tative Charles W. Sandman Jr. likes to make is that he has gotten more Federal aid for his district  Cape May  than any other Congress man in the Northeast.

title: PENNSY SEEKING A LOAN FROM U.S.
description: Trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company plan to borrow $17,338,504 from the Federal Treasury over 20 years under the Emergency Rail Fa cilities Restoration Act of 1972.

title: The Band Played On, but That's All
description: Don Anderson, an accordi onistband leader thought he had an early indication last night about how Governor Cahill was doing in his bid for renomination. He had been hired to play at the Cahill headquarters at the Ramada Inn in East Bruns wick. Mr. Anderson had played the night before for Abraham D. Beame's celebra tion in the NeW York mayoralty race at the Wal dorfAstoria. He offered a comparison of the two occa sions:

title: SENATE APPROVES OIL ALLOCATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate, expressing intense Con gressional concern over gasoline shortages, voted overwhelming ly today to authorize the Gov ernment to make mandatory allocations of crude oil and oil products to refiners and dis tributors.

title: The Belmont Starts With George
description: George Bennett Cassidy, ruddy, smiling and faultlessly tailored, climbs a short flight of stairs beside the inner rail at Belmont Park and stands watching while assistants lead the horses into the starting gate. The moment the doors are closed, four or five urgent voices rise: No, boss, not yet! No chance, boss! Not ready! Almost immediately, Cassidy's thumb presses the button at the end of an insulated cord. A strident bell rings, doors fly open with a metallic clang, the jockeys whoop like Comanches. They're off in the 105th Bel mont Stakes. In gate at 5:35, the chart in Sunday morning's paper will report. Off at 5:35, Eastern Daylight Time. Start good. With only minor variations, charts have been saying this about every Belmont since June 7, 1930, when Cassidy sent a field of four away and saw Gallant Fox come home in possession of the Triple Crown.

title: NIXON STEP HINTED ON PRICE CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  President Nixon met today with his chief economic advisers, in cluding former Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally, innid mounting speculation that a new move by the Adminis ttation on the wageprice con trol front was in the making.

title: Collectors Taking to Children's Books
description: As easily as the fairy god mother turned a pumpkin into a coach to take Cinderella to the ball, a special kind of collecting mania has turned rare old children's books, figuratively speaking, into pots of gold.

title: Fuchsberg Has Slim Lead In Counting for Judgeship
description: Jacob D. Fuchsberg held lead of fewer than 2,500 votes) last night in the race for the Democratic nomination for chief judge of the state, with Federal Judge Jack B. Wein stein a close second.

title: SANDMAN DEFEATS CAHILL IN NEW JERSEY'S PRIMARY; DEMOCRATS SELECT BYRNE
description: Governor Cahill, unable to overcome repeated charges of corruption against his admin istration, was upset in yester day's Republican gubernatorial primary election in New Jersey, losing his party's nomination to Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: The Theater: A Taming of the Shrew in Stratford
Israeli Chief of Staff Denies Torture of Syrian Captives
description: TEL AVIV, June 5 (Reuters) Israel's Chief of Staff, Lieut. Gen. David Elazar, denied to day that Syrian prisoners of war had been tortured while in Israeli hands.

title: At Any Moment, the Miracle
description: JERUSALEMEvery time that I visit Israel I feel as though I am coming back to a very ancient country, a country that I seem to have forgotten and that I find again, as I remembered it. Christians or Jews, we have the same origins.

title: TROPICAL SPRUE LINKED TO ALGAE
description: Two researchers here have reported finding a probable cause for tropical sprue, the intestinal disease of unknown origin that debilitates millions of people in underdeveloped countries each year.

title: 13% Climb in '73 Trails Earlier Forecasts
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  The Commerce Department re ported today that business plans an increase of 13 per cent in investment in plant an equipment this year, substan tially less than the 19 per cent reported earlier by a McGraw Hill survey.

title: Beanie and Badillo Jabbing As Runoff Drive Is Begun
description: Hours after they had run onetwo in the Democratic mayoral primary and thus qualified for the June 26 run off, Controller Abraham D. Beame and Representative Her man Badillo exchanged political charges.

title: GUNMAN IS SOUGHT AFTER A SHOOTOUT
description: The police searched the East New York section of Brooklyn yesterday for a lanky gunman in connection with a shootout Monday night in a tenement that culminated in the death of his two companions and the serious wounding of a police officer.

title: Aging Institute Bill Gains
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Senate Labor Commitee approved today a bill to create an Institute of Aging in the Na tional Institutes of Health of the Public Health Service. The institute would conduct re search into health problems of elderly persons and into the aging process itself.

title: French Urge U.S. To Support Dollar
description: PARIS, June 5  The United States came under pressure to day to intervene to support the dollar in European exchange markets as the beleaguered currency fell to new lows.

title: Edible Spoons Developed In a Scandinavian Country
description: ROSEMONT, Ill. (UPI)  Edible spoons and aerating straws are in the wind. The Dairy Research. Digest says the spoons were developed in an unnamed Scandinavian country.

title: Belgian Official Resigns in Scandal Over Purchasing
description: BRUSSELS, June 5A high official of Belgium's coalition Government resigned today in the wake of a threeweekold scandal over the procurement practices of the staterun tele phone service.

title: Million Mark Is Topped for 3d Month in Row
description: DETROIT, June 5  Amer icans bought 1,144,300 new cars in May, more than in any month in history. Combined sales of domestic and import ed automobiles topped the mil lion mark in May for the third straight month.

title: INFLATION TO RUN LAST AT YORKERS
description: YONKERS, June 5  To morrow night is OldTimers' Night at Yonkers Raceway, with hot dogs and beer going for 15 cents, soda for a dime and coffee for a nickel. But $2 bet will remain a $2 bet.

title: STOCK SALE BAN CURBED BY COURT
description: TRENTON, June 5 (AP) The State Supreme Court to day ruled that, unless there is a showing of fraud, the New Jersey Division of Consumer Affairs might not prevent a sale of stock that had been approved by the Federal Gov ernment.

title: Somewhat Forewarned, Sailors From French Navy Visit the City
description: The crews of three visit ing French warships were swept by rumors yesterday test one of their number had been killed on the streets of New York, most likely on the West Side, but possibly somewhere else.

title: Straub Paces Area Trials for U.S. Open
description: Austin Straub, an assistant club professional from Wilton, Conn., whose wife is the wo men's metropolitan and Long Island amateur golf champion, led the metropolitan district qualifiers today for the United States Open championship.

title: ... Other Results...
description: Consistent trends are difficult to discern in an initial sifting of the results of the New York primaries. There is some support for the view that this city's votersat least those who turn out for the primaryhave become more conservative. Totals in Democratic mayoral ballot ing show that City Controller Beame and Representative Biaggi together did considerably betterby a margin of 55 per cent to 45than Representative Badillo and Assemblyman Blumenthal, the more liberal candidates; but other candidates seeking nomination to other offices failed to follow such a pattern. Thus, former judge and Bronx County Republican leader Paul Fino, an acknowl edged hardliner, and Assemblyman Vito Battista, a vocif erous conservative, both lost nomination contests for City Council posts.

title: Administration Is Opposing Brownsville Case Payments,
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) The Administration is oppos ing a bill to grant compensa tion to families of 167 black soldiers dishonorably dismissed from the Army in 1906 after the Brownsville shooting incid ent in Texas, Representative Augustus F. Hawkins, Democrat of California, the author of the bill, said today.

title: MSGR. JOSEPH A. KERWIN
description: TUCKAHOE, N. Y. June 5 Msgr. Joseph A. Kerwin, pastor emeritus of the Roman Catho lic Church of the Immaculate Conception, died Sunday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville. He was 82 years old and lived here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 6, 1973

title: MANY SPLIT VOTE IN G.O.P. PRIMARY
description: Voters in the Republican pri mary yesterday split their bal lots in wholesale lots, electing legislative candidates running on the saine line as Governor Cahill and then switching over to cast ballots for Mr. Ca hill's opponent, Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: Advertising: New Creative Chief
description: Revs Korda, who considers being a wife and mother a business asset, is now prob ably the top ranking woman on the creative side of the agency business.

title: WHITE HOUSE SEEN SHIFTING ON DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 5In a reversal of position, the White House said today that it had left open the possibility that logs of President Nixon's con versations with John W. Dean 3d about the Watergate case would be made available to investigators.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON AMEX ANDOTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday for the first time in four sessions, despite the fact that the price of gold closed at a record of $126 an ounce in London.

title: Spying Missions and 2 Wiretaps Laid to Ehrlichman by Officials
description: WASHINGTON, June 5John D. Ehrlichman, President Nix on's former chief domestic ad viser, authorized a series of es pionage missions and at least two previously undisclosed il legal wiretaps beginning in 1969 that were carried out by an ad hoc White House intelli gence group, officials knowl edgeable about the Watergate investigation said today.

title: E. P. A. Downgrades the Threat Of Nitrogen Dioxide to the Air
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Environmental Protec tion Agency said today that nitrogen dioxide was not a widespread air pollution prob lem after all and that a 90 per cent reduction of nitrogen ox ides in auto emissions was not necessary.

title: Byrne Wins in Jersey
description: It appears that New Jersey Democrats have reacted their state's political scandals by nominating a man for Governor with a special reputation for integrity. Former Essex County prosecutor and Superior Court Judge Brendan T. Byrne took a commanding lead over his two major rivals.

title: Roundup: Orioles Send Wood to 2d Loss in Row
description: Wilbur Wood's fluttering knuckleball deliveries don't necessarily qualify as the folly floaters made famous by the exYankee, Steve Ham ilton, but last night Tommy Davis's experience in hitting junk paid off and Wood lost his second game in a row, 74, to the Orioles in Baltimore.

title: People in Sports: Howe, Howe & Howe Nearer Reality
description: It was two Howes and one if yesterday as the Houston Aeros of the World Hockey Association reached an agree ment with Marty and Mark Howe, the sons of Gordie Howe, the retired star. The if involved their father, who was still negotiating a con tract with the Aeros.

title: EUGENE SCHROTT
description: Eugene Schrott, a publicity man who had been with the Columbia Broadcasting System for 20 years until he left re cently, died on Saturday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived in Scars dale, N. Y.

title: Cuba Publicizes Watergate
description: HAVANA, June 5 (Reuters) The Cuban news media have been giving frontpage treat ment to the Watergate affair in a daily profusion of details and comments that contrasts with the discretion observed by the rest of the Communist world.

title: Nations Back a U.S. Plan to Keep Oceans Clean
description: LONDON, June 4 (AP)The world's major seafaring nations agreed today to study a United States proposal for an inter national watchdog committee to see that oceans stay clean.

title: PILOT TESTIFIES SHIP DIDN'T STEER
description: The harbor pilot aboard the American Export Lines contain ership Sea Witch, which rammed an oil tanker in the Narrows early Saturday morn ing, told a maritime board of investigation yesterday that the ship's rudder had failed to re spond moments before the cash.

title: PUBLIC SCHEDULE CUT BY POMPIDOU
description: PARIS, June 5President Pompidou drastically cut his official schedule today, stirring new worry and speculation about his health and provoking demands for more candor about what might be wrong with him.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Oscar de la Renta brought some of the old zip back into the fall fashion showings on Seventh Avenue yesterday. He simply refused to go along with the mommawore itbackintheforties (or maybe it was the fifties) routines that has captivated some other designers. He's also avoided the playitsafe gambit that has most of the fashion business in thrall.

title: Heath Picks 2 to Replace Aides Named in Scandal
description: LONDON, June 5 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Heath an nounced a minor government shuffle today that brought one of his Northern Ireland special ists, Lord Windlesham, into the Cabinet in the wake of a call girl scandal that brought the resignation of two other minis ters.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, JUNE 5When a Princeton team wins an Ivy League championship, the captain is awarded a white sweater with an orange P. Those who have won white sweaters include Cosmo Iacavazzi, Bill Bradley and Mar jory Gengler. Miss Gengler weighs 120 pounds, is 5 feet 6 inches and wears her blond hair in pigtails when she's on the tennis court.

title: CHILD CLINIC GETS PHYSICIANS VIA TV
description: The Mount Sinai Medical Center is providing fulltime physician coverage for an East Harlem child health station two miles away through the use of twoway cable television.

title: WALLACE TO STAY IN POLITICAL RING
description: LAKE TAHOE, Nev., June 5 Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama said today he had every intention of remaining in national politics and that he was certainly healthy enough now to beat anybody who might run against him for Governor next year.

title: Marine Recruit Dies
description: SAN DIEGO, June 5 (AP) A 17yearold recruit collapsed at the end of a 2mile run and died during training, a Ma rine Corps spokesman said to day. The youth was identified as Pvt. P. R. L. Juroszek of St. Cloud, Minn.

title: Stock Prices Climb
description: The stock market regis tered its first advance in six sessions yesterday. The Dow Jones industrial average climbed 14.90 points to end the session at 900.81, its big gest daily gain since May 24. The upswing was termed technical recovery. Page 63.

title: People and Business
description: Lew R. Wasserman, presi dent and chief executive offi cer of MCA, Inc., has been named chairman, and Sidney J. Sheinberg, executive vice president, has been appointed president and chief operat ing officer. The changes at the big entertainment com plex were expected, follow ing the announcement last month that Jules C. Stein would retire as Chairman at the age of 77.

title: Excerpts From Deposition by Ehrlichman in Democratic Suit in Watergate Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 Following are excerpts from the deposition given under oath by John D. Ehrlichman, former assistant to President Nixon for domestic affairs, in a civil suit by the Democratic National Committee on the Watergate case. The deposi tion was made May 22 and 23 and was released today.

title: House Unit Votes to Extend Debt Limit
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The House Ways and Means Coan ??nittee agreed today to a tem ??orary extension of the $465 million statutory debt ceiling, ejecting for now the increase ?? $20 billion that had been re ??iuested by the Administration.

title: Favorable Economic News Buttresses Technical Gain
description: A technical rebound but tressed by some favorable eco nomic announcements propelled stock prices higher yesterday in steppedup trading.

title: Excerpts From Testimony Before Senate Committee on Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Following are excerpts from a transcript of testimony to day in the sixth day of hear ings on the Watergate case by the Senate Select Commit tee on Presidential Campaign Activities:

title: DR. H. HERBERT FOX, A RESEARCH CHEMIST
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5Dr. H. Herbert Fox, whose research in organic chemistry led to the development of isoniazid, an effective remedy in combating tuberculosis, died Friday when a raft overturned in north eastern Utah. His age was 60.

title: Arms Negotiators Meet
description: GENEVA, June 5 (Reuters) Soviet and American negoti ators met for 90 minutes at the United States mission here to day in current talks on limiting offensive stategic nuclear weap ons. As usual, officials de clined to give details of the secret discussions. The session was the 22d in a series that began March 12.

title: Chile Halts June Shipment Of Copper in Mine Strikes
description: RANCAGUA, Chile, June 5 (Reuters)  Chile was forced today to suspend shipments of copper, her major export item, because of lingering strikes at two of the country's largest mines.

title: Jets Swap Davis, O'Neal For Saints' Fagan, Adkins
description: In an effort to improve their punting game, the New York Jets obtained Julian Fagan of the New Orleans Saints, along with Margene Adkins, a wide receiver, in a trade yesterday for Bob Davis, a backup quar terback, and Steve O'Neal.

title: Mrs. Collins Wins Illinois House Race For Husband's Seat
description: CHICAGO, June 5 (AP)Mrs. Cardiss Collins easily won to day the Congressional House seat left vacant by the death of her husband, and former Representative Roman C. Pucin ski returned to elective office with a victory in one of four Alderman races in Chicago.

title: TV STATIONS ADD U.P.I. FILM SERVO
description: United Press International Television News has begun to supply stations across the coun try with a daily wirefed selec tion of filmed reports for their locally edited news shows.

title: Liddy Threat to Kill Magruder Reported in Ehrlichman Data
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 John D. Ehrlichman says he was told last year that G. Gor don Liddy had threatened to kill Jeb Stuart Magruder.

title: PILOT TESTIFIES SHIP DIDN'T STEER
description: The harbor pilot aboard the American Export Lines contain ership Sea Witch, which rammed an oil tanker in the Narrows early Saturday morn ing, told a maritime board o investigation yesterday that the ship's rudder had failed to re spond moments before the crash.

title: Nastase Routs Pilic in French Final
description: PARIS, June 5 (AP)Ilie Nastase sent a stream of back hands past Nikki Pilic am routed him, 63, 63, 60, today to win the $135,000 French open tennis champsionship for the first time. The first prize was $15,500.

title: To Domestics, a Minimum Wage Is a Raise
description: AUBURN, Ala.  Queen Esther Parker, who worked as a housemaid here isn't quite surelike many other Americanswhat the mini mum wage is these days.

title: WHITE HOUSE SEEN SHIFTING ON DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 5In a reversal of position, the White House said today that it had left open the possibility that logs of President Nixon's con versations with John W. Dean 3d about the Watergate case would be made available to investigators.

title: Partial Combination of Exchange Firms Expected by July 1
description: DuPont Glore Forgan, Inc., and Walston & Co., Inc., two large stock brokerage houses in which H. Ross Perot, the Texas computer millionaire, has major investments, announced yesterday that they had reached an agreement in prin ciple for a partial consolidation.

title: Kissinger Reaches Paris For His Talks With Tho
description: PARIS, June 5 (AP)Henry A. Kissinger arrived in Paris to night for his latest round of talks with Le Due Tho on how to make the Vietnam peace agreement work.

title: Southern Conference Head Expected to Be Appointed
description: MYTRLE BEACH, S.C., June 5 (AP)Southern Conference athletic directors and faculty chairmen are holding their an nual summer gathering at Myrtle Beach amid speculation that a new conference commis sioner will be named.

title: CONFEREES PUT OFF ACTION ON RAID CURB
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  SenateHouse conferees today began trying to reconcile dif fering appropriations bill con taining provisions curbing funds for the bombing in Cam bodia, but they put off further action until Monday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Treaury Secretary Shultz' recent remark about the possibility of seek ing an increase in the Federal gaso line tax for the purposes of reducing gas consumption and relieving infla tionary consumer demand pressures generally is one trial balloon that de serves to be shot down quickly.

title: State Gets Writ to Bar Sale Of Honorary Degrees at $100
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz yesterday won what his office described as the state's first successful effort to enjoin an outofstate college from selling worthless academic degrees to resident of New York State.

title: Flood Insurance Increased
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) President Nixon signed into law today legislation increas ing the amount of protection authorized under a Federal flood insurance program. The new law raises to $6billion from $4billion the total amount of insurance that can be issued under a program ad ministered by the National Flood Insurers Association.

title: Bond Prices Spurt As Prospects Grow For Tighter Curbs
description: News reports that appeared to increase the prospects for tightened economic controls propelled the bond market sharply higher yesterday after noon in fairly active trading. Our phone tur ret lit up like a Christmas tree when it was an nounced the Presi dent was going to meet with his economic ad visers, one specialist in cor porate bonds declared. The market seemed to go slightly beserk.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Columbia Pictures Indus tries, Inc., will sell its build ing at 711 Fifth Avenue and move a major part of its in tegrated entertainment com plex to California soon.

title: Teacher Turning In Her Chalk at 82
description: SWEDESBORO, (AP) June 5 At the age of 82, Mildred West is giving up teaching.Miss West, who may be the nation's oldest public school teacher, will end a 62year career on June 14 when Kings way Regional High School closes for the summer.

title: Spying Missions and 2 Wiretaps Laid to Ehrlkhman by Officials
description: WASHINGTON, June 5John D. Ehrlichman, President Nix on's former chief domestic ad viser, authorized a series of es pionage missions and at least two previously undisclosed il legal wiretaps beginning in 1969 that were carried out by an ad hoc White House intelli gence group, officials knowl edgeable about the Watergate investigation said today.

title: Paris Enthralls Rising Throngs of Japanese Tourists
description: PARIS, June 5They roll in on their doubledecked, bubble  domed Paris  Vision buses from the Arc de Tri omphe to the Latin Quarter to Montmartre with their necklaces of cameras. They are spending up a storm on Chanel perfume, Dior scarves, Cardin ties and Vuitton hand bags in boutiques whose windows display ideographs instead of English spoken here.

title: CRAWFORD GETS ACE IN BRITISH AMATEUR
description: PORTHCAWL, Wales, June (AP)  Jim Crawford, a 51 yearold physician from Win stonSalem, N.C. sank a hole inone on the 152yard 14th hole en route to a 3and2 vic tory over C.K. Mammel of Denver today and advanced to the second round of the British Amateur golf championship.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
White and Hart HomerLyle Stops Rally
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 5 Texas baseball fans got their first look tonight at the Yank ees' new look  good hitting, bad pitching.

title: Luf kin, Foe Of Pollution, Leaves Post
description: HARTFORD, June 5Dan W. Lufkin announced today that he was resigning as Con necticut's first Commissioner of Environmental Protection.

title: SENATE APPROVES OIL ALLOCATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate, expressing intense Con gressional concern over gasoline shortages, voted overwhelming ly today to authorize the Gov ernment to make mandatory allocations of crude oil and oil products to refiners and dis tributors.

title: MANY SPLIT VOTE IN G.O.P. PRIMARY
description: Voters in the Republican pri mary yesterday spilt their bal?? lots in wholesale lots, electing legislative candidates running on the same line as Governo?? Cahill and then switching ove?? to cast ballots for Mr. Ca?? hill's opponent, Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: Soviet Embassy Denies It Had Pentagon Papers
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI)The Soviet Embassy denied today that it had been given copies of the Pen tagon papers in June, 1971.

title: BROKERAGE FEE RISE URGED SOON BY S.I.A.
description: The Securities Industry As sociation, the trade group for brokerage and investment firms, urged yesterday the promptest possible action to provide for an upward adjustment in com mission rates.

title: MAYOR DALEY GREETS 16 CHINESE NEWSMEN
description: CHICAGO, June 5 (AP) Calling ChineseAmericans the finest family people in our city, Mayor Richard J. Daley extended honorary Chicago citizenship today to 16 visit ing Chinese journalists.

title: Miss Smith's 72 Gains Lead By 2 Shots in Eastern Golf
description: PITTSBURGH, June 5 (AP)  Lancy Smith of Snyder, N. Y., shot a oneunderpar 72 at Fox Chapel Golf Club today to take the openinground lead in the threeday women's East ern amateur golf tournament.

title: Electrical Industry Negotiations Apparently Near Crucial Stage
description: Negotiations between the na tion's two largest electrical companies, General Electric and Westinghouse, and the major unions representing their employes appeared yesterday to be approaching a crucial stage.

title: SOYBEANS RECEDE AFTER HIGH IS SET
description: Speculative price jumps in July delivery soybeans con tinued yesterday to a record of $12.90 a bushel. After reaching this level, the futures contract closed at $11.80, down from $12.11 on Monday. Some ob servers wondered if the new high might remain unchal lenged for a while on the Chi cago Board of Trade.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Mayoral Runoff ...
description: The narrowing of the field in Monday's Democratic primary for Mayor gives voters in the June 26 runoff a clearcut choice on the kind of candidate and program best fitted to cope with New York City's monumental problems.

title: Central Park Zoo To Get Patty Cake
description: Patty Cake, the city's No. 1 baby gorilla, will be re turned to her parents at the Central Park Zoo.

title: New Experience for Me, Says Cahill
description: EAST BRUNSWICK, June 5  There were tears in the eyes of his wife Betty and two of his daughters wept silently tonight when Gover nor Cahill conceded that he had been beaten in the Re publican primary by his con servative challenger, Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: Long Hospital Stay For Heart Patients Called Unnecessary
description: The typical heart attack patient spends three or four weeks in the hospital recuper ating. But a team of cardiolo gists at Massachusetts General Hospital has round that, in un complicated cases, the patients do as well with a twoweek hospital stay.

title: EHRLICHMAN ASSERTS HE WAS TOLD MITCHELL CHOSE 3 PLACES TO BUG; ERVIN MAY SUBPOENA NIXON LOGS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell personally chose three sites, including the Watergate complex, for elec tronic bugging of the Demo crats in 1972, according to in formation that John D. Ehrlich man said he gathered for President Nixon earlier this year.

title: CITY FUEL COSTS TO INCREASE 297,
description: The city will have to pay over 29 per cent more than last year for the fuel to heat mu nicipal buildings and to power municipal vehicles as a result of tight oil supplies.

title: Bridge:
description: Many deals leave unsolved questions in their wake. Would the declarer have made his slam if he had been permitted to play it? Or if he had had a different lead?

title: Football Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: 2 L. I. Men Hurt in Crash Of Small Plane in Vermont
description: LUDLOW, Vt., June 5 (AP) Two men from Huntington, L.I., were injured yesterday when their small irplane crashed on takeoff from a private airfield in this Windsor County community.

title: Married, Working, 30 Years OldIs There Room for a Child?
description: She is happily married and has a good job, one in which she now has a growing chance of going places. She is 30 years old or edging close to it. What about a baby? If she is going to have one, she ought to do it pretty soon. But will she? And, it so, when?

title: Nuclear Device Tested
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 13 (AP)A nuclear device with al yield of less than 20,000 tons of TNT was exploded today atl the Nevada test site near here,! the Atomic Energy Commission reported. The blast was det onated in a tunnel 110 miles north of Las Vegas.

title: COLUMBIA PAYOLA PUT AT $250,000
description: The recently dismissed direc tor for artist relations of Co lumbia Records has told in vestigators for the Federal Strike Force Against Organized Crime in Newark that Columbia spent more than $250,000 a year on payola to black radio stations, a source close to the investiga tion said yesterday.

title: Newsman Shield Rejected
description: COLUMBUS, June 5 (UPI) The Ohio House of Represen tatives defeated 62 to 28 to day a proposed constitutional amendment providing a shield to newsmen by permitting them to refuse to reveal confidential sources of information.

title: O'Dwyer Looks to Election And Garelik to a Recount
description: Sanford D. Garelik accepted his defeat as City Council Presi dent with philosophic nonre signation yesterday, and Paul O'Dwyer, who defeated him in Monday's primary mused about what he would like to do with the office.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:

title: French Urge U.S. To Support Dollar
description: PARIS, June 5  The United States came under pressure to day to intervene to support the dollar in European exchange markets as the beleaguered currency fell to new lows.

title: $300Million Budget Reduction Asked by Citizens Group Here
description: The Citizens Budget Commis sion has called for a $300 million cut in Mayor Lindsay's proposed $10,595,000,000 ex pense budget for 197374.

title: SAIGON REPORTS VICTORY IN DELTA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, June 6 (AP)Gov ernment troops beat back a Vietcong and North Viet namese attack in the Mekong Delta, the Saigon command said today. It was the third day of some of the heaviest action since the ceasefire.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Former Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher threat ened to retract his plea of guilty to charges of income tax evasion yesterday after a Federal judge refused disqualify himself from setting the sentence. The threat was made after a lengthy hearing in which the judge, Leonard I. Garth, said the defendant had failed to prove that Judge Garth was biased or had an unnatural in terest in the case.

title: Bench Wallops a 3Run Homer Off Hennigan
description: CINCINNATI, June 5  The medical crisis on the New York Mets was so acute tonight that Jerry Grote was promoted from the 21day disabled list to the 60day list, Tom Seaver was tying Bud Harrelson's shoelaces and 42yearold Willie Mays started in center field for the first time in a month.

title: U.S. Papers Scored By Times of London On Watergate Case
description: LONDON, June 5The Times of London charged in a long editorial today that The Wash ington Post and The New York Times were interfering with the course of justice by publishing Nast quantities of prejudicial matter on the Watergate af fair.

title: BILL ON BASE RENT VETOED BY MAYOR
description: Mayor Lindsay last night's vetoed a bill passed by the City Council that would repeal the Rent Control Law's controver sial maximumbaserent for mula, which permits annual rent increases of up to 7.5 per cent in many controlled apart ments here.

title: GUERRILLAS FREE ARGENTINE AIDE
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 5 Argentine Marxist guerrillas to day released Col. Jacobo Nasif, a regional police commander, who was kidnapped April 26.

title: NIXON AUTHORIZES JET FIGHTER SALES TO & LATIN NATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Secretary of State William P. Rogers announced today that President Nixon  in a break with previous policyhad au thorized the sale of F5E super sonic jet fighter planes to Chile and four other South American countries.

title: Excerpts From Report on Custody of the Baby Gorilla
description: Following are excerpts from the report submitted by Dr. Ronald D. Nadler of the Yerkes Regional Primate Research Center to Parks Commissioner Richard M. Clurman recommending that Patty Cake, the gorilla, he returned to the Central Park Zoo.

title: U.S Pilot Dies in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, June 5 (Reuters)Cambodian officials reported today that an American pilot had been killed when his spotter plane crashed and exploded just after takeoff from the runway at a Phnom Penh airport. The pilot, who was not immediately identified, was the second American flier killed in Cambodia in two weeks.

title: Conviction Is Overturned
description: DENVER, June 5 (UN) The United States Court of Ap peals for the 10th Circuit over turned today the conviction and life sentence imposed against Frank Richard Coppola by a Federal court in Kansas. Coppola was convicted on March 27, 1972, of conspiracy to murder and aiding and abetting in a murder that was carried out at the prison.

title: Nixon Reported Ready to Name Kansas City Police Chief to Head the F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  President Nixon was reported today to be ready to nominate Ps lice Chief Clarence M. Kel ley of Kansas City, Mo., a 61 yearold career lawenforce ment officer, as director of the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Singer Company re ceived a $19.8million Air Force contract to design, develop and test equipment for advanced, ballistic reentry systems, it was announced yesterday.

title: TWO BOMBS FOUND ON SHIP, MAN HELD
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5 (Reuters)A 53year old ad vertising executive was arrested tonight after a series of tele phone bomb threats were made to a Norwegian passenger cruiser and two bombs were found aboard the ship at sea.

title: Beame and Badillo Jabbing As Runoff Drive Is Begun
description: Hours after they had run onetwo in the Democratic mayoral primary and thus qualified for the June 26 run off, Controller Abraham D. Beame and Representative Her man Badillo exchanged political punches.

title: $34.2Million Suit Filed
description: A $34.2million treble damage countersuit was filed against the United Aircraft Corporation yesterday in Atlanta by Mc Clain International, Inc., an aircraft engine parts maker. McClain responding to a $750, 000 suit filed last January by United Aircraft accused United Aircraft of attempting to mo nopolize the aircraft engine re placement parts manufacture and repair industry.

title: Paul Vincent Zumbo, 50, Jersey Reporter for News
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 5 (AP)Paul Vincent Zumbo, the senior New Jersey correspond ent for The Daily News, died today in a local hispital. He was 50 years old.

title: SALE OF TV STATION IN HARTFORD IS SET
description: The PostNewsweek Stations formally agreed yesterday to buy;; television station WTIC in Hartford from the Travelers Corporation for $33.9million.

title: U.S. Demands Curbs On Foreign Fishing Off the East Coast
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, June 5 (Reuters)The 16na tion International Commission for Northwest Atlantic Fish eries opened its annual meeting here today with the United States demanding a limit to catches off its east coast.

title: Despite Pay Rise, Guard Is Still Shy of Men
description: TRENTON, June 5The New Jersey Army National Guard, despite recent pay increases, improved benefits and better working conditions for its re cruits, is suffering a serious manpower shortage.

title: Turnpike Offers Plan For Toms River Link
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, June 5 (UPI)The New Jersey. Turn pike Authority unveiled a plan today to reduce the amount of land required in connecting the Toms River Expressway with the Turn pike.

title: Next Best to Triple Crown: Three Times as No.
description: Sham had looked good in his final workout for the Belmont Stakes and Frank (Pancho) Martin wasn't con ceding anything to anybody.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: EPSOM, England, June 5 (AP)Nelson Bunker Hunt's Noble Decree was made the cofavorite today for tomor row's Epsom Derby. The oddsmakers rated the 3yearold colt a 61 choice to emulate Nijinsky, Mill Reef and Roberto and give the United States its fourth triumph in four years.

title: Conductors to Join 5 U.S. Symphonies On $50,000 Grant
description: Five American conductors will be given special posts with American symphony orchestras next season under a new pro gram administered by Affiliate Artists and supported by a grant of $50,000 from the Exxon Corporation. The project will give the conductors the opportunity to work with the orchestras' music directors, to conduct and, particularly, to help develop the orchestras' services to the community.

title: PIHL ASSUMES LEAD IN TITLE DECATHLON
description: BATON ROUGE, La., June 5 (AP)Raimo Pihl of Brigham Young University turned in a blazing 48.8second time in the 400meter dash, the final event of the night, to take a 79point lead at the midway point of the National Collegiate decath lon championship.

title: COLUMBIA PAYOLA PUT AT $250,000
description: The recently dismissed director for artist relations of Co lumbia Records has told in vestigators for the Federal Strike Force Against Organized Crime in Newark that Columbia spent more than $250,000 a year on payola to black radio stations, a source close to the investiga tion said yesterday.

title: Why Athens Acted
description: ATHENS, June 5For SOME months there appears to have been a growing feeling among the former colonels leading Greece that they had to dc something new.

title: Japan Declines Request To Join Vietnam Panel
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, June 6 (AP)  The South Vietnamese Gov ernment said today that it asked Japan to replace Can ada as a member of the in ternational truce commission but that Japan declined.

title: Epics and Episodes
description: JERUSALEMIn the sweep of swift victory we called it the SixDay War; a name which suggests more its rapid ity than its gravity. Yet it was hell, as war always is, and eternity for those who did not return.

title: Chagall, in Soviet, Weeps On Seeing His Early Art
description: MOSCOW, June 5 (AP)Cha gall rediscovered Chagall here today and he wept. The en counter took place on the ground floor of the Tretyakov Museum between Marc Chagall and three paintings he left in Russia over 50 years ago and had not seen since.

title: Shots From Car Kill a Policeman in Ulster Town
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 5 (UPI)A burst of sub machinegun fire from a pass ing automobile killed a police man in the border town of Enniskillen today. Other gun men dumped a man's blind folded body in Clogher, a vil lage one mile from the border of the Irish Republic, the police said.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:

title: PRISONER A SUICIDE; 8TH HERE THIS YEAR
description: A 27yearold drug addict awaiting trial on a charge of murder was found hanged in his cell early yesterday in the Brooklyn House of Detention for men.

title: SANDMAN DEFEATS CAHILL IN NEW JERSEY'S PRIMARY; DEMOCRATS SELECT BYRNE
description: Governor Cahill, unable to overcome repeated charges of corruption against his admin istration, was upset in yester day's Republican gubernatorial primary election in New Jersey, losing his party's nomination to Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.

title: Pakistani, in World Court, Calls India's Policy Illegal
description: THE HAUGE, June 5 (Reu ters)Pakistan accused India in the World Court today of having illegally detained more than 92,000 Pakistani prisoners of war and civilian internees for over 17 months.

title: National League
description: Wednesday, June 6, 1973

title: U.S. MUST CLARIFY ROLE ON RADICALS
description: DETROIT, June 5A Federal judge today ordered the Gov ernment to disclose whether it had used illegal burglaries, sab otage, electronic surveillance, agents provocateurs or other espionage techniques against Weatherman militants.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI) Secretary of State. William P. Rogers said today that some concern was registered in Latin America during his re cent visit over the effect of the Watergate scandal on Presi dent Nixon's conduct of for eign affairs.

title: A NORTHSIDE PLAN URGED AT HEARING
description: Representatives of the Lind say administration, private in dustry and labor unions warned a City Council committee yes terday that delays in permit ting a corporation to expand in Brooklyn would not only force the company to leave the City, but would also make it in creasingly difficult for the city to keep other businesses and to attract new ones.

title: ISRAEL CONDEMNED IN AIRLINER DOWNING
description: MONTREAL, June 5 (AP) An International Civil Aviation Organization report released to day condemns Israel for shoot ing down a Libyan airliner over the Sinai desert, killing 108 persons.

title: EHRLICHMAN ASSERTS HE WAS TOLD MITCHELL CHOSE 3 PLACES TO BUG; ERVIN MAY SUBPOENA NIXON LOGS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell personally chose three sites, including the Watergate complex, for elec tronic bugging of the Demo crats in 1972, according to in formation that John D. Ehrlich man said he gathered for President Nixon earlier this year.The information, Mr. Ehrlich man testified, was supplied to him by Jeb Stuart Magruder, who was second in command at

title: Mets' First Draft Pick Bats and Throws LR
description: When the Mets' first turn came in baseball's freeagent draft yesterday, Joe McDon ald, the director of minor league operations, called, Lee Mazzilli. He bats rightleft. Throws rightleft.

title: Gov. Edwards's Son Seized
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 5 (UPI) Gov. Edwin Edwards's 18 yearold son, Stephen Randolph, was involved in a minor colli sion yesterday and arrested for careless operation of a motor vehicle.

title: Paper Thief Draws 30 Days
description: A 24yearold man convicted yesterday in Manhattan Crim inal Court of stealing a bundle of 40 sections of the Sunday New York Times was sentenced by Judge George Roberts to 30 clays in jail. The accused, Anthony Carter, who said he was unemployed and lived in the Bretton Hall Hotel, 86th Street and Broadway, was spotted by Patrolman Taisto Ahokas early Sunday morning and arrested at 92d Street and Broadway.

title: Data on Wiretaps Linked To Haldeman and Mitchell
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate Watergate com mitte heard testimony today that political espionage reports had been prepared for a meeting with former Attorney Gen eral John N. Mitchell and had been sent to the White House office of H. R. Haldeman, then a top Presidential aide.

title: Patrolman, 37, Slain In Bronx Gun Duel
description: A 37yearold Transit Au thority patrolman was slain in a shootout with two men yes terday in the waiting room of an IRT elevated subway station in the Bronx, the police said. One of the men was a member of the Black Liberation Army, the police said.

title: Reelection Unit's Building Hit by a Suspicious Fire
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) A fire listed as of suspicious origin was doused last night in the building containing the offices of the Committee for the Reelection of the President, Washington fire officials said.

title: REOPENED ANTIOCH REPORTS VANDALISM
description: YELLOW SPRINGS, Ohio, June 5 (UPI)  Antioch Col lege, closed until yesterday by a sevenweek student strike, began trying to catch up on work today. Faculty members and administrators were back on the job, and classes were being held on campus.

title: Cox Request Is Opposed
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., June 5 (UPI)Robert Strauss, Demo cratic National Chairman, said today that Archibald Cox, the special Watergate prosecutor, was wrong in asking that the Senate inquiry into the scandal be halted. Mr. Strauss told a news conference and Demo cratic reception, I don't think there's any place for a special prosecutor to ask the commit tee to cease. I'm not willing to stop it for five minutes, I think he should just get on with his job.

title: U.S. AIDES' VISITS TO. SAIGON CURBED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 5Concerned by a recent series of visits to South Viet nam by senior American mili tary officers, the United States Embassy has issued a directive strictly limiting the number who may enter the country, in formed sources said today.

title: AREA BONTEMPS, WRITER, 70, DIES
description: Ama Bontemps, one of the last surviving members of a group of black writers and poets known as the Harlem Renaissance group, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Nashville. He was 70 years old and was serving as writer in residence at Fisk Uni versity.

title: Judges Found on Bench Only 52% of Day
description: During a sample, week, the State Supreme Court justices handling criminal cases in Man hattan were on the bench an average of 3 hours and 21 minutes a day, or 52 per cent of their nominal working time, a study by the Economic De velopment Council has found.

title: Sadat Crosses Canal for Visit To Troops on Edge of the Sinai
description: CAIRO, June 5  President Anwar elSadat in a symbolic gesture crossed the Suez Canal yesterday and inspected Egyp tian frontline troops on the edge of the Sinai, the vast de sert that is almost totally oc cupied by Israel and that Egypt intends to win back by either diplomatic or military means.

title: USAC Changes Rules, But New Dangers Rise
description: About Motor Sports

title: $25,000 RELIEF FRAUD LAID TO WOMAN HERE
description: A 22yearold Bronx woman Was indicted yesterday on charges of having stolen more than $25,000 from the city's Welfare system in the last three and a half years.

title: . . . and the Chief Judge
description: One race remains undecided. It underscores the folly of popularly electing candidates to serve as Chief Judge of the Court of Appeals, the highest judicial office the state. In the fourway Democratic primary for nomi nation to this post, the least qualified candidate appears to hold a slim lead over the most qualified candidate. With some of the more remote upstate election districts still to report their returns, attorney Jacob Fuchsberg leads Federal District Judge Jack Weinstein.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BLACK PRINCE. By Iris Murdoch. 366 pages. Viking. $7.95.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Judge Opens City's Landlord Records
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice ruled yesterday that finan cial statements of property owners, which are part of city records and which the city has kept confidential for decades, were subject to the city's freedom of information stat ute and open to public and press inspection.

title: Ellsberg Decries Police State Tactics
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5Dr. Daniel Ellsberg said today that the breakin at his psychiatrist's office was part of an execu tive coup planned in the White House to change our form of government to a police state.

title: In Rwanda and Burundi, Bitter Strife, but Calmness Too
description: BUJUMBURA, BurundiThe tiny, mountainous, landlocked East African nations of Burundi and Rwanda are making large, although informal, population exchanges as people flee in the wake of tribal massacres.

title: Greece Seen Reopening Bids on Aerospace Unit
description: ATHENS, June 5The Greek Government has broken off ne gotiations with a Frenchled international aviation group and called for a new round of bids to build a $50million fac tory to serve as the base for an aerospace industry, it was learned today.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 450,000 shares of Barnett Banks of Florida, Inc. common stock at $47 a share was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Salomon Brothers and Loeb, Rhoades & Co. The bank holding company's stock, traded overthe counter, closed unchanged at 46 bid, 47 asked.

title: Bessie Smith's Husband Dies
description: Jack Gee, who was the hus band of Bessie Smith, the late blues singer, died Monday at his home in Philadelphia. He was 84 years old. Mr. Gee, a former policeman, married Miss Smith in 1923, the year her re cording career began, and be came her manager. Since their separation in 1930 he had been active in various business oper ations, according to Chris Al bertson, Miss Smith's biogra pher. He leaves an adopted son, Jack Gee Jr.

title: Arab Merchants in Jerusalem Strike to Mark '67 War
description: JERUSALEM, June 5Arab shopkeepers in East Jerusalem staged a brief general strike this morning to mark the sixth anni versary of the sixday war, but Israeli soldiers move in quickly and forced all but a few to reopen their stores.

title: 200 at Bryant Park Discover Poets Go Well With Lunchtime
description: A tall young poet in a pale apricot pantsuit, her dark hair flowing halfway to her waist, took the microphone in Bryant Park yesterday yesterday to open the summer season of noonhour poetry readings.

title: 7,500 Get Degrees at N.Y.U. Commencement
description: Dr. James M. Hester, the president of New York Uni versity, said at the school's commencement exercises to day that universities should in crease their concern for man as a moral being.

title: Watergate Witness Robert Alan Fernon Reisner
description: WASHINGTON, June 5I imagine what happened was that Fred Malek called Bob one day and told him that if he was interested in doing something different for awhile to see this guy Jeb Magruder.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Gristede Store Accused by City

title: CONRAD CLEARED FOR SPACE WALK
description: HOUSTON, June 5 Space agency doctors assured the Skylab 1 commander, Capt. Charles Conrad Jr. of the Navy, that a brief heart irregularity he experienced earlier in the mission should not interfere with his scheduled space walk on Thursday.

title: A Cobb in the Mob
description: BALTIMORE, June 5 (UPI) Somebody stole first, second and third bases and home plate yesterday at the James Mosher Little League field but didn't get in the boxscore. A thief broke into a playground shed and made off with the bases and plate, valued at $30.

title: U.S. AND MONGOLIA NEGOTIATING TIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 5A State Department official said today that United States and Mongolian diplomats had held a series of unpublicized dis cussions in recent months on establishing diplomatic re lations.

title: TV: Ustinov as England's George III
description: With tonight's The Last Ring of America, the Colum bia Broadcasting System series The American Revolu tion shows some signs of improving. While encourag ing, however, the change hardly provides cause for jubilation. On an arbitrary scale of 10, it might be seen going from 0 to about 2.

title: Noranda Mines Sets Cuts In Shipments, of Copper
description: Noranda Mines, Ltd., an nounced yesterday in Toronto it had informed its customers that it had been forced to in voke a partial force majeure on July, August and September copper shipments because of continuing labor troubles. The company said that longtime customers would have their deliveries trimmed 12 per cent in the third quarter, while new customers added in expec tation of greater mining and refining capacity in Quebec would be cut by 30 per cent.

title: Class Gives M.I.T. $8Million
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 5 (AP)The Massachusetts Insti tute of Technology received an $8.1million gift yesterday from the 328 members of the class of 1923.

title: 6 Students' Murals Vie With Subway's Graffiti
description: A young artists' contest of sorts began underground yes terday in the IRT Seventh Ave nue subway station at Houston Street when six students from Elisabeth Irwin High School, a private school in Greenwich Village, were hanging paintings on the walls of the station as subway cars covered with graf fiti roared into and out of the station.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Stock Prices Climb
description: The stock market regis tered its first advance in six sessions yesterday. The Dow Jones industrial average climbed 14.90 points to end the session at 900.81, its big gest daily gain since May 24. The upswing was termed technical recovery. Page 63.

title: Grace Bumbry as Lady Macbeth
description: Opera history is filled with accounts of singers who changed from one voice part to another, and often back again. Sometimes, as with Melchior or Sutherland, the results have been so impres sive that opera history itself might have been different if the transformations had not occurred.

title: NIXON AUTHORIZES JET FIGHTER SALES TO 5 LATIN NATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Secretary of State William P. Rogers announced today that President Nixon  in a break with previous policyhad au thorized the sale of F5E super sonic jet fighter planes to Chile and four other South American countries.

title: Brooke Doubts Nixon Aides Acted Without His Approval
description: Senator Edward W. Brooke, Republican of Massachusetts, said here yesterday that it is inconceivable to me that per sons close to the President would not have sought his approval in handling the Watergate affair, The Associ ated Press reported.

title: Hearing Date Set len Plea
description: A United States Court of Appeals here has set June 12 for a hearing on a minority stockholders plea that a pro posed recapitalization plan of the Missouri Pacific Railroad be stopped. The plan was ap ??oved by a lower court in March.

title: Athens Vows Fair Vote; Opponents See a Sham
description: ATHENS, June 5 (UPI) The Government today pledged fairness and free dom even under conditions of martial law during next month's referendum on the Greek monarchy, but op ponents of the Government said the people would not really be given a chance to decide.

title: Malavasi Picked by Rams As Defensive Coordinator
description: LOS ANGELES, June 5 (AP) Ray Malavasi, Oakland Raid er linebacker coach for the last two seasons, was named as de fensive coordinator yesterday by the Los Angeles Rams.

title: New Hampshire Files Lawsuit In High Court on Lobster Fight
description: CONCORD, N. H, June (AP)New Hampshire filed suit in the United States Su preme Court today to settle a marine boundary dispute with Maine.

title: NixonDean Logs Will Be Given to Ervin committee
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 After four days of statements followed by retractions, the White House announced today that it would turn over logs of President Nixon's conversations with John W. Dean 3d to the Senate Watergate committee.

title: Henry Hudson Detours Due
description: The city's Transportation Ad ministration announced that southbound traffic on bhe Henry Hudson Parkway between West 231st Street and Broadway in the Bronx would be detoured on five consecutive weekday nights bginning today to per mit resurfacing of the road. The section of the road to be re surfaced will be open to traffic from 5:30 A.M. to 9 P.M. week days and from 5:30 A.M. Satur day to 9 P.M. Monday.

title: Bill to Exempt Phone Company From Some Taxes Scored on L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 6A bill passed by the Legislature that would exempt the New York Telephone Company from taxation on certain equipment it owns that is installed after Dec. 31, 1974, was severely criticized today by Abe Seldin, a former Republican Assembly man from Nassau County and candidate for chairman of the County Board of Assessors.

title: C.B.S. Ends Instant Analysis' of Presidents Talks
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System will cease immediately the practice of providing so called instant analysis follow ing Presidential speeches car tied on its television and radio networks.

title: Experts See How Brooklyn Tries To Combat Its Urban Problems
description: Experts in urban economic development from throughout the country toured Brooklyn in a bus yesterday to see some of the things the city has been doing to counter urban decay and unemployment.

title: French Currency Reserves And Gold Rose in May
description: PARIS, June 6 (Reuters) France's overall gold and con vertible currency reserves rose 319 million francs in May to reach 47.41 billion francs, the Finance Ministry said today. The French franc is currently quoted at about 2370 cents.

title: A COMMISSIONER QUITS IN SYRACUSE
description: SYRACUSE, June 6  Syra cuse Department of Public Works Commissioner Ernest W. Speach resigned this afternoon in the midst of an investiga tion into missing department equipment and charges that the city paid for work done on a red truck he owns.

title: Aspirin Antacid Products Are Said to Aggravate Some Stomach Disorders
description: WASHINGTON, June. 6 Three gastroenterologists told a Senate subcommittee today tha antacid aspirin productsAlka Seltzer in particularcan ag gravate some stomach disor ders whose symptoms the anta cid remedy is supposed to re lieve.

title: ORGANIZED CRIME LINKED TO PAYOLA
description: Federal investigators in Newark believe that their in quiry on payola at Columbia Records has uncovered a clear involvement of organized crime in some segments of the record industry, according to sources close to the case.

title: Liquid Hashish Poses Problem in State
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 6 (AP) State narcotic enforcement officers are in a quandary over how they should proceed against persons arrested for possession of liquid hashish.

title: TWO ENGLISH STARS BOW IN WALES GOLF
description: PORHCAWL, Wales, June 6 (AP)It was a disastrous day for the English at the British amateur golf championship to day as Trevor Homer, the de fending champion, bowed out in the second round and Mike, Bonallack, a fivetime winner; withdrew with an injury.

title: We All Tick Better as Pros
description: For decades, they said it couldn't be done, that pro track would never make it. But it has. With last night's meet at Madison Square Garden, the International Track Association completed a tour of 16 indoor meets. Next year its tour will involve perhaps 30 meets, indoor and outdoor, some in Europe and the Orient, with more athletes and more prize money. In establishing pro track, an event was addedtaking money over the table. Another event was subtractedhassling with Amateur Athletic Union officials. Each move was for the better, be cause as pro track grows, the power the A.A.U. will decrease, notably the dicta torial power of Ollan Cassell, the A.A.U. executive director.

title: SWEDEN APPROVES NEW CONSTITUTION
description: STOCKHOLM, June 6The Swedish Parliament approved new Constitution today that strips the King of his residual powers, lowers the voting age by one year, to 18, and guar antees the right of citizens to hold demonstrations.

title: Consumer Safety Urged
description: The National Business Council for Consumer Affairs urged manufacturers today to supple ment Federal regulation with a greater strengthened volun tary program to improve, the safety of consumer products.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: GOVERNORS URGE FUEL REGULATION
description: LAKE TAHOE, Nev., June 6  The nation's Governors called today for mandatory al location of petroleum supplies by the Federal Government.

title: Pincay Aboard 4 Winners In Row at Hollywood Park
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 6 (AP)Laffit Pincay Jr. rode four consecutive winners at Hollywood Park today, then wound up fourth in the $33,750 Senorita Stakes, captured by Cellist.

title: Bridge: Europe's Best Are Expected To Contend for Cash Prizes
description: Tournaments in Europe are able to offer players some thing that is not available on this side of the Atlantic: cash prizes. These get bigger each year as hotels and re sorts compete to attract en thusiasts from all over the world.

title: New Oil Slick on Coast Laid to Natural Causes
description: GOLETA, Calif., June 6 (UPI)A new oil slick in the Santa Barbara Channel, the scene of an ecological disas ter four years ago, is appar ently the work of nature, not man, and does not seem to threaten Wildlife or beaches, the authorities said yester day.

title: SENATOR CRITICIZES COST COUNCIL PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (AP) Senator William D. Hatha way,. Democrat of Maine, said today that a Cost of Living Council proposal would make meaningless a Congressional requirement for disclosure of profit information by big busi ness after price increases.

title: ... the C.I.A....
description: The memorandums prepared by Central Intelligence Agency officials published in The Times on Monday spell out in painfully clear detail the Nixon Administra tion's effort to pervert the C.I.A. for its own domestic political purposes.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Topographic Maps Useful
description: The soft days of the sixth month are calling young and old to the outdoors, to beach es, to mountains, to hiking trails, to wilderness canoe trips.

title: VICTORS IN JERSEY ASSAYING ISSUES
description: TRENTON, June 6  Pro pelled by the strongest guber natorial primary victories in New Jersey's recent political history, the new Democratic and Republican candidates for Governor prepared today for an election campaign domi nated by the state income tax issue and the Republican cor ruption scandal that led to Gov ernor Cahill's humiliating de feat in yesterday's voting.

title: BIG NUCLEAR BLAST SET OFF IN NEVADA
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 6 (AP)One of the largest under ground nuclear tests ever con ducted at the Nevada Test Site went off on schedule today, causing shock waves felt as far away as Las Vegas.

title: Misses Hogan and Latham Triumph in English Tennis
description: MANCHESTER, England, June 6 (AP)Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., moved through the third round of the Northern, lawn tennis championships to day with a 63, 63 victory over Barbara Downs of Alamo, Calif.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: BOSTONRecalled Ray Culp, righthander, from Pawtucket, and optioned Craig Skok, righthander to Pawtucket.

title: Wire Rope Dumping Alleged
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reu ters)  Steel wire rope from Japan is being sold at less than fair value in the United States, the Treasury Department said today. It is now up to the Tariff Commission to determine if United States industry Is or is likely to be Injured by the practice. Dumping duties then could be imposed.

title: PRICES ARE LOWER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Uncertainty over the antiin flation plans of the Nixon Ad ministration slowed down the buying pace on the American Stock Exchange yesterday and the market closed lower after being higher the day before.

title: FEY MUSCOVITES NOTICE CHAGE
description: MOSCOW, June 6The open ing of the Marc Chagall show here, after decades of denun ciation of the Russianborn ar tist as a formalist, may have been big news in the West, but it has been a nonevent here for the ordinary Russian.

title: COSMOS ATOMS IN H DEADLOCK
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6 The New York Cosmos ran into a wellconditioned team in the Philadelphia Atoms at Veter ans Stadium tonight and barely managed to gain a 11 tie be fore 9, 168 fans.

title: Illinois Elects Its First Black Woman to Congress, on 92% of Vote
description: CHICAGO, June 6With lit tle campaigning and the help of the Cook County Democratic organization, Mrs. Cardiss Col lins was elected yesterday as Illinois' first black Congress woman, gathering about 92 per cent of the vote.

title: Indonesia Toll Put at 1,500
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, June 6 (AP)  Fifteen hundred fisher men have perished on islands east of Bali since April because of storms and floods, the Com munications Department said today. Damage to houses, Gov ernment buildings, mosques and dams has been estimated at more than $7million.

title: HAROLD S. BAUMGARTEN
description: Harold S. Baumgarten, a re tired vice president of the Uris Buildings Corporation, died Tuesday while on a visit to At lanta. He was 76 years old and lived at 174 East 74th Street.

title: Tomasson Returns After a Back Injury To Dance Waltzes
description: Jerome Robbins's An Eve ning's Waltzes, which was given its premiere only a week and a half ago by the New York City Ballet, had its first major cast change Tuesday evening at the State Theater. Helgi Tomasson, recovering from a back injury, essayed the male role in the third section.

title: VICTORS IN JERSEY ASSAYING ISSUES IN NOVEMBER RACE
description: TRENTON, June 6  Pro pelled by the strongest guber natorial primary victories in New Jersey's recent political history, the new Democratic and Republican candidates fat Governor prepared today for an election campaign domi nated by the state income tax issue and the Republican cor ruption scandal that led to Gov ernor Cahill's humiliating de feat in yesterday's voting.

title: Nicklaus Changes Strategy for Open Drills
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., June 6 Can the strategy Jack Nick laus is using help him win next week's United States Open? Only twice in Big Jack's suc cessful professional career has he decided to compete in a golf tournament the week prior to the Open, the game's premier test.

title: Deadline in Cruz Baby Case
