description: PARAMUS, June 7It's perfectly natural that Tim Conheeney became a star distance runner at Paramus Catholic High School. After all, he worked out his own school course on distance running and his two older broth ers were state mile champions.

title: Nixon Names Kelley for F.B.I.; Senate Confirmation Expected
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  After a sixweek search, Presi dent Nixon named Clarence M. Kelley, police chief of Kansas City, Mo., today to be director of the Federal Bureau of In vestigation.

title: Equity Financing
description: A public offering of 1,250,000 common shares of the Florida Power Corporation at $39.125 a share was made yesterday by underwriters man aged by Kidder, Peabody & Co. The company's stock closed at 39, up  on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Argentine Guerrillas Release ExAdmiral Held for 68 Days
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 7 (AP) Francisco Alemn, a retired rear admiral, was freed today after having been held 68 days by kidnappers belonging to the leftist People's Revolutionary Army.

title: Buddy Greco Plays And Sings Casually
description: When Buddy Greco was both pianist and singer with Benny Goodman's orchestra a little more than 20 years ago, it was his work as a pianist that was more apt to catch one's attention than his singing. Since then he has been working as a single and with his own small group, but in 20 years the balance of his talents has not changed noticeably.

title: RELIANCE ELECTRIC PLANS TO DIVERSIFY
description: The Reliance Electric Com pany, a maker of automation equipment, disclosed plans yes terday to diversify. H. D. Luke, chairman of Reliance, said the company had reached tentative plans to move into a totally new field of activity with the acquisition of the Lorain Prod ucts Corporation, a power equipment supplier based in Lo rain, Ohio. The deal, which will be presented for approval of stockholdrs at a meeting to be called next month, provides for the exchange of 1,945,789 shares of Reliance stock for all of Lorain's

title: Iceland Patrol Boat And British Frigate Are in a Collision
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, June 7 (Reuters)  A British warship and an Icelandic patrol vessel collided early today off Ice land's coast, where ships of the two countries have been in dis pute over fishing rights.

title: TV: Reactions Studied
description: People are watching it more but appreciating it less.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: A Bravo for the Authentic Spanish Food
description: The restaurants reviewed here each Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the author's subjective judg ment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable estab lishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: Freight Cars Derailed
description: GILA BEND, Ariz., June 7 (UPI)A train accident near here left two dozen cars of a 123car Southern Pacific freight train derailed 31 roles west of town yesterday.

title: TENNIS PLAYERS WARN OF BOYCOTT
description: ROME, June 7 (AP)  The Association of Tennis Players said today that it would boy cott tournaments that banned Nikki Pilic of Yugoslavia, in eluding Wimbledon. The A.T.P. represents all of the leading tennis players.

title: House Unit Calls for Curb on President's War Powers
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The House Foreign Affairs Com mittee voted today in favor of legislation aimed at limiting the power of the President to com mit American armed forces to combat in foreign countries without Congressional approval.

title: Heavy Fighting Continues For Cambodia Road to Sea
description: BEK CHAN, Cambodia, Fri day, June 8  Heavy fighting for control of Route 4, Phnom Penh's land link to the sea, continued throughout yesterday with Government troops trying to push back strong Communist forces that had cut the road.

title: WHOLESALE PRICES CONTINUE TO SHOW A SHARP ADVANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Wholesale prices continued to increase in May at the highest peacetime rate since World War II, the Labor Department re ported today.

title: 3 Documentaries From China Examine a History
description: The three Chinese films that opened yesterday at the Festival Theater were all made during the last year, obviously for foreign con sumption. Each has an Eng lishlanguage narrationnot too perfectly spokenand each has a fairly obtrusive didactic purpose. There is nothing, say, of the quality of life so marvelously sensed in Michelangelo Antonioni's recent television study of China. But there is a good deal to be learned from movies that have such fasci nating material at their dis posal.

title: A Cautious Lawman
description: WASHINGTON, June 7If Clarence Marion Kelley were ever to appear in civilian clothes in a lineup with a handful of other unidentified men, The authorities would have little difficulty in spot ting him for what he is a police chiefand always has beena lawman. At least, that was the view in the White House today as the Pres ident introduced the man who, the Senate willing, will be the new director of the Federal Bureau of Inves tigation, highlighting a ca reer of 21 years with the agency and a dozen more as police chief of Kansas City, Mo. Mr. Kelley is a 6foot 200pounder, with thick hands, bull neck and slicked back silver hair.

title: Court Lifts Restrictions In Compensation Study
description: TRENTON, June 7A court ruling that barred the New Jersey State Commission of In vestigation from publicly identi fying targets of its inquiry into alleged abuses, misconduct or fraud in workmen's compensa tion settlements was tempo rarily set aside today.

title: PRICES ARE DOWN FOR COMMODITIES
description: Trading on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday nearly came to a standstill after the open ing when prices of soybeans, corn and wheat plunged the daily permissible price limit. The limit is 40 cents a bushel in soybeans, except for the July delivery, which has no limit, and 10 cents in wheat and corn.

title: Krogh Won't Talk To Jury Voluntarily On Coast BreakIn
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7 (AP) Egil Krogh Jr. has refused to appear before a county grand jury investigating the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ells, berg's former psychiatrist, Div trict Attorney Joseph Busch said today.

title: Stocks Stage Late Spurt; Dow Ahead 11.44 Points
description: The stock market turned in a strong performance yester day spurred by investors' grow ing conviction that the Admin istration would soon be forced to introduce new economic measures to halt the inflation ary spiral.

title: The Gasoline Shortage: Real or Contrived?
description: WASHINGTONIs the gaso line shortage genuine or con trived?

title: Egypt Said to Urge Mirage Jets for Saudis
description: WASHINGTON, June 7An Administration official said to day that Egypt was urging Saudi Arabia to buy French built Mirage fighterbombers instead of American F4 Phan toms offered by Washington in recent weeks.

title: Yankees Lead, 50, but Lose, 75
description: ARLINGTON, Tex., June 7 The talk of the day among the Yankees concerned the deals that made Sam McDowell and Pat Dobson part of them; the question of the night was where they were when the Yankees needed them.

title: Joseph Neal Sings at New Supper Club
description: A new supper club called Alexander the Great has opened on the second floor of the restaurant on 46th Street just west of Broadway that once was Dinty Moore's, and Joseph Neal, one of the army of performers who served in the long run of Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris, is its first attraction.

title: DEATH SENTENCES VOIDED IN ALBANY
description: The State Court of Appeals ruled in Albany yesterday that New York's law allowing exe cution for convicted murderer, of policemen was unconstitu tional because it gave too much discretion to juries.

title: FAIRLEIGH U. CITES FISCAL EXIGENCY
description: RUTHERFORD, June 7The board of trustees of Fairleigh Dickinson University declared today that a financial exigency, exists at the univer sity.

title: City Ballet Students Perform Lively Farewell at Graduation
description: Both curious patrons of New York City Ballet and happy parents of students in its School of American Ballet mingled Wednesday afternoon at graduation performances in the Juilliard Theater. There was a great deal to be seen and enjoyment to be taken from this year's graduating class.

title: Newspaper Aide Elected
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7 (UPI)  Rollan D. Melton, head of Spiede Newspapers of Reno, Nev., has been elected presi dent of the Western Newspaper Foundation, succeeding J. Clif ton Toney of the Folsom, Calif., Telegraph.

title: Central Park Condition Decried
description: The problems of decay, ero sion, disrepair and overuse of Central Park are so extensive they may require as much as $60million over five years to remedy, the city's Adminis trator of Parks, Recreation and Cultural Affairs said yesterday.

title: India's Problerils Growing Worsel
description: NEW DELHI, June 5Prime Minister Indira Gandhi is con fronted with serious economic and political troubles, marked by violent riots across India, widespread hunger, labor un rest and spiraling unemploy ment, and allegations of party corruption and Government mis management.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 3.9 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 170.2 from 166.3 a week ago.

title: LOAN PLOT IS LAID TO 2 V.A. OFFICIALS
description: Two former officials of the Veterans Administration and a realestate appraiser were in dicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn on charges of conspiracy and brib ery in the processing of mort gage loans to former service men.

title: Badillo Picks Up Support Of Bronx Borough Chief
description: With liberal and Reform Democrats rallying to support Representative Herman Badillo, Bronx Borough President Rob ert Abrams, who opposed Mr. Badillo in Monday's primary, endorsed him yesterday for the Democratic mayoral nomina tion.

title: Witness Details Workings Of the Recording Industry
description: The former Columbia Rec ords executive who has been cooperating with Federal au thorities in their investigation of payola and narcotics traffic in the recording industry de tailed yesterday the events that led to his appearance be fore a Federal grand jury, and his decision to tell the Federal Strike Force Against Organ ized Crime in Newark any thing and everything I know about the record business.

title: Queens Prosecutor To Get Hogan Aide For His No. 2 Spot
description: One of District Attorney Frank S. Hogan's key assist antsa man often identified as his possible successor in 1976 will be named to the No. 2 spot in the scandalridden Queens District Attorney's of fice in a ceremony Monday morning.

title: Cahill Gets Bill to Create Refuge Along the Coast
description: TRENTON, June 7The As sembly today approved a con troversial bill establishing an environmental sanctuary along New Jersey's coastline and sent the bill to Governor Cahill for his signature.

title: Return of $782,000 Sought In U.S. Education Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP) In an continuing crackdown on Title I spending, the Gov ernment is asking four more states and a school district in a fifth state to repay a total of $782,562 that was allegedly misspent under the Federal pro gram for educationally disad vantaged children.

title: Egypt Asks Creation of New Palestine
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 7Egypt said today that there could be no stability in the Middle East until the Pales tinian refugees, many of whom continue to live in refugee camps, were given their own sovereign state, whose borders they themselves should help to draw.

title: Public TV Head Recounts Fund Battle
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Henry Loomis, president of the Corporation for Public Broad casting, said today he had talked long and hard to the White House in an attempt to forestall a second veto of legis lation granting twoyear fund ing for public television.

title: A Campaign Aide Admits Lying on Watergate Cash
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  A former official of President Nixon's campaign committee admitted today that he had lied last year in an effort to disguise the dirty tricks nature of cash payments to one of the Water gate conspirators.

title: The Pop Life
description: How can they stand the music that loud, so long?

title: Moscow Asks Tanaka to Postpone Visit but Invites Legislators
description: TOKYO, June 7The Soviet Union has requested a post ponement of Premier Kakuei Tanaka's projected visit to Mos cow, saying it would be incon venient to receive him at the end of August.

title: Rattenni Is Winner Of Federal Appeal In Tampering Case
description: A threejudge Federal Court of Appeals yesterday threw out the conviction of Nicholas Rat tenni, the alleged Mafia leader of Westchester County, for con spiring to influence a juror in an earlier trial.

title: WHOLESALE PRICES CONTINUE TO SHOW A SHARP ADVANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  Wholesale prices continued to increase in May at the highest peacetime rate since World War II, the Labor Department re ported today.

title: Basketball Transactions NATIONAL ASSOCIATION
description: BOSTONSigned Steve Downing, Indiana center, to multiyear contract

title: STATE COURT ENDS DEATH SENTENCES
description: The State Court of Appeals ruled in Albany yesterday that New York's law allowing exe cution for convicted murders of policemen was unconstitu tional because it gave too much discretion to juries.

title: Freight Cars Derailed
description: GILA BEND, Ariz., June 7 (UPI)A train accident near here left two dozen cars of a 123car Southern Pacific freight train derailed 31 mles west of town yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A former member of the Atlantic County Road De partment was sentenced to 36 months in prison, 34 of them suspended, for conspiracy and extorting $1,500 from a road contractor. Chief United States District Court Judge Mitch ell H. Cohen also placed the defendant, Francis J. Southard, 53 years old, on two years' probation and fined him $1,000.

title: CHEM TRACED IN FAT REDUCER
description: The chemical action of a fat reducing agent with a long term potential for obesity con trol has been determined, ac cording to a report presented yesterday to the American Chemical Society.

title: Saigon's Forces Report Killing 16 in 5th Day of Delta Fighting
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, June 8 (AP)Govern ment forces killed 16 Vietcong on the fifth consecutive day of fighting in the Mekong Delta, the Saigon command said today.

title: Black Unit to Share Capital Charity Fund
description: WASHINGTON, June 7  A black charity fund here has reached agreement with the traditional Community Chest organization to share in fund raising efforts and monies col lected, an agreement with sig nificant national implications.

title: Harlem Nursing Alumnae Recall Early Racial Snubs
description: The 50th anniversary of Harlem Hospital's School of Nursing has lured back more than a thousand graduates happily reminiscing, attend ing teas and balls and din ners and proudly displaying their name tags, their maroon and gold nurses pins and their pride in the school.

title: Voice of America Sets Watergate News Curb
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 (AP)The Voice of America may no longer carry news about the Watergate scandal based on information from unnamed sources.

title: Business Briefs
description: Joint U.S.Yugoslav Oil Venture Is Set

title: SCIENTISTS SCORE RESEARCH POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Nine Nobel Prize winners speaking for themselves and 8,000 other scientists, sent letter to President Nixon today protesting the Administration's policies in funding medical re search.

title: Chess:
description: LENINGRAD, June 7At a midnight supper for the scattering of foreign players who arrived early for the In terzonal tournament, Colonel Baturinski, head of the Soviet Chess Federation, proposed a vodka toast to our pleasant sojourn in Leningrad. To which Svetozar Gligoric, the Yugoslav grandmaster, cut in with: But you forgot to wish us bad play.

title: To Halt Inflation
description: The latest report on wholesale pricesshowing a 2.1 per cent jump in May, which is 25.2 per cent at an annual rateis a devastating blow to the Administra tion's contention that inflation would slow down after April and that Phase 3 was working just fine.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: People in Sports: Nance Returns as a Jet
description: Jim Nance, who was a blubbery 262 pounds in Feb ruary, won his battle with weight, and that won him a contract with the New York Jets. Nance, who was released by the Philadelphia Eagles one week before the start of the 1972 National Football League season, was signed as a free agent yesterday. He weighs 238 now. He had been traded to the Eagles by the New England Patriots, last July 25.

title: Books of The Times
description: THERE IS A TREE MORE ANCIENT THAN EDEN: By Leon Forrest. Foreword by Ralph Ellison. 163 pages. Randoin House. $5.95.

title: Fugitive Trapped in Brooklyn StakeOut
description: A 20yearold man described by the police as one of the wanted members of the Black Liberation Army, and sought in connection with a bank rob bery here, was arrested yester day morning in a police and Federal stakeout in Brooklyn.

title: Hiding of Agnew Funds Is Investigated
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 7 (AP)Investigations were be gun today to determine whether Maryland law was violated by false entries on financial state ments filed by organizers of 1972 fundraising affair honor ing Vice President Agnew.

title: Chamber Planning A More Active Role On Far East Trade
description: David L. Yunich, chairman of the board of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry, dis closed yesterday plans for the chamber to take a more active role, in sponsoring trade with the Far East.

title: A Patient's Right to Die Upheld in Suit on Surgery
description: EASTON, Pa., June 7 (AP) A 60yearold female patient at Allentown State Hospital has a right to die rather than sub mit to surgery for possible breast cancer, a judge has ruled.

title: Earnings at U.S. Shoe Off in Quarter
Weekend Entrees: Smoked Pork and Eggplant
description: In the menus below, the dishes marked with an as terisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: Winning numbers drawn on June 7 were:

title: MobLinked Conduits Get Subpoenas in Payola Case
description: A Federal grand jury in Newark has subpoenaed offi cers of nonexistent trucking companies, limousine services, airline ticket agencies and other concerns that allegedly were links for payoffs from record companies to Mafia fig ures, sources close to the case said yesterday.

title: The New Nixon Staff
description: President Nixon's new White House staff answers some of the questions on the public mind but not by any means all the questions. He has changed the men, but has he changed the system? Has he installed at the center of power a truth squad or a rescue squad?

title: Government Defies Court on Releasing Weatherman Taps
description: DETROIT, June 7 (AP)The Federal Government has de clined to hand over a set of wiretap logs to four defendants in an alleged Weatherman bombing conspiracy case here.

title: ARNOLD F. SCHERER
description: FORT WAYNE, Ind., June 7 (AP)Arnold F. Scherer, re tired Fort Wayne newspaper executive and the father of a National Broadcasting Compa ny correspondent, Ray Scherer, died yesterday. He was 80 years old.

title: M'AFEE PREFERS DISTANCE RUNNING
Philip Morris Expansion Set
description: The board of directors of Philip Morris, Inc., has author ized a $25million capital ex penditure program for the mod ernization and a 35 per cent expansion of plant capacity of its wholly owned subsidiary, the Miller Brewing Company,

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Parks Administrator Rich ard M. Clurman said that Central Park was the great est single asset for leisure the city has, but was in such poor shape it might need $20million to $60mil lion in repairs over a five year period to save it. He announced that a major study was under way to in ventory problems and pro pose solutions. In slides and an a tour, park officials de tailed the problems, includ ing polluted, siltfilled lakes, soil erosion, tree decay, cracked roads, and crumbling buildings and bridges.

title: Excerpts From Haldeman's Statements in May to Attorneys for Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 Following are excerpts from a deposition made by H. R. Haldeman on May 22, 24 and 25 under examination by two attorneys, Maurice R. Dunie, representing the Dem ocratic National Committee, and Charles A. McNelis, representing Lawrence F. O'Brien, former chairman of the Democratic National Com mittee:

title: HOUSE BILL SEEKS CURB ON IMPOUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 House Democrats' introduced today legislation to temper the President's power to impound Congressionally appropriated funds.

title: Glasgow Blast Kills One
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, June (AP)One man was killed and six were injured early today by an explosion in the oilrig construction yard of the Mara thon Manufacturing Company, a concern based in Texas. The police said a piece of an oil rig had been blown 70 yards across the installation. The Marathon concern had taken lover the yard from John Brown, the shipyard that built the Queen Mary and the Queen Elizabeth.

title: LABORITES OFFER A NEW PROGRAM
description: LONDON, June 7Britain's Labor party, troubled by inter nal divisions, a loss to the governing Conservatives in a recent public opinion poll and a sense of having grown slug gish and indecisive over the last decade, introduced a new pro gram today aimed at reviving its old fighting image.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FILMS The 20th cycle of films in the twoyearold Anthology Film Archives, at the Public Theater, 425 Lafayette Street, near Astor Place (6773197), begins to night, starting with one of the special programs that have been inserted into the series on Friday nights. The more than 100 films in this most private and intimate of movie houses (you sit in hooded seats, shielded from your neighbor in order to strengthen the ties between the individual and the screen) are chosen by a fivemember committee.

title: Met Patio Adorned By Italian Sculpture
description: The Metropolitan Museum's Blumenthal Patio, which is often a rather chillylooking room with an antiseptically preserved look and which has also served as reluctant host to some altogether in compatible exhibitions, has been turned into just about the most gracious single spot in the museum by a new ex hibition, Early Renaissance Sculpture From Northern Italy. Small in size, low in key and tops in quality, the exhibition has been brought into such delightful harmony with its setting that it seems a shame it must ever be broken up. The closing date, is Nov. 30.

title: Nixon Plan to Consolidate Drug Enforcement Wins Victory in House
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 President Nixon's plan to con solidate all drug enforcement activities into a single unit un der the Justice Department won a victory in the House today.

title: Innovative Design and Planning Take Shape in Lower Manhattan
description: New York destroys and renews itself periodicallyfor better or worse. Consen sus and cynicism usually have it for worse, but there are exceptions to every rule. The exception right now is Lower Manhattan, where a combination of economic vitality, determined business leadership and revo lutionary urban design are creating a new city while erasing the old one. The differ ence is that the new construction is not a result of traditional specu lative building processes, but of the city's conscious care and guidance and original planning thought. That, in New York, is a definite nov elty. The transformation is proceeding on a grand scale, and it, is beginning to be strikingly visible now.

title: British Name Panel On Security Aspect Of CallGirl Scandal
description: LONDON, June 7 (UPI)The Government named a fiveman commission headed by a jurist today to investigate whether security was endangered in the recent scandal in which two ministers, Earl Jelliooe and Lord Lambton, resigned after con fessing to relationships with call girls.

title: A Campaign Aide Admits Lying on Watergate Cash
description: WASHINGTON, June 7A former official of President Nixon's campaign committee admitted today that he had lied last year in an effort to disguise the dirty tricks nature of cash payments to one of the Water gate conspirators.

title: Private Security Guards To Join Midtown Patrols
description: A plan that would join tip private security patrols of mid town skyscrapers into a noc turnal anticrime regiment and complement the police was an nounced yesterday. Under the plan, announced by Mayor Lind say and developed in collabora tion with top corporate execu tives and crime leaders, the new force will soon spread to include the area from 42d to 59th Street and from Second to Seventh Avenue.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating Outlook
description: Fishing Report

title: S.E.C. Censures I.T.T. Unit For Securities Violations
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 The Securities and Exchange Commission issued an order of censure today against I.T.T. Family Security Sales Corpora tion of St. Louis, Mo., and against Gerard M. Hoff, presi dent of the company at the time of its alleged violations of federal securities laws.

title: Elderly Stage Protest on Steps of Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, June 7 About 3,000 elderly persons, many wearing oversized Sen ior Power buttons, gathered on the steps of the Capitol today to petition the Govern ment for a redress of griev ances.

title: ExMiss Riverside Indicted In a Murder in Connecticut
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn. June 7 (AP)A grand jury returned an indictment against a Spring field woman yesterday charging her with the murder of a Winsted woman and intent to murder the woman's husband the same day.

title: SECRETARIAT GETS RAIL FOR BELMONT
description: Secretariat, Pvt. Smiles, My Gallant, Knightly Dawn, Twice a Prince and Sham make up the field, in that post position order, for the Belmont Stakes at Belmont Park tomorrow. These colts were entered yes terday for the classic 12mile test that makes up the third jewel of the Triple Crown for 3yearolds, a crown that Sec retariat is the overwhelming favorite to attain.

title: Retail Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $909million, up 14 Iper cent from the yearearlier $799million. Total retail store sales were about $9.783billion, up 15 per cent from last year's $8.483billion.

title: Alex Bail, Long an Official Of Department Store Union
description: SYOSSET, L. I., June 7Alex Bail, executive vice president of the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union, A.F.L. C.I.O., died today in St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn. He was 73 years old and lived here.

title: Advertising: Cousins's Project
description: Although the takeover of the bankrupt Saturday Re view has not yet been com pleted, ad salesmen for Nor man Cousins's World were out for the first time yester day selling the combined pub lication.

title: MISS WHITWORTH SHARES GOLF LEAD
description: SUTTON, Mass., June 7 (AP) Kathy Whitworth and Chako Higuchi of Japan posted two under par 71's today to share the firstround lead in the $35,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association championship.

title: Saigon Denies It Refuses To Sign Any New Accord
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, June 8  A senior spokesman for the Sa;gon Gov ernment denied today that South Vietnam had refused to sign any new appeal to carry out the Vietnam peace agree ment that may be put forward in Paris by the United States and North Vietnam.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: WILLIAM C. TIERNAN
description: WALDWICK, N. J., June 7 Wiliam C. Titernan, vice pres ident of Rand, McNally & Co., map publishers, died of cancer last night in Memorial Hos pital, New York. He was 54 years old and lived at 58 Grand Avenue.

title: Subsidizing Politics
description: Hugh W. Sloan Jr. painted for the Ervin Committee a dizzying picture of rivers of money flowing into and out of the Committee for the Reelec tion of the President. Much of it was in cash, received and disbursed in great stacks of bills, with G. Gordon Liddy, for example, casually picking up a briefcase packed with $83,000. and Herbert G. Kalmbach spending some cash receiptsit is not clear for whatbefore the money ever reached Mr. Sloan's treasury.

title: Subject A for Governors: Watergate
description: LAKE TAHOE, Nev., June 7 The Watergate scandal hung over the 65th National Gov. ernors Conference this week like a damp, depressing fog, spreading uneasiness among the politically sensitive Governors and leaving its own particular imprint in many states.

title: MRS. VERMONT HATCH
description: Mrs. Nita Cowlishaw Hatch, widow of Vermont Hatch, a partner in the law firm of White & Case until his death in 1959, died yesterday in her home at 40 Fifth Avenue. She was 79 years old and had also lived in CornwallonHudson, where the Hatches' home is now the Storm King Art Center.

title: StakeOut Yields Arrest And 3 Pounds of Heroin
description: The police staked out a sus pected heroin factory in the Corona section of Queens yes terday and last night arrested a 26yearold man for posses sion of three pounds of heroin said to be worth a half million dollars in potential street sales.

title: Brando to Make Appearance on Dick Cavett Show
description: LOS ANGELES, June 7The first public appearance of Mar lon Mrando since he refused to ateend the Oscar ceremonies, it seems, will b on the Dick Cavett television show next week.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Rose 8.8% Over YearAgo Week
description: WASHINGTON, June 7The Association of American Rail roads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.5 billion tonmiles, 8.8 per cent above the corresponding week last year. Both weeks included the Memorial Day holiday. The association also reported rail carloadings in the same week totaled 505,856 cars, 6.1 per cent above last year. The American Trucking Associa tions, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage last week was 9.1 per cent above last year.

title: SCHOOLS IN LIBYA ARE TAKEN OVER
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, June 7 (Reu ters)Revolutionary commit mittees today took over most of Libya's schools, hospitals and banks in the growing re sponse to the call by the coun try's leader, Col. Muammar elQaddafi.

title: People and Business
description: A former leader in the electric utilities industry, Walter T. Lucking, whose special interest had been solar energy, has now moved into the business of selling pure water.

title: WILLIAM REYDEL, 76, AD AGENCY LEADER
description: William Reydel, for many years a leader in the advertis ing agency field, died Wednes day at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 45 Exeter Street, in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Watergate Fans Protest
description: MINNEAPOLIS, June 7 (AP) MinneapolisSt. Paul televi sion stations received a flood of telephoned protests yester day when the local Columbia Broadcasting System affiliate dropped the Watergate hear ings to broadcast a baseball game.

title: U.S. Said to Reject New French Plea To Support Dollar
description: PARIS, June 7With the cur rency markets nervous once more, France today renewed her demand for United States inter vention to support the sagging dollarand the United States was reported to have rejected the demand again.

title: RALLY BY BONDS LOSES MOMENTUM
It Was a Day of Frenzy on Fashion Avenue
description: Yesterday was the day when Seventh Avenue came undone at the seams. The showings were stacked one on top of each other so closely that nobody could get to them allbut a lot of peo ple tried. Lunch was a cup of cottage cheese on the corner of 39th Street, pretzels passed among friends and hard candy for dessert. Shows ran late, viewers left early and on top of all this, retail had a real headache.

title: CONTROLS CORP. SUIT CITES VESCO WASTE
description: The International Controls Corporation, the New Jersey company once controlled by Robert L. Vesco, the New Jer sey financier, sued him in Fed eral court here yesterday for damages for corporate waste.

title: M'AFEE PREFERS DISTANCE RUNNING
description: BATON ROUGE, June 7  Reg McAfee, the first black American to break four minutes in the onemile run, had to quit his high school team to con vince the coach that he was serious about becoming a dis tance runner.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Senate

title: KALMBACH CALLED READY TO TESTIFY ON NIXON EXAIDES
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Her bert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's former personal at torney and longtime associate, has agreed to testify for the prosecution against H. R. Hal deman and John D. Ehrlichman and other former White House officials, if needed, in any Watergate criminal trials, sources close to the case said today.

title: Norway Seeking First Students For Its Arctic Medical School
description: TROMSO, Norway, June 2 Tromso University, a political creation of the Norwegian Gov ernment, is choosing 40 teen agers to become the first group of future doctors at the world's only medical school in the (Arctic.

title: Filthy Avenue
description: Fifth Avenue deserves to be called Filthy Avenue after a typical parade. Throughout spring and summer hardly a Sunday passes without the massive littering, not to men tion congestion, that is the inevitable consequence of the city's compulsive marching. After last Sunday's parade, for example, the, authorities reported that a new record tonnage of trash had to be removed by the Sanitation Department at premium, overtime cost. Last year's com bined postparade litter weighed in at close to 400 tons.

title: GUILD ENDS WALKOUT AT CONSUMERS UNION
description: Three hundred Newspaper Guild members employed by Consumers Union ratified a new threeyear contract yesterday, ending a 16day strike.

title: PRICES ARE HIGHER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthe/ counter market continued to rise yesterday in subdued trad ing.

title: Arena Debut Is Smashing
description: SALT LAKE CITY, June 8 (UPI)  An unemployed 34 yearold Brazilian wielding a pipe, smashed 56 windows at the Salt Palace Sports Arena yesterday afternoon. Officials estimated the damage at $30, 000. Security officers saw the man, identified as Omar Alves Pavia, smash the first window and went after him, but before they caught him he had broken 56 windows.

title: S. E. C. CLARIFIES NET CAPITAL RULE
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Securities and Exchange Com mission issued today a series of interpretations intended to clarify the net capital treat ment that should be given to securities positions, transactions and obligations during a period in which the security is sus pended from trading.

title: JIM BARBER LEADS BY THREE STROKES
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., June 8  Jim Barber, who until this week had been an obscure cam paigner on the pro golf tour, remained the leader today in the $150,000 Philadelphia. Classic with a 36hole total of 132, or 12 under par. It was one of the best tworound ag gregates compiled on the cir cuit this year.

title: RESERVE RAISES ITS DISCOUNT RATE TO 50YEAR NIGH
Books of The Times
description: TOMS, COONS, MULATTOES, MAMMIES, AND BUCKS. An Interpretive History of Blacks in American Films. By Donald Bogle. Illustrated. 260 pages. Viking. $12.50.

title: Missing Bronx Girl Is Found Asleep In a Vacant Lot
description: Maria Acierno, the 3year old Bronx girl who disappeared last Wednesday, was found yesterday in good condition in a vacant lot in the Bronx, five blocks from where she disap peared according to the police.

title: Seventh Ave. Humming With Fall Apparel Buyers
description: This was the big week for Seventh Avenuethe women's apparel capital of the nationwhen most of the fall lines of readytowear were presented to retail buyers.

title: Epsom Salt Packages Contain Lethal Chemical
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Food and Drug Admin istration alerted consumers today to watch for contain ers labeled as epsom salts that in fact contain a chem ical that could kill children and people with heart trouble.

title: No Hope That It Will Ever End
description: A cloudy day: do you know what that is in a town of ironworks? The sky sank down before dawn, muddy, flat, immovable. The air is thick, clammy with the breath of crowded human beings.

title: Judge Permits Stans to Testify Before Ervin Panel on Tuesday
description: A Federal district judge cleared the way here yesterday for Maurice H. Stans, President Nixon's former campaign fi nance chairman, to testify in Washington next Tuesday be fore the Senate Watergate com mittee.

title: Ernest Warther, 87, Dies; World's Master Carver
description: DOVER, Ohio, June 8 (UPI) Ernest Warther, who carved intricately detailed figures from ivory, hone and wood for 60 years and became known as the world's master carver, died today. He was 87 years old.

title: Dumansky, Potter Triumph In Opening of State Tennis
description: Jeff Dumansky of Leonia, N.J., seeded No. 8, led th6 early advancers by winning a first round match yesterday from Pat DiBlasio of Howard Beach, Queens, 60, 60, as a field of 200 began the New York State Men's tennis championships at the North Shore Tennis and Racquets Club in Bayside, Queens.

title: WINE TALK
description: It was lunch time the other day aboard the visiting French aircraft carrier Foch, and several hundred crew members, most of them youths of 19 or 20, were lined up in the ship's cafe teria waiting for their meal of soup, pork chops, salad and French fries.

title: Operative Texts
description: The President ... shall take care that the laws be faithfully executed.

title: SEOUL RECEPTIVE TO A U.N. DEBATE
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 8  The Foreign Minister of South Korea, Kim Yong Shik, said today that his Government was prepared to take on North Korea at the United Nations next fall in a full debate over the destiny of this divided peninsula.

title: Teams' BoxOffice Staffs Face Scalping Inquiry
description: Boxoffice personnel for all major professional sports teams in the metropolitan area will be called for questioning in Attor ney General Louis J. Lefko witz's investigation of ticket profiteering, state sources said yesterday.

title: SOVIET GAS DEAL OF $10BILLION SET
description: MOSCOW, June 8Dr. Ar mand Hammer, chairman of the Occidental Petroleum Corpora tion, announced today another largescale, longterm business transaction with the Soviet Unionan agreement of intent to move Siberian natural gas to consumers on the West Coast of the United States.

title: Civil Service Chaos
description: The best insurance for keeping government agencies free of strikes is to provide comprehensive machinery for resolving civil service labor disputes through impar tial methods, as called for by New York State's admirable Taylor Law. That sensible procedure is undermined whenever unions or public agencies reject the fact finders' recommendations and insist on having their own way. Most often such rejections have come from willful unions; but sound settlement proposals made by three separate review panels are currently under chal lenge by the state and city governmental units concerned.

title: Navy Jails 4 More in Refusal Of Duties on Ship Off Vietnam
description: MANILA, June 8The United States Navy sentenced four more men today for disobeying superiors and refusing to do their duties aboard the amphib ious transport ship Ogden on March 30 during a minesweep ing operation off North Viet nam.

title: Satellite Launching Put Off Until Tomorrow at Earliest
description: CAPE KENNEDY; Fla., June 8 (UPI)The space agency postponed tonight for at least 24 hours the launching of a small unmanned satellite to ward an orbit around the moon.The shot had been scheduled for tomorrow and was delayed until Sunday morning at the earliest.

title: Inspection Planned On Two Sister Ships In Ramming Inquiry
description: Rear Adm. James W. Mor eau, head of the maritime board of investigation looking into the ramming of the Bel gian oil tanker Esso Brussels by the American Export Is brandtsen Lines containership Sea Witch early Saturday morning, yesterday said he had ordered an inspection of the steering mechanism on two sister ships of the Sea Witch.

title: DOW STOCK INDEX ADDS 10.38 POINTS
description: Expectations that President Nixon will soon announce a new antiinflation program helped the stock market make a sizable advance yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Milburn's 13.1 Lowers N.C.A.A. Hurdles Record
description: BATON ROUGE, June 8 Putting bitter memories behind him, Rod Milburn won a Na tional Collegiate outdoor track and field title tonight with the second fastest performance ever in the 120yard high hurdles, 13.1 seconds.

title: SIDEROWF GAINS FINAL IN BRITAIN
description: PORTHCAWL, Wales, June (AP)Dick Siderowf of Easton, Conn., putting erratically to day but driven by a dogged desire to win, moved into the final round of the British Ama teur golf championship.

title: RADIO MEN SPURN PAYOLA CHARGES
description: Broadcasters representing black  oriented radio stations reacted strongly yesterday to continued allegations that large payola funds within promo tional budgets had been set aside by record companies to induce black disk jockeys to play chosen records.

title: Business Briefs
description: PHILADEPHIA, June 8 (AP)The Penn Central Com pany asked a Federal judge today to extend a July 2 deadline calling for the Penn Central Transportation Com pany to come up with a plan to either reorganize or liquidate its bankrupt railroad operations.

title: Lancers Hand Cosmos First Loss of Year, 21
description: ROCHESTER, June 8The New York Cosmos suffered their first defeat in North American Soccer League play here tonight, a 21 setback by the Rochester Lancers. The game was held at Aquinas Stadium before 4,553 fans.

title: Nixon Asks Graduates to Be Optimistic
description: ORLANDO, Fla., June 8In a rare public appearance, Pres ident Nixon visited Florida Technological University today and delivered a campaignstyle speech that emphasized what is right about this country.

title: GOERING'S WIDOW IS DEAD IN MUCH
description: MUNICH, West Germany, June 8 (UPI)Emmy Goering was Emmy Sonnemann, a wellknown actress of the Nazi era, at her marriage to Her mann Goering, the Nazi Luft waffe commander, died today at the age of 80, a hospital spokesman said.

title: Harriet Walworth Pierpoint Is Bride of Gerard Alford Bos
description: Miss Harriet Walworth Pierpoint, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Powell Pierpoint of slew York and Madison, Conn., was married here yes terday afternoon to Gerard Alford Bos, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerard Karel Bos of Rock Hall, Md., and Manala pan, Fla.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Prosecutor's Aide Warns About Confessions on TV
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  The Watergate special prose cutor's office sought today to persuade the United States Dis trict Court that it should ban all radio and television cover age when two major witnesses go before the Senate Water gate committee for question ing.

title: Rites for Judge Macchia
description: A funeral service for Judge Jo seph A. Macchia of the New York City Civil Court will be held at 9:30 A. M. today at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Vincent de Paul, 115 West 23d Street. Judge Macchia died Thursday in Roosevelt Hospital after heart surgery. He was 57 years old. Interment will be at Holy Name Cemetery in Jersey City.

title: AFTERSCHOOL USE OF SPACE IS URGED
description: Speakers from northern Queens representing community groups, the School Board of District 26, Boy Scouts and Girl Scouts joined yesterday in calling for more funds for after school centers to keep the kids off the streets and out of trouble.

title: FUCHSBERG'S LEAD IN JUDGE RACE SLIPS
description: Jacob D. Fuchsberg's lead in the Democratic primary for chief judge of the state slipped to less than 1,000 votes last night, with only a fraction of the statewide vote still to be counted.

title: Gabriel Is Traded To Eagles by Rams; Unitas Signs Pact
description: Roman Gabriel, the big 32 yearold quarterback with a questionable passing arm, was traded by the Los Angeles Rams yesterday to the Philadelphia Eagles for three high draft choices and two players, Harold Jackson and Tony Baker.

title: Kennedy Links Inaction On Economy to Scandal
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP)  Senator Edward M. Ken nedy, Democrat of Massachu setts, said today that the Ad ministration's preoccupation with Watergate had led to in action on the economic front.

title: Jackson Seized Here
description: City policemen and Fed eral agents yesterday cap tured Andrew Jackson, de scribed as one of the leading members of the Black Libera tion Army. He was wanted on charges of murder and bank robbery. Details, Page 30.

title: RESERVE RAISES ITS DISCOUNT RATE TO 50YEAR HIGH
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Federal Reserve Board raised the discount rate today to 6 per cent, its highest level since 1921.

title: Events Today
description: Opera

title: BADILLO STUMPS In BEANIE LAND
description: Representative Herman Ba dillo tramped the streets of Queens yesterday in search of some of the votes he did not get there last Monday.

title: Told to Attack Peace Units, Alleged Defector Reports
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 8 (AP)A man identified as a North Vietnamese junior officer who said he had de fected to South Vietnam said today he had been ordered to attack international peacekeep ing planes and convoys investi gating alleged Communist vio lations.

title: Joseph B. Zahm Weds Mrs. Anne B. Plastrik
description: Mrs. Anne Berry Plastrik, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Emmons Berry of Ridgewood, N. J., was married here yes terday evening to Joseph Bakst Zahm, son of Dr. and Mrs. William N. Zahm of New York and Moore's Mills, N. Y.

title: 300 Attend Rites for Suicide P.O.W.
description: QUINCY, Mass., June 8 (AP)About 300 persons at tended funeral services for Capt. Edward A. Brudno of the Air Force, the first re turned Vietnam prisoner of war to die. He was carried to his grave by other former P.O.W.'s today, five days after he committed suicide.

title: Dodgers' Rally Beats Mets, 53
description: Not even Tom Seaver, who is as close as one can get to a last resort, could check the downward slide of the New York Mets last night, as he ran into a fourrun sixth inning which gave the Los Angeles Dodgers a 53 victory before 42,500 spectators, Shea Stadi urn's largest crowd of the season.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: ALEXANDER BACLAWSKI
description: MERIDEN, Conn., June 8 (AP)Alexander S. Baclawski, who founded American Indian Tobacco and Enterprises Kinni Kinnick here in the early nine teensixties, died Tuesday at the Veterans Hospital in New ington. He was 59 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Art: Ventures of New Talent Festival
description: Something called the New Talent Festival, by which a group of wellestablished art dealers are making explora tory gestures into the vast fields where worthy but un sung artists languish, opened Tuesday, jointly at the gal leries of the 14 participants. Whether, idealistically or commercially inspired, the idea somewhere behind the project, initiated by Bella Fishko of the Forum Gallery, seems to be that the uptown galleries have been leaving the job of talent scout up to art's Off Broadway, SoHo, and that it's time the legits got back into the act.

title: Notes on People
description: Prime Minister Heath of Britain has accepted an in vitation to visit China, ac cording to diplomatic sources in London. The invitation was reportedly extended by For eign Minister Chi Pengfel of China, who is in London for talks with Mr. Heath and other officials. The date of the Prime Minister's visit is expected to be set later, If Mr. Heath goes to Peking, he will be the first British Prime Minister to have done so since the Communists took control of China in 1949.

title: RECORD EXPECTED FOR AUTO OUTPUT
description: DETROIT, June 8 (AP)  Spurred by the American Mo tors Corporation's highest pro duction in 10 years, major do mestic auto makers expect to reach record production levels this week, according to Au tomotive News.

title: Marilyn Aschner Victor In State Net Final, 6.2, 7.5
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June, 8Topseeded Marilyn Aschner of Holliswood, Queens, won the New York State women's ten nis championship today by de feating, thirdseeded Barbara Goldman of Fort Lee, N. J., 62, 75, at the Beach Point Club.

title: PEAK CROP SEEN IN WINTER WHEAT
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The 1973 winterwheat har yest, now under way in the southern Great Plains, is ex pected to produce a record crop llof 1,315,672,000 bushels, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Greeks in North Greet Changes With Mixed Emotions
description: IOANNINA, Greece, June 8 At dusk Greeks here turn out each night for a mass promenade along the main street, past the statue of a dead hero and the town clock, saying hello to friends they have not seen since the walk of the night before.

title: Russians Say 40 Died In Hijacked Airliner
description: MOSCOW, June 8Soviet sources said today that a hi jacked plane crashed in southern Siberia two weeks ago killing all 40 persons aboard.

title: GOVERNOR VETOES EDUCATION PLAN
description: ALBANY, June 8Governor Rockefeller, often accused of trying to interfere in activities of the State Education Depart ment, vetoed a bill today that would have curbea the State Education Commissioner.

title: 2 SOUGHT IN KILLING OF A POLICE OFFICER
description: The police issued an alarm yesterday for two suspects wanted in the fatal shooting of Police Officer Robert B. Lauren son in a West Side bar early last Saturday morning.

title: Environmental Chief Urges Ban on TaxiCruising in Midtown
description: Herbert Elish, the city's En vironmental Protection Admin istrator, said yesterday that ban on daytime taxi cruising should be instituted in midtown Manhattan this summer as part of the drastic changes in mo tor vehicles use that must be instituted here to achieve clean air standards.

title: ,Saigon Invites Red Cross To Visit Civilian Prisons
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 8 (AP)  South Vietnam has invited the International teague of Red Cross Societies to visit its civilian prison camps, the Government news agency, Vietnam Press, report ed today.

title: GILBERT J. JERTBERG
description: FRESNO, Calif., June 8 (AP)  Gilbert J. Jertberg, senior judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, died at his home here today. He was 76 years old.

title: Antioch Trustee Resigns, Calling Outlook Pessimistic
description: Dr. Alfred J. Marrow, a mem ber of the board of trustees of Antioch. College for the last three years, has submitted his resignation and in a brief letter said the outlook [for Antioch] has grown even more pessi mistic.

title: 14 Debutantes Bow at St. Vincent Ball
description: RYE, N. Y., June 8Four teen young women were presented here this evening to Cardinal Cooke of New York at the 11th annual St. Vincent Debutante Ball at the Apawamis Club.

title: Salomon Is Suing to Undo Sears Fund's Equity Sale
description: Salomon Brothers, one of the nation's richest and most powerful investment banking houses, filed suit here yester day against the giant employe pension fund of Sears Roebuck & Co. in an effort to undo Salomon's purchase of 77,100 shares in the Equity Funding Corporation of America.

title: Camden Mayoral Aspirant Fatally Shot on His Estate
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June 8Major B. Coxson, a flam boyant entrepreneur and ex convict who ran second in a field of nine for Mayor of Camden last month, was mur dered in his sumptuous Cherry Hill home before dawn today.

title: Xerox Stirs Zoning Fight in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 8 A battle is shaping up in the affluent back country of this rich commuter town that may have an important effect on the town's development and on affluent suburbs across the country.

title: Many Emergency Units Speed to Scene of Crash
description: Within minutes of the crash at the Mount Vernon station, scores of emergency vehicles had sped through the town's downtown section to converge at the scene.

title: CONNREX INVITES CHLORIDE TENDER
description: The Connrex Corporation, whose primary business is bat tery making, said yesterday it had agreed to invite a tender offer for 70 per cent of its 1.9 million shares of common stock from the Chloride Group, Ltd., a subsidiary of the Chloride Electrical Storage Company of London. The tender price is $16 a share. On the American Stock Exchange yester day, the stock closed at 13, up 2. Previously Connrex had reported that an other of Chloride Electrical's subsidiaries had offered to pur chase either Connrex's battery business for $22.1million, or 67 per cent of the company's com mon shares at $15 a share. Di rectors of Connrex and their families and associates own about 26 per cent of the com common stock.

title: MRS. MEIR ACCEPTS BONN'S INVITATION
description: JERUSALEM, June 8Chan cellor Willy Brandt announced today that Premier Golda Meir had accepted his invitation to make a formal state visit to West Germany.

title: Denver Man Kills Himself
description: DENVER, June 8 (AP)Gary S. Ringsby, a former official of the Denver Rockets of the American Basketball Associa tion, shot himself to death yes terday, the police said.

title: Richardson Shifts Inquiry Into I.T.T. Merger to Cox
description: WASHINGTON, June 8At torney General Elliott L. Rich ardson announced today that he was shifting to Archibald Cox, the special Watergate prosecutor, authority to inves tigate all the ramifications of the merger of the International Telephone and Telegraph Cor poration with the Hartford Fire Insurance Company.

title: Roundup: A Few Tricks Help Twins Beat Orioles
description: Bert Blyleven, Minnesota's 22yearold righthander, won his fourth straight game and pitched his third shutout of the season last night, allow ing two hits as the Twins heat the Baltimore Orioles, 20. Blyleven's hot streak may be due to a handker chief and a tape recorder.

title: Joyce Guilty in Drug Case
description: LUMBERTON, N. C., June 9 (AP)Kevin Joyce, a member of the United States Olympic basketball team, and a former teammate at South Carolina, James F. Powell, have been fined $500 for possession of Marijuana. They pleaded guilty in Robeson County Superior Court yesterday to the lesser charge, a misdemeanor, after being brought to trial for pos session with intent to distrib ute, a felony.

title: Baker Paces Alamo Charge
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex., June 8 (AP)Buddy Baker of Charlotte, N. C., drove his 1970 Dodge Charger around Texas World Speedway's twomile oval at 169.240 miles an hour today and won the pole posi tion for Sunday's $92,000 Alamo 500 stock car race.

title: Connecticut Bridal For Miss Cacace
description: TRUMBULL, Conn., June 8 St. Teresa's Roman Catho lic Church was the setting here this evening for the marriage of Miss Roseann Cacace, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Vincent Cacace of Fair field, to Anil C. Madan, son of Justice Chunilal Madan of Kenya's High Court and Mrs. Madan of Nairobi, Kenya.

title: The Screen
description: ANIMATION: VENUS AND THE CAT, be Zlatko, 10 minutes; BURLINGTON ZEPHYR, by Alan Kraning, 2 min utes; SANDMAN, by Eli Noyes, minutes; A BALL OF STRING AND OTHER THINGS OR A YARN SPUN WITH STRING by Barbara Dourmash kin, 7 minutes; A MINDGRAIN FANTASY by Gall Schlesser, 6 minutes; NEURON by Robert Russett, 5 minutes; THE CANDY MACHINE by George Griffin, 4 minutes; TRIK FILM 1 by George Griffin, one minute; FACES OF WOMEN by Peter Feldes, 7 min utes; INK TEST NUMBER 1 by Tom Saxe, 2 minutes; APOTHEOSIS by Lillian Schwartz and Ken Knowlton, 4 minutes; BUPKIS by Kenny Schneider, 5 minutes; THE GROUP by Kenny Schneider, one minute; RAINDANCE by Stan Lawder, 16 minutes. At the Film Forum, 256 West Street June 810 and 1517, 8 P.M.

title: PROTESTANT ACTION REPORTED IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 8  A group of young Protestant militants said to night that it had overthrown the leadership of the paramili tary Ulster Defense Association the Protestant equivalent of the Roman Catholic Irish Re publican Armyand was hold ing five of its top officers cap tive.

title: Bridge: ThreeWay Playoff Starting For the Grand National Title
description: A threeway playoff to de termine the grand national champions for the North Eastern zone will be held to day and tomorrow at the New York Hilton Hotel. Each of the teams competing has won a lengthy qualifying competition in its own dis trict, and the winners of the playoff will be eligible for the national final next month in Washington.

title: RUTGERS REJECTS DESIGNER IT HIRED
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, June 8 The Rutgers University board of governors today discharged an architectural firm it had hired to design a sports center because the firm had pleaded guilty to writing off political contributions as incometax deductions.

title: Sam's Sluggers, 10, White House Unit, 9
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Almost unnoticed in the spate of words and the flare of revelations, there was an other confrontation between the legislative branch and the White House this weekthe dust flew, there were jeers and cheersand the beer ran out in the third inning.

title: Way to Reduce Sonic Boom Devised
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Prof. Sing Cheng of the aerospace and mechanical sciences department at Princeton University was granted a patent this week for a device to reduce the sonic boom caused by supersonic air craft and to im prove flight per formance. Patent 3,737,119 explains that the engine creates an antiboom jet with about the same pressure as the flow around the aircraft and directs it at the shock wave below the wing. In addition to reducing the boom that the shock wave creates at a distance, the method is described as im proving the lift.

title: Senate Suspends Ruling
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (UPI) The Senate approved legisla tion today to suspend a Labor Department regulation specify ing the length of time workers must be kept out of fields sprayed with a number of dan gerous pesticides.

title: Whitehead Again Assails F.C.C. Rules
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Clay T. Whitehead, director of the White House Office of Telecommunications Policy, re asserted today his belief that broadcasters alone must de termine what goes on the air, without any interference by the Government.

title: Farm Bill Clears Senate With Limit Of $20,000 on Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Senate approved today a farm 1bill that would impose a $20, 000 ceiling on subsidy pay ments that could go to any one farm. The present ceiling is $165,000.

title: Mrs. Sanders Takes Golf By Shot Over Mrs. Baldwin
description: NORTHFIELD, N. J., June Mrs. David Sanders of Plain field, N. J., won the Women's New Jersey Golf Association's 23d Uebelacker Memorial Tour nament today at the Atlantic City County Club.

title: Guerrilla Groups in Argentina Explain Their Goals
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 8 (AP)  Rival guerrilla groups held a clandestine news conference today to ex plain their positions.

title: Skylab Invicta ...
description: The successful emergency repair so brilliantly per formed by the Skylab astronauts proves that a manned vehicle outside the earth's atmosphere is not completely helpless when unforeseen contingencies arise. Astronauts can function as repair mechanics, and function well, as was dramatically demonstrated when the astronauts fixed Skylab's wing so that its solar cells could supply badly needed electrical power.

title: Mujib Insists Pakistani P.O.W.'s Will Be Tried
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 8 Sheik Mujibur Rahman has declared that war crimes trials against 195 Pakistani prisoners will be held shortly, and he attacked the Pakistani Govern ment for refusing to accept the realities of the subconti nent.

title: Train Crash in Mt. Vernon Kills One and Injures 119
description: A northbound Penn Central commuter express smashed into the rear of a local discharging passengers at Mount Vernon last night, killing one rider and injuring 119, at least one of them critically. All but five of the injured were treated and released at local hospitals.

title: 29 Seized for Gambling
description: DRACUT, Mass., June 8 (AP) Twentynine persons were ar rested early this morning on gaming charges after local and state policemen raided a home here. Twentysix of the men pleaded guilty and were fined $50. Three cases were confined.

title: Richardson Shifts Inquiry Into I.T.T. Merger to Cox
description: WASHINGTON, June 8At torney General Elliott L. Rich ardson announced today that he was shifting to Archibald Cox, the special Watergate prosecutor, authority to inves tigate all the ramifications of the merger of the International Telephone and Telegraph Cor poration with the Hartford Fire Insurance Company.

title: Freshness vs. Seasoning: Two Schools of Thought
description: Whether new talent exhibi tions should be confined strictly to young artists fresh from the academies, or whether the results are more satisfactory when the artists have gone through several years on the gallery circuit.  in New York or else where  is a debatable point. Seasoning in the field seems to account for the impressive new talents in the four exhibitions under re view.

title: Underground Concourses Are Proposed
description: The city will study the possi bility of an extensive network of shoplined, underground con courses  similar to that in Rockefeller Centerthat could be a virtual street systembelow ground reaching more than a half mile from the Battery area to the South Street Seaport in lower Manhattan.

title: Argentine Pact Sets WagePrice Curbs
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 8 President Hector J. Campora announced tonight a broad pact between business and labor un der which major unions would agree to abandon strikes and collective bargaining for two years in return for moderate wage increases and price con trols for key consumer items.

title: 15 Die in Philippine Bus
description: MANILA, June 8 (UPI)The police said today that a pas senger bus fell into a river yes terda near the mountain resort city of Baguio, killing 15 persons.

title: SMITH, MISS EVERT GAIN AT ROME NEt
description: ROME, June 8 (AP)Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., and Chris Evert of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., advanced today in the $135,000 Italian open tennis championships.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NEW TWIST John Fisch er, the sculptorpainter who works in bread, accompanied by music, opens his summer season today, with some new ingredients thrown in, at the sculpture garden and parking lot of the Brooklyn Museum, 188 Eastern Parkway, near Prospect Park.

title: Cherry Hill: Rich, but Still Vulnerable
description: Despite its spacious, subur ban acres and large, comfor table homes, Cherry Hill Town ship has been unable to escape sporadic outbursts of a bigcity style of violence.

title: People in Sports: Shue Steps Out
description: Gene Shue, coach of the Baltimore Bullets of the Na tional Basketball Association, said yesterday he was quit ting his job and was negotiat ing with the Philadelphia 76ers, whose coach, Kevin Loughery, moved to the New Yort Nets of the American Basketball Association.

title: Oil and the Indian Ocean
description: BRUSSELSOnce again the nebulous balance is changing in the enormous and strategically important Indian Ocean. Over the last decade, Soviet naval influence has steadily grown in the region between the Red Sea, Mau ritius, and the Bay of Bengal. At the same time, the British withdrew from the Persian Gulf and there was a dra matic buildup in Iranian military power.

title: Camden Mayoral Aspirant Fatally Shot on His Estate
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June 8Major B. Coxson, a flam boyant entrepreneur and ex convict who ran second in field of nine for Mayor of Camden last month, was mur dered in his sumptuous Cherry Hill home before dawn today.

title: Rand and Willard of Maryland Capture Anderson Golf Medal
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 8On a day on which weather gave early birds an edge, 16 qualifiers, headed by the Mary land combination of Tom Rand, and Brian Willard, gained qual ifying berths today in the 37th annual Anderson Memorial fourball golf tournament.

title: Archie Bunker a Winner
description: HAMLIN, N. Y., June 8 (AP) On the strength of one vote, the television character Archie Bunker has been declared a pri mary winner in this town's balloting for highway superin tendent. Election officials said no Democrats filed for the post in this Rochester suburb, but one person wrote in the Bunker, name. That entitles Bunker to a spot on the Democrats' No vember ticket.

title: Picket Pittsburgh Stations
description: PITTSBURGH, June 8 (AP) Some 75 technical workers at KDKA radio and television, members of Local 820, Inter national Alliance of Theatrical and Stage Employes Union, re fused to cross picket lines set up today by strikers from a sister station in Baltimore. Contract negotiations between the union and Westinghouse Group W stations in Baltimore and Philadelphia ended in strikes yesterday.

title: New Gas Ovens May Have Perilous Loose Connection
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Consumer Product Safety Commission said today that it had learned that about 12,000 new gas ovens on the market may have a loose connection that could pose a hazard to owners, especially in mobile homes.

title: Accord Expected in Paris On Enforcing CeaseFire
description: PARIS, June 8An Ameri can official said tonight that Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho of North Vietnam are ex pected to issue a joint com muniqu this weekend, pos sibly tomorrow, on how the Vietnam ceasefire accords can be enforced.

title: The Unlikely Wordmen
description: From the start the Nixon Adminis tration sought to present a selfportrait of sobriety and dullness suggesting pious drones full of gray but excellent earnestness. At the same time, how ever, it was talking and popularizing a language more gaudily outrageous than any contrived in Washington since Franklin Roosevelt discovered the alphabet.

title: Individual Imprint Noted In Some of the Paintings
description: New art derives from many sources, but, the fore most source Is undbidatedly old art. The old art in ques tion may be no older than a few days, a few months or a few years. It may, on the other hand, be as old as civ ilization itself. Whatever its age or tradition, it is old art that inspires the new, either by way of imitation, competition or revolt.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Mollie Parnis, as usual, had the last word. When the chips are down, all a woman asks of a dress, whether she is 16 or 60, is whether she looks pretty in it, she told the audience at the opening of her fall collection. It was the last show in a frenetic week of openings and it was filled with pretty clothes.

title: Fugitive in Slayings of 4 Policemen Here Is Seized
description: Federal agents and city po licemen stormed a West Side apartment just after dawn yes terday and captured a man they described as one of the leading members of the Black Liberation Army.

title: Puzzle of Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The present rapid rate of inflation in the American economy, dra matically illustrated again yes terday in the Wholesale Price Index for May, does not fit with past peacetime experience, matched against such other measures as the general ex pansion of business or total employment. The result is that it is at least in good part, to the experts as well as to the or dinary citizen. It is very hard to comprehend, Arthur M. Okun said today. Mr. Okun, now at the Brookings Institution, was the last chairman of the Coun cil of Economic Advisers under President Johnson.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Dave Anderson
description: At the gate, where the concrete of Hempstead Avenue dissolved into the leaves and flowers of Belmont Park, the Pinkerton nodded to the car's driver.

title: Limits on Privilege Sought
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) Senators Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, and Edmund S. Muskie, Demo crat of Maine, introduced legis lation today to restrict the use of executive privilege in testi mony before Congress.

title: Athens Acts to Insure Papadopoulos Grip on Helm
description: ATHENS, June 8The Greek Government announced plans tonight to insure the continued rule of Provisional President George Papadopoulos for at least seven more years.

title: Franco Yields as Premier; To Remain Chief of State
description: MADRID, June 8  General issimo Francisco Franco, the leader of Spain for more than 30 years, relinquished some of his power today by naming a Premier to run the Government.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, Jute 8Cathy Corckone of West Long Branch and Princeton University, who has been New Jersey's fastest woman swimmer for years, is back in the water at Dillion Pool at Princeton working out daily, and some days twice a day, preparing for the World University Games in Moscow in August.

title: Farm Bill Clears Senate With Limit Of $20,000 on Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Senate approved today a farm bill that would impose a $20, 000 ceiling on subsidy pay ments that could go to any one farm. The present ceiling is $165,000.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day wets:

title: EGYPT, AT U.N., ASKS FOR PLAIN LANGUAGE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 8Egypt asked the Secu rity Council today for a resolu tion in basic English plainly saying that despite her 1967 military victory Israel cannot acquire Arab territory.

title: Thieu Party and Vote Fail to Inspire Village
description: LONG TRACH, South Vietnam, June 7The coolie who hauls rice sacks for the local mill voted in the vil lage council election here, but he does not know whom he voted for.

title: Spanish Airline Authorized To Extend Routes in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (Rout  President Nixon has author ized Iberia Air Lines of Spain to extend its routes in the United States and parts of the Carib bean, the Civil Aeronautics Board announced today.

title: Tories and Labor Run Close In Local British Elections
description: LONDON, June 8 (UPI)  Prime Minister Heath's govern ing Conservatives and the op position Labor party emerged roughly even today in voting for 296 localgovernment coun cils in England and Wales.

title: Paris Conciliatory In Seeking Answer To Dollar Problems
description: PARIS, June 8  Finance Minister Valry Giscard d'Es taing of France sought today to play down monetary dif ferences with the United States in an effort to speed agreement on new rules for managing the world's cur rencies.

title: Thousands at Funeral of Slain Patrolman
description: Funeral services for Sidney Thompson, a 37yearold Tran sit Authority patrolman slain in a subway shootout were held yesterday in a small church in a South Bronx slum.

title: Belmont Field and Early Odds
CAMBODIAN FIGHT FOR ROAD GOES ON
description: BEK CHAN, Cambodia, June 8Dozens of confused clashes between Government and Com munist troops occurred today near Rout 4 westsouthwest of Phnom Penh, with opposing sol diers so intermingled they often were unsure of where their own positions were.

title: Officials of 4 States Doubt Gasoline Shortage Is Real
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Top lawenforcement officials of several states, including New York and Connecticut, express ed today the suspicion that the current gasoline shortage was artificial.

title: Needed Veto
description: Mayor Lindsay exhibited a realistic understanding of New York City's needs in vetoing the City Council bill to kill the computerized formula for establishing fair rents in 1.2 million rentcontrolled apartments.

title: S.E.C. SUSPENDS F.D.I. 20 DAYS FOR FRAUD
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Securities and Exchange Com mission ordered today the sus pension of F.D.I. Securities, Inc., of Wilmington, Del., for 20 business days for fraud and other violations of Federal securities laws.

title: An Ohio Hassle
description: HIDE AWAY HILLS, OhioOn a quiet evening, the high sheriff of my remote Ohio county knocked on my back door. With him was a deputy of the private guard service hired to patrol the secured 2,000acre complex in which I reside with a hundred other families.

title: G.E. Locomotives Purchased
description: The National Railways of Mexico announced yesterday the purchase of 38 high horse power dieselelectric locomo tives from the General Electric Company for about $15million. Delivery of the engines is sched uled to begin in d1973.

title: TALKS MAIN FOCUS OF BREZINEV VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 Leonid I. Brezhnev's visit to the United States is shaping upl as a restrained affair with a minimum of public exposure for the Soviet Communist party leader.

title: MISS ANNA A. DODGE
description: NEW LONDON, N.H., June 8  Miss Anna A. Dodge, who was a founder of Camp Quini beck for girls on Lake Fairlee in Ely, Vt., and was active in its operation up to a few years ago, died Sunday in a nursing home here. She was 91 years old.

title: TV CODE BOARD SETS AD RULES FOR YOUNG
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP)  The television code board has barred commercials that frighten or exploit children or depict violence.

title: U.S. Agencies Squabbled On Wounded Knee Moves
description: WASHINGTON, June 8  Bureaucratic infighting between departments of the Federal Government was so intense during the 71day occupation of Wounded Knee, S. D. by militant Indians that a House courier hid security copies of a proposed settlement for fear his mission would be blocked.

title: Strike at The Star Ends
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., June 8 (AP)A strike by 10 electri cians against The Kansas City Star ended tonight with a back towork agreement. Pickets ap peared at The Star this morning after a oneweek extension of the electricians' old contract expired at midnight.

title: Dance: Two penny Portrait Premiere
description: The Louis Falco Dance Company is a very special delight. It often seems like a commune set to music, and its technical standards are among the very highest in modern dance. Where so many young, and even mid dle  aged modern dancers, confuse hope with achieve ment, it is a special pleasure to encounter something like the Falco group.

title: Neighbors Say Rhodesian Was Killed by Guerrillas
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 8 (Reuters)A white Rhodesian was shot dead by guerrillas on his farm last night about 70 miles north of Salisbury, his neighbors said today.

title: Its Artists Call Englewood Another Athens
description: ENGLEWOOD, June 8 John Ross and Clare Romano are husband and wife and professional artists. They have lectured and shown their prints and paint ings in galleries from Texas to Tokyo and in United States embassies from Lon don to Kuala Lumpur.

title: That 1799 Schoolhouse Has Been Preserved Thanks to the Children
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn.  How does a crusade start? In this affluent community in Connecticut's southwest poc ket, all it took was a casual conversation.

title: Transit Strike in Japan
description: TOKYO, June 8 (AP)Work ers in public transportation in Tokyo and 36 other major cities halted subways, buses and streetcars for as many as eight hours today. The AllJapan Federation of Municipal Traffic Workers said it was protesting a municipal transportation bill intended to make us work harder in the name of sound management.

title: Wallace's Brother Is Cleared by Bar In Bond Fee Case
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 8 The Alabama Bar Association cleared Gov. George C. Wal lace's brother today of charges of unethical legal conduct in connection with fees paid for processing bond issues for the State of Alabama.

title: G.&W. Extends Offer
description: Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., has extended its exchange offer to holders of its common stock and certain convertible securities until 5 P.M., June 29, it was announced yesterday. The company said that there would be no further extension after that. The original expira tion date was May 25 and this was extended to June 8.

title: DREW OF SKYLAB FORGOES HOLIDAY
description: HOUSTON, June 8The Sky ab 1 astronauts, at last enjoy ing a comfortable, poweredup space station, settled down to day to the real business of the mission as they conducted a broad spectrum of scientific and medical experiments.

title: SANDMAN SELECTS STATE PARTY CHIEF
description: TRENTON, June 8 John Spoltore, the former Mayor of Bridgeton, is Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr.'s choice to be state Republican chairman.

title: 142 BY JAPANESE LEADS IN L.P.G.A.
description: SUTTON, Mass., June 8 (AP) Chako Higuchi, a fivetime Japanese golf champion seeking her first victory in the United States, charged into a four stroke lead today despite a con troversial call against her in the second round of the Ladies Professional Golf Association championship.

title: Xerox Stirs Zoning Fight in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 8 A battle is shaping up in the affluent back country of this rich commuter town that may have an important effect on the town's development and on affluent suburbs across the country.

title: Nuptials Held for Jane Olmstead
description: WESTPORT, Conn, June 8  Miss Jane Frances Olm stead, a May graduate of George Washington Universi ty, was married here this af ternoon to Paul Thomas Mur phy, a Foreign Service officer, who next month takes up the post of third secretary at the United States Embassy in Cotonau, Dahomey.

title: Mrs. Macellari Wed To Thomas Nichols
description: In the chapel of the Uni tarian Church of All Souls here yesterday afternoon Mrs. Sheila Noonan Macel lari was married to Thomas Williams Slocum Nichols by the Rev. Walter Donald Kring. A small reception fol lowed at the home of Capt. Rodman de Kay, U.S.N., re tired, and Mrs. de Kay, step father and mother of the bridegroom.

title: Antiques: Chess Sets to Be Auctioned
description: Long before Bobby Fischer made chess frontpage news last summer, the relatively dormant auction market in period and modern chess sets had stirred and was very much alive.

title: SIDEROWF GAINS FINAL IN BRITAIN
description: PORTHCAWL, Wales, June 8 (AP)Dick Siderowf of Easton, Conn., putting erratically to day but driven by a dogged desire to win, moved into the final round of the British Ama teur golf championship.

title: Franco's Premier
description: The man who Generalis simo Francisco Franco named to succeed him as the head of the Spanish Government has been known for so long as the Generalissimo's closest friend and adviser that the Spanish public has little sense of him as a man with a separate identity. Adm.
