Luis Carrero Blanco, at 70 years old, 10 years younger than his mentor, has served as the Franco leadership's chief spokesman and public de fender since the middle nine teenfifties; yet he has not held a news conference for years and has assiduously avoided personal publicity. Many of his magazine articles on political subjects appear under pseudonyms.

title: Jackson Seized Here
description: City policemen and Fed eral agents yesterday cap tured Andrew Jackson, de scribed as one of the leading members of the Black Libera tion Army. He was wanted on charges of murder and bank robbery. Details, Page 30.

title: Ehrlichman Again Places CoverUp Blame on Dean
description: LOS ANGELES, June 8John D. Ehrlichman again placed the blame for the Watergate cover up on John W. Dean 3d, the former counsel to President Nixon, but his comments today seemed to conflict with those attributed yesterday to his for mer White House colleague, H.R. Haldeman.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SAN DIEGO, June 8 (UPI)The city received official notification today that the Padres were being sold to Washington interests, and the reaction indicated there might be problems. The letter asked a termination of the Padres' 20year lease at the stadium. The Padres have been here five years.

title: Officials of 4 States Doubt Gasoline Shortage Is Real
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Top lawenforcement officials of several states, including New York and Connecticut, express ed today the suspicion that the current gasoline shortage was artificial.

title: Seoul's Agents Are Accused Of Harassing Koreans in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The State Department said today that it had complained to the South Korean Embassy about reported improper activities by agents of South Korea's Central Intelligence Agency who were accused of trying to disrupt meetings in the United States.

title: High School Notes
description: The city high school sys tem's best writers, artists, film makers and industrial lesigners were honored at a dinner at the St. RegisShera ton Hotel yesterday and awarded prizes for their winning entries in the city's first High School Arts' Festival.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yeter day was:

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Six alleged underworld figures and the lawyer for the Trenton Patrolmen's Benevolent Association were indicted on cliarges involving the robbery and kidnapping of the wife of a local dentist. The lawyer, Lawrence N. Stein, was charged with aiding and abetting armed robbery, conspiracy and obstruction of justice. He was arrested and freed on a $50,000 bond backed by securities.

title: Boy Fatally Knifed In School yard Here In Bicycle Dispute
description: A 15yearold boy was fatally stabbed yesterday in the school yard of a junior high school in the northeastern Bronx after what was believed to have been a dispute over his bicycle.

title: Buildings Chief Sworn In
description: Theodore Karagheuzoff was sworn in yesterday by Mayor Lindsay at a City Hall ceremony as Commissioner of Buildings, succeeding Joseph Stein, who resigned recently to enter pri vate business. Commissioner Karagheuzoff, a career civil servant, had been Traffic Com missioner since 1968. He will receive the same salary he got as Traffic Commissioner $36,925 a year.

title: Train Crash in Mt. Vernon Kills 1 and Injures Many,
description: A northbound Penn Central commuter express train smashed into the rear of a standing local train discharging passen gers in the new Mount Vernon station last night, killing at least one rider and injuring 75 others.

title: MRS. MEIR ACCEPTS BONN'S INVITATION
description: JERUSALEM, June 8Chan cellor Willy Brandt announced today that Premier Golda Meir had accepted his invitation to make a formal state visit to West Germany.

title: Fire on a Truce Plane Hurts 7; Traced to Hanoi Aide's Gear
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, June 9 (Reuters))A fire on board a United States Air Force C130 aircraft flying a regular liaison flight between Hanoi and Saigon injured seven people yesterday, an American Embassy spokesman said.

title: Jury Selection System Is Tested by Prisoners
description: TRENTON, June 8 (UPI) In a broad test of the jury selection system throughout New Jersey, a group of Tren ton State Prison jailhouse lawyers filed suits contend ing the juries that convicted them were weighted against blacks and other minorities. The suits were mailed on be half of 456 inmates to courts in all 21 counties by the In mate Legal Associates.

title: Pope Plans to Open a Museum for Modern Art Soon
description: ROME, June 8Pope Paul VI, who will complete the 10th year of his pontificate on June 21, plans to open a new Vati can museum of modern art, in cluding works by American abstractionists, a few days after that date.

title: People and Business
description: Castle & Cooke, Inc., the big Hawaiian foodproduc tion, landdevelopment, mer chandising and manufactur ing company, named a new top banana yesterday in line with its new emphasis on that field, He is Malcolm MacNaughton, 63, who had been president since 1959. Following yesterday's annual meeting at Honolulu, Mr. MacNaughton was named chairman and chief executive officer.

title: BASENJI IS VICTOR IN TUXEDO SHOW
description: TUXEDO, N. Y., June 8A barkless dog made himself heard today at the Tuxedo Park Kennel Club show in Sterling Forest when Mrs. George B. St. George found Ch. Reveille Be Sirius, a Basenji, best in a field of 1,328 dogs.

title: 4 Killed Here in a 2Week Outbreak In ProPeking Dominican Movement
description: The political violence of the Dominican Republic has made a sudden appearance in Wash ington Heights in the last two weeks, claiming at least four lives in gun battles in the streets and bars.

title: Equity Financing
description: The Winter Park Telephone Company yesterday said it had filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed pos sible offering of 800,000 shares of common stock to be underwritten by a syndicate headed by Mer rill Lynch. The company's stock, traded over the counter, closed at 31 bid, 32 asked, down 1.

title: KALMBACH CALLED READY TO TESTIFY ON NIXON EXAIDES
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Her bert W. Kalmbach, President Nixon's former personal at torney and longtime associate, has agreed to testify for the prosecution against H. R. Hal deman and John D. Ehrlichman and other former White House officials, if needed, in any Watergate criminal trials, sources close to the case said today.

title: Suit Challenges Nixon on School Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 8The Commonwealth of Pennsyl vania, in a comprehensive court challenge of the impoundment of Federal education funds by the Nixon Administration, filed today in United States District Court a suit seeking the elease of $18million in impounded Federal aid for the fiscal year 1973.

title: Papers in Baltimore Agree On $51 Rise Over 20 Months
description: BALTIMORE, June 8 (AP) The Baltimore Sunpapers and the WashingtonBaltimore Newspaper Guild reached agree ment today on a 20month con tract with salaries of $218 or above increasing $51 a week.

title: Army Is Reviewing Charges Against Benedict Arnold
description: Benedict Arnold will prob ably always be considered a traitor to this country, for having tried to surrender West Point to the British in 1780. But the tides of re visionist history may yet wash an earlier blot or two from his escutcheon.

title: Commuters Hike Again, as They Did on May 29
description: For the second time in two weeks, thousands of commuters who depend on the New Haven Division of the Penn Central were faced last night with the problem of finding other means of travel.

title: Minnesota Nine Defeats Oklahoma in Playoffs, 10
description: OMAHA, June 8 (AP)Dave Winfield scattered six hits and pitched out of a basesloaded ninth inning jam tonight as the University of Minnesota de feated Oklahoma, 10, in the opening game of the 27th Col lege world series.

title: Turcotte: No. 1 Rider, No .1 Colt
description: Ron Turcotte rode six horses at Belmont Park yes terday, and he's scheduled to ride six more there today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: $160,000 Awarded in House Ransacking

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Dayton Aides Urged to Walk
description: DAYTON, Ohio, June 8 (UPI) City Manager James E. Kunde has ordered city officials con ducting business in the down town area either to walk or ride a bicycle to conserve gaso line.

title: JOHN F. GILLIGAN
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., June 8  John F. Gilligan, a lawyer long associated with John H. Sherry in a law practice at 342 Madison Avenue, died of can cer at his home here yesterday. He was 54 years old and lived at 16 Roosevelt Avenue.

title: Aeschylus With Nightstick
description: ATHENS  Fate has reserved for Greece today the sad privilege of ex periencing the essence of truth  as expressed by Aeschylusthat in order to penetrate into the deeper meaning of a situation, one has to live with it and suffer. By being de prived of our political freedoms, we came to appreciate the value of democ racy and the meaning of human dig nity. However, we pay too big a price for this knowledge.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I have read with interest your May 29 editorial about the Mideast oil producing countries using their re sources for political purposes.

title: Yanks Belt Four Homers And Vanquish Royals, 81
description: KANSAS CITY, June 8The Yankees made their debut on an allartificial turf field to night and discovered how bene ficial it could be for their hit ting: They socked four home runs as they whipped the Kansas City Royals, 81.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURE ADVANCE IN PRIC
description: After a week of some wild swinging pricei, commodity f?? tures markets resumed a mo?? leisurely pace yesterday, pe?? haps reflecting the tradition preweekend lethargy of sum mer months. Most prices showe only moderate changes.

title: Nixon Asks Graduates to Be Optimistic
description: ORLANDO, Fla., June 8In a rare public appearance, Pres ident Nixon visited Florida Technological University today and delivered a campaignstyle speech that emphasized what is right about this country.

title: Fashion Institute Graduate Gets $1,000 Times Prize
description: The award of a $1,000 prize by The New York Times to Janis L. Gibson of Edison, N. J., a graduate cf the Fashion In stitute of Technology in New York, was announced by the newspaper yesterday.

title: Roberta Flack III at Concert
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., June 8 (AP)Jazzsoul singer Roberta Flack cut short a concert at Providence Civic Center tonight after she became ill and was taken to Rhode Island Hospital. Members of the audience of more than 6,000 said Miss Flack had finished singing her third song about 30 minutes into the twohour concert, when she walked off the stage with her accompanist. Hospital officials said later that she's doing fine and will be discharged.

title: Ervin Panel to Investigate Burglary in Ellsberg Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 8Sen ator Sam J. Ervin Jr. said to day that the Senate Watergate committee would expand its investigation to include the burglary of the office of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's, former psy chiatrist in Beverly Hills, Calif., in September, 1971.

title: Chess: Adventurous Misadventure Follows Shunning of Draw
Secretariat's Strategy: We'll Play It by Ear
description: Only one jockey will be chirping to Secretariat in to day's 105th Belmont Stakes, but thousands of armchair strategists have already de cided exactly how the $6.08 million colt should be ridden.

title: U.S. Grants Go to Four Areas For Desegregation of Schools
description: WASHINGTON, June 8 (AP) The Nixon Administration has awarded four grants to finance voluntary metropolitan school desegregation and is about to approve a dozen other grants.

title: Goodyear Raises Prices Of Auto and Truck Tires
description: The Goodyear Tire and Rub ber Company announced late yesterday that it would in crease prices on automobile tires and tubes, certain sizes of truck tires and ;tubes, re treaded tires and retreading and repair materials, effective today.

title: Penny Tweedy and Her Crowning Touch
description: The toss, of a 50cent piece in the office of Alfred G. Vanderbilt, the chair man of the New York Racing Associa tion, decided the ownership of Secre tariat, who seeks the final leg of the Triple Crown in the Belmont Stakes today.

title: A NEW RAIL LINK SOUGHT FOR BRONX
description: A proposal to establish an interim railcommuter service that would start in Stamford, Conn., serve parts of West chester County and introduce rail commuting to the CoOp City area of the Bronx is being sought by two Congressmen and the Mayor of Yonkers.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges this week is sued their latest repoits on changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of their listed com panies. The reports include the following:

title: LOUISIANA TO DEFY INTEGRATION ORDER
description: BATON ROUGE, June 8 (UPI)  Gov. Edwin Edwards of Louisiana, faced with a Fed eral court order to desegregate predominantly black Grambling College and Southern Univer sity, said today that he would accept a cutoff of Federal ed ucation funds rather than make a chocolate milk facil ity out of the state's univer cities.

title: And Now Just 25 Years Later, It's 15 There'll Be 9th Triple Crown Winner
Charles Sparacio, Teacher, Ran Cram Course on Law
description: Charles Michael Sparacio, senior professor on the faculty of St. John's University School of Law and until 1970 conduc tor of a nationally known cram course for New York State bar examination candi dates, died Tuesday at Maimon ides Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived at 506 Rugby Road, Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Judge Invalidates System Of Selecting Juries in Alabama
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 9A Federal judge ruled this week that discrimination in se lection of jurors by race, sex or level of income is unconsti tutional and ordered the Mont gomery Jury Commission to reconstitute the jury rolls with in four months to include a crosssection of the commu nity.

title: Camelia Cook, V. P. Blair 3d Are Married
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 9Miss Camilla Michele Cook and Vilray Papin Blair 3d were married this after noon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin C. Whitehead by the Rev. William Wendt of the Episcopal Church of St. Stephen and the Incarna tion in Washington.

title: Barbara Cusack Wed
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., June 9Miss Barbara Corne lia Cusack, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George C. Cusack Jr., was married here tonight to Alfred Robert Bonfantini, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Bonfantini. The ceremony was performed in Christ Episcopal Church by the Rev. David S. Hoag. He was assisted by Msgr. Joseph P. O'Brien of the Immaculate Heart of Mary Roman Catho lic Church in Scarsdale.

title: Major League Averages
description: Records Include Games Played Friday Night

title: Notes from London
description: LONDON. Watergate, Watergate, Watergate: end lessly the flood of news and rumors pours from television, radio and newspaper, but it washes over the mass of the population leaving hardly a name or an event behind.

title: SCHOOL BASEBALL
CITY'S DELEGATION IN HOUSE TERMED A HELPLESS GIANT
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The 17member New York City dele gation to the House of Repre sentatives, which exceeds or equals the size of delegations of 43 states, was described to day as a helpless giant, and some members of the delega tion were quick to agree with that assessment.

title: POLICEMEN GUILTY OF TAKING BRIBES
description: Sixteen of 18 on trial since February in Brooklyn Supreme Court on charges of taking payoffs to protect gamblers were found guilty last night by a jury that had deliberated since Wednesday. The other two officers were cleared on all five counts of the indict ment.

title: Do We Dare Help the Artist Who Dares?
description: IN a bookstore recently, I overheard two middleaged, middleclass womenprint dresses, little hats, the girdled lookpraising a small book. One held the volume and read in eager, hushed tones a few lines, letting her friend in on something profound. The phrases were familiar: If a man does not keep pace with his com panions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away. Ah, I thought, the great nonconformist naturalistphilosopher. In fantasy I wondered what his admir ers would have thought of him had the bachelor Thoreau walked into the book store at that moment wearing a Gay Liberation button. How different is different? Could they have tolerated his lifestyle any better than his contem poraries did? And what of another great American artistmystic, Whitman? Would the Long Island banks and schools named after this native genius feel as kindly disposed to the man as to his legacy? Would my bookstore women have asked Poe in for a drink? Not twice, I'll bet.

title: The Joy of Being Part of a Team
description: RECENTLY I found my self puzzled at a per formance of David Storey's The Chang ing Room. The drama of the pain and exultation of 22 men brought together for a rugby ?? was ?? tilling. And the production was superb in every respect.

title: Women at Princeton Outdo the Men
description: PRINCETON  Four years ago, when Princeton Univer sity admitted its first women students, some of the men already enrolled here and most of the news coverage riveted attention on the more visible and frivolous aspects of coeducation.

description: In the first of three pro grams at the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater, the Mazuko Hira bayashi Dance Theater pre sented Triste, a premiere by Miss Hirabayashi and two of her earlier works, Mudai and The Stone Garden on Thursday night.

title: Gen. Weyand Said to Get Gen. Haig's Army Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (UPI) Gen. Frederick C. Weyand, command veteran of the Ko rean and Vietnam wars, has been selected as the new Army Vice Chief of Staff, The Wash ington Star News reported today.

title: Health
description: WASHINGTONThey looked fit and certainly happy as they got off the medical evacuation planes from Hanoi earlier this year. But the ap pearances were sometimes decep tive.

title: Laird Plans to Visit Italy And Germany This Week
description: BONN, June 9 (Reuters)Former Defense Secretary Mel vin R. Laird, appointed this week as President Nixon's new chief White House adviser for domestic affairs, will visit Italy and West Germany next week, the United States Embassy here said yesterday.

title: Suffolk To Vote On BOCES Centers
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH,  Voters in 28 school districts in eastern Suffolk will go to the polls on Friday to decide whether they want to spend $14,475,085 to build two centers for occupational and special education cen ters proposed by the Board of Cooperative Educational Services.

title: An Expert Looks At State Politics
description: NEW BRUNSWICKThe departing director of the Eagleton Institute of Politics does not believe that New Jersey politics is more cor rupt than politics in other states, but he is nevertheless distressed by the way the system is being abused.

title: Music Series Opens in Nassau
description: ROSLYN, L.I.  The first in a series of free art shows and concerts was held last week in the farmer Frick es tate here as the beginning of what eventually will become the Nassau County Center for the Arts. Similar events are scheduled today and each Sunday for the remainder of the month.

title: Miss Paula J. Simmons Is Married to Mark S. Butler
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., June 9Miss Paula Johnston Simmons, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John William Sim mons of Chicago and East Hampton, was married here this afternoon to Mark Smith Butler. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Francis Butler of Tenafly, N. J., and Ama gansett.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial of May 30 entitled The President as Witness argues that the President cannot be subpoe naed to testify before a grand jury or in a trial because of obvious potenti alities for politically motivated abuse by prosecutors or others who may be acting irresponsibly. I believe your reasoning is at least highly debatable, if not wrong outright.

title: Rock Impresario Is a Success at 23
description: EAST ORANGEAfter his first full year of putting on weekly rock shows at the Capitol Theater in Passaic, 23yearold John Scher is using the theater as the base for developing a widerang ing, locally based music em pire.

title: Karin Armstrong Is Married in Vermont.
description: BARRE, Vt., June 9  In the United Church of Christ here this afternoon, Miss Karin Chace Armstrong, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John C. Armstrong of Old Greenwich, Conn., and Greensboro, Vt., and Arthur Newhouse 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Newhouse Jr. of Berlin, were married by the Rev. Bruce Cleary.

title: Colleges Will Get $425,000 To Aid Status of Women
description: The Carnegie Corporation and the Danforth Foundation have announced $425,000 in grants to the Association of American Colleges to support a project on the status and rights of women in higher education.

description: The European automobile market is one of the world's big business battlegrounds.

description: For more than 20 years, Wilma Soss, the corporate critic, has persistently cam paigned for the election of women to the allmale board rooms of American business.

title: Fiat's Social Program Roiling
description: TURIN, Italy  This dusty city along the Po River is Italy's Detroit. notionally it throbs to the vic tories of its soccer team and finan claily and commercially it rolls along at the pace of its biggest employer, the giant Fiat auto works.

title: Home Improvement
description: DAMP or wet basements are probably one of the most widespread of all homeowners com plaints and many people tol erate this tremendous waste of what could be perfectly good living and storage space because they feel that there really is nothing that can be done about it.

title: NEW SAFETY UNIT BACKS CONSUMER
description: WASHINGTON, June 9The Federal Government's newest regulatory agency, the Con sumer Product Safety Commis sion, has taken a firm procon sumer stance in its first regu latory action.

description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 9Eight Federal judges will meet June 18 to discuss whether the annex of the Federal Eastern District Court in Brooklyn should continue operations here,

title: England Within Sight Of Victory in Cricket
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 9 (Reuters)Centuries by Dennis Amiss and Tony Greig and uncertain batting by New Zealand left England within sight of victory today on the third day of the first cricket test. New Zealand, needing 479 runs to win, was 56 for two wickets at the close.

title: Long Island Boy, 16, Ties A World HalfMile Mark

2 pilots, 2 wars; Our faith never faltered in our God, our families and our country.... It didn't sicken me at all. A man has to answer to himself first.... How can I be part of this?; By Steven V. Roberts
description: LOS ANGELES. On Feb. 17, Capt. Harry Jenkins stepped off a plane at the Alameda Naval Air Sta tion, one of the first flights of returning former prisoners of war to the United States. Captain Jenkins had been a P.O.W. for more than seven years, and as the senior man on the trip he moved to a microphone to address the crowd of about 500 cheering wellwishers. A teenager broke through the lines carrying his 2yearold brother. The child, looking a bit confused, handed Captain Jenkins box of Valentine's Day candy. Then the naval of ficer spoke: As we boarded the aircraft at Clark Air Force Base, a young girl gave me a huge sign which read, Waiting sure takes a lot of patience. Out there, our patience sometimes faltered but our faith never didin our God, our families and our country.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: WHOLESALE PRICES in May, unadjusted for seasonal variations, rose 2.1 per cent over the April level to 133.5 per cent of the 1967 base period. The farm products, processed foods and feed category was up 4.7 per cent.... The nation's money supply increased at an annual rate 12 per cent in May, up from the 7 per cent rate in April and the 1.7 per cent growth rate posted in the first quarter of 1973.... The Commerce Department reported that busi ness planned a 13 per cent increase in capital investment 1973 over the 1972 level, which was substantially less than the 19 per cent increase reported earlier by McGraw Hill Publications.

title: Joseph Harmon Fiance Of Muriel Bloomberg
description: NORTH ANDOVER, Mass., June 9Mr. and Mrs. Haskell Bloomberg have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Muriel Bloom berg to Joseph Harmon, son of Nathan Harmon of New York and the late Mrs. Har mon. The wedding is planned for June 24.

title: Challenges to Democracy
description: BRUSSELSIt is an odd coincidence that the West's three leading democ racies should face institutional prob lems at the same historic moment. While existing Governments in Britain and in France have not come under anything like the pressure facing President Nixon, certain administrative weaknesses have been exposed.

title: Radio
description: Today: Leading Events

title: A Score of Notes on Music Festivals
description: AGLITTERING array of artists from the Metropolitan Opera, the New York City Opera and the concert halls of the U.S. are appearing on the European festival circuit this summer. Among those performing abroad are Mignon Dunn, Reri Grist, James King, Evelyn Lear, Janis Martin, Regina Resnick, Georgio Tozzi and Frederika von Stade.

title: Stamps
description: ATREASURED Chinese handscroll of the Ming Dynasty is being re produced for the sec ond year on stamps from Na tionalist China, and also on tap are enough art reproduc tions to fill a small gallery.

title: HOSPITALS WIDEN VIEW OF ILLNESS
description: While medical services as whole are not equipped to handle the human side of sick ness, as opposed to the scien tific side, some institutions here are making a serious attempt to change that.

title: TENNIS; Who's who in the movie stills? See Page 47.;  1973, The New York Times Co, All rights reserved.
description: The thing to do with a tennis book is not read it but to give it away. Look it over first, then make a present of it to someone you play with whose game the book will almost certainly destroy. For example, Dick Huber. Huber is the dean of the School of General Studies at Hunter College. He is a leathery competitor, toughest near the finish, calls his opponents victims. We both live in Princeton and play each other at least a dozen times a year. Huber is the author of, among other things, The American Idea of Success, which comes wrapped in dust jacket that shows an apple pie in a blue sky. He may write about Norman Vincent Peale and Dale Carnegie, but Huber himself was invented by Stephen Potter. Huber offers you lessons in the middle of matches. He is master of the premature congratulation. He knows medicine and can convince you at the start of a match that he is 20 per cent dead. Once, after beat him in the first set, he politely excused himself, went off and took a shower. It was all his after he came back.

title: Christina Casey Is Bride
description: RYE, N.Y., June 9  In the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection here this afternoon, Miss Christina Catherine Casey was married to David Joseph Petro. The Rev. Robert Poveramo per formed the ceremony. The couple's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Charles Casey of Rye and Mrs. and Mrs. David G. Petro of Perth Amboy, N.J.

title: Louise Cohen Plans Nuptials
description: CHATHAM TOWNSHIP, N. J., June 9Miss Louise Jane Cohen and David Joseph Trudel, who graduated Mon day from Brown University, where they were elected to Phi Beta Kappa, will be mar ried Sept. 1 in the Unitarian Church in Summit.

title: The color is true
description: Cosmetics for black women have come a long way since the days of hair straighten ers and pomades. Manufacturers of beauty products have caught on to the fact that 11 per cent of their potential market is black. And now there are cosmetics created to enhance, but not change skin color or come on. too strong.

title: Susan a Dingbat? Mary Too? Not on Your Life, They Say
description: To THE EDITOR: HURRAH for Judy Kle mesrud and for The Times for giving her the opportunity, in TV's Women Are Dingbats, to voice an opinion so many of us women have been shar ing for such a long time. If the Women's Liberation movement can credit its fail ures to anything, it is to women like me who too often are silent. We watch TV, and are discriminated against in everyday life, and we are silent.

title: Ford Foundation Awards $250,000 for Study by Irish
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 2The Queen's University of Belfast has been awarded grant of $250,000 by the Ford Foundation for research in so cial science in Northern Ire land and the Irish Republic over the next three years.

title: Beer vs. Champagne, or Dusseldorf Revisited
description: THE rapprochement be tween German 19th century painting and the American art pub lic, which has been going on for five years or so follow ing an extended alienation, progresses rather slowly in spite of the hard work of a handful of enthusiastic me diators. The latest effort to put things back on the old friendly basis is an exhibi tion called The Diisseldorf Academy and the Ameri cans, at the National Col lection of Fine Arts in Wash ington. It closes June 24 (the catalogue's date, July 28, is in error) and will wind up at the High Museum of Art, Atlanta, Ga., which was the

title: 10 Unhurt at a Party as Plane Crashes ,Next Door
description: Ten persons escaped injury yesterday when a light plane crashed into an unoccupied cottage in Haddam,.Conn., 10 I feet from where they were celebrating a birthday party.

title: Dubious French Medicine
description: President Pompidou of France, with the backing his top financial officials, has been pressing the United States to support the dollar in European exchange markets; the French are apparently afraid their exports will be hurt. Secretary of the Treasury Shultz has firmly but diplomatically stated that the United States intends to let the dollar move up or down in response to market forces.

title: A Symbolic New Center For Christian Scientists
description: BOSTON, June 6An in scription on the front wall of the local church affirmed that God's love always has met and always will meet every human need, and, one by one, members of the con gregation rose in their places to tell how this was true in their own lives.

title: Running the Rapids Deliverance'Style In Pennsylvania
description: NSONIA, N Pa.Ever since Burt Reynolds scored a smashsuccess with the movie Deliverance, a thriller which takes place during a whitewater canoe trip, this relatively unspoiled wilderness six hours by car from New York City has been attracting more visitors than ever before. It's not that Deliverance was filmed herethe movie was shot along the Chattooga River in Georgiabut this is about as close as you can come in the Northeast to navigating fast water through an equally challenging and spectacular canyon.

title: Franco
description: Generalissimo Francisco Franco, who turned 80 last December, has been leaving the day to day running of the Spanish Government in recent years to his closest aide, Adm. Luis Carrero Blanco, 70. The constitutional arrange ments have been for the admiral to take over the generalissimo's post as Premier upon the leader's death or re tirement. Admiral Carrero Blanco, an archconservative known as more Franco than Franco, would then share power with Prince Juan Carlos, 35, who would be proclaimed king and take over General Franco's post as Chief of State. The prince is said to favor political liberalization.

title: Tests Arranged For Hypertension
description: HACKENSACKOlder resi dents will be able to have their blood pressure checked every month at the Senior Citizens Center, 133 River Street starting Wednesday. County Health Department nurses will conduct hyper tension tests the second Wednesday of each month from 10:30 A.M. to 12:30 P.M.

title: Golf Title to Wofford
description: SPARTANBURG, S. C., June 9 (UPI)  Wofford, the host school, won the golf champion ship of the National Associa tion of Intercollegiate Athletics with an 875 total today. Camp bell College of North Caroling was second at 889.

title: Easy Jet Arrive Favored In $353,250 Event Today
description: RUIDOSO, N.M., June 9 (AP) Easy Jet Arrive ranks as narrow favorite in a 10horse field for tomorrow's Kansas Quarter Horse Futurity at Rui doso DoWns.

title: Restoration of Fort Greene Park to Begin
description: Next Sunday ground is to be broken formally for the $780,000 restoration of Fort Greene Park and its monu ment to the Prison Ship Martyrs of the American Revolution. Rehabilitation of the monument and grand staircase will cost $250,000 and the restoration of the park to the original Olmsted and Vaux plan is to take an other $530,000. Weather per mitting, the entire project is expected to be completed this September, according to Parks Department officials.

title: Engineer Weds Stephanie Speir
description: CENTERPORT, L. I., June 9  Miss Stephanie Bertine Speir, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lester Allen Speir of Norwell, Mass., formerly of Huntington, and Charles R. Bower, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Bower of Newport News, Va., also formerly of Huntington, were married here this morning in the United Methodist Church by the Rev. Louis Young.

title: Recordings
description: I LAST heard Arrau play Beethoven in recital year or two ago in Salz burg: late Liszt and De bussy prefaced by Beetho ven's Sonata Op. 7 and an .Appassionata which, to adopt Neville Cardus's useful distinction, I still recall not as a performance but as an experience.

title: MUSHROOMING
description: This morning I ate a Jew's ear. that way of putting it isn't defiant enough to commemorate an act of utter audacity on my part, let me add that I ate a small slice of it raw be fore sauting the rest in butter.

title: Green Vit'ls
description: WILD greens and potherbs sup plemented the often spare menu of the family table in Colonial days and Depression times. With food prices what they are today, some Americans are once again interested in eating off the land.

title: VIA VENETO AREA IS DETERIORATING
description: ROME, June 9Once there was the voluptuous glamour of the Via Veneto, as portrayed by Federico Fellini and a slew of secondgeneration dolce vita films.

title: Manes Urges a Budget Review
description: Queens Borough President Donald R. Manes called last week for a fine tooth comb examination of Mayor Lindsay's proposed $10.6bil lion expense budget for 197374, which, he said, shows an increase of ad ministrative jobs as against servicedelivery ones.

title: Calendar of Horse Show Events
description: TodayGlen Head, Hollandla Farms, Moriches Road, St. James, L.I. Regular, green, special, ama teurowner and junior working hunters; intermediate and junior jumpers, ponies, equitation. 8:30 A.M.

title: Mailbox
description: To the Editor: Within the last week I have seen your reports on the Indianapolis 500 motor race in the sports section. This race has been the last for 34 dead drivers. Many specta tors have been injured from the countless accidents that have taken place at the Speedway. This type of event in the sports section? I think you have made a mistake. No, maybe it is us for allow ing such an event to take place at all.

title: Nixon Ponders Prices
description: MIAMI, June 9As President Nixon, in Key Biscayne, re ceived recommendations today on action against inflation, his panel of economic advisers held an emergency meeting in Washington to study the situa tion and make further recom, mendations.

title: Trial of Sailor Opens in Sabotage of Carrier Ranger
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 9The first trial of military Sabo tage in a time of war since World War II opened at the Treasure Island Naval Station here this week.

title: Sunday Observer
description: WASHINGTON. Bill and Georgette Cooley who live down the block called and asked could I come to dinner Saturday night, and I said yes, and they said swell, and would I come by their place at 7:30 Friday evening for a briefing, and I said, A brief ing for dinner?

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Will the inevitable pileup of large sums of money in a handful of small oilproducing Arab countries mean continuous monetary crises or a high ly advantageous mutual bar gain with the industrial countries?

title: MOTORING
description: My secret vice, Doctor, is that I drive a car. I realize that's wrong of me, it's eco logically improper and ethical ly unsound, but I can't help it. It's what I do outdoors. Despite everything from the Sierra Club and the energy cri sis to radar traps and Nader's Degraders (the ultimate auto mobile will be the Nadir 6) I just go on driving, trying my best to have a good time.

title: Yankees Score 5 in 9th To Win 64
description: KANSAS CITY, June 9 With a Detroit World Series ring on the ring finger of his right hand and a Baltimore World Series ring on the little finger of his left hand, Pat Dob son joined the Yankees today, looking for another ring and regular work.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: The article on May 6 by David Sirota entitled Job Enrichment: Nice but No CureAll does indeed.just represent his point of view.

title: A Too Tearful Vanya
description: AT the beginning of the second half of Circle in the Square's Uncle Vanya, Nicol Williamson starts to enter the drawing room of a Russian country estate, sees that Julie Christie and Elizabeth Wilson are still moping about in it, and promptly with draws without uttering a word. It is the most intelligible move of the eve ning and at the preview I attended the audience laughed its understanding approval.

title: Primaries
BEMO, $13.40, WINS MONMOUTH STAKES
description: OCEANPORT, June 9While his trainer watched from a wheelchair, Bemo demon strated his own soundness by turning back nine other 3year Ads to win the $28,850 Long Branch Stakes at Monmouth Park today.

title: COUNTRY HOUSE
description: She broils not; neither does she swim. In the Hamptons, this alone may constitute a violation of local ordinances. What is such a person doing in a waterfront house, sur rounded by tennis fanatics? She al legedly sits indoors, willfully pale and lacking in muscle tone, not to mention fully clothed, when all about her are out perspiring freely, in haling fresh chlorine and getting evenly burned on the backs of their knees.

title: Rodeokind, U. S. A.: Do Cowboys Live The Good Life, Or Are They Playing Western Roulette?
description: HELMVILLE, Mont.  How do rodeo cowboys get that way? Wnat makes a man want to flirt with death so often? Is it the lure of fame and fortune? In an attempt to find the answers to these questions and to explore the mystique of the rodeo itself I came to this rural West ern town in Montana, where the sky never ends and the mountains look like the backdrop for a, Marlboro ad.

title: Athletic Facilities at Tufts Get Major Reconstruction
description: MEDFORD, Mass., June 9Tufts University has begun major reconstruction of its ath letic and physical education facilities.

title: Words to the Wise On Buying a Home
description: A house is a complex structure. It is built of many materials by craftsmen of va??ying skills, and there are many elements that are criti cal to its quality.

title: Dyce Captures HalfMile, I Mile in Met A.A.U. Track
description: Byron Dyce, who has not lost a Metropolitan halfmile run since his freshman year at New York University in 1966 (he did not compete in two meets) ex tended his streak yesterday in the annual Amateur Athletic Union's Metropolitan track and field championships at Down ing Stadium on RandalIs Island.

title: SCOTTISH TERRIER IS BEST IN SHOW
description: NORTH STAMFORD, Conn., June 9Near 90degree heat and flash storms couldn't stop the Scottish terrier, Ch. Bala chan Naughty Gal, from taking the top award at the 41st annual Greenwich Kennel Club's show today.

title: KrosnickSchwarz Triumph
description: Andy Krosnick and BobbyI Schwarz of Far Rockaway de feated Jordon Greenberg and Steve Shields, 2220, 219, to win the American Paddleball Association's recent spring tournament at Bellmore (L.I.) Recreation Park.

title: HARRY HATRY DIES; JAYTHORPE READ
description: Harry A. Hatry, until 1957, president of JayThorpe, Inc., the women's specialty store on West 57th Street, died Friday night in the SherryNetherland Hotel, where he had lived for many years. He was 89 years old.

title: Miss Nancy C. Desrosier Is Married
description: SADDLE RIVER, N. J., June 9Miss Nancy Colwell Des rosier, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Norman Wilfred Des rosier of HoHoKus, and Jeffrey Hagstrom Stevenson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sanford Stevenson of Wyckoff, were married here this afternoon in St. Gabriel's Roman Catho lic Church.

title: Battle of the Bottle in Suffolk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I.  By next fall, if some legislators and county officials have their way, the aluminum can and the oneway bottle may be nothing more than col lector's items in Suffolk County.

title: Penelope R Brosnahan Affianced
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 9Miss Penelope Rogers Bros nahan, an assistant buyer of children's clothing for Lord & Taylor, New York, plans to be married here in Sep tember to John Milton Tassie Jr., a product director with Johnson & Johnson, Makers

title: Springy Valley Has Changed
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y.Since 1960, this Rockland County village has seen its population triple, its summer hotels all but replaced by housing and its business dis trict yield to new shopping malls. The onceinadecade visitor to Spring Valley would have difficulty linking the past with the present. The Talk Even the motion of picture theater Spring on Main Street Valley has been moved from the west side, near the railroad tracks, to the east side, next to re tail stores farther up the business area.

title: Brooklyn Races Narrow
description: Some Brooklyn politicians were catching their breath over the weekend after June 4 primaries in councilmanic races, but others could be variously characterized as either holding their breath or breathing fire over the as yet unofficial results.

title: In Massachusetts, Legislature Votes To Cut Mentbership
description: BOSTON, June 9 (AP)Culminating a fiveyear battle, the Massachusetts legislature has voted, 166 to 93, to cut the size of the House by one third.

title: Florida Court Backs Paper On Confidential Sources
description: MIAMI, June 9 (UPI)A Miami Circuit Judge ruled yes terday that The Miami News cannot be forced by the courts to disclose a reporter's source or notes because to do so would violate freedom of press rights of the United States Constitu tion.

title: Raybestos Is Closing Amid Controversy
description: PASSAICRaybestosMan hattan, a rubberproducts manufacturer here for the last 80 years, will cease all operations next Thursday amid widespread bitterness over what the workers call a bad deal on pensions and sev erance pay.

title: Mrs. Everitt Rewed
description: TEWKSBURY, N.J., June 9 Mrs. Susan Stanley Everitt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Howard J. Stanley, and Peter Bruce Eddy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter S. Eddy of Sum mit, were married here this afternoon at the Stanley home by the Rev. Roger Verse, pastor of the Fair mount Presbyterian Church. The bride is head of public relations and fundraising at the Animal Medical Center in New York. Her previous mar riage ended in divorce. Mr. Eddy is a partner in the New Jersey law firm of Williams, Caliri, Miller & Otley.

title: White Asparagus: German Favorite
description: BONN  A German spring brings a kind of gentle mad ness upon the land, and one of its surest signs is the mania for asparagus that now has much of the popula tion in its grip.

title: Merckx of Belgium Takes Italy Cycle Race 4th Time
description: TRIESTE, Italy, June 9 (UPI) Eddy Merckx of Belgium made cycling history today by win nig his fourth Tour of Italy Classic,

title: Janet Simmons Is the Fiancee Of Herbert Pratt Van Ingen Jr.
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., June 9  Miss Janet Ains worth Simmons, who gradu ates this month from Louisi ana State University, plans to be married in early August to Herbert Pratt Van Ingen. Jr., who is descended on his mother's side from Commo dore Cornelius Vanderbilt and on his father's side from Charles Pratt, founder of the Pratt Institute in Brooklyn, New York.

title: Protecting Investors
Coliseum In Nassau Is Center Of Tax Figh
description: MINEOLA, L. I.  Shoulc Nassau County's $28million Veterans Memorial Coliseum in Uniondale, which cele brated its first birthday in April, be placed on the coml ty tax rolls or be taxex empt?

title: ILLEGAL JAILINGS LAID TO GREECE
description: The militarybacked Govern ment of Greece has been ac cused of illegally detaining sev en Greek lawyers in the inter rogation branch of the military police headquarters in Athens.

title: COPPELIA IS DANCED AT FASHION SCHOOL
description: The irresistibly charming Delibes score for Copptlia is often saddled with very resist ible choreographic realizations of its story. Karoly. Zsedenyi, director of the Romantic Ballet Repertory Company, created one at the Fashion Institute of Technology on Friday evening,

title: Dassin's Dialogues
description: TOO many Sundays have passed with no word of.a new movie from Jules Dassin, the talented director of Never on Sunday, Rififi and He Who Must Die. In fact, Dassin's last film to open here was Promise at Dawn, starring his wife Melina Mercouriand that was back in the early weeks of 1971. But now comes the good word that Dassin will soon be back behind the camera.

title: Abbott and Costello and Steinbrenner
description: KANSAS CITY, June 9Contrary to how it might have appeared, Lee Mac Phail and Gabe Paul, and not their boss, George Stein brenner 3d, made the deals that made Yankees of Pat Dobson and Sam McDowell.

title: Ohio State at Michigan Brings Earliest Sellout
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., June 9 (AP)Tickets for the Nov. 24 Ohio StateMichigan foot ball game at the 101,001 seat Michigan Stadium have been sold out, the earliest in Michi gan history.

title: The Region
description: The powerful, privatelysponsored DowntownLower Manhattan Asso ciation made public the model last week for a new southern tip to Man hattan Island. More than $5billion has already been spent or com mitted to the development program, which started in 1958 and should be finished by 1980.

title: G.O.P. IN VIRGINIA PICKS EXDEMOCRAT
description: RICHMOND, June 9 (UPI)Former Gov. Mills E. Godwin, a product of the Byrd Democrat ic organization, was nominated today as the Republican candi date for Governor.

title: Master Plan
description: After years of hullabaloo and hear ings, the controversial Master Plan for New York City was quietly buried last week by the agency that proposed, pushed and praised it, the City Plan ning Commission.

title: A.E.S. STEPHENS, 72, VIRGINIA OFFICIAL
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., June 9 (UPI)Former Lieut. Gov. A. E. S. Stephens, who opposed massive resistance to deseg regation because he feared it would destroy Virginia's public schools, died today. He was 72 years old and lived in Smith field.

title: The Last Word
description: You may be intending, of course, to spend the rest of the summer crouched like a Bedouin in front of your television set, absorbed in the Senate hearings instead of a good book. And certainly the Watergate inquiry reads like a novel or a fairy tale, in which half the members of the executive branch of government kiss the frog and come dawn with a terminal case of warts.

title: Arts Revival Eyed In New Brunswick
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  I would like to establish New Brunswick as the cultural capital of the state, and also bring the arts back to the people of New Jersey, Clin ton C. Crocker said in an interview last week. We've got the talent and the people want cultural enrichment. I think it's about time we did something.

title: BENEFITS LISTED IN SOVIET TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, June 9A Congressional study made pub lie today said that the United States stood to gain more in the way of political benefits from expanded trade with the Soviet Union than in the rela tively modest economic re turns.

title: A Teaneck Agency To Help Veterans
description: TEANECKA service to aid homecoming veterans in re adjusting to civilian life has been created here.

title: SUFFOLK PATROLMAN ACCUSED OF ROBBERY
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., June (UPI)A 26yearold Suffolk County patrolman was charged with robbing and beating two men in Miller Place, L. I., early this morning.

title: France to Stop Paying Dues To SEATO in June, 1974
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 9 (AP)France has given notice that she will stop paying dues to the Southeast Asia Treaty Organization after June 30, 1974, SEATO has announced.

title: Major League Baseball Sunday, June 10, 1973
VIENNA MAYOR QUITS AFTER REFERENDUM
description: VIENNA, June 9, (Reuters)The Socialist Mayor of Vienna has resigned a week after vot ers dealt the city government blow in a referendum involving the city environment.

title: Continued Guerrilla Support Promised by Syrian Leader
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 9Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, the President of Syria, today re peated his determination to support Palestinian guerrillas and to provide them with sanc tuary in spite of Israeli threats of reprisals.

title: FLOWER CHILD WINS AT YONKERS TRACK
description: YONKERS, June 9Flower Child, now an international star after having earned a European record of 1:58 4/5 for a mile in Sweden, beat seven of this country's leading trotters to night at Yonkers Raceway. The 6yearold was clocked in 2:01 1/5 for the mile, equaling the season mark for aged trotters on a halfmile track.

title: Renting a London Flat: Jolly Nice, Even If You Must Bathe in the Dark
description: THE thing that impressed me about the real estate agents I met dur ing my search for a furnished flat (apartment) in London was their rare blend of tact and frankness. The agent who handed me the keys of two flats in the Mayfair section succinctly summed up their pros and cons like this: ... elegant neighbor hood... a bit of a dryrot problem in the first one... the other's a bit pricey but convenient. Mind the leaky pipe along the bedroom wall. I went to inspect both, and in a couple of hours I had, checked out of my hotel and into one of them, on Reeves Mews, a cobblestone alley that lies between Park Lane and Grosvenor Square smack in the heart of the West End. pipe along the bedroom wall. I went to inspect both, and in a couple of hours I had, checked out of my hotel and into one of them, on Reeves Mews, a cobblestone alley that lies between Park Lane and Grosvenor Square smack in the heart of the West End.

title: Lawyer, 29, Named Defender for State
description: NEWARKSomeone told me the two most beautiful words in the English lan guage are not guilty,  Roger A. Lowenstein said the other day, and I agree.

title: Watson Is Appointed As Hill's Headmaster
description: Charles Caldwell Watson has been appointed to suc ceed Archibald R. Montgom ery 3d as headmaster of the Hill School, the boy's prepar atory school in Pottstown, Pa.

title: U.S., ENGLISH TIE IN COLLEGE MEET
description: ITHACA, N. Y., June 9The 10th international track meet ing of the combined teams from Oxford and Cambridge against Cornell and Pennsyl vania ended in a tie today as each squad won a first place in eight events. Only first place counted in the scoring.

title: Wottle Takes Mile; 8 Better 4 Minutes
Class of '73
description: The saying used to be that if a boy didn't need kill his father figuratively in order to become man, at least his first step toward manhood would mean a boot in his father's face. But this is not quite the case any more, for the simple reason that suicide has become so prevalent: the suicide of the Nixon kitchen Cabinet, for example, which in ferentially has taken with it whole globs of the na tion's rich and influential. Before that, there was the suicide in Vietnam of an entire generation of mainstream leaders of the Democrats and the view point they represented. (Recently the custom has been to speak only of the suicide of the Democratic party's left, but much more stunning in its effect on the country was the catastrophic misjudgment the centrist figures, the best of whom, if they are not dead, are now doing good works at such insti tutions as the Ford Foundation or Yale, rather like Profumo doing in his South London slums.)

title: Love and Stability Offered by Emergency Mothers
description: At any hour of the day or night, Mrs. Soccoro Martin may be summoned to the telephone to be informed that within hours she will have a new child to care for.

title: Walkout Is Called By Union Workers At 47 Cemeteries
description: Cemetery workers will strike 47 cemeteries in New York City, Westchester and Long Is land this morning, their union president, Sam Cimaglia, said last night.

title: Sunday Schools Show Vitality
description: In spirit, perhaps, if not in numbers, thousands of chil dren in Brooklyn and Queens carried on a historic tradi tion last Thursday by march ing through their neighbor hoods to celebrate the 44th anniversary of the Brooklyn Sunday School Union.

title: PARCHED AFRICA SEES RAIN BEGIN
description: OUAGADOUGOU, Upper Vol ta, June 7  Many farmers rejoiced in this droughtstrick en nation when a cloudburst this week signaled the start of the rainy season in subSaharan Africa, the time for planting.

title: Housing Project Gains in Princeton
description: PRINCETON  Despite many obstacles, work may begin soon on Princeton Township's first lowincome public housing project.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Before house tours are for ever buried [Whither the House Tour? Maybe to Ex tinction, May 20], I would like to suggest some impor tant reasons to keep them alive and some ways to re duce the hazards and increase the enjoyment for tour goer, giver and home owner.

title: Miss Allamong Is Bride of Robert Jacob
description: MECHANICSBURG, Pa., June 9In the Peace Church here tonight, Miss Kathryn Ann Allamong, daughter of Mrs. Doris Long Allamong of Harrisburg and Robert Alla mong of Sunbury, was mar ried to Robert Joseph Kassel Jacob, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ezekiel Joseph Jacob of Brooklyn Heights, New York.

title: New Community in Gloucester Seeks to Help the Handicapped Join Society
description: MULLICA HILLA new community is taking shape here in the gentle hills of Gloucester County. And while it may look like just another realestate develop ilea within an easy drive of Wilmington and Philadel phia, the Bancroft Commu nity is different.

title: Child to the Seidmans
description: A daughter was born on May 31 at LyingIn Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. Michael Seidman of Fresh Meadows, Queens. The child has been named Erica Lynn.

title: BRAVES WIN, 82; AARON HITS TWO
description: ATLANTA, June 9 (AP)Hank Aaron walloped a pair of home runs tonight to lead the Atlanta Braves to an 82 tri umph over the St. Louis Car dinals.

title: Future Social Events
description: Cocktail DansantDon't Hit the Deck, It's Iron June 13  Hors d'oeuvres, open bar and dancing to Victor Montanez, 5 to P.M., on the sailing relic Wavertree, under the co chairmenship of Mrs. John V. Lindsay and Helen Hayes to raise funds for the South Street Theater, the theatrical arm of the South Street Seaport Mu seum at the foot of Fulton Street. Tickets $15 tram the museum office, 16 Fulton Street. The Waver tree, built in 1885, de masted off Cape Horn in 1910 and being restored, is at Pier 16. The next night in a tent on Pier 16 the theater will give a dramatization of Masters's Spoon River Anthology, with folk music of the period. Admission $2.50. Reservations possible.

title: Orioles Defeat Twins, 74; Powell Hits Homer in 5th
description: BALTIMORE, June 9 (AP)Boog Powell's home run high lighted a tiebreaking, tworun fifth inning that carried the Baltimore Orioles to a 74 vic tory over the Minnesota Twins tonight.

title: Television If Watergate Turns You Off
description: Idle various Watergate hearings trace the in numerable strands of arrogant righteousness that led to national scandal, broadcasting's coverage of the senate hearings is producing Its own curious quota of rightebusness. It seems that several commentators, pro fessional and not so profes sional, are waxing indignant over the three commercial networks experimental plan tobitigdcast the hearings live on a rotational basis, with only one network responsible for complete coverage on any given day.

title: THREE SHARE LEAD IN WOMEN'S GOLF
KISSINGER AND THO HALT THEIR TALKS; RESUME TUESDAY
description: PARIS, June 9Henry A, Kissinger and Le Duc Tho today broke off their latest round of talks on how to strengthen the Vietnam peace accords. They did not sign. a draft document that was expected to be re leased this weekend.

title: U. S. Feels Cambodia Raids Blunt Communist Chances
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, June 9An authoritative Amer ican source has asserted that the intensive bombing of Cam bodia in the last four months has killed 10,000 Communist troops and wounded 10,000, with the result that the Com munists chances of a quick military victory have been blunted.

title: A Lunch of Loaves and Fishes Near Troubled Waters
description: FFROM beginning to end the mea was a long one. It really began last spring in New York City or the sidewalk outside an East Sid( junk shop where I spotted and subse quently bought a heavygauge aluminurr pot. It cost me $35, plus seven per cent sales tax. The tax, the highest in the country, is admittedly outrageous, but If you think $35 is a lot to pay for a pot, you should see the pot. Set on the ground, it reaches to my thigh. Its breech rivals the major armament aboard the battleship Missouri, and Its welded aluminum handles might, if detached, serve as croquet wickets In more scientific terms, and as speller out under the worn Everwear trademari near the rim, it is a 120quart pot; that is, 30 gallons, which, when full, is about as much as two brawny messcooks car heft between them.

title: 11 Killed in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, June 9 (AP)  Eleven persons were killed yesterday in northern Pakistan when their vehicle tumbled into the Indus River while rounding a curve on k mountain road, the police said.

title: Bridge
description: An investment that offers no hope of a profit and a clear possibility of a loss would hardly recommend it self to a financial genius. Yet bridge players can and not infrequently do reach one of the four contracts that rep resent jeopardy of this kind. One of these, five notrump, is the rarest contract of all, and can be ignored for prac tical purposes. Four notrump is by contrast quite a common contract but is relatively safe. A partnership that was seri ously considering a 12trick contract can usually scrape together 10 in notrump.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONPresident Nixon was confronted last week with new and convincing evidence of the worst peacetime inflation in the American economy since World War II, and, in agreement with several polls of public opinion, called it the nation's number one problem. The President conferred several times with his eco nomic advisers, but the week ended with present policies intact and no as surance of change in the immediate future.

title: The Achievement of Jacques Lipchitz
description: JACQUES LIPCHITZ was born in the town of Druskieniki, in Lithu ania, on Aug. 22, 1891. He died while vacationing on the island of Capri on May 26, and was buried in Jerusalem a few days later. For 60 years he had been an artist of great power and originality  one of the major sculptors of the mod em era. Although his life had been deeply affected and dis rupted by political catastro phe and personal misfortune. he was enormously produc tive, and lie brought to his work an extraordinary spirit of optimism and affirmation.

title: City's Planning Panel to Start Workshops for Neighborhoods
description: Beginning in a few weeks, neighborhood residents will be able to take part in policymak ing workshops run by the City Planning Commission, And this week, the agency is releasing detailed and updated profiles on each of the city's 62 plan ning districts.

title: Women Pilots
description: WASHINGTON  Icarus the fool hardy was a boy, and the sex  if any  of angels is disputed, but since Amelia Earhart at least it has been evident that women, too, can fly. And last week it became official, with the appointment of the first women to a cockpit seat with a major Amer ican passenger carrier.

title: Chandoha Focuses on Pets
description: ANNANDALE  Walter Chandoha's photographs of cats and dogs can be found on virtually every box or can of animal food, on maga zine covers, in advertisements and in the 20odd books he has published.

title: Kenya: More Creatures Than Comforts
description: PATCHES of sunlight broke through the branches of the makeshift but and fell upon the carcass of the slaughtered camel. The butcher removed the liver and handed it, drip ping with blood, to me. My face must have registered the repugnance I felt, for an old man in the but took the liver from me and impaled it on a stick be fore handing it back. Ducking through the low door of the but and stepping into the full blaze of the desert sun, was glad that we were there when the camel was freshly killed, for the hut's protection seemed a poor substitute for refrigeration. I joined my two com panions, John Friesen, a Canadian, and Dennis Mullin, a fellow American, and we walked back to our campsite to cook the camel's liver with onions and curry powder. We had bought the meat from a member of the East African Rendille tribe in rilaut, a small village that was the first prolonged stop on our journey from Nairobi, Kenya's capital, to Ely Springs, a fishing lodge lying on the western shore of Lake Rudolf in the country's Northern Frontier District. We were waiting for a truck to take us to South Horr, 30 miles to the west. From there we would trek 180 miles to Ely Springs through the isolated region ad jacent to the lake, an area described to me by an American friend as beautiful,

title: Riviera Life Appeals to American Fanciers
description: A new circuitthe Mediter raneanhas been discovered by American dog fanciers. A group of 40, including a half dozen who brought dogs, de scended on San Remo, Italy; Nice, France, and Monte Car lo, Monaco, and left with wonderful memories and the major laurels. Bob and Nancy Russell's Alas kan malamute, Glacier's Storm Kloud, C.D., from Sussex, Wis., an international champion, captured top awards at San Remo and Monte Carlo, and was best of breed on the French Riviera.

title: Dope Open Teeing Off June 28
description: MORRIS TOWNSHIP Golf tournaments have been named for cigarettes, auto mobiles and television per sonalities, among others, but the Dope Open, which will be played on June 28, takes its name from the problem it seeks to eradicate.

title: Does Little Women  Belittle Women?
description: THE women's movement is several tele vision seasons old now and each sea son more and more column inches are written protesting the medium's car icature of women as a gaggle of witless won ders endowed with the intelligence, independ ence and emotional maturity of retarded guppies. But, as Judy Klemesrud pointed out on this page a few weeks ago (TV's Women Are Dingbats), relief is not even in sightunless, in the shadow of the television stereo type, we look in unlikely places and revise a lew prejudices. For, in contrast to the weekly humiliation of Edith Bunker, whose victimiza tion is a matter for therapy not comedy, Little Women (the BBC production of which is currently being serialized in nine install ments on WCBS, Sundays at 5 P.M.) takes on the force of a feminist tract.

title: Mr. Nixon's New Politburo
description: WASHINGTONEven after the re shuffle of the Nixon Administration, which was supposed to strengthen the Cabinet and reduce the authority of the White House staff, it is fairly clear that the strong, bold and assertive men are still working out of 1600 Pennsyl vania Avenue.

title: Donna Freeman Affianced
description: TEANECK, N.J., June 9Mrs. Donna Lee Freeman and Mark Stoddard plan to marry Sept. 8. Announcement of their engagement has been made by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Freeman of Teaneck. The prospective bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Marie D. Stod dard of Closter. The bride is a registered nurse at the Englewood Hospital, where her fiance is an equipment technician.

title: Rich Town's U.S. Aid May Go for Bridle Paths
description: REDDING, Conn., June 9 Tennis courts, bridle paths and a dog pound are among the proposals being seriously debated by the residents of this affluent rural township as it decides how to spend $69,000 in Federal revenue sharing funds before the end of the month.

title: Siderowf Defeats Moody By 5 and 3 in British Final
description: PORTHCAWL, Wales, June 9 (UPI)Dick Siderowf achieved (something today that only 15 Americans had managed before. He won the British Amateur golf championship.

title: HALPERIN MAY SUE NIXON MEN ON TAP
description: WASHINGTON, June 9Dr. Morton H. Halperin, whose home telephone was bugged while he was working as a staff member of the National Security Council, is expected to announce next week that he is suing those allegedly respon sible for the wiretap.

title: Black Banks: Progress and Problems
Time to end the big affair
description: Every time I climb into my fourdoor, commodi ous, comfortable Citroen these daysor occasion ally into my neighbor's Fiat station wagonI am overcome with a radical thought. The thought became a downright nag after President Nixon's recent message to Congress on the energy problem and the simultaneous reports of gasoline shortages around the country.

title: Cooking Under Sail
description: In the special world where the kitchen pitches and rolls, where rust and mold lurk around every elbowcracking corner and where you say ice box without fear of being dated, Katharine Robinson cooks serenely on both burn ers. That's all she has, and she makes the most of them in Gourmet in the Galley (to be published by Quadrangle Books at $9.95 on July 1), a practical text oh feeding afloat.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: PHASE 3 of the Administration's Inept economic stabilization program will reach the ripe old age of five months tomorrowbattered, floundering and ready for prompt retirement. But will its progenitors in Government have the vision and the courage to cast it aside in favor of some vital, new mechanism that can effectively restore a less inflationary environment?

title: East Bloc Goes UnSoviet Way
description: BREST, U.S.S.R.Here on the SovietPolish frontier an un usual feat of engineering bc curs every day: Entire trains are lifted off their carriages, car by car, and fitted with new sets of wheels to pass out the Soviet Union into Europe.

title: Architecture
description: MORE than ever, it is necessary to write of basic things. Contrary to still prevalent belief, that does not mean beautiful buildings. And it is not the polemics of design theory. The former are a matter for rejoicing and the reaffirmation of architecture as art and bench mark of civilization; the lat ter is a luxury for anyone dealing with the awesome and awful nitty gritty of to day's urban condition.

title: U. S. Schoolboy 2Mile Record Of 8:40.9 Is Set by Illinois Star
Llamas Are the New Stars At a Game Farm on Island
description: MANORVILLE, L. I.One should never turn one's back on a llama.

title: Illicit Foster Homes Here Exploit Mental Patients
description: Since their discharge from state hospitals, some mental, patients have become virtual inmates of illicit foster homes in Queens.

title: Child to Mrs. Phillips
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Michael Wayne Phillips of Miami, Fla., on May 28 in Mercy Hospital in Miami. Mrs. Phillips is the former Miss Charlotte Louise Snyder of Kettering, Ohio. The child, whose father is an account executive with Mer rill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., in Coral Gables, Fla., is named Stephanie Eli zabeth.

title: Donation of Bodies Benefiting Science
description: NEWARKAfter thinking about it for years, Mrs. Mary Ellen Lewis finally reached what she calls a Christian decision on how to dispose of her body after death: She is bequeathing her body to medical science.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Couple of nice things about paperback mysteries: they don't generally cost too much more than a dollar, and since they so overwhelmingly deal in reissues, you can get reacquainted with early Stout or Christie and live a more innocent life. Is there anything more pleasant on a long plane trip than cuddling into your temporary womb, sneering at the stewardess when movie time comes, and plunging into The Murder of Roger Ackroyd or Ferde Lance? One of the anticipa tory things, come vacation time, is nosing around the pa perbacks in the airport shop or the local drugstore, and getting aboard Travis McGee's houseboat. All those girls! All that philosophy! All that ac action! Jane Austen, Dickens, Tolstoythat's for retirement. For vacation give me of Travis time.

title: A'S DOWN TIGERS ON 2HITTER, 40
description: OAKLAND, June 9 (AP)Ken Holtzman, a lefhande pitched a twohit shutout today to give the Oakland A's a 40 victory over the Detroit Tigers

title: Rent Increase Patterns Grow Clearer
description: New answers are emerging to an old question in the city: How much will the rent go up when the lease expires?

title: Pop
description: THE 1973 Newport Jazz FestivalNew York, to be held June 29 through July 8 at lo cations throughout the city, promises to present a num ber of young and relatively unknown musicians in addi tion to the usual preponder ance of more established ar tists. Trumpeter Miles Davis's criticism of last year's safe and predictable talent lineup and the successful counterfestival staged by the New York Musicians Organ ization (which will be work ing in conjunction with George Wein this year) are only two of the reasons for the inclusion of a large avant garde contingent; many re viewers tempered their ap preciations of the 1972 fes tival with comments on the lack of adventurous new talent.

title: Presidential Scholar, 16, Has Hopes For Future
description: It is a long way from the slums of BedfordStuyvesant to the White House, but Jan ice Herbert, a high school senior at Hunter College Campus School, achieved this distinction in only her 16th year. Miss Herbert was se lected as a Presidential scholar  representing all fe male high school students of New York State and one of 121 chosen from more than a million nominees through out the nation. President Nix on will present the prestig jous medallions in the White House a week from Tuesday.

title: WALL SETS MARK IN JERSEY MILE
description: PISCATAWAY TOWNSHIP, N. J., June 9Dave Wall of Dickinson broke Marty Liguori's onemile record at the New Jersey allgroup state track and field championships today at Rutgers Stadium.

title: OTB Plunger Goes for $40,000
description: Although most of the Off track Betting Corporation's customers showed healthy disinterest in betting on the Belmont Stakes yesterday, OTB's favorite customer did not let it down.

title: Lindsay
description: Somewhere in between absence makes the heart grow fonder and out of sight out of mind lies the right political timing for John Lind say.

title: CAMPING
description: There are, among other things in the world, cocktail bars. Either seat ed or standing, you feel quite at home in them, laughing, talking, drinking your liver away in man kind's great good sciencecreated pleasuredome with a million con venient locations. When night comes doesn't matter; it's dark in there anyway. You feel no wind and see no moon. There are no insects, no animals, no birds, except in rare, dis turbing instances, a cockatoo or an aquarium of disillusioned fish. You could spend your life amongst such surroundings and not have to worry about anything but the bill. You could spend your life there, and you're afraid you're going to have to.

title: William Patrick Is Killed in California Air Crash
description: William Penn Patrick, who pyramided a cosmetics sales organization into a California business empire and became active in, rightwing politics, was killed yesterday when one of his vintage World War 1I planes crashed on a ridge near, his High Valley Ranch, 80; miles north of San Francisco.

title: Numismatics
description: IN 1891 a bridge was built over the Mississippi Riv er between Muscatine, Iowa, and a point just south of Rock Island, Ill. Last April, with a new bridge al ready in service, the rickety old Muscatine bridge was blown up. The event was fea tured in newspapers all across the country because there is something specialtangible and intangible about a bridge, any bridge, but especially an 82yearold span that, to borrow Emer son's line, had arched the flood of one of the world's great rivers to provide a safe crossing for millions of peo ple on foot, on horseback and in Model T Fords.

title: Queens Regulars Win
description: The Queens Guilty Demo cratic organization under the leadership of Matthew J. Troy Jr. came across hand somely during last week's pri maries for the City Cuncil.

title: Rail Crash Is Attributed to Human Error
description: The Penn Central said yester day that man failure ap peared to be at the root of the crash of two trains in Mount Vernon, N.Y., Friday evening that killed one person and in jured 140.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Although all fullservice ad agencies basically perform the same Unction and draw on the same small, almost transient, pool of talent, nei ther their output nor reputa tions are the same.

title: Cahill's Defeat Will Alter Legislative Races
description: TRENTONLegislative re apportionment and the abrupt change in the leadership of ?? Republican Party that followed Governor Cahill's stunning defeat in last Tues day's primary election fore cast wide open legislative races for the 120 seats in the November general election.

description: GENEVA, June 9Drugtak ing in itself should not be con sidered a crime, according to experts of the World Health Organization.

title: Mary's Poppin'
description: AS of the first of this year, Mary Poppins, Walt Disney's 1964 mu sical adaptation of the P. L. Travers stories had earned ap proximately $31,000,000 in the United States and Canada. The film was voted five Academy Awards, including one for Julie Andrews as the best actress of 1964, and it was so popular that it even inspired its own tiny backlash: bumper stickers announcing Mary Poppins Is A Junkie, which may or may not have been prompted by a song in the Oscar winning Sherman Brothers score to the effect that a spoonful of sugar helps the medicine go down.

title: Soviet Launches Unmanned Probe In Cosmos Series

title: Fireflies
description: The fireflies are out and winking. You can see them almost any evening.now, in city parks, in suburban back yards, and over country meadows. Entomologists call them Lampyridae, from the Greek word for a torch. They have been sparkling early summer evenings for eons, and for generations scientists have, investigated them, trying to find the secret of their cold light.

title: The Press And Watergate
description: The Times of London has suggested that the American press, which has played such a large role in the Water gate and related disclosures, now is publishing much prejudicial material which will make it difficult for justice to be done to President Nixon and other officials. Maybe so; but the un warranted implication is that the news papers ought to leave the matter to the official investigators.

title: Puerto Rico First to Require Use of Safety Belts In Autos

title: RHODESIA PLAN LOSES ITS COLORED SUPPORT

title: Skylab
description: HOUSTON  When an astronaut steps out of his ship into the vacuum of space, he becomes a human satellite. His body, wrapped in helmet, gloves, and pressure suit, is orbiting the earth at the incredible speed of 17,000 miles an hour. And yet he appears only to be floating on an invisible sea, buoyed by Kepler's orbital laws and bobbing in obedience to Newton's actionreaction laws.

title: State Panel Warns Of Gas Shortages For This Summer

Toye said that the proposal would not be applicable to expansionn teams or to play ers who have been here before, but only to new players. He said he had cir culated the proposal through the league ofice and all nine franchises were aware of it.

Delay of the surcharge income until late summer, the company said in a petition, would jeopardize its $3billion construction program by limiting the stocks and bonds it could issue.

title: A Study on Recycling of Paper Finds Concepts Misconceived
description: A 177page analysis recently released says that two popular ly held conceptions on how to encourage recycling of the nation's glut of waste paper are misconceived and that sever al other suggestions would have very limited effects.

title: Two Quintuplets Go Home
