Roger, the first born of the five, weighed 5 pounds 2 ounces and Owen just over five pounds when they were released from Bess Kaiser Hospital. The three other babies of Mrs. Eric An derson are expected to go home soon.

title: GOLF
description: I think I have been asked to write about golf as a hobby. But of course golf is not a hobby. Hobbies take place in the cellar and smell of airplane glue. Nor is golf, though some men turn it into such, meant to be a profession or a pleasure. Indeed, few sights are more odious on the golf course than a sauntering, beeredup foursome obviously having a good time. Some golfers, we are told, enjoy the landscape; but prop erly the landscape shrivels and com presses into the grim, surrealistically vivid patch of grass directly under the golfer's eyes as he morosely walks toward where he thinks his ball might be, We should be con scious of no more grass, the old Scots adage goes, than will cover our own graves. If neither work nor play, then, if more pain than plea sure but not essentially either, what, then, can golf be? Luckily, a word newly coined rings on the blank Formica of the conundrum. Golf is, let us say, a trip.

title: GARDENING
description: Gardeners are happy people. Whether they are born sanguine and by accident take up gardening or whether this calling has made them. merry and benign I don't know. Yet come spring and, like lovers, lunatics and poets, here come the gardeners  especially the organic gardeners with their love of compost heaps and their lore of ladybugs. In cheer ful garden books, they write Vir gil's Georgics over again: Scorn not to soak the dry soil with fatten ing dung. Pray for dripping mid summers and clear winters, O hus bandmen. They sound busily at peace like Gilbert White of Selborne, whose common entry in his journal of 25 years was Wheeled dung. Like Thoreau they plant their nine bean rows, scorning insecticides, un dismayed by the wanton ways of the world, maintaining a state of grace that may yet save us the pieces. As Bertrand Russell said, when intellectuals question if life is worth living while gardeners feel no doubt about it, it seems that intel lectuals have something to learn from gardeners.

title: LITTLE RISK TAKES 2 HUNTER CROWNS
description: FAR HILLS, N. J., June 9Mrs. Frank Chapot, wife of the United States Equestrian Team starand herself a former in ternational riderpiloted Little Risk to both the regular and green working hunter cham pionships at the Far Hills horse and pony show today.

description: The ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center, one of the na tion's leading healthcare and medicaleducation complexes, announced plans yesterday for a fiveyear, $183million con struction and modernization program and the start of a fund drive to pay for it.

title: Constantine as Symbol
description: In announcing, the deposition of King Constantine and the appointment of himself as provisional President, Colonel Papadopoulos called the Greek monarchy an outdated leftover of past ages. But former Premier Canellopoulos came closer to current reality in asserting that the King is a far greater guarantee for the restora tion of the liberties of the Greek people than the self proclaimed President of a nonexistent republic. The ruling colonels showed that they keenly appreciate the King's current importance as a rallying symbol for all democratic forces by forbidding Greek newspapers print Constantine's statement, issued in Rome, or even the fact that he made a statement.

title: the traveler's world
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va.For nearly 50 years, Colonial Williams burg has been working hard at preserving its reasonably good facsimile of an 18thcentury environ ment, so it was natural for the top executives of this great historic preser vation foundation to become leaders in efforts to negotiate a fruitful marriage between the travel industry and the contemporary environment. Williams burg has proved to be a good test labor atory for the American Hotel and Motel Association's Committee for a Quality Environment, a nationwide endeavor of enlightened selfinterest whose potential for the common good exceeds possible ulterior and financial benefits.

description: PLUCKEMIN  A group of flying enthusiasts meets on most seasonable weekends and some weekdays at the Somerset Airport for a sort of search and enjoy mission. The object of the search is what one of them called green air.

The airline's attempt, to the form of plan to guarantee seats to passengers who pay in advance, did not win the necessary approval of the Civil Aero nautics Board. As a result, overbooking, which occasionally results in a passen ger's being bumped off a plane on which he his a reservation, will con tinue.

title: Machines that answer the telephone
description: Mignon Fedderman spent a recent morning on the phone. She called the airconditioning service and paint store and left her name and number. She called to confirm plane reserva tions and was told that a clerk would be with her presently; after five min utes and no clerk, she decided to try again later. Both her analyst and dentist were out, so she left messages asking for appointments. Next she dialed a movie house and, in addition to performance times, she was treated to quotes from two good reviews and a plot summary. Her friend Hilda was out, so she left word to call her tomor row. When it was time to go down town, she called the weather number and heard that sunny skies were pre dicted.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:

description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.Y. Long ago in Brooklyn, a young girl used to skip by the motherhouse of the Ro man Catholic nursing order of the Sisters of the Infant Jesus on Henry Street, three blocks from her home. Someday, Agnes Doran would say to herself, I'll be one of them and take care of poor people who are sick.

title: 400 Illegal Aliens Seized As Coast Roundup Goes on
description: LOS ANGELES, June 9 (UPI) Federal agents rounded up 400 illegal aliens from Mexico at bus stops, factories and on the streets yesterday, bringing to 7,100 the number of aliens arrested in use last 11 days.

title: Going the Kodaly Way
description: THE late Zoltan Kodaly said that music should be a refreshment and a joy. The Hungarian com poser and educator had every. one.in mind when he made this state ment, but he was particularly concerned about, music's relationship to children. During his long life, he developed what is known as the Kodaly method of teach ing, which now permeates the Hungarian schools. It has impressed observers so much, that the method has been taken up by teachers in other countries, in cluding our own. The Holy Names Col lege in Oakland, Calif., will be host to the First Kodaly International Sympo sium Um Aug. 1 to 15, with dele gates coming from 18 countries, Argen tina, Japan, Australia and the Soviet Union them.

title: Miss Kinney To Be Bride

title: GOLDIN PLANNING MEDIA CAMPAIGN
description: State Senator Harrison J. Gol din, who spent about two and a half times as much as his three opponents together in swamping them in last Mon day's Democratic primary for City Controller, says that he does not consider his spending excessive and that he hopes to wage a similar media cam paign in the general election.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs war, not available in time to appear in Section

title: Ferraris and Matra Duel for Honors at Le Mans Race
description: LE MANS, France, June 9French and Italian cars, as they have been known to do throughout Europe, hogged the roads here today and made the 24 Hours of Le Mans a twofac tory race for publicity.

title: INSURANCE FRAUD IS CHARGED TO 28
description: Twentyeight persons have been arrested in a multimil lion dollar insurance fraud scheme in the Providence, R. I., area. Taken into custody early Thursday morning by the state police and other law enforce ment officials, the suspects were among 43 persons named in secret indictments by a Superior Court grand jury June 1.

title: Western Europe Aiming for 185MileanHour Trains
description: A reddish blur, 100 yards long, streaking across Aqui taine at nearly 200 miles an hour in recent tests, is France's big hope for a new era of veryhighspeed rail Passenger service.

title: Two Towns Will Mark Founding Of Churches
description: LITTLE FALLS  This town in Passaic County and Woodbridge in Middlesex Cothrity will mark today two nottobeforgotten dates in their religious history.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Son to Mrs. Schellenberg
description: AURORA, Colo., June 9A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Carl B. Schellengberg last Tuesday at St. Luke's Hospital in Denver. Mrs. Schellengberg is the former Miss Laurie La Fontaine of Southport, Conn. Her hus band is a lawyer with the Federal Aviation Administra tion in Denver. The child has been named Arthur Burckly.

title: Dear Senator... Letters from U.S. fliers
description: In recent weeks many American fliers have written their Congressmen or Sen ators to express their views about the bombing in Indochina. Following are ex cerpts from some of the letters received by Senators J. W. Fulbright and Edward M. Kennedy (they have withheld the names of the writers):

title: Poll Indicates a Big Loss For House G.O.P. in '74
description: A new Gallup Poll indicates that the Republicans could lose as many as 40 seats in the House of Representatives in the Congressional elections next year, at least partly because of the Watergate scandal,

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market showed increased signs of life last week and made a good advance. Part of the upswing was termed technical following the long decline in prices.

title: So Lie Down and Face the Music
description: THERE was a time, well within the memory of living men, when all audiences listened to concerts while seated in upholstered chairs, facing the music like good Presbyte rian parishioners in their assigned pews. There still are such concerts, of course, but in recent years a new variety of listdner has appeared a mutated strain that seems to enjoy music most while lying on floors.

title: Yomkers Result
College Will Host Harpsichord Fete
description: PRINCETON  Westrmin ?? Choir College will host a Harpsichord Festival Week from Sunday, June 24, through Friday, June 29.

title: SHOP TALK
description: NEW BRUNSWICK This old college town is a reward ing one to visit, if only be cause of its unusual shops.

title: The Clearwater Hardens Her Fight Against Pollution
description: ALPINEThe 96foot sloop Clearwater was taking out groups of children here last week to bring home the mes sage of cleaning up water pollution, much as it has been doing up and down the Hud son for the last five years.

title: Turnpike Authority Seeks to Answer Objections to New Spur
description: EAST BRUNSWICKThe New Jersey Turnpike Author ity, whose ability to attract growing revenues has won it almost unquestioned support from Wall Street, is embark ing on a new venture that may make or break its im age as a roadbuilder.

title: Cornett Wins Auto Race
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., June 9 (AP)Mel Cornett, 37 years old, of Wauwatosa, Wis., won the 40lap United States Auto Club sprint car feature race at the Action Track today.

title: Susan Terry Fincee of G. S. Craft
description: HOUSTON, June 9  Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Terry have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Nell Terry, to George Sullivan Craft, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. Craft of Scarsdale, N.Y. The wed ding is planned for July 14.

title: Queens'
description: A collection of 37 photo graphs and various artifacts a door latch, a handrail, a wooden bracerepresent ing the Lost Architecture of Queens is on exhibition at the Kingsland Mansion, the 200yearold landmark in Flushing, Queens.

title: 161 SHOT VICTOR IN RACE ON COAST
Juniors, Boys Play Aug. 6 In Columbia Net Tourney
description: The Columbia tennis tourna ment for juniors and boys is scheduled for Aug. 6 through 11 at the Columbia Tennis Center at Baker Field. Eastern Airlines will sponsor the tourney for the third straight year.

title: Dave Anderson
description: On a tiny portable TV set atop a mid nightgreen Cadillac parked outside the Meadow Stable barn at Belmont Park yes terday, a voice was saying, ... and that horse, named Secretariat.... Minutes later, deep in the shadows of, the green and white barn, the 3yearold chestnut emerged from his stall.

title: New & Novel
description: One of the questions I've been mulling over the years goes as follows: Is there sum mer reading as opposed to winter, spring and autumn reading? This ranks just be hind: Could the heavyweight champ beat a gorilla in the ring? (first asked by Arthur Brisbane) and What is Gloria Steinem really like? (first asked by her mother). Dodging the question once again, we can say that there certainly is summer reading matter: paper backs, especially the novel. Here is a disposable mediumfull of dreams, immune to de valuation by ketchup stains, mildew and other vacation hazards. Paperback novels are meant to last no longer than a picnic lunch. Unless they are as long as Herman Wouk's Pocket Book The Winds of War ($2.25). In which case: 2 picnic lunches.

title: Camera World
Headliners
description: To Israel With Emotion Many Israelis thought they would never see the day when the German flag would fly and the German national anthem would be played in Jerusalem. But it happened last week when Chancellor Willy Brandt arrived for the first state visit to Israel by a German head of government in officethe latest step in the gradual reconciliation of the two countries. The fourday visit was charged with emotion, symbolized by Mr. Brandt's stop at the Yad Vashem memorial to the six million Jews exterminated by the Nazis. The Lord is compassionate and gracious, the Chancellor quoted the 103d Psalm. He will not always be the accuser or nurse his anger for all time. Then Premier Golda Meir, who once said she would never set foot in Germany, accepted Mr. Brandt's invitation for a reciprocal visit.

title: Florida Man Gets Jail Term For $1.3Million Job Fraud
description: For his role in a $1.3million swindle of 2,000 jobseekers who wanted to be corporate executives, Jack Kuscher, the 69yearold former president of an executive placement busi ness, is expected to surrender June 22 in Florida and serve 30 days in prison, The Asso ciated Press reported yester day.

title: F.D.U. Coach Is Elected
description: Gerry Clinton, Fairleigh Dickinson University's lacrosse coach the past two seasons, has been elected president of the Knickerbocker Lacrosse Confer ence's Coaches Association. Clinton led the Knights to the conference championship this spring.

title: Mrs. Bianco Has Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Michael F. P. Bianco of Tokyo, Summit, N.J., and Pocono Farms, Pa., on May 1 in the Tokyo Sani tarium Hospital. The child is named Francessca Louise. Her father is a vice president hand representative of Loeb, Rhoades & Co., international investment banking firm, Japan Representative Office in Tokyo.

title: WALL STREET
description: With the chemical business great across the board, as one Wall Street analyst noted, it comes as no great surprise that one hears kind words about chemical stocks this spring.

title: The Truth Is Forcing Its Way Out
description: WASHINGTONThere were scat tered signs last week that public inter est in the Watergate affair might be flagging, but there were countersigns that, bored or not, the public could no more escape the scandal than the Government officials who fear it.

title: SAILING
description: One summer day 35 years ago, canoe rigged for sailing floated idly a few yards from the north shore of Long Island's Peconic Bay. Although there were several people about, the craft was momentarily unattended. The single sail flapped in the breeze.

title: CanAm Best Bet: Healthy Donohue in a Fast Porsche
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 9As Teddy Mayer says, so long as Mark Donohue is in the field, everybody else is more than 100 to 1 to win the 1973 CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup.

title: Ballet: Margot Fonteyn, Guest Artist
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., June 9 Apart from her brief, but telling appearance at Sol Hurok's Gala at the Metro politan Opera House a couple of weeks ago, the only ap pearance Dame Margot Fon teyn has made, or will make, in the New York area this season came last night at the C. W. Post College Audi torium.

title: ANTIWIRETAP BILL GAINS IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, June 9A Govern ment antiwiretapping bill that aroused little public interest be fore the Watergate exposures has suddenly become urgent legislation.

title: Carol McDougal Bride of D. S. Cashman
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., June 9 In St. Anne's Roman Cath olic Church here this after noon, Miss Carol Ann Mc Dougal, daughter of Walter A. McDougal of Garden City and the late Mrs. McDougal, became the bride of Daniel Stephen Cashman, son of Thomas E. Cashman of Fer gus Fails, Minn., and the late Mrs. Cashman.

title: TwoWheeled Intruders in a FourWheeled Culture
description: THERE are 6 million tennis players, 7 million bowlers, and 12 million golfers in the United States. And each of the sports to which these millions devote themselves is occasional ly declared a national pastime. That being the case, it will come as a sur prise to many to learn that there are close to 20 million motorcyclists, enough to make motorcycling, far and away, our real national pastime.

title: Trade With China Enters a New Stage
description: China's trade with the United States is now moving into a new stage, less euphor ic than the first, but one that promises tough negotiat ing and substantial American sales.

title: Air Travel
description: The era of supersonic airline travel, once expected to be flourishing by the mid1970's, may yet arrive on sched ule, but it has not been an easy pas sage.

title: Is the Only Good Writer a Dead Writer?
description: THE Flint River is truly in Georgia. However, there's a creek near Clearwater, Florida, and we called it Flint River and it was good enoughsuch is the magic of cinema and I was sitting beside the Flint River writing a letter to my wife in California when Maurice Rosenfield said to me, What are you doing?

title: Positively Smashing Tour
description: TORONTO, June 9 (Canadian Press)  The unbeaten Welsh Rugby team ended its tour of Canada today with a 58.20 vic ?ory over an allCanada team after Canada had led, 16.13, at halftime. It was the visitors ?fth victory and it brought their aggregate score to 28844,

title: Needs of the Elderly In Suffolk Studied
Ward Hinkle Weds Cynthia Foote
description: DORSET, Vt., June 9Miss Cynthia Ann Foote was married here this afternoon at the home of her step father and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Earl Gladstone Holmes, to Ward Byington Hinkle, son of Dr. and Mrs. Law rence Earl Hinkle Jr. of New Canaan, Conn. The Rev. Hal C. Miller 3d of the United Church of Dorest and East Rupert, performed the cere mony.

title: OKLAHOMA OUSTS PENN STATE, 60
description: OMAHA, June 9 (AP)A freshman lefthander, Bob Shir ley, checked Penn State on one hit, a twoout single in the eighth by Garry Koch, as Okla homa posted a 60 victory to day in an elimination game in the 27th College World Series.

title: Miners Get Credit Union
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) A Federal credit union de signed to serve about 200,000 members of the United Mine Workers was chartered this week. It will operate initially from offices in Washington.

title: College Head's Sabbatical: 2 Months at Menial Jobs
description: Dr. John R. Coleman, president of Haverford College, outside Philadelphia, had repeatedly complained that the educational process kept people in lockstep from infancy to Ph.D. and then some.

title: Ottawa to Help Olympics
description: OTTAWA, June 9 (UPI)The Canadian Government plans to introduce legislation to author ize special stamps, coins and lottery to help finance the 1976 summer Olympics in Montreal.

title: James Crosby Fiance Of Miss Eugenie Ryan
description: CHATHAM, N. J., June 9Mrs. Gertrude Carroll Ryan has made known the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Eugenie Carroll Ryan to James Allen Crosby, son of Mrs. W. Claude Andrews of Fenton, Mich., and John R. Crosby of Arlington, Va.

title: Miss Caroline Curtis Wed to James Gerard Brown
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., June 9In St. John's of Lat tingtown Episcopal Church here this afternoon, Miss Caroline Page Curtis, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Todd Porter Curtis of Glen Cove, became the bride of James Gerard Brown of Southamp ton. He is the son of Mrs. Victor Joseph Brown of Say ville and the late Mr. Brown.

title: Fighting in South Vietnam Heaviest Since February
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, June 10Fighting in South Vietnam surged to its highest level since midFebru ary yesterday and both the Saigon Government and the Communists appeared to be jockeying for more territory.

title: CITY CUTS WORTH OF AID FROM STATE
description: The city's Budget Directol, David A. Grossman, says the $90million in aid to the city voted by the Legislature in its closing hours actually added up to only $60million, because $30million of the total required matching city funds, which may not be available.

title: Paperbacks
description: THE CONFESSION OF A CHILD OF THE CENTURY, by Thomas Rogers. (NAL, $1.50.) A rebellious son undergoes Harvard, serves Korea and is captured by the Chinese, defects and returns to the C.I.A. a picaresque tale, an astonishing kaleidoscopic account of coming age in contemporary America.

title: Fire Escape, Updated, Is a Fire Balcony
description: Fire escapes, shorn of their spidery stairs, are making a comeback of sorts. The latest version, known as fire balcony, is sprouting on the facades of several buildings nearing completion in the city.

title: Best Seller List
Stanley Kowalski Loves Gittel Mosca
Gardens
description: WHILE a carefully tended, lush green lawn, devoid of weeds and thick bluegrass, is certainly a beau tiful sight, it is the natural colors and textures that stirs me to delight.

title: Vistafjord Makes Her Maiden Cruise
description: The largest passenger liner ever to fly the Norwegian flag, 25,000ton Vistafjord, made her maiden cruise to the West Indies last week after adopting New York as her home port.

title: At 71, Barbara Cartland Is Still a Crusader
description: LONDON  There is no doubt that Barbara Cartland likes to talk: Words rush from her lips by the hundreds, usually at machinegun speed.

title: MYSTERIOUS WINS EPSOM OAKS RACE
description: EPSOM, England, June 9 (AP) Unbeaten Mysterious, the fa vorite owned by George Pope Jr. of Madera, Calif., raced to a fourlength victory today the 195th running of the gruel ing Oaks Classic for 3yearold fillies at Epsom Downs.

title: Mrs. Mary Adams Married to David B. Findlay Jr.
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 9Mrs. Mary Evans Adams, widow of Peter R. Adams, was married here this after noon to David B. Findlay Jr. of New Canaan, a director of Findlay Galleries in New York. The ceremony in St. Paul's Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. T. Guthrie Speers Jr., assisted by the Rev. Everett L. Fuliam.

title: Sallie B. Drury Bride Of Frederick D. Iselin
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., June 9Miss Sallie Bennett Drury, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Simonds Drury, was married here this evening to Frederick Downes Iselin of Salters, son of Mrs. Oliver Iselin of Rome and the late Mr. Iselin of Glen Head, L. I. Canon Samuel T. Cobb per formed the ceremony in St. Phillip's Episcopal Church.

title: U.S. Friendship Put First In a Poll of West Germans
description: TUBINGEN, West Germany, June, 9 (Reuters)Fiftyseven per cent of West German's questioned on a survey regard the United States as the coun try whose friendship is most important to them, according to an opinion poll published here this week.

title: MONSOON IN INDIA ENDS THE DROUGHT
description: NEW DELHI, June 9Rains lashed India's western coast this week, bringing respite to millions of people and cattle suffering from a severe threeyear drought.

title: Mark Louis Schmid Marries Margot Zavell, Teacher Here
description: The Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest was the setting here yesterday after noon for the marriage of Miss Margot Zavell, daughter of Mrs. Arnold Zavell of New York and Breckenridge, Colo., and the late Mr. Za vell, to Mark Louis Schmid. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul A. Schmid of South Westport, Mass.

title: Percy Approves Research On a 76 Presidential Bid
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) Senator Charles H. Percy, one of the chief Republican critics of President Nixon's handling of the Watergate scandal, disclosed today that he had taken the first step to ward a possible 1976 Presiden tial candidacy.

title: U.S. MONEY POSES PROBLEM ON L.I.
description: WOODSBURGH, L. I., June 9This community of $75,000 to $150,000 homes on winding, treelined roads had a problem recently: what to do with some $3,500 in Federal funds it re ceived in the last six months from revenue sharing.

title: ADELPHI U. OFFERS PARALEGAL COURSE
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I.An intensive summer program to enable college graduates to study to become lawyers as sistants will start tomorrow at Ade1phi University here, according to Mrs. Lois Blume, dean of continuing education at the university.

title: Retreat on Hijacking?
description: Five months ago, following two aerial hijackings that were marked by unusual violence, the Federal Govern ment belatedly moved to halt a longtime plague of sky piracy by ordering electronic screening of all airline passengers and searches of all carryon luggage. This ac tion has proved dramatically effective. There hasn't been a single hijacking in this country since the new order took effect last Jan. 5, whereas hijackings occurred at the rate of one every two weeks during the comparable period last year.

title: Mayor Hopefuls Seek to Raise $200,000 Each Badillo Mostly for Ads, Beame for Organization Efforts
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame and Representative Herman Badillo are raising at least 8200,000 each for the Demo cratic mayoral runoff minicam paign, which will be decided in. June 26.

title: Water Gap To Be Site Of Concerts In Summer
description: DELAWARE WATER GAP The Delaware Water Gap Recreation Area will be the setting this summer for a series of free chamber music concarts under the ?? of the Artists For Environ ment Foundation. The con certs will begin on June 30 at 7:30 P.M. and continue throughout the summer.

title: Cantata from Holocaust Back on L.I.
description: A welltraveled, widely hailed Long Islandborn can tata is coming home.

title: SKYLAB CREWMEN PUT IN A BUSY DAY
description: HOUSTON, June 9 (AP) Powerful cameras aboard Sky lab I scrutinized corn fields in Nebraska, strip mining in Ken tucky and the effects of the Mississippi River flooding as astronauts on the space station collected scientific knowledge today.

title: Montclair School Rooms Go to Camp
description: BRANCHVILLEIt's camp ing time again for the sixth grade.

title: Foods From Scandinavia
description: MONTCLAIR  Elmer's Delicatessen, at 104 Walnut Street here, features foods from Norway, Sweden, Den mark, Finland, Greenland and Iceland. There is also a wide selection of traditional Scan dinavian wooden handi craft, cookware such as Krunikake irons, Plett and Munke pans, aebleskiver (doughnut) fryers, and Disk Tdaja, an efficient, pot cleaner made of straw.

title: Somewhere Between Ketzantzakis and Kesey
description: INDOS, RhodesThe village of Lindos was still a quiet, primitive place when we first encountered it 13 years ago. We were immedi ately won, even though our initial im pression of it was all wrong. Seen from the heights of the approach, Lindos was undoubtedly beautiful, but on the pic turesque side. There were all those white houses that lay scattered under the commanding acropolis like a hand ful of confetti. Then there was the bay of Lindos, blue as a butterfly's wings, sitting in the sunlight beneath the vil lage, enclosed by horns of rock, two is lands guarding its entrance. The air was fragrant with the scent of wild herbs, fishing boats lay bobbing at anchor, and kestrels surged across the sky. It all seemed to have been put together for a postcard.

title: Lisa Smith Is Married
description: Miss Lisa Cathy Smith and Bruce Bertram Emmett, who were graduated last month from the Syracuse University School of Art, were married yesterday afternoon. Matthew Spatter performed the cere mony at the Riverdale Ethical Society, of which he is leader, in Riverdale, the Bronx. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ving Smith of New Rochelle, N. Y. Mr. and Mrs. Robert Emmett of Greenwich, Conn., are the parents of the bride groom.

title: WEICKER REPORTS A HALDEMAN LINK TO MISSING FILE
description: WASHINGTON, June 9John W. Dean 3d has said that he was told by an aide to H. R. Haldeman that Mr. Haldeman ordered pertinent documents de stroyed right after the Water gate burglary, according to the report of a Senator who inter viewed Mr. Dean last month.

title: Stans Gets Salary Out of Funds Left By 72 Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) Maurice H. Stans.has begun drawing a salary from the $4.8 million left over from the Nixon campaign, the Finance Commit tee to Reelect the President announced today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WARWICK, R. I.The day was bright, but a stiff north westerly swept across Narra gansett Bay, and Art Laval ley, my fishing host for the day, was not optimistic.

title: AROUND THE
description: Keep up weekly rose spray while damp humid weather continues to ward off black spot... Mulch vegetable and flower borders to keep down weeds and hold soil moisture.... Don't forget to apply liquid fertilizer to containergrown plants every three weeks or so.... Stake tomatoes if they were not staked at planting time.

title: Quincy's Citizens to Salute Whalers'
description: QUINCY, Mass., June 9 (AP) The city of Quincy has pro claimed next week as Whaler Week in honor of the New England Whalers of the World Hockey Association.

title: 13 Laymen Become First in State to Be Ordained to Revived Catholic Diaconate
description: John Maloney, a social work er from Nanuet, N.Y., took on an additional role yesterday and lost no time putting it to use.

title: Patricia Prouty Becomes Bride
description: KATONAH, N. Y., June 9 Miss Patricia Stewart Prouty, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman R. Prouty, was married here this afternoon to Jehu Patterson Cooper 4th, son of Dr. and Mrs. Cooper 3d of Matawan,: N. J.

title: Myth and Distortions
description: WASHINGTONDuring recent de bate over Presidential authority to impound funds, constant repetition has almost made fact of the myth that our third President began the practice long ago. The charge is that President Jefferson refused to build fifteen gun boats to patrol the Mississippi River.

title: Senate Bill Would Prohibit Killing of Imperiled Species
description: WASHINGTON, June 9 (AP) Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, has introduced legislation that would prohibit the killing of animals on the endangered spe cies list.

title: 2 Crewmen Die in Rio Crash
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June (AP)  A Boeing 707 airliner carrying no passengers crashed Into the bay while attempting to land Saturday at Rio's Galeao Airport. Authorities reported two crewmen were killed and two survived. The plane, appar ently on a cargo flight, hit about 100 yards short of the runway. Officials of Varig, the Brazilian state airline that owns the plane, said they did not know what it was carrying.

title: Beyond Any Limits
description: The numerous disclosures of the Watergate scandal already indicate that the Nixon Administration pursued several of its objectives by means that were outside reg ular lawful channels or in defiance of the law.

title: Traffic
description: Manhattan's traffic problems touch many lives impartially: the Westches ter executive who pays $100 a month to garage his car during the Wall Street day, and the downtown pedestrian who inhales the effluence of 1,000 cars crawling onto the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Chess: Larsen Turns Back Estevez In 5th Round at Leningrad
description: LENINGRAD, June 9Guil lermo Estevez went astray in the early middle game as White in a Sicilian Defense against Bent Larsen, running into a decisive pin that cost him a piece and the point yesterday in the fifth round of the Interzonal chess tour nament held in the Dzerjin sky Palace of Culture.

title: Oil
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate vot ed 85 to 10 last week to keep Lester C. Ripley of Luverne, Minn., in busi ness. Mr. Ripley has operated a filling station for more than 20 years, but now is afraid he will be forced to close. Like other independentsthey account for onefifth of the 220,000 filling sta tions in the United Stateshe is hav ing difficulty lining up supplies of gas oline.

title: COOKING OUT
description: Uncle Green was late so that meant all the Blue Gums would be late too. He was up from Alabama for 20 days with a $500 bill which never broke because nobodynobodyhad change and so he had to borrow what ever he needed until the time he could get to a store big enough to handle it. Mama and Aunt Millie looked at his big bill, then at each other, then at the sky that stretched overhead with precisely the infinite patience they had lost.

title: Bridal Held for Deirdre M. Jackson
description: NEW VERNON, N. J., June 9In the Roman Catholic Church of Christ the King here at noon today, Miss Deirdre Mary Jackson, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Stevens Pell Jackson of New York and Cape May, was married to James Adams Grundy Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Grundy of Ambler, Pa. The Rev. Rob ert Keck performed the cere mony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: B. E. McBee Jr., Deborah Melum Have Nuptials
description: WONALANCET, N. H., June 9The Wonalancet Chapel at the foot of Mount Passaconaway on the Swift River here was the setting this afternoon for the wed ding of Miss Deborah Ruth Meium and Burrett Eaton McBee Jr. The ceremony was performed by the bride groom's father, the Rev. Mr. McBee, who is the synod executive for New England of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.

title: Adelaide Beacham Wed to Bank Aide
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 9  Miss Adelaide Amelia Beacham, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. E. Brand Beacham Jr. of Bronxville, New York, and Key Biscayne, Fla., was married here this afternoon to Dirk Robert Dreux Jr., son of Mrs. Victor. Dowling of Simsbury, Conn., and the late Mr. Dreux.

title: Hal Hastings 19191973
description: I FIRST met Hal Hastings in 1949. He was playing rehearsal piano and writ ing incidental music for Tickets Please, the Hart mans revue, and I was sec ond assistant stage manager. Since then we have worked together always. He conduct ed 15 of our musicals, was choral arranger for as many and contracted for an addi tional two (we found, much as we would have liked to have him, he could only con duct at one place at a time). For the straight plays, he chose the incidental music and orchestrated it. For the film we made, he was musi director.

title: Grace School Expanding
description: Grace Church School, the 80yearold coeducational, nonde nominational school ranging from kindergarten through eighth grade, plans to add new structure to the school's facilities at Fourth Avenue and 11th Street. The building will have a combined auditorium gymnasium, meeting rooms and a rooftop playground.

title: Sally Boone Castleman Is a Bride
description: WASHINGTON, June 9Miss Sally Boone Castleman, who graduated last month from the University of Mary land, was married here this afternoon to James Angus Currie Jr., secretary of the Erie (Pa.) Foundry Company, of which his father is presi dent. The Rev. Peter Winter ble performed the ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church in Georgetown.

title: Letters: S. Freud, Mountain Climber
description: To the Editor: I enjoyed the reminiscences of early 1900's Adirondack mountain climbing by 92yearold Lawrence G. Brooks (Scaling the Heights63 Years ago) in the May 13 Travel Section. I wonder if you know that Putnam Camp in Keene Valley, so aptly described by Mr. Brooks as a retreat for intellectuals who liked to flex their muscles as well as their brains, has preserved its guest books from the time of its founding in 1877.

title: Trip to an Eclipse to Begin in Cranford
description: CRANFORDFor six min utes and five seconds of total eclipse of the sun on June 30, 220 amateur astron omers will travel thousands of miles to the desert heart land of Mauritania in West Africa.

title: East Colleges Leaning To Basketball League
description: An old plan for a formal conference of Eastern major colleges received some new twists and solid endorsement following a recent meeting of seven of the eight schools involved.

title: ShotAt Police
description: A price has to he paid to keep the streets safe and the price comes high, because it's our lives. CHARLES PICCOLI, a New York policeman.

title: Sort of like Nero Wolfe
description: What color are your wife's eyes? asked the private in vestigator.

title: U.S. JOINING INQUIRY ON JERSEY SLAYING
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June 9 Federal investigators have joined the inquiry into the mur der yesterday of Major B. Cox son, the flamboyant exconvict and mayoral candidate who was found shot to death in his rented $200,000 home here yes terday.

title: What's New In Theater?
description: UNCLE VANYA, the Circle in the Square revival of Chekhov's play with Lillian Gish, George C. Scott, Ni col Williamson, Elizabeth Wilson and Julie Christie, got 10 favorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Watt, News; Watts, Post; Wallach, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Campbell, AP; Gayer, UPI;. Harris, CBS TV; Sanders ABCTV; Klein, WNEWTV) and one mixed review (Gottfried, Women's Wear).

title: Kristine Enquist Is Married to Cole Fach
description: MANHASSET, L. I., June 9 Miss Kristine Marie Enquist was married here this after noon to Albert Cole Fach, who is known by his middle name. The Rev. Raymond Fenner performed the cere mony at the Congregational Church.

title: A Not So Grand Central Station
description: Grand Central Station after midnight, once a happy haven for suburbanites who had tarried too long over an aftertheater drink and missed the 12:30 to Scarsdale, has fallen on unhappy times. The Penn Central says that the 42d Street terminal during the early morning hours is now frequented by undesirables.

title: Bomb Is Thrown Into Bar In Belfast, Hurting 5 People
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 9 (AP)  Terrorists threw a bomb into a crowded bar in the Belfast city center today, injuring at least five people, the police said. There was no ad vance warning.

title: Filmed Depositions Urged for Courts
description: NORTH BRUNSWICK New Jersey's judges have been asked to consider the use of videotaped depositions by expert witnesses instead of sworn written statements so that juries might better weigh the credibility of the person on the stand.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: I read William F. Buckley Jr.'s observations on the Watergate affair (Impeach the speech, not the Presi dent, May 20) with sym pathy; I read his conclusions with incredulity. Can it be that the authoritarian mind cannot comprehend the mean ing and the value of the rule of law under the Constitution of the United States?

title: Patricia Schenkel Prospective Bride
description: Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Peter Jakobson of New York and Elberon, N.J., of the engage ment of Mrs. Jakobson's daughter, Miss Patricia Sue Schenkel, to Michael Keith Marshall, son of Mr. and Mrs. Keith Marshall of Seminole, Okla.

title: The Golden AgeWhere to Find It
description: ONE day during World War II, at a time when patriotic citizens were being exhorted to turn in their unwanted shellacs for scrap, the woman who ran my local record shop handed mea susceptible schoolboy, passionate about music, but still undefined of tastethree old disks which someone had brought in for disposal and which she felt unable to con sign to the junk heap. The disks, which I have good cause to remember, were GalliCurci's To son Titania and two Carusos: No, Pagli accio, non son! and the Si ciliana from Cava'feria rus ticana. I have been mad about the singing voice ever since. Another thing: I have never ceased being grateful

title: MISS LORENGAR SINGS DESDEMONA AT MET
description: The Metropolitan Opera of fered a hightension interpreta tion of Verdi's Otello on Friday night, which resulted from the combined efforts of James Levine, the conductor, and a strong cast headed by Jon Vickers in the title role, Sher rill Milnes as Iago and Pilar Lorengar, who took over the role of Desdemona for the first time here.

title: Lindner Is 6.2, 6.1 Victor In State Tennis at Bayside
Why Can a Texan Be Like a Duke?
description: THE British aristocracy is tradi tionally above not just reproach, but above everybodyespecially tourists. Favored indeed was the Yank who would wrench a glacial nod from a viscount or even a raised eye brow from an earl. But as milord's taxes rose, his hauteur dropped, and he could, discern, gold (or at least ster the visiting bumpkins.

title: Nixon Selects Judge
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 9 (UPI)President Nixon today selected Thomas G. Gee, an Austin, Tex., lawyer, to be a judge for the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit. If confirmed by the Senate, Mr. Gee, 47 years old, would succeed Joe McDonald Ingraham, who plans to retire by July 31.

title: Former Mets Inabilities Have Dimmed With Age
description: A group of New York Met alumni, clearly improving with age, routed a group of survivors from championship Brooklyn Dodger and New York Yankee teams, 1.0, in the annual twoinning, Old Timers Day game at Shea Stadium yesterday.

title: Music in Review
description: Sometimes the New York Philharmonic Promenades leave out a Viennese pro gram, and the omission makes the annual spring se ries seem incomplete. This year there was a Promenade in Vienna, first given on Thursday night, and it made a highly satisfactory finale to Andre Kostelanetz's set of concerts in Philharmonic Hall.

title: Bills Sign No. 1 Pick
description: BUFFALO, June 9 (AP)Paul Seymour, an offensive tackle from Michigan and the Buffalo Bills first draft pick, signed multiyear contract with the Na tional Football League team to day.

title: Anthony Abell Weds Miss Zannini
description: LAKE FOREST, III., June 9 Miss Susan Margaret Zan nini, who is working for a master's degree in urban af fairs at the American Univer sity in Washington, was mar ried here this afternoon to Anthony Francis Abell, a program analyst with the Atomic Energy Commission in Bethesda, Md.

title: Youngsters Promise Bright Yacht Future in Spain
description: SAN FELIU DE GUIXOLS, Spain, June 9  Spain gave notice to the yachting frater nity last week that it is on its way to becoming a world power. In a fourday interna tional regatta for the Optimist Class, concluded here last Sunday, Spanish youngsters, competing against represent atives of seven other nations, swept to a smashing victory.

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: ART

title: Gallman Quits Post As Top Collector Of Taxes for State
description: Governor Rockefeller has ac cepted the resignation of Nor man Gellman, his Commis sioner of Taxation and Finance for the last four years.

title: Water Sports Aid in Student Explorations
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., June 9Today's college studentkeen on sailing and water sportsmay be a frontrun ner in tomorrow's world of exploration. This is the opin ion of Prof. T. P. (Ted) Bank 2d of Western Michigan Uni versity and the director of the American Institute for Exploration.

title: Reading
description: You've got to get it when you're younger, Gary Warren, a student at Bushwick High School in Brook lyn, says about learning to read. Otherwise, it becomes harder and harder.

title: A List of Candidates for the Senate and Assembly
Modernization Sought for Port of Albany
description: ALBANY, June 9A drive to modernize and expand the Port of Albany got under way here this week with the support of 200 business and industrial leaders and state and local officials.

title: Dance: 3 by June Lewis
description: June Lewis is fond of mak ing wellcrafted dances with a message. Sometimes the message is humorous, some times tragic and other times a bit ambiguous. She present ed examples of all three Thursday evening at the thea ter of the Riverside Church.

title: U.S. Calls On Costa Rica For Extradition of Vesco
description: The State Department has asked Costa Rica to extradite Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive financier, who is charged in New York with trying to pre vent a Federal investigation of his business affairs by giving $200,000 to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: ALSO OPENING
description: THE LAST OF SHEILAHerbert Ross's drama, written by Stephen Sondheim and Anthony Perkins and starring Richard Benjamin, Dyan Cannon, James Coburn, Joan Hackett, James Mason, Ian McShane and Raquel Welch, Thursday at the Sutton.

title: Park Bus Service To Start in Bergen
description: HACKENSACK  Summer time bus service on weekdays to Van Saun and Darlington Parks in Bergen County will begin for the fifth season on Monday, June 18.

title: MORE GRADUATES EXTEND STUDIES
description: A survey of graduate schools at American universities has found that despite more limited opportunities for financial aid and scholarships, there was an increase of 2 per cent in gradu, ate enrollments during the academic year just ending.

title: Idle Dice to Face 40 Challengers at Ox Ridge
description: It's Idle Dice against the field again when the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show opens a riveday run in Darien, Conn., on Wednesday.

title: 12 Men and W omen To Attend Harvard As Nieman Fellows
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June (AP)Eight men and four wo men have been named as Nie man Fellows in journalism to study at Harvard University for the 197374 academic year.

title: Seoul Gives No Comment On U.S. Protest on Agents
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 9 The Seoul Government had little to say today about allega tions of improper activities by Korean agents in the United States or the resignation of three Korean information serv ic officers there.

title: Ft. Greene Residents Fighting Drug Unit
description: As a result of complaints from a number of residents in the Fort Greene section of Brooklyn that a government financed methadone clinic on Fulton Street treated more narcotics addicts than it could handle, the organiza tion that runs the clinic is decentralizing its operations and will open a satellite cen ter in Bushwick.

title: Badillo Makes Vow to Restore Full Mayoral Responsibility
description: Nattily clad in royal blue slacks, a red, white and blue shirt and white shoes, Repre sentative Herman Badillo, in walking tours of middleclass areas in the Bronx and Brook lyn yesterday, declared that executive powers of the May or's office had eroded be cause of a nonintervention policy of the present adminis tration.

title: Donohue Sets Qualifying Mark
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ont., June 9Mark Donohue wasted no time this week in establishing the onehorse character of the 1973 CanadianAmerican Chal lenge Cup.

title: State Spells Out Rules on Mobile. Homes
description: TRENTON The prolifera tion of mobile homes in New Jersey  considered by some to be a blight on the land scape  is generating a new field of tenantlandlord rela tions.

title: Bible Salesmen
description: NASHVILLE  Some where around St. Louis next week, a typical Mrs. Jones will answer a knock on her door and receive a warm smile from Sharon Babbitt.

title: The urban garden
description: This spring's rain has been great for city gardens, washing some of the pol lution out of New York's air and cut ting down on watering chores. Never theless, it takes imagination and per sistence to be a successful city gar dener whether your plot is a window box or a penthouse terrace. In remod eling their West Side brownstone, right above, the owners adapted the traditional South Carolina walled garden (including firescreens from Savannah plantation) to their city backyard. A southfacing terrace, left, becomes a greenrimmed summer room for cookouts and sunning. The penthouse, below and right, is so satisfactory for a family with four chil dren that they rarely leave home to get away from the city. All designed by K. Fitzgerald, The City Gardener.

title: In 18 Months, Methaqualone Has Soared in Popularity Among the Young
description: In New Jersey, rock music fans show up at concerts wearing Tshirts labeled Captain Quaalude and Rorer.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: I doubt that there is much disagreement anymore over the need both to reform ex isting private pension plans and to expand their cover age to employes who do not participate presently in a pri vate plan. Congress would like to do both and I am reasonably confident that the legislation it enacts for pen sion plans will go a long way toward meeting these objec tives.

title: A Fur Center Seeks to Recoup From Disaster
description: The 23story building on the southeast corner 28th Street and Seventh Avenue has become a vertical ghost town.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Today  International Motor Sports Association 500 mile Camel GT Challenge race at Pocono International Raceway, Mount Pocono, Pa.; 1 P.M.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: MASSACHUSETTS U. ASSURES BOSTON1
description: BOSTON, June 9  The Uni versity of Massachusetts board of trustees, acting to allay com munity fears, has adopted broad statement of policy con cerning problems that may be created in surrounding areas by the nearly completed campus here.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration has eased its regulations govern ing oil burners in apartment houses and commercial build ings. The change was made by shifting the program's em phasis from installation re quirents to performance standards.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Despite the booming na tional economy there is a de cidedly mixed outlook this summer for young men and women seeking employment during the months of July and August.

title: The Diffident AvantGarde Has an Outpost in the Sky
description: TO see James Bishop's current show of paint ings, in a strange new exhibition space called the Clocktower, requires a taste for adventure. First one must travel far downtown to 108 Leonard Street, a gran diose pile built in 1912 for the New York Life Insurance Company and now housing municipal offices. Then it is necessary to take an elevator to the 12th floor, climb some stairs, walk through a couple of dingy corridors and climb stairs.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho of Hanoi broke off their latest round of talks in Paris on how to strengthen the Vietnam peace accords and did not sign a draft docu ment that was expected to be released this weekend. One high American official had expressed optimism that the document would be signed promptly but added that difficul ties had arisen because of a triangular argument among the United States and North and South Vietnam. Mr. Kissinger returned to Washington. Mr. Tho will remain in Paris. Their top aides are expected to resume the Paris negotiations Monday. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Our true blue berry
description: The blueberry season is revving up. Berries are being trucked in from the Carolinas now, but next week, they'll be rolling down the turnpike from New Jersey into New York markets. And some of the Garden State's big gest and best will be air freighted to London for the first time so that Britishers can enjoy America's versa tile, indigenous berry. After you've baked the season's first blueberry pie, try this spicy, nutty, blueberry crumb cake and the rumflavored parfait.

title: Photography
description: To the average amateur which is to say, to most of usthe name Pola roid suggests a kind of snapshot that is developed in the camera, on the spot. No days of waiting for the pic tures to come back from the lab. No gnashed teeth because of an opportunity missed. If the picture does not come out, you can take it again, right then and there.

title: A. VIOLETTE ALLEN
description: A. Violette Allen, a retired lawyer who had been active in the Conservative party since its founding in 1962, was found dead on Friday in her apart ment at 215 West 75th Street. She was 73 years old.

title: WEICKER CHARGES FRI, USED A PART OF 1970 SPY PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 10Senator Lowell F. Weicker Jr. asserted today that at least one aspect of a 1970 domestic espionage plan had gone into. effect despite President Nixon's declaration that it had been withdrawn.

title: Susan Ina Striar Wed To Stewart Lee May
description: Miss Susan Ina Striar, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Striar of Douglaston, Queens, was married at noon yesterday to Stewart Lee May, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry May of Rego Park, Queens.

title: 200 WhiteWater Boatmen Bring Sport to Connecticut's Housatonic
description: SALISBURY, Conn., June 10Whitewater boat racing came to Connecticut this weekend as 200 men and women battled the rapids of the upper Housatonic River in canoes, kayaks and inflated rafts to raise money for the local Rotary Club's scholarship fund.

title: Soccer Results
PRESS FOR YOUTHS SEEKS NEW IMAGE
description: BOULDER, Colo., June 10Representatives of 53 youth oriented publications who met here this weekend seemed to agree on a new and more sedate image of themselves.

title: Chess:And This Man Was Afraid He Wasn't in Good Form?
description: LENINGRAD, June 9 Bent Larsen determinedly master pressed a minuscule position al advantage to victory over Robert Huebner of West Ger many in a bishopsofoppo sitecolor end game in the sixth round of the Interzonal Tournament for world cham pionship candidates.

title: Delay in Paris Agreement Laid to Saigon Objections
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 Henry A. Kissinger and Hanoi's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho, decided to break off their talks in Paris yesterday for a few days when it became clear they could not quickly resolve the lastminute reservations raised by Saigon to the pro posed document on strengthen ing the Vietnam ceasefire agreement, an Administration official said today.

title: 75,000 March Here in a Salute to Israel
description: Bands blared Sholom Alei chem (Peace Unto You), and the blue and white colors of Israel were everywhere as 75, 000 marched up Fifth Avenue yesterday in a salute to Israel's 25th anniversary as a nation.

title: Party Glory Fades in Brooklyn
description: Although the Brooklyn Democratic organization is usually singled out as the last surviving example of past party glory, the organi zation was less than a smashing success in last Monday's primary.

title: Ross and Barker Advance To State Tennis 3d Round
description: Steve Ross of Brooklyn, the defender, and Bob Barker of Port Washington, L. I., won secondround matches in the New York State tennis cham pionships yesterday at the North Shore Tennis and Rac quets Club in Bayside, Queens. Ross defeated Steve Goldman, of Spring Valley, 63, 60 and Barker, seeded No. 2, beat Joe McLaren of Massapequa, L..I., 61, 61.

title: B.52's Bomb in Cambodia. For 96th Consecutive Day
description: HONOLULU, June 10 (AP)American B52 bombers for the 96th day in a row joined United States tactical aircraft today in operations over Cambodia at the request of the Cambodian Government, the Pacific Mili tary command said.

title: Lieut. Wottle's Next Foe: Wohlhuter in 880
description: BATON ROUGE, La., June 10Tomorrow morning, prob ably before he has a chance to drink, his first glass of milk, Dave Wottle will trade his white golf cap for an Air Force officer's service hat.

title: Books Today
description: GENERAL

title: Samuel B. Finkel, Official Of Dropsie College, Dies
description: NORTH HOLLYWOOD, Calif. June 10  Samuel B. Finkel executive vice president of Dropsie College in Philadelphia from 1947 to 1963 and a former president of the National Fed eration of Temple Brotherhoods, died at his home here yester day. He was 85 years old.

title: Delay in Paris Agreement Laid to Saigon Objections
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 Henry A. Kissinger and Hanoi's chief negotiator, Le Due Tho, decided to break off their talks in Paris yesterday for a few days when it became clear they could not quickly resolve the lastminute reservations raised by Saigon to the pro posed document on strengthen ing the Vietnam ceasefire agreement, an Administration official said today.

title: Arts and Humanities
description: In the next few days the House of Representatives will vote on renewing funds for the National Endowment for the Arts and its twinagency for the Humanities. The bill would authorize somewhat less money than the cor responding measure already passed by the Senateless, for that matter, than the amount President Nixon re questedbut it is good enough to warrant the hope that it will be passed intact and by so large a margin that the Appropriations Committee will be discouraged from any attempts to cut it.

title: Betty Furness Finds Myriad Things to Do, but Not Much Time Left to Do Them
description: The things Consumer Af fairs Commissioner Betty Furness feels have to be done are myriadwatching the utility companies more close ly, analyzing economic indi cators, finding more ways to help consumers in their daily battle with the cost of liv ing, examining how big cor porations affect people's lives, raising the level of honesty in business.

title: Cardinal Goes to Ireland
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 10 (AP)  ohn Cardinal Krol left to night for an eightday visit to Ireland, where he will meet ?? Roman Catholic and Prot estant leaders. The Archbishop of Philadelphia will also partici pate in ecumenical functions with civic and religious leaders of both the Irish Republic and Northern Ireland.

title: Manila Reports Crime Drop
description: MANILA, June 10 (UPI) Crime has droped by 42 per cent since President Ferdinand E. Marcos declared martial law last September, according to Defense Secreteary Jaun Ponce Enrile. Mr. Enrile said yester day that the drop in crime was the result of a largescale fire arms collection drive, which netted 523,499 guns, and the rounding up of 8,870 criminal elements.

title: Advertising: Moscow Missions
description: It is beginning to sound as if May was Advertising Month in Moscow. At least two delegations from the United States had confer ences with Vneshtorgrek lama, the stateowned ad vertising agency.

title: MORTON PREDICTS NEW CABINET UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 (AP) President Nixon plans to propose within days a new Cabinetlevel Department of Energy and Natural Resources, Interior Secretary Rogers C. B. Morton said today.

title: Kemp, in Porsche, Takes CanAm Race
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 10The first time Charlie Kemp drove his turbocharged Porsche 91710, a bright toy acquired from Mark Donohue last November, he stuffed it into a muddy embankment in the rain at Road Atlanta.

title: Miss Vinson Married To Dr. C.I. Wasserman
description: Miss Marsha Lynn Vinson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Vinson of Great Neck, L. L, was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Charles I. Wasserman, who will become a psychiatric medical resident at the Johns Hopkins Hospital in Balti more next month. Rabbi Je rome Davidson performed the ceremony at the Pierre.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., June 10 (UPI)A former Florida State University reserve quarterback said today that during alleged mandatory offseason football drills F.S.U., everyone was so desperate to win we kicked, slugged, hit each other in the groin, did everything and anything.

title: FASHION TALK; Thinking Mink? Think of Spending Twice as Much as 1972
description: It's more than beef, or even tomatoes or onions, that has taken a price jump.

title: WHITLAM FACING TOUGH DECISION
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 10 Prime Minister Gough Whit lam has returned from Indiawhere his foreign policy pro posals reportedly got a mixer reception  to face tough po litical decisions at home.

title: Pass Over, Quarter Horse, Wins $353,250 Futurity
description: RUIDOSO DOWNS, N. M., June 10 (AP)  Pass Over, owned by Jack Delman, scored a halflength victory over Dial Easy today in the 23d running of the $353,250 Kansas Quarter Horse Futurity.

title: ECUADOR DEFEATS LAZIO OF ITALY,11
description: More than 11,000 soccer fans paid $8 apiece to watch the national soccer team of Ecua dor defeat Lazio of Italy, 10 yesterday at Downing Stadium on Bandalls Island, and about 300 watched the game for free from the pedestrian sidewali of the Triborough Bridge.

title: Home Costs Rise 91.7% in 20 Years, Outstripped Only by Service Industry By BILL KOVACH
description: WASHINGTON, June 10In nearly all areas of the nation rising home costs are slowly putting the dream of a family house out of the reach of many young families.

title: COSTA RICAN COURT WILL ACT ON VESCO
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, June 10 (UPI)The Costa Rican Su preme Court is expected to act tomorrow on an application by the United States Government on permission to extradite the financier, Robert L. Vesco, on charges arising from a Securi ties and Exchange Commission investigation into his handling of mutual funds. The court is expected to make the request a matter of urgent business.

title: Rising Bangladesh Unrest Marked by 2,000 Killings
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 10 Political murders, communal unrest and armed terrorism are al fueling Bangladesh, a nation born in violence 16 months ago.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Threedimensional maps of the United States, drawn by computer from census data, show con centration of population and how it has shifted toward the West in the last decade. Nevada, for example, although lowest area in density, has ex perienced heavy growth.

title: Among Geographers, New York Is Podunk
description: As far as geography goes, New York City is an aca demic wasteland.

title: Cathy Gelfand Marries Here
description: Miss Cathy Susan Gelfand, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herman. G. Gelfand of Flush ing, Queens, was married yesterday to Leon Allen Pol lack, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nat Pollack of Forest Hills, Queens. Rabbi Louis Cassel performed the ceremony in the Jewish Center of Jackson Heights, Queens. He was as sisted by Cantor Joseph Pol lack, uncle of the bridegroom.

title: Nixoh Back at White House After Weekend in Florida
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 (UPI)  President Nixon re turned tonight from a long weekend in Florida, where he rested in preparation for meet ings tomorrow with his chief economic and foreign affairs advisers.

title: MATRA TRIUMPHS IN LE MANS RACE
description: LE MANS, France, June 10q. pair of French dropouts prie driver and one carfrom the Grand Prix world of speed persevered for 24 hours and combined to win their second straight Le Mans endurance test today.

title: Shifting Budget Gears
description: There is far less budgetary hysteria in New York City this year than last, even though this is an election year and no candidate for public office can be expected to campaign very enthusiastically for increased taxes. The current calm can probably be attributed at least in part to a diversion of, public interest from inherently dull figures on budgetary ledgers to often lively candidates on the hustings seeking posts that run the gamut from district leader to mayor. This measure of inattention on the part of the public is also due, no doubt, to the rela tively small size of the projected budgetary gap. Last year's $1billion gap has become this year's $150million gap.

title: SCHOOLS BUYING SCORED BY STATE
description: The city school system may be paying higher prices than necessary for supplies and equipment because too few venders compete for Board of Education contracts, according to a report issued yesterday by State Controller Arthur Levitt.

title: Baseball Transactions
News Summary and Index MONDAY, JUNE 11, 1973
description: International

title: House Plans New Attempt To Talk About Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 (AP) Another attempt to discuss the impeachment of President Nixon has been scheduled in the House, Representative Bella S. Abzug, Democrat of Man hattan, said today.

title: Pei's Bold Gem Cornell Museum
description: ITHACA, N.Y.  Architec ture is never more clearly and purely an art than in the museum, a building type that has been exploding with the regularity of the housing cri sis, at opposite poles of the social and cultural scene. The first museum explosion, which spanned the late 19th and early 20th centuries, left the American landscape dot ted with Beaux Arts classi cism and great collections. The last two decades have seen an eruption of new wings and buildings, boldly contemporary in style. Statis tically it would be enlighten ing to calculate the frequency of museum openings, but the latest of note is the Herbert F. Johnson Museum of Art on the Cornell University Campus.

title: Arden Aibel Is Wed
description: CARMEL, N.Y., June 10 Miss Arden Aibel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Aibel of Roslyn Heights, L.I., was married here at noon yesterday to Dr. Arnold Roth stein of New York. Rabbi Arnold Belzer performed the ceremony at the Dreamwold Inn. The bride is a staff psy chologist at the Montefiore Hospital in the Bronx, and her husband is an instructor of psychiatry at the College of Physicians and Surgeons of Columbia University, and director of clinical psycholog ical service at the Lexington School for the Deaf in New York.

title: 10,000 Refugees Said to Flee Burundi in a Month
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, June 10  More than 10,000 members of the majority Hutu tribe in Burundi have fled into Tanzania in the last month ac cording to missionaries in the frontier area.

title: WILLIAM MOORE, 100, AN EDUCATOR, DEAD
description: WEST CAPE MAY, N.J., June 10 (AP)  William J. Moore, who celebrated his 100th birth day last August in a hospital recovering from injuries suf fered during a tennis game, died yesterday at his home here.

title: WARSAW TRYING LESS CENSORSHIP
description: WARSAW, June 10Poland in a series of reforms aimed at uncovering and venting discon tent and grievances before they explode in street violenceas in Gdansk in 1970, is testing abolition of censorship control over the press.

title: BADILLO ATTACKS RIVAL ON HOUSING
description: Representative Herman Ba dillo charged yesterday that Abraham D. Beame, his op ponent in the June 26 Demo cratic mayoral primary runoff, was being supported by peo ple not interested in middle income housing and added that his opponent therefore owed a significant debt to those interested in luxury housing.

title: In West Philadelphia, Gang Wars Are a Way of Death
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 10 In West Philadelphia the atmosphere on the streets is almost palpably tense. Gang wars are a way of lifeand death. So far this year, 13 Philadelphia youngsters, sev eral in their early teens, have been killed in gang violence. Some were innocent bystand ers. There were 39 deaths last year, 43 the The Talk year before, a total of 248 in of West the last 10 years. Philadelphia as often as not, the antagonists were no more than children. It is as if they were playing cowboys, but somehow, in some malign transmogrifica tion, the guns have become

title: GOVERNOR CITES RELIEFROLL DROP
description: The first extended drop in the state welfare rolls in more than a decade was reported by Governor Rockefeller yester day as evidence that the long cycle of rampant relief growth was ending. The Governor re leased data from the Commis sioner of Social Services, Abe Lavine, showing that the state wide rolls stood at 1,752,099 persons at the end of March. This was a drop of 74,261 from the record of March, 1972.

title: Restoring the Balance
description: Congress moved another step toward restoring the essential checks and balances of the American constitu tional system the other day when the House Foreign Affairs Committee voted 31 to 4 to report a measure that would require the President to terminate any mili tary action abroad in 120 days unless he receives Con gressional authorization to continue. Similar legislation with a more restrictive thirtyday cutoff has already been endorsed by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: China's Foreign Minister In Paris for a 3Day Visit
description: PARIS, June 10 (Reuters) Foreign Minister Chi Pcngfei of China arrived here today from London for a threeday official visit.

title: SOVIET RESTRICTS FOREIGNERS MORE
description: MOSCOW, June 10  The Soviet police, apparently acting under instructions from the Foreign Ministry, today tight ened controls on the movement of Americans in the Moscow area as Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, prepared to fly to the United States next weekend.

title: MATRA TRIUMPHS IN LE MANS RACE
description: LE MANS, France, June 10A pair of French dropouts?e driver and one carfrom the Grand Prix world of speed persevered for 24 hours and combined to win their second straight Le Mans endurance test today.

title: ATLANTIC CITY FIRE DESTROYS 500 CLUB
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 10 A generalalarm fire that raged for more than four hours today virtually wiped out the 500 Club, the entertainment spot where Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis first performed as a team and where many other big name stars once played.

title: Rising Bangladesh Unrest Marked by 2,000 Killings
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 10 Political murders, communal unrest and armed terrorism are afflicting Bangladesh, a nation born in violence 16 months ago.

title: ExSailor Takes Helm Shannon Jerome Wall
description: In 1956, when the first American container ship sailed from the Port of New York, Shannon J. Wall was Baltimore port agent for the National Maritime Union. He has now been elected president of the 50,000mem ber organization, according to a count that gives him a 2to1 lead over his chief opponent, with most of the 20,000 votes counted. Mr. Shannon's assumption of the presidency comes at a time in which many changes have come to the industry.

title: Miss Goolagong Conquers Chris Evert in Rome Final
description: ROME, June 11 (AP) Evonne Goolagong of Australia ended a personal jinx today by upsetting topseeded Chris Evert, 76, 60, in the women's singles final of the $135,000 Italian open tennis tourna ment.

title: Horse Lovers Have Their Day
description: LONG VALLEY, June 10Horse lovers, including many who had never ridden or placed a bet on one, had their day in the sun in four counties today when horse breeders opened their farms to visitors.

title: Patrick J. Buchanan
description: WASHINGTONTen weeks into the Watergate siege, and the President's traditional adversaries are happily drawing up his surrender terms.

title: Ford Dance Grants May Be Extended
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 9The Ford Foundation's un precedented and controversial $7.7million grant in 1963 to eight ballet organizations should now be considered a downpay ment, according to W. McNeil Lowry, the Ford Foundation's vice president for the humani ties and the arts.

title: Brandt Draws Protesters, First of His Visit to Israel
description: JERUSALEM, June 10  Isman Chancellor to visit Israel raeli demonstrators hurled an egg at visiting Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany today, showered his party with anti German leaflets and burned West German flag in the street.

title: PILOT DIES IN CRASH OF HOMEMADE PLANE
description: EAGLESWOOD TOWNSHIP, June 10The pilot of a home made airplane powered by Volkswagen engine was killed yesterday when the plane crashed on its first test flight.

title: Miss Judith A. Granet Bride of Arthur Levy
description: NORTH CALDWELL, N. J., June 10  Miss Judith Anne Granet, an occupational ther apist with the New York Hospital, was married here today to Arthur Irwin Levy, a certified public accountant with Mason & Co. in New York.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Women's Sexuality Conference Ends in School Here
description: More than 1,000 women and nearly 100 men took part it workshop discussions during. twoday Women's Sexuality Conference that included a womancreated erotic art show and a sexual fantasy costume party.

title: Many Hospitals in City Withhold Contraception After Abortions
description: A study of women who have had more than one abortion in New York City hospitals has disclosed that although, nearly 9 out of 10 requested contraception before leaving the hospital, only twofifths got the method they asked for and nearly half got no method at all.

title: POPE INAUGURATES HOLY YEAR PERIOD
description: ROME, June 10Pope Paul VI today urged Roman Catho lics throughout the world to pray for spiritual renewal and reconciliation as he opened the preparatory phase of the church's 1975 Holy Year.

title: Lawless Government
description: Federal District Judge William Mehrtens has dramati cally illustrated how seriously the Nixon Administration's disregard for constitutional restraints has interfered with the orderly process of law enforcement. In eleven Federal gambling, narcotics and bribery cases before Judge Mehrtens in Miami, the evidence of guilt contained in wiretaps submitted by the Justice Department was overwhelming. Yet the judge found himself compelled with the greatest reluctance to suppress that evidence because the taps had been illegally authorized. Former Attorney General John N. Mitchell had improperly dele gated the right to authorize wiretaps to aides who did not enjoy such powers under thenexisting laws.

title: Buddy Rich's Big Band Swings It at Jimmy's Place
description: The downstairs room at Jimmy's, 33 West 52d Street, which has been the scene of the weekly jazz sessions of Jazz Adventures, has gone into jazz fulltime with the instal lation of Buddy Rich's big band, which will perform twice each night through Saturday.

title: U.S. HELD REMISS IN BURUNDI CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, June 10 The Nixon Administration was criticized today for acting with indifference, inertia and irre sponsibility in response to the massacres that occurred in the small African country of Bu rundi in the spring and summer of 1972.

title: 2 Savings Units Would Rather Switch Than Lose
description: What would you do if you were the head of a company and your concern was of fered a deal yielding an an nual income of $228,000 that required no investment, and practically no expenses?

title: Personal Finance
description: We used to advise people to have their possessions re appraised about every three years. Now, with the rate of inflation as high as it is, it's a good idea to do it annu ally.

title: WEICKER CHARGES F.B.I. USED A PART OF 1970 SPY PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 10Senator Lowell F. Weicker Jr. asserted today that at least one aspect of a 1970 domestic espionage plan had gone into effect despite President Nixon's declaration that it had been withdrawn.

title: Coke and Pepsi Boycott Called by Consumer Unit
description: NEWARK, June 10  The National Consumer Congress, an outgrowth of the recent meat boycott, last week called for a weeklong na tional boycott of CocaCola and PepsiCola, starting to day.

title: The Community Menace
description: No smoke signal ever delivered a clearer message. There it is on every package. Warning: The Surgeon Gen eral Has Determined That Cigarette Smoking Is Dangerous to Your Health. Yet millions of smokers fog the packet's warning in a smokescreen of denial and indifference.

title: PARTIES PREPARE NEW ALIGNMENTS
description: TRENTON, June 10  The Democrats and Republicans in New Jersey will elect new state chairmen this week as they set their party and campaign ma chinery in motion for the guber natorial election this fall.

title: Old New York Festival Draws 3,000 to West 69th St. Block
description: About 3,000 people turned out in ideal weather yester day for the fifth annual Lit tle Old New York Festivalan event sponsored by the West 69th Street Block Asso ciation to beautify the block and help elderly citizens living in the neighborhood.

title: SATELLITE RACES TO LUNAR ORBIT
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., June 10 (UPI)  America's last planned moon satellite, a small un manned radio astronomy Ex plorer, raced accurately toward lunar orbit today to eavesdrop on the universe.

title: Tactics of an Elite Police Unit Election Issue in Detroit
description: DETROIT As Detroit's 1973 mayoral campaign moves onto summer and heads toward the Sept. 11 primary, one funda mental question has come to dominate public discussion in the country's fifth largest city.

title: Coast Bugging Is Linked To Aide in House Inquiry
description: The Federal Bureau of Inves tigation and the District At torney's office in San Diego County in California are inves tigating charges that a top as sistant to Representative Sam Steiger, Republican of Arizona, planted an illegal listening device in a wall of a San Diego hotel as part of an investiga tion being conducted by the House Select Committee on Crime, of which Mr. Steiger is a member.

title: Dragster Breaks Record
description: COLUMBUS (AP)The Pollu tion Packer, a rocketpowered dragster, broke its own quar termile record with an exhibi tion run of 4.99 seconds today, hitting 322 miles per hour. Dave Anderson drove the dragster, owned by Tony Fox, also of Minneapolis. The previous rec ord was 5.17 seconds and 305.8 m.p.h.

title: A HardEarned Age of Affluence Is Dawning in Japan
description: TOKYO, June 10  For most of the 104 million Jap anese, the affluent society has arrived. They have be gun to share in the rewards of the economy after years of hard work in which the emphasis was on industrial progress.

title: Experts Confident On World Business
description: PARIS, June 10  The com mercial banking community and financial authorities of the Western industrialized coun tries gathered in Paris last week to try to assess what's wrong with the dollar, what's wrong with the monetary system and whether anything is wrong with world business.

title: Cynthia C. Bishop, Student, Is a Bride
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., June 10  Miss Cynthia Chambers Bishop, who is en tering her senior year at Southern Connecticut State College, was married here to day to David Vaillant Orbi son, who will be a senior at Yale University. The cere mony was performed at St. Mark's Episcopal Church by the Rev. John C. Humphries Jr. He was assisted by the Rev. Walden Pell 2d, cousin of the bride.

title: GOVERNOR CITES RELIEFROLL DROP
description: The first extended drop in the state welfare rolls in more than a decade was reported by Governor Rockefeller yester day as evidence that the long cycle of rampant relief growth was ending. The Governor re leased data from the Commis sioner of Social Services, Abe Lavine, showing that the state wide rolls stood at 1,752,099 persons at the end of March. This was a drop of 74,261 from the record of March, 1972.

title: Events Today
description: ST. LUKE'S COMMUNITY CHURCH SUM MER SING, St. Luke's Chapel, 487 Hud son Street, 7:30.
