description: CAIRO, June 11The leader of Libya, Col. Muammar el Qaddafi, announced tonight the nationalization of an American oil company, asserting that the time had come for the Arabs to strike at United States inter ests.

title: CHARLES ROTHENBERG
description: Charles Rothenberg, a leader in the millinery industry, died Sunday of a heart attack at his home in Miami Beach. He was 74 years old.

title: Democrat Criticizes Role Of Haig in Executive Post
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (UPI)  Representative John E. Moss, Democrat of California, said today that Gen. Alex ander Haig Jr., was illegally performing top White House jobs and had compounded vio lation of Federal law by bring ing in other active duty mili tary men to help him.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: PRINCETON, June 11When Royce Flippin, the ath letic director at Princeton University, said last year that the school's athletic programs were under review, he wasn't kidding. The football program is a case in point.

title: RICHARD ACCEPTS CANADIENS PACT
description: MONTREAL, June 11 (UPI)The Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League an nounced the signing of Henri Richard to a twoyear contract today. The exact terms were not announced but it was be lieved Richard would receive in excess of $100,000 a season as inducement to stay out of the World Hockey Association. He had been offered $200,000 to Join the W.H.A. Houston Aeros.

title: Two Guys Strike Widens As Clerks Leave Stores
description: NEWARK, June 11 (AP)A strike by retail clerks at the Two Guys department stores widened today as workers walked off their jobs at nearly a score of additional stores. The strikers are members of the Retail Clerks International Association, AFLCIO.

title: Windy's Daughter Goes for a Triple Crown
description: Now that Meadow Stable's Secretariat has safely packed away thoroughbred racing's Triple Crown for 3yearolds, another triple crown may be won next Saturday at Bel mont.

title: Witness Expected to Testify Courier Photographed Muskie Data for G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, June 11Herbert L. Porter, who will be at the witness table when the Senate Watergate hearings re sume tomorrow, is expected to testify that the Nixon reelec tion committee paid a taxi driver to photograph docu ments from Senator Edmund S. Muskie's Presidential campaign.

title: Saigon Reported Unyielding on Eve of Renewed Talks
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, June 12Sources close to President Nguyen Van

title: Court Tells States They Cannot Permit Air Quality to Drop
description: WASHINGTON, June 11States cannot permit the quali ty of their air to deteriorate from present levels, under decision that an equally divid ed Supreme Court affirmed today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Catching Food for Thought
description: WRIGHTSVILLE BEACH, N. C.Sometime long after midnight the wind and seas picked up, the rolling of the 47foot Martha Ellens in creased, and, after striving uselessly for a half hour to return to sleep's embrace, I opened my eyes to see Capt. Eddy Haneman busily sew ing up billfish baits on the heaving afterdeck.

title: Abortion Foes to Seek Ban By Amending Constitution
description: DETROIT, June 11 (UPI)Some 800 antiabortionists from across the nation, de nouncing the United States Supreme Court for an irre sponsible exercise of raw judi cial powers in legalizing abor tion, have voted to seek a con stitutional amendment to re verse the high court decision.

title: Canada's Big Banks Raise Their Prime Rate to 7%
description: TORONTO, June 11 (Cana dian Press)  Canada's major banks moved quickly today, in the wake of a bank rate in crease by the Bank of Canada, to raise their prime lending rate to 7 per cent from 7.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Skylab Crewmen Gather Data on Severe Storms
description: HOUSTON, June 11 (AP)The Skylab 1 astronauts photo graphed a menacing weather front over Texas and Oklahoma today to gather data that may help scientists better predict devastating storms.

title: The Bettmann Archive
description: WASHINGTONHistory is full of echoes, parallels and forebodings to make very good escape reading. There I was, snuggled comfortably with memoir of the Restoration era, when out leapt a curiously timely scandal/ conspiracy that nearly toppled the English System of government in the seething seventiesthe 1670's, that is.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:

title: Fellow Travelers Are All in One Class
description: When the Mikhail Lermon tov steamed into New York Harbor there was Leningrad style Rassolnik soup on the menus and cheesecake in the brochures.

title: Nastase Crushes Orantes In Final of Italian Tennis
description: ROME, June 11 (Reuters)llie Nastase, after taking only 10 minutes to complete a semi final victory in a carryover from yesterday, crushed Manuel Orantes of Spain, 6I, 61, 61, to win the Italian open tennis championship today. First prize was $16,000 of the $135,000 purse.

title: PAPERS CAUTIONED BY TYPOGRAPHERS
description: Bertram A. Powers, presi dent of Typographical Union 6, warned in his monthly bul letin to members yesterday that a confrontation with the publishers of the city's three major dailies might be neces sary to achieve a satisfactory contract settlement.

title: Brown &
description: In a proposal involving more than $200million, the British owned Brown & Williamson To bacco Corporation yesterday an nounced an offer to pay $23 a share for all the common stock of Gimbel Brothers, Inc.

title: LowRise Development Project Begun in Brownsville by U.D.C
description: The stifling reality of Brook lyn's Brownsville section is world apart from the aircondi tioned abstraction of the Mu seum of Modern Art in mid town Manhattan, but yester day the two worlds were linked when state housing officials began work on a project in Brownsville whose fullfledged concept they then demon strated at the museum.

title: Business Briefs
description: Hartke Plan to Aid Pennsy Detailed

title: Libyan Chief, Citing U. S Aid to Israel, Seizes Oil Concern
Treasury Bill Rates Drop at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Gov ernment's weekly competi tive sale today of these short term securities.

title: Heart Defect Found Cause Of Bob Purkey Jr.'s Death
description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo., (AP)Bob Purkey Jr., 18yearold son of a former major league pitcher, died from a heart defect called athlete's suddendeath syndrome, an autopsy showed today.

title: A Venerable Dixie Legislator Retires
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., June 11 An era in South Carclina politics ended last week when 78yearold Solomon Blatt of Barnwell announced his retirement as Speaker. of the House of Representatives after 33 years.

title: No Taps for the Tappers
description: Mr. Charles Colson has painted an appealing picture of a kindly President Nixon who did not press his inquiries about Watergate for fear of making an innocent person a scapegoat, and who wanted to reassure his aides rather than crossexamine them.

title: 5 Hooded Pickets Halt Work at a G.M. Plant
description: LORDSTOWN, Ohio, June 11 (UPI)Five hooded and silent pickets, apparently un known to either company or union officials, temporarily halted production in the fab ricating plant at the General Motors Corporation complex here today.

title: Sex Stereotyping Persists in Schools
description: Despite nearly five years of challenges, American schools are still moving slowly to eli minate sex sterelotyping in the classroom.

title: People in Sports: Rusty Golfer
description: Gary Player, who recently deserted the pro golfing tour for four months to undergo surgery in South Africa, is discouraged by his recent play and said yesterday that he would return to South Africa to work out his problems.

title: Cosmos 572 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched on Sunday another artificial earth satellite, cosmos572, ac cording to Tass, the official So viet press agency. The satellite carries scientific equipment to continue exploration of outer space. The equipment on board was said to be functioning; normally

title: HOWARD V. SMITH
description: Howard V. Smith, president of Caleb V. Smith & Son, Inc., manufacturer of uniforms, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital in Bronxville, N. Y. He was 86 years old and lived at 27 Ridge croft Road, Bronxville.

title: ZORILA IS AHEAD BY STROKE ON 71
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 11Greg Zorila of Briar Hall, the 1969 winner when the tourna ment was still held on a match play basis, took a onestroke lead today in the 54th annual Westchester County Golf Asso ciation amateur championship.

title: Erich von Manstein Dead; Planned Blitzkrieg Attack
description: IRSCHENHAUSEN, West Germany, June 11 (AP)Field Marshal Erich von Manstein, whose bold strategic designs carried off Germany's lightning conquest of France in 1940, died yesterday, members of his fam ily reported today. He was 85 years old.

title: Dean Requests Immunity Or Quashing of Subpoena
description: WASHINGTON, June 11John W. Dean 3d asked a Fed. eral judge today either to throw out a grand jury sub poena or to grant him im munity from prosecution in re turn for his testimony on the Watergate affair.

title: Ron Ziegler's Diary
description: The following are excerpts from Ronald Ziegler's diary, which were leaked by sources close to the source of the Nile. Mr. Ziegler's diary entries are undated. This is because Mr. Zieg ler apparently distrusts his diary. Con, sider the following entry:

title: National League Tuesday, June 12, 1973
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: 63% CUT IN CAR USE SUGGESTED BY U.S FOR NORTH JERSEY
description: TRENTON, June 11Federal Government has drafted an airpollutioncontrol plan for New Jersey that recommends a cut of 63 per cent in vehicular travel in the state's northern metropolitan regions to cope with a smog crisis second only to that in Los Angeles.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
DAY SET IN HONOR OF MEDGAR EVERS
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Gov. William Waller issued a proc lamation today declaring a statewide observance of Med gar Evers Memorial Festival Day on Tuesday, when 10 years will have passed since the as sassination of the Mississippi civil rights leader.

title: Village Cadres Now Aid Thieu Party
Paper Bids Nixon Quit
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., June 11 (UPI)The Arkansas gazette, the largest newspaper in the state, called yesterday for the resignation of President Nixon. There is little confidence in the United States Government, under Mr. Nixon, either at home or abroad. Mr. Nixon should, indeed, resign in the interest of the country and of us all, said The Gazette, which en dorsed Senator George McGov ern in the 1972 Presidential election.

title: First Chicago Forms Unit
description: LONDON, June 11 (Reuters)  First Chicago, Ltd., London based merchant banking sub sidiary of the First National Bank of Chicago, said today it had formed a subsidiary, first Chicago Investments (U.K.), Ltd., for the purpose of equity in vestments.

title: Quake Jars Yugoslav Town
description: ZAGREB, Yugoslavia, June 11 (AP)Chimneys crumbled, walls cracked and window panes shattered when an earhquake struck early today at Ivanec, about 40 miles north of Zagreb. Only a few persons were hurt, according to first reports. Offi cials said the area's residents fled into the streets when their houses began shaking.

title: May Sales 1% Above April And 12% Over 1972 Month
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (Reu ters)May retail sales totaled $41,56billion, 1 per cent above April sales, seasonally adjusted, and about 12 per cent over May, 1972, sales, the Commerce Department said today,

title: Justices Refuse to Review A State Judge's Conviction
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (UPI)  The Supreme Court refused today to review the conviction of Justice Joseph P. Pfingst of New York Supreme Court on charges of concealing $35,600 in assets of two dairies he repre sented as an attorney before he became a judge.

title: After 27 Years, U.S. Airlines Get the. Right to Land at Dublin
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (AP) After 27 years of haggling, Ireland finally agreed today to grant landing rights for Ameri can commercial airplanes at Dublin.

title: I.B.M. Is Accused by U.S.
description: The International Business Ma chines Corporation was accused by the government Monday of nit picking in an effort to de lay trial of a fouryearold an titrust suit. At issue was an I.B.M. claim that the FBI has been purging electronic data processing records, in defiance of a longstanding order by Federal Judge David N. Edel Istein.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, June 11 (UPI) Robert Taylor, a goalie for the Philadelphia Flyers, was sentenced today to 30 days in jail and fined $500 for assaulting a policeman during a brawl with fans at the Pacific Coliseum last Dec. 29. Taylor was released on his own recognizance, pending an appeal.

title: Pennsylvania Ruling Allow Women to Wrestle and Box
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., June 11 (AP)The Pennsylvania Jus tice Department ruled today that women may be licensed to box or wrestle in Pennsyl vania. It instructed the Depart ment of State to disregard the Section of the athletic code barring such licenses.

title: Attica Panel Finds Reform Is Elusive
description: A special state committee set up in the wake of the 1971 Attica prison revolt reported yesterday that the state's prisons had made some progress since Attica, but that change which has a funda mental impact on the dayto day existence of the inmate population remains elusive.

title: Cutbacks at Naval Bases Fought by U.S Workers
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., June 11 (AP)  Union representatives testified in a Federal Court to day that thousands of pounds of machinery and equipment were being transferred from Rhode Island Navy bases be cause of Pentagon orders for cutbacks at the bases.

title: Consumer Is Gaining in Eastern Block
description: WARSAW  The private home and the private car, the two most blatant symbols of the Western way of life and the bourgeois appetite for property and status, are making it officially now in Eastern Europe.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WELCOME MATS The New York Philharmonic is tearing up the seats in its hall, 63d Street and Broad way (TR 42424), and is starting a week of rugcut ting concerts tonight (through Sunday, all at 8.

title: Church of England May Sell South African Gold Snares
description: LONDON, June 11 (AP)The Church of England is consider ing selling its South African gold shares, a church spokes man said today.

title: Advertising: New Maturity Seen
description: This should show up, he said, in the way we conduct our businesshopefully more professionally, less cutthroat competitively.

title: Fete in Central Park Draws 2,000 Elderly
description: Two thousand old people from recreation centers all over the city went to the mall at Central Park yesterday to en tertain each other with songs, dances, and puppet and art shows in a Senior Citizens Car nival sponsored by the City De partment of Recreation.

title: Dana Corp. Lifts Its Profit in Quarter and 9 Months
Santos Wins, Pele Injured
description: PHILADELPHIA June 11 (UPI)The Santos soccer team of Brazil, featuring their world famous player Pele, scored the seventh victory of its unbeaten American tour last night by defeating ArminiaBielefeld of Germany, 50. Pele played for the first nine minutes of the second half and scored a goal in the 53d minute.

title: Byrne Backing Dugan for Democratic Chairman
description: TRENTON, June 11State Senator James P. Dugan of Hudson County was named to day by. Brendan T. Byrne as his choice for state Democratic chairman.

title: AGNEW CRITICIZES SENATE HEARINGS
description: WASHINGTON, June 11Vice President Agnew declared today that the televised Senate Watergate hearings can hardly hope to find the truth and can hardly fail to muddy the waters of justice beyond redemption.

title: U.S. Agents Link 4 N.F.L. Stars to Drug Traffic
description: At least four National Football League players, each a star, are under surveillance for traffic in illegal and dangerous drugs, according to information gathered from narcotics agents on the Fed eral, state and local levels.

title: Food Prices Up 0.6% Here
Speedier Justice
description: The need for streamlined administration in all sections of the court system is highlighted by the revelation that state Supreme Court justices handling criminal cases Manhattan at the end of last year were putting in only half of their assigned time on the bench.

title: 7% Jobless Rate Recorded in State; Highest This Yea,
description: TRENTON, June 11 (AP)The New Jersey unemployment rate climbed above 7 per cent again in May, the State De partment of Labor and Industry reported today.

title: JOSEPH N. ALVIANI
description: JERSEY CITY, June 11 (UPI) Joseph N. Alviani, a Hudson County Freeholder, died, ap parently of a heart attack, Sat urday in his home here. He was 59 years old.

title: Executive Dies of Shooting Linked to Angry Employe
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., June 11 (UPI)Eugene Kane, 34yearold electronics control execu tive allegedly shot by an em ploye, died yesterday at Penin sula Hospital.

title: Hilary J. Sandoval Jr. Is Dead; Headed Small Business Bureau
description: EL PASO, Tex., June 11 (AP) Hilary J. Sandoval Jr., who served a rocky 22 months as director of the Small Business Administration in the first Nixon Administration, died at Sun Towers Hospital here to night after a lengthy illness re lated to brain surgery he under went in 1971 and 1972. He was 43 years old.

title: Pentagon Asks Cut In Quotas of Guard And of the Reserves
description: WASHINGTON, June 11, (UPI)  The Defense Department asked Congress today to cut the authorized personnel strength of the National Guard and armed forces Reserves by 66,044 because of a shortage of volunteers.

title: Court Upholds State Controller In Bid to See Records of M.T.A.
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court upheld State Controller Arthur Levitt yesterday in his demand to see records relating to operations of the Metropolitan Transpor tation Authority.

title: Refining Energy
description: As motorists this summer we are being asked to pay the price for the procrastinations and blunders of Gov ernment and the oil industry over the last three years or so. Gasoline shortages are not melodramatic por tents that the world's oil fields are drying up; all that dried up was the planning of refining and distribution capacity adequate for the predicted growth in fuel demand. The result is now obvious to all: by Memorial Day over 1,000 gas stations had been forced to close down, and the tanks at nearly 2,000 more are emptying fast.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Crews from the Lighting Departments of the villages of Freeport and Rockville Centre, which provide their own electricity, worked yesterday to restore power to the hundreds of homes still without it as a result of Saturday night's rain and windstorm.

title: People and Business
description: Lord Rootes, chairman of the Chrysler Corporation's British subsidiary, said yes terday that he would retire July 1. He will be succeeded by Gilbert Hunt, managing director and chief executive officer.

title: Pupil Busing Is Ordered by Court Between Detroit and Its Suburbs
description: DETROIT, June 12A Fed eral appeals court ruled today that black children from De troit must ride buses out to the suburbs and that white sub urban children must ride them in to Detroit to achieve racial balance in the schools.

title: Increase Will Be 5%
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission approved yester day plans of all but two of the nation's railroads to increase freight rates by 5 per cent,, which on the basis of last year's revenues would yield the industry an estimated $619 million a year.

title: Japan Auto Spending to Dip
description: TOKYO, June 12 (UPI)The Japanese automobile industry, at the urging of the Govern ment, has agreed to cut down on its capital investment in order to check inflation, the Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today. Auto makers had planned to spend about 346billion yen (about 1$1.3bililon) for plant construc tion and acquisition of equip ment

title: The Creation of Vacuums and Pressures
description: The Presidency (not the personal one of Richard Nixon, but the consti tutional office) has become a public trust. The principal responsibility for making it again an effective instru ment of government rests on political leaders and officeholders, especially on those who are members of the Congress of the United States.

title: Daily News Sales Director
description: Jack E. Underwood, a vice president of New York News, Inc., and former director of the circulation department, was named director of sales for the Daily News. In a state ment released yesterday, the general manager, Bruce Mc Cauley, said Mr. Underwood would assume overall respon sibility for the sales functions of the company and would co ordinate the activities of the advertising, circulation and promotion departments.

title: Unsnarling the Traffic
description: Mayor Lindsay's new proposals to disentangle the midtown traffic mess are in essence so sensible and so obviously needed that they immediately raise two questions: Why have such measures not been introduced years ago; will the new regulations continue to be enforced after the initial enthusiasmand publicityhave worn off?

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: Offshore Ports for Tankers Advocated by Nixon Aide
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)The Nixon Administra tion urged Congress today to approve legislation allowing construction of offshore ports for supertankers.

title: Temperature in Connecticut Reaches 97
description: HARTFORD, June 12State offices and some schools closed early, roads buckled and at least one hospital resorted to emergency power as the heat wave continued in Connecticut today.

title: Arab Says Oil Restraint Is a Way to Pressure U.S.
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 An Arab oil expert says Arab oilproducing countries could bring the United States to the brink of a severe energy crisis within one year by merely hold ing production to its present levels.

title: HEAT WOE SPURS JERSEY CLOSINGS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 12  A heat wave that sent temperatures soaring into the 90's across New Jersey for the second consecutive day forced the shutdown of City Hall here at 1 P.M., the impo sition of water restrictions in East Brunswick, early closing of schools and a rush to the beaches of the Jersey shore.

title: IMMUNITY DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 John W, Dean 3d lost his two month struggle for immunity from prosecution today and for the first time went before the Watergate criminal grand jury on orders from Chief Federal Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court.

title: Fritz Kredel, Illustrator, 73; Won Medal for His Work
description: Fritz Kredel, an illustrator, died Sunday in New York Hos pital. He was 73 years old and lived at 180 Pinehurst Avenue.

title: Fire on Empty Train
description: The undercarriage of an empty southbound Penn Cen tral train caught fire at 1:40 A.M. today at Park Avenue and 171st Street in the Mott Haven section of the Bronx, The Fire Department reported that there were no injuries and that the fire was quickly put out.

title: TV: Thicker Than Water, a Thin New Comedy
description: On one level, the Ameri can Broadcasting Company effort is almost noble. As one long night's journey into re runs follows another, the net work is bringing in a few new series for the summer months. Whatever the reasons, the gesture alone inspires grati tude.

title: 4 INDICTED BY U. S, ON FRAUD CHARGES
description: Harold P. Koenig, who re signed as chief operating offi cer of the Ecological Science Corporation last December, was indicted yesterday with three others on charges of con spiring to defraud creditors and stockholders of the Flor idabased concern.

title: CEMETERY GETS A WRIT IN STRIKE
description: One of the 47 struck ceme teries in the metropolitan area obtained a temporary restrain ing order yesterday directing the 48 strikers there to return to work immediately because of the health hazard posed by unburied bodies.

title: 47 Years on Job, Worker Loses His Pension
description: HUDSON, N. Y., June 12 Robert and Grace Pratt don't really expect to get their pen sion money, but, as Mrs. Pratt said, they hope that what hap pened to us will help other people.

title: Nicklaus Worries Nicklaus
description: OAKMONT, Pa., June 12Jack Nicklaus acknowledged today that he had a num ber of challengers in this week's United States Open, but the only one he is worry ing about is himself.

title: U.S.HANOI DRAFT IS SAID TO DEMAND ANEW CEASEFIRE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 12Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc Tho have drafted a document that aims at strength ening their original Vietnam agreement with a call for a firm ceasefire within 24 hours of signing and with a restatement of other key provisions, accord ing to sources close to the Sai gon Government.

title: What's New in the Lush Berg Collection Goes on Display Here
description: Albert A. Berg (18721950) probably knew more about indigestion than any other man ever. He was a surgeon who specialized in abdominal surgery at Mount Sinai and other hospitals. A gifted authoritarian figure, he refused to concede that he ever lost a patient, although his assist ants sometimes did.

title: Seat on the Amex Is Sold at $41,000, Rise of $3,500
description: The American Stock Ex change said yesterday a seat had been sold for $41,000, up $3,500 from the previous sale June 7.

title: Death Penalty for Murder Voted in Louisiana House
description: BATON ROUGE, La., June 12 (AP)The Louisiana House of Representatives has reenacted the death penalty for firstde gree murder and sent the bill to the Governor for signature. The vote last night was 73 to 28.

title: Tobacco Company's Volume to Double
description: Business is so good these days at the Brown & William son Tobacco Corporation that the company decided the time was right to go into retailing on a large scale.

title: Management Called Special Concern
Hydrants in City Opened Illegally on 93 Day
description: Water pressure dropped be low critical levels in many areas of the city yesterday, depriving firefighters, hospitals and homes of adequate supplies as 1,000 fire hydrants, opened il. legally, spilled out half a billion gallons onto torrid streets for the second day.

title: Whitehead Says Nixon Favors 1Year Funding for Public TV
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Clay T. Whitehead, Director of the White House Office of Tele communications Policy, said to day the Administration still favored a oneyear funding plan for public broadcasting despite an agreement for greater local station autonomy reached last month.

title: Nixon's Drug Aide Quitting
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) President Nixon announced today that he was accepting the anticipated resignation of Myles J. Ambrose as a special Presi dential consultant and special assistant Attorney General for drug abuse enforcement, effec tive July 6.

title: East Bloc Fights West's Ideas, but Flow Goes On
description: BUDAPESTThe entire stage throbs with the rhythm, roll and spontaneity of folk rock. The set is straight out of America: electric guitars and kids with long hair, beards, beads, jeans, leather jackets, sweat shirts, miniskirts, the works. They break out in song:

title: West Germany and NATO Allies Seeking to Dissuade U.S. From Sudden Cut in Troops
description: BONN. June 12Despite all the American reassurances that! there will be no unilateral re duction of United States troop strength in Central Europe, West Germany and the other NATO allies are obviously afraid that the reduction will come anyway and have cm harked on a lowkeyed public relations campaign to try to forestall it.

title: ZORILA, WITH 220, WINS BY 4 SHOD
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 12Greg Zorila of Briar Hall won the 54th annual Westchester County Golf Association ama teur championship by four strokes today with 220 on the 6,686yard, par71 course at Metropolis Country Club.

title: ICELAND ASKS U.S. FOR TREATY REVISION
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, June 12 (Reuters)  Iceland formally asked the United States today for a revision of the 1951 de fense treaty under which Amer ican forces are stationed at the Keflavik air base.

title: Edward N. Gadsby Dead at 73; Was a Former S.E.C. Chairman
description: BOSTON, June 12Edward Northup Gadsby, a lawyer who served as chairman of the Securities and Exchange Com mission in the Eisenhower Ad ministration, died of cancer here tonight at New England Deaconess Hospital. He was 73 years old.

title: 5 Pacts Reported Ready For Brezhnev's U. S. Visit
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The United States and the Soviet Union plan to use the visit by Leonid I, Brezhnev to this coun try next week to announce five or six specific agreements in tended to promote further co operation between the two na tions, Administration officials and Soviet diplomats said today.

title: Domestic Primary Up
description: The Copper Range Company announced yesterday that it had increased its base domestic primary copper price to 66.6 cents a pound, effective imme diately.

title: Rockefeller Wants Legislature to Create a Commission on Inflation at Special Session Next Month
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday that he was enlarging the scope of the spe cial session of the Legislature next month beyond the pension issue to include creation of a commission to investigate prob lems caused by inflation.

title: Passaic Mayor Reelected
description: PASSAIC, June 12 (AP) Mayor Gerald Goldman was re elected today following a bitter contest with Walter Tencza. Vote totals were not immedi ately known. Mr. Goldman and Mr. Tencza finished first and second respectively in a four man race last May 8, with the incumbent barely missing the 50 per centplus one vote need for victory on the first ballot.

title: U.S. Investigation Is Asked Of Yonkers Mayor Hopeful
description: YONKERS, June 12  The United States Attorney's office has been asked by Yonkers of ficials to look into the possible illegality of a private investiga tion initiated recently by the Democratic candidate for Mayor, John J. Morrissey, into the back grounds of two leading figures here.

title: NAVAL BASE CUTS BARRED BY COURT
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., June 12 (AP)A Federal judge ordered a temporary halt today to preparations for major cut backs at Navy bases in Rhode Island and Massachusetts.

title: People in Sports: Unitas to Sue
description: Johnny Unitas, traded to San Diego Chargers after 17 years with the Baltimore Colts, plans to sue his former team to collect $300,000 he contends they owe him in a personal services contract, acording to a report in the Baltimore News American.

title: 5 Pacts Reported. Ready For Brezhnev's U. S. Visit
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The United States and the Soviet Union plan to use the visit by Leonid I. Brezhnev to this coun try next week to announce five or six specific agreements in tended to promote further co operation between the two na tions, Administration officials and Soviet diplomats said today.

title: Ulster Blast Kills 6 as Violence Spreads to a University Town
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, June 12Six persons, four of them women, were killed today and 33 were injured by an explosion of a 100pound bomb in a busy shopping street in town 50 miles north of Belfast. It was the heaviest loss of life from a terrorist bomb for more than a year and the first major attack in Coleraine, predominantly Protestant uni versity town of 15,000 people, which has been almost un touched by the four years of violence.

title: Martha Graham Stuck In a Stalled Elevator
description: Martha Graham, the 79yearold dancer and chore ographer, her escort, two other persons, and a French poodle were victims of the power shortage yesterday evening when they were trapped for 40 minutes in an elevator that stalled between the sixth and seventh floors of her apartment house.

title: Pittsburgh Bus Plunge Kills 1
description: PITTSBURGH, June 12 (UPI) A 6yearold boy was killed and 23 persons were injured today when an airport bus headed for the Greater Pitts burgh International Airport skidded off a wet highway, went over an embankment and overturned. The dead boy, identified as Robert Ball Jr. of Worthington, Ohio was one of eight persons pinned inside the bus.

title: Mississippian Is Reelected by Southern Baptists
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 12More than 10,000 Southern Baptists, opening a threeday national convention here, re elected Owen Cooper, of Yazoo City, Miss., today to a second oneyear term as president of the largest Protestant denomi nation in North America.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Watergate Investigation

title: 5 Nations in U.N. Talks Urge Israeli Troop Withdrawals
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 12The Middle East de bate continued here today with the Soviet Union, Iran, Moroc co, Guinea and Yugoslavia crit icizing Israel and demanding that her armed forces be with drawn from territories occupied during the sixday war in 1967.

title: TEST CRICKET
description: At Nottingham, EnglandFirst match: England 250 and 325 for eight declared; New Zealand 97 and 440. England wins by 38 runs.

title: Mississippi Celebrates Life of Medgar Evers
description: FAYETTE, Miss., June 12 (AP) Medgar Evers's life was celebrated today with a salute to the decade of prog ress in Mississippi since a sniper's bullet cut him down. It was the 10th anniversary of the day when a man armed with a 3006 hid near Mr. Evers's home in Jackson, Miss., and shot the civil rights leader in the back.

title: Savings Bank Inflow Lags
description: The net inflow of deposits into mutual savings banks came to $1.6billion during the first five months of 1973, down almost 50 per cent from the $3.1billion net inflow in the same period of 1972, the Na tional Association of Mutual Savings Banks said yesterday.

title: Australian OTB Impresses U.S. Horsemen
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 12New York could learn from Australia about offtrack betting, a group of American turf men agreed today after a look at how it is done in Sydney.

title: Figure in Heroin Case I Said to Talk on Payola
description: A 25yearold man who was indicted in Newark last Febru ary for allegedly having taken part in a heroin trafficking ring has given Federal authori ties information on payola in the record industry, sources close to the case said yester day.

title: Lieutenant Weds Gulielma Rogers
description: EAST WILLISTON, LI, June 12In the Community Church here this afternoon, Miss Gulielma Rogers, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs, Philip Ashley Rogers of Old West bury, was married to Lieut. William Edward Rosenberg, U.S.A.F., a 1973 graduate of the United States Air Force Academy and son of Mr, and Mrs. John E. Rosenberg of Brookfield, Wis.

title: Dr. Inez A. Bentley Is Dead; Child Psychiatrist Was 89
description: Dr. Inez A. Bentley, a dip lomate in both psychiatry and neurology and former secretary and treasurer of the American Women's Hospitals Service, died Monday in a Syracuse nursing home. She was 89 years old and had been a clinical psychiatrist with the Health Department's Bureau of Child Guidance until she retired in 1953.

title: 5 U.S. MEN SCORE IN ENGLISH TENNIS
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 12 (AP)Tom Gorman, the United States Davis Cup player, capped a good day for Americans today with a 63, 46, 6.4 triumph over Ismael ElShafei of Egypt in the sec ond round of the $75,000 Not tingham grasscourt tennis tournament, a tuneup for Wimbledon.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Former Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher changed his mind about withdrawing a guilty plea to one count of tax evasion and is scheduled to be sentenced Friday. Federal District Court Judge Leonard I. Garth said he had been informed of Gallagher's decision during a 2 A.M. telephone call from his attorney, Charles A. McNelis.

title: East Germans Apply at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS,. N. Y., June 12East Germany ap plied today for membership in the United Nations, getting in her request for admission ahead of West Germany.

title: Excerpts From Judge Sirica's Denial of Delay in the Senate Watergate Hearings and the Response by
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Following are excerpts from an opinion by Chief Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court denying a request by Special Prosecu tor Archibald Cox that the Senate Watergate hearings be delayed or that, if continued, they be herd without live radio and television coverage, and the text of a statement by Mr. Cox deciding not to appeal. The motion by Mr. Cox, who heads the Water gate criminal investigation, was opposed by the Senate Watergate committee, the American Broadcasting Corn panics, Inc., Columbia Broad casting System, Inc., National Broadcasting Company, Inc., and Public Broadcasting Serv ice.

title: EHRLICHMAN LINKED TO BREAKIN MEMO
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Watergate prosecutors have a onepage memo ad dressed to the former White House domestic affairs adviser, John D. Ehrlichman, giving de tailed plans for burglarizing the office of Dr. Daniel Ells berg's psychiatrist, The Wash ington Post reported in Wednes day's editions.

title: VOLSTAR HANOVER IN YONKERS TROT
description: YONKERS, June 12Trainer John Simpson Jr. announced today that he would enter Vol star Hanover in Saturday night's $100,000 Yonkers Futur ity Trot at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Market Place:
description: The rail stocks have been off on a deadend siding for months, sitting idly as the market drifted lower and the outlook for freightrate in creases remained uncertain.

title: EXAIDE OF JERSEY SAYS HE GOT BRIBE
description: TRENTON, June 12Former State Teasurer John A. Kervick pleaded guilty in Federal Court here today to bribery charges involving an extortion con spiracy to fix a New Jersey highway contract in return for a $27,000 kickback to the Democratic party.

title: NEW TESTS ORDERED FOR FIREMEN HERE
description: The city was ordered yester day to change its written tests for applicants to the Fire De partment and for promotion in the department, when a Federal judge ruled that current exam had the effect of unconstitu tional discrimination against black and Hispanic candidates.

title: School Integration in 17 States Upheld by U.S. Appeals Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) A court order directing fur ther enforcement of school de segregation in 17 states was upheld today by the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit.

title: U. S. SUES TEXACO ON GASOLINE DEAL
description: The Justice Department sued yesterday to prevent Texaco, Inc., the country's largest gas oline marketer, from carrying out a deal that the Government contends would put inde pendent gas station operators out of business.

title: SUSAN D'USSEAU
description: Susan d'Usseau, a portraitist and textile designer who had her first oneman show two years ago, when she was 71 years old, died yesterday of cancer at her home, 409 East 58th Street.

title: Want to Dress Like a Model? Buy a $1.98 Hat
description: As soon as the weather got warm, a few weeks ago, some of the soign, sophisticated girls who model the most glamorous clothes on Seventh Avenue began coming to work in squashy brimmed hats with their little cotton dresses or pants.

title: SUDAN SETS TRIAL IN ENVOY KILLINGS
description: CAIRO, June 12  Sudanese authorities have decided to bring homitide charges next week in Khartoum civil court against the eight Palestinian commandos who killed three diplomats, including two Amer icans, on March 2, the au thoritative Sudanese newspaper AlSahafa reported today.

title: Sponsors Call for Action on Pension Bill
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The two principal sponsors of a bill aimed at reforming the private pension systems on which 35 million workers are dependent told a Senate sub committee today that speedy action was urgent to end a situation in which a private pension promise all too fre quently is a broken promise.

title: Mets Beat Marichal of Giant On Kranepool's Homer, 54
description: In a rush of unusual occur rences, the Mets hit a home run, won a game and even beat Juan Marichal of the San Fran cisco Giants last night in Shea Stadium.

title: Greek Vote on Confirmation Of Republic Set for July 29
description: ATHENS, June 12  The Greek Government announced tonight that it would hold its nationwide referendum on July 29 to confirm the proclamation of a republic and the appoint ment of Premier George Papa dopoulos as its first President.

title: U. S. Court Upsets Ban on Medicare To Alien Refugees
description: MIAMI, June 12 (AP)Medi care regulations barring pay ments for some services to ali ens who have not become per manent residents of the United States are unconstitutional, threejudge Federal court has ruled.

title: S.E.C. Weighs Scrapping Of Fixed Brokerage Fees
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The Securities and Exchange Commission told Congress to day that it was considering the scrapping of fixed brokerage commissions in the near future in favor of fully com petitive rates at all levels.

title: A Show of Hands
description: BROOKVILLE, Md.It is possible that Administrations in the past have somehow used their power to keep incriminating information from the voters, but never has there been a case as patent as Watergatewhere the voters learned just a few months after the election of criminal behavior engaged in by the party in power six months before the election.

title: U.S.C. 87 VICTOR WITH 8 IN NINTH
description: OMAHA, June 12 (AP)Southern California, seeking its fourth straight title, rallied for eight runs in the last of the ninth inning tonight and ousted Minnesota, 87, from the 27th College World Series.

title: Con Ed Reduces Voltage by 5 Per Cent Here
description: The Consolidated Edison Company cut back its voltage yesterday as the heat wave con tinued, but it managed to meet a record demand for electricity because it had more generators working and was able to buy more power from outside than Ion Monday

title: NEW OIL DEMANDS BY ARABS FEARED;;West Views Libya's Seizure of Bunker Hunt Company as Warning to 3 Others
EXAIDE OF JERSEY SAYS HE GOT BRIBE
description: TRENTON, June 12Former State Teasurer John A. Kervick pleaded guilty in Federal Court here today to bribery charges involving an extortion con spiracy to fix k New Jersey highway contract in return for a $27,000 kickback to the Democratic party.

title: Edward English, Poet, 58, Dies; He Celebrated Life as Triumph
description: Edward H. English, a vaga bond poet, jewelry maker, wel fare recipient and optimist, was found dead last Friday in his home at 320 Jefferson Avenue, in Brooklyn's BedfordStuyve sant section. His death was at tributed to natural causes. He was about 58 years old.

title: Red Smith
description: The man who broke Muhammad Ali's jaw sat relaxed on a sofa in the hotel suite he shared with Eddie Futch, his trainer. His white boots came to midcalf. The matching belt was three inches wide, perhaps 28 inches long. Ex traordinary biceps strained the short sleeves of his blue gray knitted jersey. A smile gleamed beneath his Pancho Villa mustache. He is in light training now at 220 pounds, he said, and next month will return to Gilman Hot Springs in California's San Jacinto Mountains, where he got ready for All last March. It's been lucky for Eddie, he said of the training camp where Futch has been working with fighters for more than 15 years. It has also been lucky for Ken Norton, whose name was something less than a household word the last time he came down out of the mountains. Now he is recognized on the street, and in restaurants diners queue up for his autograph. If lie whips Ali again on Sept. 10, he may even be recognized by George Foreman. Sports of The Times

title: INQUIRY IS URGED ON IMPEACHMENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Representative Bella S. Abzug, Democrat of Manhattan, urged the House tonight to open an inquiry into whether there were grounds for impeaching Presi dent Nixon over the Watergate affair.

title: Australia Bars Mediating In Cambodian Dispute Now
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 12 Prime Minister Gough Whit lam today rejected a suggestion that Australia mediate between Prince Norodom Sihanouk, Cambodia's deposed Head of State, and President Lon Nol of Cambodia.

title: DOLLAR VALUE OFF; GOLD CLOSES MIXED
description: LONDON, June 12 (UPI)The dollar lost value in a num ber of quiet money markets to day and some traders said the United States might have be gun secret support operations.

title: NINE START TODAY IN JERSEY STAKES
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., June 12 Who Duzzit, Pete Fox and Last Spy are the major con tenders in the $28,375 Tyro Stakes, tomorrow's feature at Monmouth Park.

title: A's Down Yanks, 42
description: OAKLAND, June 12  The Yankees completed the maneu vering of their pitching staff today by trading Mike Kekich to the Cleveland Indians, but later discovered their pitching problems weren't over when Steve Kline was plagued once again by elbow trouble in to night's game against the Oak land A's.

title: 2 MORE CONCERNS INDICTED ON TAXES
description: NEWARK, June 12United States Attorney Herbert J. Stern said today that a Federal grand jury had indicted two more corporations for alleged ly filing false incometax re turns. The companies were in dicted as an outgrowth of an investigation of alleged irregu larities in the financing of Gov ernor Cahill's 1969 election campaign.

title: TRAFFIC PLAN WINS INITIAL APPROVAL
description: Traffic and transportation specialists voiced guarded ap proval yesterday of Mayor Lindsay's new midtown traffic control program, but the Madi son Avenue mall, which is part of the plan, came in for further criticism.

title: Politics, Watergate and Television
description: WASHINGTONFor the last couple of years the Nixon Administration, with Vice President Agnew leading the charge, has been protesting against what It calls instant analysis of Presidential speeches by television commentators, and now the Columbia Broadcasting System has announced that it will abandon this practice.

title: Excerpts From Plea by Stans's Counsel for a Delay in Senate Testimony and Replies by Ervin and Baker
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Following are excerpts from the statement to the Senate Watergate committee today by Robert W. Barker, attor ney for former Secretary of Commerce Maurice H. Stens, and the replies of the com mittee chairman, Senator Sam J. Ervin, and Senator Howard H. Baher Jr.:

title: Clearing the Way
description: The latest developments affecting the testimony John W. Dean 3d, former White House counsel, tend to dissipate the concern expressed by Vice President Agnew and others that the Senate Watergate hearings may seri ously hamper the work of special prosecutor Archibald Cox,

title: COMMODITY PRICES LIFTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices, for the week ended June 5.

title: Action on Inflation Today Hinted as Nixon Confers
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  President Nixon held an extraordinary meeting with his senior economic advisers today, and the Republican leader in the Senate, Hugh Scott, hinted that the White House would announce a new pack age of antiinflation measures tomorrow.

title: Interior Secretary Rejects Power Unit In Southern Utah
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) Interior Secretary Rogers C, B. Morton announced today his refusal for environmental rea sons to grant permits for the construction of a coalfired power plant in southern Utah.

title: Kerr's Nomination Rejected
description: NEWARK, June 12 (UPI) For the fourth time, the Newark City Council rejected today the nomination of Lieut. Edward L. Kerr to be the city's first black Police Director. All three black councilmen voted in favor of Kerr, but the six whites on the body abstained.

title: Records: A Set of Billie Holiday's Hits
description: In the midst of the collec tions of Golden Oldies, Great est Rock n Roll Hits, Origi nal Big Band. Hits and other miscellany that are being peddled on television, there has appeared a remarkable fourdisk set that would stand out in any surround ings. 55 Original Hits by Billie Holiday (Adam VIII 8002, $8.95) brings together in one album almost all of Miss Holiday's best records drawn from Columbia (with Teddy Wilson's orchestra and the other allstar combos she recorded with in the late nineteenthirties), from Com modore (including the origi nal Strange Fruit) and from Decca (half a dozen astutely chosen records including Lover Man).

title: 2 Firemen Killed, 38 Injured in Philadelphia Blaze
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12 (AP)  Two firemen were killed and at least 38 others were injured tonight when an explosion and fire raged through a South Philadelphia ink plant.

title: MissAschner 64, 62 Victor; Miss Carillo Scores Upset
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 12Marilyn Aschner of Hollis wood, Queens, and Sheila Mc Inerney of Rome, the topseeded players, reached the quarter. finals of the Eastern women's claycourt tennis championship at the Oriente Beach Club to day. Mimi Kanarek of Hastings onHudson, seeded No. 3, was upset my Mary Carillo of Doug laston, Queens, 61, 16, 76.

title: ROBERT KNOX DIES; FASHION DESIGNER
description: Robert Knox, the fashion designer, who started his career as a sketcher at the age of 15, died Sunday of leukemia at Mount Sinai Hos pital. He was 65 years old

title: Roundup: Carlton Finds It's a Different Season
description: By DEANE McGOWEN

title: New Jersey Sports
description: MONTVALE, June 12The Pascack Hills High School track team ended its dualmeet season with a 3.6 wonlost record, its worst showing in five years. But the 88 boys on the squad at least were liberated.

title: LINDSAY ATTACKS PRESS ON SCANDAL
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday criticized the reporting of the Watergate scandal as contribut ing to intolerable breakdowns of the rule and the spirit of the law.

title: COAST BUGGING HELD NOT PART OF INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Be cause of an editing error, The New York Times reported erro neously today that a top aide to Representative Sam Steiger, Republican of Arizona, said he planted an illegal listening de vice as part of an investigation by the House Select Committee on Crime.

title: Orantes,Newcombe Pressed To Win in German Tourney
description: HAMBURG, Germany, June 12 (UPI)After his lackluster performance in the final of the Italian championship, Manuel Orantes of Spain had to scram ble through the first round of the West German open today. He won by 36, 60, 119 from unheralded Guillermo Vilas of Argentina.

title: Cambodia Asks Calm as Fighting Grows
description: BEK CHAN, Cambodia, June 12With Communist forces increasing their pressure 13 miles west of Phnom Penh, the Cambodian Government today broadcast an appeal for calm and promised a victory in the area in a few days.

title: Caterpillar Tractor Earnings Advanced Sharply Last Month
description: The Caterpillar Tractor Com pany reported yesterday that its earnings in May jumped by $5million to $21.6million, or 38 cents a share, from $16.5 million, or 29 cents a share, in May of last year.

title: CanAm Series Takes Steps Toward Safety
description: To make CanAm road races safer, the format of that series is being changed several ways. The biggest change is division of each race into a pair of heats of approximately 100 miles apiece, the purpose being to halve the amount of gasoline that needs to be carried in these big sports About cars. Another in Motor novation is the use of pace cars Sports to slow down traffic after seri ous accidents. This practice, common in other sanctioning clubs, protects safety crews cleaning up debris from the track, coping with a disabled car or extricating an injured driver from a wreck. The changes were adopted at a meeting of promoters held in Toronto on Monday, the day after this season's opening CanadianAmerican Challenge Cup event at Bow manville, Ontario. The Can Am series is sanctioned by the Sports Car Club of Amer ica and the Canadian Auto mobile Sport Clubs.

title: Most Bonds Higher in Mixed Market
IMPROVED BALANCE OF TRADE IS SEEN
description: Secretary of Commerce Fred erick B. Dent said yesterday that the United States was on the way to improvement of its trade balance.

title: Kulig Conquers Lindner In 3 Sets in State Tennis
description: Bob Kulig of New York up set thirdseeded Ken Lindner of Brooklyn, 75, 57, 76, yes terday to gain the fourth round of the New York State men's tennis championships at the North Shore Tennis and Rac quets Club, of Bayside, Queens.

title: SUGAR FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Heavy speculative liquida tion depressed world sugar futures prices yesterday, a re treat following a sharp price increase recently on the New York Coffee and Sugar Ex change.

title: NEW YORKER'S TEAM WINS GRISCOM TRIAL
description: ARDMORE, Pa., June 12Mrs. Walter Cooperstein, a for mer New York metropolitan champion, Jeannie Watson of Boston and Debbie Massey of Philadelphia scored a net best ball of partners 33, 2962 in winning a handicap tournament today on Merion Golf Club's cast course.

title: Sailor Is Freed by Navy Board In Trial on Sabotage of Carrier
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 12A courtmartial board of three enlisted men and two officers acquitted Navy Fireman Patrick D. Chenoweth today on the charge of sabotage in a time of war on the aircraft carrier U.S.S. Ranger.

title: Soviet Liner Leaves City
description: The Mikhail Lemontov, first Soviet passenger vessel to visit New York on regular trav el service, sailed for home yes terday after a 24hour stay. The ship's captain waved a salute to the city and the ship's band played marches as the vessel left the HollandAmerica terminal at Houston Street and the Hudson River. The ship took aboard 206 passengers for the cruise to Le Havre, London, Bremerhaven and Leningrad.

title: FRANCE IMPOSING TIGHT SPEED CUR??; 62Mile Limit Will Prevail or 90% of Nation's Roads
description: PARIS, June 12The Gov ernment today decreed a dras tic limit on car speeds on 90 per cent of the French roar network. As of July 1, drivers will not be permitted to go faster than 100 kilometers an hour, or about 62 miles, on or dinary roads.

title: Fuchsberg Wins Judgeship Primary by 763 Votes
description: Jacob D. Fuchsberg has won the Democratic nomination for chief judge of the state, ac cording to the complete un official returns.

title: Attorney Vows Dean Will Take On Nixon and Administration at Senate Hearing
description: WASHINGTON, June 12An attorney for John W. Dean 3d vowed today that despite an apparent court setback, the former White House counsel would still take on President Nixon and his Administration in the televised Senate Water gate hearings next week.

title: Phase 3: A Failing Experiment Ends
description: In one of his great World War II cartoons, Bill Mauldin showed a British Tommy squat ting on a rubber tire on the Anzio battlefield, staring bleak ly at the discarded equipment, Kration cans, barbed wire, shell casings and other junk littering the beach around him. The Tommy is saying to two passing American G.I.'s You blokes sure leave a messy battlefield. The battle over Phase 3 and a new anti iinflation policy is coming to an end, and President Nixon will soon announce the results. But the Washington battle ground is still littered with de caying economic analyses, broken options, spent rhetoric and remnants of position blowing in the wind.

title: U.S. Syphilis Study Called Ethically Unjustified
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (UPI) An advisory panel described as ethically unjustified today a government study begun in 1932 among 430 Alabama blacks to gauge the longterm effects of syphilis in men.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O.GIVES BACKING TO BYRNE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 12  Brendan T. Byrne, the Democratic gubernatorial nom inee, was endorsed by the state A.F.L.C.I.O., today and he pledged a prolabor plat form embracing workmen's compensation, job safety and security, pensions and higher employment.

title: Little N.F.L. Reaction To Drug Traffic Story
description: The National Football League had little comment yesterday about The New York Times story that four pro football players were un der surveillance by Federal authorities for allegedly traf flexing in drugs.

title: Glass Leaves Hospital
description: CLEVELAND, June 12 (AP)  Charles (Chip) Glass, a 24yearold backup tight end for the Cleveland Browns, was re leased today from a hospital, where he had undergone sur gery to correct a back prob lem. Glass entered the hospital to correct a herniated lumbar disc, then suffered a blood clot that led to emergency surgery and a delay in his release.

title: Bishop Asserts Watergate Typifies U.S. Immorality
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., June 12Bishop W. Ralph Ward Jr, last night urged the leaders of the 560 United Methodist Churches in western Connecti cut and metropolitan New York to stir the conscience of the nation on the Watergate scan dal in light of the appalling immorality of our time.

title: Isolationism: Two Faces
description: BRUSSELSNATO was thrown into a tizzy by a speech made here last week by the new U.S. Defense Secre tary, James Schlesinger. Mr. Schles inger appeared deliberately to down play Soviet military capabilities in direct contradiction of a report simul taneously delivered by the alliance's own intelligence analysts.

title: Advertising: Grey's Retail Unit
description: Grey Advertising, the coun try's seventh largest agency, has spun off its sales promo tion unit to create a wholly owned subsidiary that will also be going after retail advertising accounts.

title: State Residents Are Rated A on the Arts
description: Contrary to the assump tion that the general public holds cultural activities in low regard, the majority of New York State residents have a decidedly positive outlook toward the arts and favor increased cultural facil ities in their communities.

title: Action on Inflation Today Hinted as Nixon Confers
description: WASHINGTON, June 12  President Nixon held an extraordinary meeting with his senior economic advisers today, and the Republican leader in the Senate, Hugh Scott, hinted that the White House would announce a new pack age of antiinflation measures tomorrow.

title: Excerpts From Testimony Given Before Senate. Select Committee on Watergate
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: June 13, 1973 SECURITY COUNCIL

title: U.S.HANOI DRAFT IS SAID TO DEMAND A NEW CEASEFIRE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 12Henry A. Kissinger and Le Duc The have drafted a document that aims at strength ening their original Vietnam agreement with a call for a firm ceasefire within 24 hours of signing and with a restatement of other key provisions, accord ing to sources close to the Sai gon Government.

title: Burying the Dead
description: The dead may be beyond mortal affront, but it unconscionable that bereaved families should have their anguish heightened by a strike that impedes burial their loved ones. Even where religious laws do not require burial within a day, the fear of bodies decom posing in this week's torrid heat is not eased by the assurance of authorities that no actual threat yet exists to."the health and welfare of the residents of the state"presumably those still alive.

title: Judge Criticizes Editor but Clears Him of Libel Charge
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., June (UPI)Circuit Judge Henry B. Britt has dismissed criminal libel charges against a weekly newspaper editor saying that an article the editor wrote that told of a man who could neither read nor write and lived on a whisky ranch was not to be admired but also was not libelous.

title: CABINET FORMATION BLOCKED IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12TWo members of the Lebanese Cabinet resigned today, forcing Premier Amin Hafez to ask for an indefinite adjournment of a parliamentary vote of confi dence and increasing the chances that the entire Cabinet will resign.

title: Bridge: A Poor Defense Helps Elis Win in U.J.A. Charity Play
description: A glittering array of bridge stars and social celebrities congregated at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel Monday night for the annual United Jewish Appeal charity game. The proceeds, amounting to about $25,000, will help to build a teacher's college near Tel Aviv.

title: Exit Mr. Andreotti
description: Premier Giulio Andreotti's middleroad Government in Italy had been living for weeks on borrowed time. Its fate was sealed when nearly all the other leaders of his Christian Democratic party, including three exPremiers, lined up behind a resolution at the party convention for a return to the centerleft governing formula, with participation by the Socialists.

title: Prices Advance on Amex and OTC
U.S. Says City May Lose $77Million Renewal Fund
description: The Federal Government said yesterday that New York City stood to lose $77.5million in urban renewal funds unless it brought the plumbing and elec trical provisions of its build ing code into compliance with Federal requirements by the end of this month.

title: ITALY'S PREMIER AND CABINET QUIT
description: ROME, June 12Premier Giulio Andreotti and his Cabinet resigned today, opening a Gov ernment crisis that is expected to result in a shift to the left.

title: Hydrants in City Opened Illegally on 93 Day
description: Water pressure dropped be low critical levels in many areas of the city yesterday, depriving firefighters, hospitals and homes of adequate supplies as 1,000 fire hydrants, opened il legally, spilled out half a billion gallons onto torrid streets for the second day.

title: Skylab Leader Melts Metal in a Vacuum, Testing Techniques That Could Lead to Space Manufacturing
description: HOUSTON, June 12 (AP)The Skylab 1 astronauts used an electron beam today to melt metals in a space furnace and to test a process that could lead to a multibillion dollar business of space manufactur ing.

title: RED SOX FISK LEADS ALLSTAR BALLOTING
description: Carlton Fisk of Boston was the top votegetter while Kansas City had three players among American League position lead ers in early balloting for the major league AllStar Game, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn an nounced yesterday.

title: Grid Helps Utilities to. Fill Peak Power Demand Here
description: The Consolidated Edison Company augmented its own capacity with electricity from Canada, New England, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Dela ware to keep ahead of a record demand that occurred between 11 A.M. and noon yesterday.

title: Top 100 Black Businesses Listed
Deadlocked Talks Resumed By North and South Koreans
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 12 North and South Korea to day opened a third round of their deadlocked political talks aimed at improving their rela tions and eventually reunifying the nation.

title: OVERTIME IS URGED FOR POLICE IN CITY
description: Matthew J. Troy Jr., chair man of the City Council Finance Committee, proposed yesterday that overtime be used as a means of strengthen ing the city's police force immediately.

title: A Peerless Political FundRaiser
description: WASHINGTON, June 12From the time he walked out of Shakopee, Minn., Maury Stans was an achiev er, says an admirer who worked closely with Maurice Hubert Stans when he was director of the Bureau of the Budget under President Ei senhower. A n d that is the way Maurice S tans would almost certainly describe himself. Testify ing today before the Senate select committee investigat ing the Watergate affair, Mr. Stans concluded his formal statement by declaring that as chairman in 1972 of the Finance Committee to Re elect the President, he raised the largest amount of mon ey ever spent in a political campaign.

title: A Soviet Ship Is Adrift in Antarctic Ice
description: MOSCOW, June 12The So viet Union disclosed today that its main Antarctic supply ship, the Ob, became caught in ice early in April and has since been drifting helplessly off the icy continent.

title: Stans, Reluctant Witness Who Only Raised Funds
description: WASHINGTON, June 12He didn't sign checks. He didn't hand out cash. He didn't keep detailed financial records. All he really did, Maurice H. Stans told the Senate's Watergate commit tee today, was raise money, about $50million of it.

title: Stocks Advance Strongly On InflationCurb Hopes
description: Anticipation by investors that President Nixon would soon disclose new economic measures to stop the inflation ary spiral enabled the stock market to make a strong ad vance yesterday in much heavi er trading.

title: BEANIE MAY NIT HIS STAY IN OFFICE
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that if he is elected Mayor he would serve only one term if he found after four years that he had put the city on the right track.

title: People and Business
description: William J. Schoen has been named president and chief executive officer of the F. & M. Schaefer Brewing Company, effective July 1. He succeeds Rudolph J. Schaefer 3d, who continues as chairman of the country's sixth largest brewery and was named vice chairman of the F. & M. Schaefer Corpo ration, the parent company.

title: Boyle Is Described as Not Part of Yablonski Plot
description: ERIE, Pa., June 12 (AP)A key state witness in the Yablon ski murder cases said today that he had been told during the planning of the killings that W. A. Boyle, then presi dent of the United Mine Work ers, was not involved in the plot.

title: Ervin Panel Survives First Constitutional Court Clash
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The Senate Watergate investi gation survived its first brush with the Sixth Amendment to the Constitution today, suffer ing little immediate damage, but the final report on this significant legal collision is not due for some time.

title: Paris: Summer Art. Scene Flourishes
description: PARIS  Who said Paris was dead, as far as art is concerned? What other city today presents at the same time retrospectives of Sou tine, Tapies, Hajdu, exhibi tions of works by Poussin, Laurens, Hosiasson, the gold of Bogota, the bronze of China, group shows of young artists from Den mark, Ireland and Canada, drawings of the Counter Reformation  to mention only the offerings of museums?

title: Books of The Times The Imagination of Politics
description: FACING THE LIONS. By Torn Wicker. 432 pages. Viking. $7.95.

title: Clinton W. Blume Dead at 74; ExHead of Real Estate Board
description: Clinton W. Blume, a leading realestate broker here since 1936, died in his sleep yester day at his home, 77 Park Ave nue He was 74 years old,

title: Con Ed Reduces Voltage by 5 Per Cent Here
description: The Consolidated Edision Company cut back its voltage yesterday as the heat wave con tinued, but it managed to meet a record demand for electricity because it had more generators working and was able to buy more power from outside than on Monday.

title: RED SOX FISK LEADS ALLSTAR BALLOTING
description: Carlton. Fisk of Boston was the top votegetter while Kansas City had three players among American League position lead ers in early balloting for the major league AllStar Game, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn an nounced yesterday.

title: FlyCasting Expert Slain
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 12 (UPI)  Jon E. Tarantino, 36 years old, who held 12 world championships in flycasting, was shot to death yesterday in his family's fish and poultry market, apparently by a robber, the police said.

title: Immigration Inquiry Calls Justice Department Aide
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The Justice Department has re fused Congressional investiga tors access to its files, on ad ministrative mismanageinent in the Immigration and Natural ization Service, but the House subcommittee involved has noti fied a high official of the de partment to appear on Monday and testify regarding the in formation it seeks, Government sources said today.

title: Badillo Sees a Fix in Threats to Reduced Fares
description: The current threats to abolish reduced transit fares for the elderly and for schoolchildren are fiscal gameplaying, Rep resentative Herman Badillo said yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 12 (UPI)Forecasters at the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School today pre dicted a slowdown in the United States economy through the next two years, but ruled out the possibility of recession.

title: Protestors of Noise Driven Off NATO Base
description: NORDHORN, West Ger many, June 12 (Reuters) The police used clubs and water cannon today to clear a NATO bombing range here of demonstrators who had set fire to British military vehicles as a protest against excessive noise from the base.

title: A Witness Links Turner To Plot to Frame Gewertz
description: TRENTON, June 12  The prosecution's first witness at the trial of State Senator James M. Turner testified today that the Gloucester County Republi can had agreed to fix a stolen property charge against three men in exchange for $10,000 and help in framing Assem blyman Kenneth A. Gewertz on narcotics charges.

title: Julia Manning Becomes Bride
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., June 12 Miss Julia Margaret Man ning was married at home here this afternoon to Jona than Dwight Watts in an Episcopal ceremony per formed by the Rev. Dr. David L. Anderson of Oberlin, Ohio.

title: Iowa House Votes to End Civil War Era Pensions
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, June 12 (UPI)The Iowa House voted yesterday to end pension pay ments for veterans of the Frontier Guards of Mitchell's Cavalry of 1861, the Spirit Lake Relief Expedition of 1857 and the Northern Border Brigade.

title: IMMUNITY DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, June 12John W, Dean 3d lost his two month struggle for immunity from prosecution today and for the first time went before the Watergate criminal grand jury on orders from Chief Federal Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court.

title: NUCLEAR REACTOR DELAYED BY COURT
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The development of a new type of atomic reactor the Govern ment hopes will eventually solve the national energy crisis was delayed indefinitely today by a unanimous threejudge ruling of a Federal appeals court here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Park Avenue Tunnel Reopens Today

title: Kissinger and Tito Meet, Inconclusively
description: PARIS, June 12Henry A. Kissinger and North Vietnam's chief negotiator, Le Duc Tho, conferred for more than four hours today in their continuing effort to salvage the Vietnam ceasefire.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Cycle Race Rescheduled
description: MILAN, Italy, June 12 (UPI) Organizers today announced a 13day postponement of the Monza 500kilometer motor cycle race, scheduled on the same track where Jarno Saari nen of Finland and Renzo Paso lini of Italy lost their lives in a crash May 20. The Milan Motorcycle Club said the speed land endurance contest, origi nally set for June 24, had been moved to July 7.

title: Israelis Meet Peron and Win Assurances of His Friendship
description: MADRID, June 12An Israeli delegation met here today with Juan D. Perlin, the former Ar gentine dictator, and obtained assurances of a friendly attitude by the new Peronist Govern ment in Buenos Aires toward Israel and the Jewish commu nity in Argentina.

title: IDLE DICE CHOICE IN OX RIDGE SHOW
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 12The 44th edition of the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show gets under way today for five days with more than 800 hor ses on hand and everyone won dering whether any jumper on the sprawling grounds is ca pable of beating Harry Gill's Idle Dice.

title: INQUIRY ON FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Maurice H. Stens, who was forced to appear before the Senate Watergate committee, denied today any involvement in the scandal and pleaded ignorance about many of the activities of the Nixon reelec tion campaign.

title: Woman Takes Top Prize at Princeton
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 12Things have changed at Princeton, Marsha Levy of White Plains said today.

title: Equity Financing
description: An offering of 140,000 common shares of the Northwestern Public Service, Company at $22.25 per share was made yesterday by underwriters managed by Merrill Lynch. The company's stock, traded over the counter, has been quoted at 22 bid, 22 asked.

title: Nixon Daughter Plans Visit
description: WASHINGTON, Tune 12 (UPI)  Mrs. David Eisenhow er, President Nixon's younger daughter, will visit a housing project for the elderly in Hartford! this Thursday, the White House announced today. Mrs. Eisenhower's visit to the P. C. Smith Tower will precede her appearance as commence meat speaker at the Americani School for the Deaf in West Hartford.

title: Buttons That Have Some Tales to Tell Find a New Forum
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J.When Viviane Beck Ertell sets out from here next week on her 3,000mile journey home to Solano Beach, out side of San Diego, the trunk of her big Buick will jingle with thousands of buttons.

title: BALTIMORE NEWSMAN GOES BEFORE JURORS
description: SNOW HILL, Md., June 12 (AP)David Lightman, a Balti more Evening Sun reporter whose refusal to reveal sources for an article dealing with drugs in Ocean City, Md., took him to the Supreme Court, ap peared today before Worcester County grand jury.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was: 45840

title: A du Pont Is Among Those Leaving Firm of Same Name
description: Peter du Pont, a vice presi dent and a member of the cor porate finance department of du Pont Glore Forgan, Inc., has resigned, it was learned yester day. The company confirmed a report that about 100 of its staff of 3,000 had been dis charged.

title: Candidates Take MiddleofRoad Stances as Parties Reorganize
description: TRENTON, June 12New Jersey's major gubernatorial candidates scrambled toward the middle of the road today as the state Democratic and Re publican parties reorganized for the coming fall election.

title: 200 Men Fight Fire on Vacant Hudson Pier Reportedly Set by 3 Boys
description: Three Greenwich Village boys, aged 7, 10 and 12, were charged with juvenile delin quency yesterday while 200 firemen, in 90degree heat, fought a fire that destroyed the vacant Pier 50 in the Hudson River and spread to the roof of Pier 51.

title: Soviet Insurance Deal Set
description: Chubb & Son, Inc., the insur ance company, said yesterday that it had signed an agreement with the Sovietowned Black Sea and Baltic General Insur ance Company, Ltd., of London.

title: Indian Government Takes Over Administration of Uttar Pradesh
description: NEW DELHI, June 12Prime Minister Indira Gandhi today ordered the Government of Ut tar Pradesh in northern India replaced by Federal adminis trators.

title: ISLANDERS DRAFT BERT MARSHALL
description: MONTREAL, June 12 (UPI)Bert Marshall, defenseman for the New York Rangers, was obtained by the New York Is landers today as the first pick in the National Hockey League's annual intraleague draft.

title: U. S. SUES TEXACO ON GASOLINE DEAL
description: The Justice Department sued yesterday to prevent Texaco, Inc., the country's largest gas oline marketer, from carrying out a deal that the Government contends would put inde pendent gas station operators out of business.

title: Trial by Temperature
description: Officially, summer has not even arrived yet. But that was not the message given by the thermometer in the past two days before a cool front began to push the mercury down. Even more dispiriting than the blistering heat and humidity, however, was the evidence that the lessons of past New York summers have been illlearned.

title: INQUIRY ON FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Maurice H. Stans, who was forced to appear before the Senate Watergate committee, denied today any involvement in the scandal and pleaded ignorance about many of the activities of the Nixon reelec tion campaign.

title: A Reputed Nixon Agent Asserts He Worked on McGovern Staff
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., June 12 (Reuters)A man named as Nixon campaign undercover agent in testimony before the Senate Watergate committee said today that he had infil trated the staff of Senator George McGovern, the Demo cratic Presidential candidate, at Miami Beach as a security ad viser.

title: Livingston Biddle 4th Marries Carol Collins
description: Miss Carol Miniurn Col lins and Livingston Ludlow Biddle 4th were married here yesterday afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More by the pastor, Msgr. James G. Wilders. A reception was held at the Colony Club.

title: Notes on People
description: At a ceremony in Manila, President Ferdinand E. Mar cos of the Philippines marked the 75th anniversary of his country's declaration of in dependence with a patriotic speech. Mr. Marcos said that that we have achieved all our hopes for reform. This is our true independence. We have pushed away the dark ness of the long, long night with one single blow, an apparent reference to his re organization of the Govern ment under a new constitu tion.

title: BONN OPPOSITION PICKS NEW CHIEF
description: BONN, June 12The Christ ian Democrats, floundering in disunity since last fall when they were defeated by a wide margin by Chancellor Willy Brandt's coalition, elected Hel mut Kohl as their new nation al chairman today. He replaces Rainer Barzel, longtime leader of the West German Opposi tion.

title: Brando Explains His Stand on Indians
description: Marlion Brando said last night that he never got to Wounded Knee, S. D., to join the Indian protest there last March because he feared his presence would bring charges that he was part of a plot to grab headlines.

title: U.S. LOSS OF COPTER REPORTED BY SWEDE
description: HONG KONG, June 12 (Reu ters)Foreign minister Krister Wickman of Sweden said today that one or two United States helicopters taking part in mine clearing in North Vietnamese waters had been blown up when mines exploded accident ly.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 12 (Reuters)England won the first cricket test here today by 38 runs after New Zealand had made a magnificent comeback. Need ing 479 runs to win, New Zealand went all out for 440. After having lost its first two secondinnings wickets for only 16 runs Saturday, New Zealand was on the brink of victory when it reached 402 for five. But Ken Wads worth was out for 46 just before lunch and Vic Pollard, who batted more than seven hours for his first century in 30 tests, went out for 116 soon after and the New Zea land tailenders were unable to carry on. The final was: England 250 and 325 for eight declared; New Zealand 97 and 440.

title: Sale of Assets by Vesco Halted by Federal Judge
description: A Federal judge issued yes terday a temporary restraining order against the sale by Robert, L. Vesco and associtaes of the assets of Property Resources, Ltd., situated in the Bahamas and said to be controlled by, Value Capital, Ltd., and in turn by Global Financial, Inc.
