description: VALLEY STREAM, L. I., June 16Mr. and Mrs. Ben R. Fogel have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Joanne Lisa Fogel, to Paul Alper, son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph M. Alper of New York. An Aug. 4 wedding is planned.

title: Investigating
description: Investigating the FBI pres ents papers and discussions delivered at a 1971 conference of writers and scholars held at Princeton University. The book is invaluable; like Ralph de Toledano's effusive biography, however, it is dominated by J. Edgar Hoover and suffers there by from a curiously dated per spective.

title: AARON HITS 691ST, BRAVES LOSE 43
description: ATLANTA, June 16 (AP)Jim Hickman's tworun homer with two out in the seventh following a thirdstrike passed ball lifted the Chicago Cubs to a 43 victory over Atlanta to night, snapping the Braves fivegame winning streak.

title: Why Can't a Woman Compose Like a Man?
Five Democrats Records Subpoenaed
description: WASHINGTON, June 16The Senate Watergate com mittee has subpoenaed the fi nancial records of five Demo crats who ran for President last year.

title: Miss Coward and Peter Post, Penn Graduates, Are Married
description: ESSEX FELLS, N. J., June 16  Miss Patricia Lamborn Coward was married at noon today in St. Peter's Episcopal Church to Peter Lindley Post.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: Point of View
description: The City Council's opposition to the Maximum Base Rent formula is a con venient electionyear answer to ten ant complaints. Last week, by over riding Mayor Lindsay's veto of the council's repeal of the computer rent system, the council took an action that can only succeedif it is sus tained in courtin further shrinking the city's desperately needed housing supply.

title: Hempstead Seeking Gas Station Curbs
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I.In an effort to end what was de scribed as the honkytonk atmosphere that surrounds many of the gasoline stations in the Town of Hempstead, a committee that has been studying the problem for the last 18 months proposed last week a new law that would enable the town to order the demolition of some stations and block the construction of others.

title: StratfordWhere You Can See the Original Beast at Work
description: WHILE we are spending so much time talking about the thea ter's failing powers, we really ought to stop now and then to take note of the theater's con tinuing, phenomenal, almost absolute power not only to reassert itself but to reanimate whole communities. In stances of such rebirth and transforma tion may be relatively rare, but they do occur when the circumstances are right, and when they occur they should be tossed onto the scales as fair meas ure against our fears.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: How much responsibility do schools and colleges in the United States have for the moral education of our young people? Watergate has revealed seri ous moral deficiencies in those who have enjoyed excellent educational opportunities. Have we, asks Prof. Henri Peyre (letter May 30) failed lamentably to impart any sense, any critical spirit to those whom we have instructed?

title: Man Survives Plunge From Brooklyn Bridge
description: A 25yearold man, holding a 10footsquare nylon tar paulin over his head, jumped from the Brooklyn Bridge into the East River last night and survived, though he was critically hurt, the police said.

title: $4.4BILLION WON BY STATE PUTS IT 7TH IN U.S. 72 AID
description: WASHINGTON, June 16 New York State receives more direct Federal aid per capita than all except six states, but Connecticut and New Jersey are near the bottom of the list.

title: Basketball Transactions
Confrontations With Myself
description: When Simone de Beiuvoir wrote The Second Sex in 1949, she used Dr. Helene Deutsch's Psychology of Women extensively as source mate rial; it was then the massive classic on the psychology of women. Al though many of Helene Deutsch's ideas are currently under attack, and she herself feels that some of them are outdated, Confrontations With Myself does not deal with her the ories but her life. Helene Deutsch was among the first pioneering group of women analysts surrounding Freud; she had a short didactic analysis with him, and under his aegis became head of the Vienna Training Institute in the 1920's. In this country after 1934, she was known as an excellent clinician and training analyst in Bos

title: LacrosseCoCaptainsPicked
description: Goalie John Martino, a goalie, and Nick DeRobertis, a mid fielder, both of Yorktown Heights, N. Y., have been elect ed cocaptains of the Franklin and Marshall College Lacrosse team.

title: Khctjuraho's New Temple Has Soft Beds and Parking Space
description: IT is just dawn. The light of the sun is gently warm. There is an im pending glow in the sky, a shimmer in the shallow pools, a waking glint in the eyes of a buli and a silent rustle in the old mahua trees. Khajuraho takes its own time to start a new day. But one corner of this village in central India is wide awake. A low white build ing with polished doors and windows is alive with people and activity.

title: THE BIG TEN ON BROADWAY
SOUTH STARS WIN INLACROSSE, 1311
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, L. I., June 16Dick Belsito of Phila delphia led the South to a 1311 overtime triumph over the North today in the lacrosse club allstar game.

title: Soviet Under Brezhnev Powerful Yet Insecure
description: MOSCOW, June 15The So viet Union of Leonid I. Brezhnev is a land that is immensely powerful and yet strangely in secure, eager to promote recon ciliation and yet anxious to limit its impact at home, reach ing out to the world and yet trying to hold it at bay.

title: P.P.C. Nominee
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate, which has been fretting about the erosion of its powers, sent a signal to the White House last week that it intends to take a closer look at the nominees for Federal regulatory agencies that Presi dent Nixon sends up for confirma tion.

title: G.M. PUTS OFF PLAN FOR USE OF AIRBAG
description: DETROIT, June 16The plan of the General Motors Corpora tion to put the revolutionary airbag safety device into 100, 000 of its 1974 cars has been set back at least a few months.

title: State Help to Arts Stirs L.I. Dispute
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I.  Is Long Island getting a fair share of the funds the state contributes to cultural activ ities throughout New York? John W. Maerhofer, direc tor of Nassau County's Office of Cultural Development, in sists that the Island, which received $452,070 out of $15 million allocated this year, is being shortchanged.

title: South Vietnam Without the Americans
description: SAIGONIn the dry, brown rice fields of Quang Nam Province in central South Vietnam, six chil dren were killed by a mine last week as they flew a kite, long a symbol of peace in the Vietnamese countryside. It was incident number 16,547 since the first ceasefire went into effect last January, according to the Saigon Government's count, and made a total of over 30,400 persons killed after the war was supposed to have stopped. Few Viet namese expect the second ceasefire agreement, signed in Paris last Wednesday, to be any more effective in bringing peace.

title: With a Hop, Skip and Jump, Playgrounds Go Modern
description: The wanderer along Central Park West should be prepared these days for a bizarre sight near 67th Street. In one cluster there he will find stepped pyramid, a minicastle that might be some sort of treehouse and series of concentric fortress walls awash with children.

title: Miss Metcalf Retains Title In National College Tennis
description: AUBURN, Ala., June 16 (AP) The defending champion, Jan ice Metcalf of Redlands Univer sity, won the national women's collegiate tennis tournament to day. She routed Tina Watanabe of California State, 61, 60.

title: Criminals At Large
description: This week's fairy tale is Wil liam Judson's ALICE AND ME (Fields, $6.95). It follows a story line explored last year by Brian Garfield's Death Wish, and will help New Yorkers live out their fantasy life. The idea is that crime is increasing and nobody seems to be doing any thing about it. Or, worse, no body seems able to do any thing about it. The System has gone haywire. So what would happen if a concerned citizen took the law into his own hands?

title: DALEY AB GIBSON SCORE E.P.A. PLAN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 16Mayors of some of the nation's largest cities denounced the Environmental Protection Agen cy's latest proposal to reduce air pollution as the annual con ference of mayors opened to day in what was described as a period of storm for Ameri ca's cities.

title: Route 1287: Change Unlikely
description: TRENTON  Ecologists and state Transportation De partment officials see little chance of a change in the proposed alignment of 20 miles of Route 1287 extend ing from Route 202 in Mont ville to the New York Thru way in Suffern, despite the likelihood of new hearings on the route.

title: The End of Patience
description: The Senate's overwhelming vote in favor of cutting off all funds for any United States military action through out Indochina represents the most emphatic Congres sional rejection yet of the Administration's persisting policy of intervention in the affairs of Southeast Asia.

title: Washington's Latest Tourist Attraction
description: ASHINGTON, D. C.They took turns. She snapped his picture; then he snapped hers. Make sure you get the sign in, she cau tioned. The sign read: Watergate.

title: Miss Bacon Has Nuptials
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 16 Miss Charlotte Rush Bacon, daughter of Robert Bacon of Woods Hole and Mrs. Katherine Jay Bacon of Cambridge, was married to John Charles Phillips 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur H. Phillips of Ipswich in Christ Episcopal Church here this afternoon. The Rev. Mason Wilson performed the cere mony.

title: Here comes Mr. Brezhnev
description: It is now little more than a year since President Nixon went to Moscow, and Soviet Communist party chairman Brezhnev's return visit to Wash ington, scheduled for this week, follows long established diplomatic practice. Because of the Watergate scandal, President Nixon may find difficult to think of the urgent questions that have to be settled here and now on the very highest level, but he will no doubt welcome the fact that for some days, at least, the press will be concerned with topics other than Watergate. Mr. Brezhnev, given the problems facing the Soviet economy, may be in a little more of a hurry. He has never been to the United. States and will be interested in gain ing firsthand experience of the leading capitalist country, which has been the source of so much preoccupation for him in years past.

title: Mays Homers Off Padres
description: Shea Stadium was a glorious playland for the Mets and 24,452 of their fans last night as they went on an offensive orgy and routed the hapless San Diego Padres, 102.

title: RADNOR II TAKES STAKE AT OX RIDGE
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 16Melanie Smith, a 23yearold blonde from Germantown, Tenn., outside Memphis, gave Radnor II the ride of his 7yearold life today and won the preliminary jumper champion ship at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show.

title: Dog Tax in Prague Is a Matter of Degree
description: Opposition to dogs in cities is presenting a problem to philotherians in places be sides New York. Perhaps it hasn't reached the propor tions of Reykjavik, Iceland, where dogs are banned but on a recent visit to Czecho slovakia it was noticeable that quite a change had oc curred in Prague. In that capital, often referred to as the City of 100 Spires (actually there are 473), an antidog campaign, abetted by Mayor Zdenek Zuzka, is in progress.

title: Per Capita Breakdown Of U.S. Aid to States
description: been allocated on the basis of need or justice or equity or fariness, but on a raw nose countwhat formula gets the most votes.

title: Seoul Stiffens Drug Penalty
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 16 (UPI)  A South Korean nar cotics law calling for capital punishment for, habitual nar cotics addicts and sellers went into effect this week.

title: BREDINEV ARRIVES FOR A 9DAY VISIT
description: WASHINGTON, June 16 Leonid I. Brezhnev arrived in a heavy downpour today for the unofficial start of a nine day visit intended to spur arms control talks and to promote cooperation and commerce be tween the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Landau and Sealtiel Named To U.S. Table Tennis Team
description: Victor I. Landau of Yonkers and Mitchell Sealtiel of Trenton are the first to be named to the table tennis team that will rep resent the United States at the World Maccabiah Games in Israel July 9 to 19.

title: Ellen Beebe Is Bride
description: FREEPORT, L. I., June 16 Miss Ellen Beebe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George A. Beebe, was married here this afternoon to Gerard Dallal, son of Mr. and Mrs. Elie J. Dallal of Brooklyn. The Rev. Carleton Fisher Jr. performed the ceremony in the South Nassau Unitarian Church.

title: F. P. Pandolfi Weds Joyce Verhalen
description: LAKE HOPATCONG, N. J. June 16Miss Joyce Mary Verhalen was married here this noon to Francis P. Pan dolfi, president of MBA Com munications, which publishes magazines for persons start ing out on careers in med icine, law and engineering.

title: Miss Woodard Has Nuptials
description: HASTINGS ON HUDSON, N. Y., June 16Miss Melissa Sue Woodard and Craig Ed ward Barringer, 1972 gradu ates of St. Lawrence Univer sity, were married here this. afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Clifton. Woodard Jr., parents of the bride. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Bruce Barringer of Scotia. The ceremony, written by; the bridal couple, was per formed by the Rev. Harold. Schutt of the Dutch Reformed Church in Scotia.

title: Arlene Stein Betrothed
description: PORT JERVIS, N. Y., June 16  Dr. and ,Mrs. Nathan Stein have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Arlene Stein, to Robert Ginsburg, son of Dr. and Mrs. Abraham Ginsburg of Huntington Valley, Pa. Miss Stein, whose father is a dentist, attends the Penn sylvania School of Dental Medicine. Her fianc, a grad uate of Muhlenberg. College, is a student at Temple Uni versity School of Medicine. His father is a general prac titioner.

title: How the West Was, and How Elvis Is?
description: IT is probably impossible for seriously commercial American filmmakers ever quite to fulfill promisesmade in their advertisementsto give us the truth behind the legend, or behind what a copywriter for Elvis on Tour calls the storybook myth. It's not be cause Americans are reluctant to ex pose truths. Debunking is an especially appreciated American art, one that is often rewarded with so much money, as well as with so much fame, that no film producer in his right mind would hesitate to do it if he possibly could. The truth is that he can't. It has something to do with the nature of popular American films, and with the manner in which we look at them.

title: The Environment
description: WASHINGTONThe Supreme Court decision was about as short as they get: The judgment is affirmed by an equally divided court. But with those nine words four justices charted whole new course for environmental protection across the country.

title: Dance
description: HOW fast times move. It seems only yester day that the newer forces of modern dance, Paul Taylor, Alvin Ailey, Alwin Nikolais and Murray Louis, were moving forward to join the Martha Graham and Jose Limen com panies as a new modern dance establishment. These, were (and incidentally still are) the companies most readily recognized by the dance public in particular and the entire world in gen eral.

title: New Role for an Old Mine?
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP The Jersey Central Power & Light Company is conduct ing economic and feasibility studies on the prospects of converting an old iron mine here into a $300million underground powergenerat ing plant.

title: SHOP TALK
description: JERSEY CITYThe trouble with growing little potted plants successfully is that you eventually turn to bigger and better plants, like the trees and bonsai available at Art Florist.

title: Witnesses Tell of Horror In New Burundi Slaughter
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, June 16More than 20,000 members of the Hutu tribe of the tiny Central African nation of Burundi who have fled to Tanzania in the last month are painting a grim picture of slaughter taking place in the southern part of Burundi.

title: Noreen Nugent Bride Of Timothy L. Baker
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., June 16Miss Noreen Elaine Nu gent and Lieut. (jg.) Timothy Louis Baker, U.S.N., were married here this morning in St. Peter Celestine Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. George Sharkey, who also celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: Prices Go Back Into The Freezer
description: WASHINGTON  The major prob lems bedeviling President Richard M. Nixon have the torturing quality of persistence: the Vietnam war, the Wa tergate affair and inflation seem to go on forever, and now the President is facing them with a badly weakened White House staff. Last week, he took unilateral action in the only place he could: He announced another dramatic and unexpected move in economic policy. By his own admission, he took the first step into Phase 4 with dis taste.

title: Sylvia Talmage, Frank A. Kissel Wed in Jersey
description: GLADSTONE, N. J., June 16  Miss Sylvia Bill Tal mage, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Prentice Talmage Jr., was married here this after noon to Frank Ashburn Kis sel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter F. F. Kissel of Indian Creek Island, Miami Beach. The ceremony was performed in St. Luke's Episcopal Church by Canon John A. Morrow.

title: A.C.L.U. Challenges Arrest in the State House
description: TRENTON  According to the state chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union, the incident marked the first time that anyone had ever been arrested in New Jersey because of his objections to being under surveillance.

title: ROY F. WRIGLEY
description: DUNEDIN, Fla., June 16 Roy F. Wrigley, former corpo ration lawyer and professor at the Brooklyn Law School, died here Tuesday in a nursing home. He was 81 years old.

title: Chess: Gligoric Examines Theory Of Risking All for Victory
description: LENINGRAD, June 16 Svetozar Gligoric, the leading Yugoslav grandmaster for more than 30 years, enlarged upon the question of stronger players going all out for the muchneeded victories against their lesser colleagues.

title: BACKWOODS, $23.80, WINS AT DELAWARE
description: STANTON, Del., June 16 (AP) Mrs. Henry Obre's Back woods, trying the grass course for the first time, took an early lead and held it to record threelength victory over fa vored Mild Deception in to day's Batter Up Purse at Dela ware Park.

title: Senegal Theft Suspect Is Caught in Dry Lake
description: DAKAR, Senegal, June 16 (Agence FrancePresse)Two policemen in the village of Malika near here spotted a theft suspect this week and gave chase.

title: Archives Director Named
description: Carlyle R. Bennett, an archiv ist for the Federal Government, has been appointed director of the New York City Municipal Archives and Records Center, the city announced yesterday. Mr. Bennett has been director of the Federal Archives and Records Center of the National Archives and Records Service in New York since 1953, super vising its accession and dis posal branch.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: I read with interest the rebuttal to the article en titled I.B.M.'s Methods, which was printed June 3 [Letters, June 10].

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The securities markets didn't think much of President Nixon's newest plan to stop prices from rising so fast. Stocks and bonds slid lower last Thursday and Friday as investors bemoaned the lack of progress in fighting inflation.

title: Pamela Davis, Terry Schmidt Have Nuptials
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., June 16Faunce Memorial Union Church at Long Pond here was the setting at noon today for the marriage of Miss Pam ela G. Davis, daughter of Samuel R. Davis of Katonah, N.Y., and the late Mrs. Davis, to Terry Paul Schmidt. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. E. Paul Schmidt of Grand Junc tion, Colo.

title: Future Social Events
description: How To Go Sulky And Love It

title: Miss Katzenberg Is Wed
description: Miss Gene Katzenberg was married here last evening to Joseph Contorno. Family Court Judge Nanette Dem bitz performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. E. Walter Katzenberg, par ents of the bride. The bride groom is the son of Mrs. Saverio Contorno of New York and the late Mr. Con torno. Miss Nina Stern and Andrew Petty attended the couple.

title: NICKLAUS TO PLAY AT WESTCHESTER
description: Jack Nicklaus, the winner last year, has confirmed plans to participate in the $250,000 Westchester Classic, Aug. 2 to 5 in Harrison, N. Y., His accep tance was announced by Donald Whamond of Rye, N. Y., the contestants chairman of this event which benefits Westches ter County hospitals.

title: Experiment in Pleasant Learning
description: TRENTONAlthough Sat urday is normally a day of idleness or playing in the streets for many innercity youngsters, nearly 300 stu dents have been taking ad vantage of a special Satur day School that was established for them at the Trenton State College cam pus in nearby Ewing Town ship.

title: Leslie Hopkins Is Wed
description: WASHINGTON, Conn., June 16The marriage of Miss Leslie Hopkins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. Hop kins of New Preston, New York and Warwick, R.I., to David John D'Alessio, son of Mr. and Mrs. John D'Alessio of Rumford, R.I., took place here this afternoon in St. John's Episcopal Church. The Rev. George Cooper of New Milford, performed the cere mony. The bride's father is president of PEPI (Phillips Electronic and Pharmaceuti cals, Inc.).

title: CORkECTION
description: It was erroneously report ed in The New York Times on June 3 that the only un defeated Yale athletic team this year was the women's tennis team. Actually, this team won eight matches and then lost one to Princeton. The freshman (men's) soc cer team was Yale's only undefeated team this year.

title: Chinatown Residents Here Seek Unified Approach to Problems
description: About 250 city officials and residents of Chinatown met yesterday to begin what they hope will be a communitywide discussion of looming prob lems in the area precipitated by vast increases in Chinese immigration in recent years.

title: KLECATSKY WINS 3 ROWING EVENTS
description: The New York Athletic Club easily captured the Van Twisk Trophy yesterday in the 105th annual New York Athletic Club open regatta. The races were contested on the Orchard Beach lagoon against strong winds and in choppy water.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1PHILIP HAYS

title: Coop Swaps Georgia Plot for Its Own
description: The cooperative corpora tion that owns the apartment building at 25 Sutton Place South has acquired the land under its building by buying about 500 acres of undevel oped land in Fulton County, Ga., and trading it.

title: Cawley Finds Department Closing Ranks Behind Him
description: Police Commissioner Donald F. Cawley says that he finds a shift of attitude within the ranks of the Police Department and that peer pressure is now working against the guy who's not doing his job properly.

title: Klein Receives Bigger Budget
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. L  It was the largest and most ambitious program of expen ditures, construction and ac quisitions in the history of Sufffolk County when County Executive John V. N. Klein presented it as his threeyear capital program last month.

title: Headliners
description: Campus radicals often have charged that the Central Intelligence Agency was behind the Foundation X which donated $35million to endow Princeton's Woodrow Wilson School for Public and International Affairs. But last week it was revealed, reluc tantly, that the donors were Mr. and Mrs. Charles S. Robertson, of Lloyd Harbor, L.I. Said a son:

title: Carol A. Clare Wed in Jersey
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., June 16 Miss Carol Anne Clare, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Ross Clare of West field and Lost Tree Village, Fla., was married here this afternoon to Steven Lathrop Brown, son of Mr. and Mrs. Russel W. Brown, also of Westfield. The Rev. Thomas B. Meaney performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. John Flanagan, in St. Helen's Roman Catholic Church.

title: A Pastoral Life Resists Change Only 32 Miles From Manhattan
description: NEW CITY, N. Y.It seems that re ports of the impending death by bull dozer of a certain artists colony in this Rockland County community have been greatly exaggerated.

title: ALSO OPENING
description: BLUME IN LOVEA film di rected and written by Paul Mazursky and starring George Segal, today at Loew's Tower East.

title: 5 RECORDS BROKEN IN MASTERS TRACK
description: Phil Partridge, a 62yearold competitor representing the New York Pioneer Club, won five events and set three world I records for his age group yes terday as the Pioneer Club won the first Metropolitan Masters track championships at Ran dall's Island.

title: June Evenings
description: The long evenings of midJune are full of summer. You can smell it in the meadow where the big red clover blooms, and along the road where the honeysuckle creeps and climbs. You can smell it in the suburban street, the odor of freshcut grass, and of petunias in the floral borders. You can smell June in any country side where there is a meadow, a hayfield with freshcut alfalfa or Timothy waiting for another morning's sun to finish the curing before it is baled and stowed.

title: Bridal for Elizabeth A. Danneman
description: MOUNT KISCO, N.Y., June 16  Miss Elizabeth Anne Danneman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fred C. Danneman, was married here this after noon to Thomas Kerry Mc Carter, son of Mr. and Mrs. G. Berry McCarter. Both families are of Chappaqua.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: Although direct response advertisers spent approxi mately $2billion in print media in 1972, a majority of print media advertising peo ple do not fully understand the business of direct re sponse.

title: What rich people are doing
description: Anxious trendies, poised in their Gucci loafers and Cach arel shirts, sniffing the air for some scent of the newest wa tering hole, can relax and get back to the next issue of Women's Wear Daily. Thrifty Stephen Birmingham has merely dusted off a few old lecture tour notes. This is no vade mecum for beautiful jetsetters endlessly questing for ultimate chic, but a glancing account of what rich people are doing in places like Fort Lauderdale and Kansas City.

title: Holland Wilson, J. B. Cramp Jr. Wed in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 16In St. Luke's Episcopal Church here this afternoon Miss Holland Gordon Wilson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kendrick R. Wilson Jr., was married to John Bruce Cramp Jr., son of Mrs. Wilma E. Cramp of Washington and the late Mr. Cramp. The Rev. Robert Back performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Richard Griffing Jordan, uncle of the bride.

title: James Grant Weds Patricia Kavanagh
description: WASHINGTON, June 16Miss Patricia Kavanagh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Carroll Kavanagh, was married here this afternoon to James Douglas Grant, son of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Os borne Grant of Middletown Springs, Vt. The Rev. Wil liam C. McFadden performed the ceremony in Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church in Georgetown.

title: LINDSAY REJECTS ROMAN BID FOR AID
description: Mayor Lindsay has rejected a request from Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metro politan Transportation Author ity, to restore $100million in operating subsidies for the. Transit Authority during the fiscal year that begins July 1.Dr. Ronan told the Board of Estimate last week that without the subsidy, a rise in subway and bus fares to 60 cents would be required next Jan. 1.

title: Watergateiana
description: In case you've forgotten, today is the first anniversary of the Watergate breakin. Like everyone else, the Book Review has been following the case with all the sustained fascination of chil dren watching 20 suspenseful chapters of Flash Gordon, Watergate will no doubt have its impact in the publishing world insofar as it spawns a school of inside and outside books by involved parties and questing journalists. Already a num ber of books are rumored or firmly in the works.

title: Coxson Is Buried With Pomp And Ceremony in Pennsylvania
description: DARBY, Pa., June 16Major Benjamin Coxson, the self described entrepreneur who was murdered one month after losing the Camden mayoral race, was buried in the Mount Lawn Cemetery here yesterday.

title: Meeting on Westbury Court
description: WESTBURY, LIA solu tion to the problems beset ting an annex here of the Eastern District Federal Court will be sought at a meeting tomorrow of eight Federal judges. Both the lo cation Of the court and its procedures have long been criticized by lawyers and jurors.

title: NATO's Modest Start
description: President Nixon's Year of Europe has been such a nonstarter to date that any positive act to refurbish this country's relations with its Atlantic allies merits commendation. NATO foreign ministers took such a step in Copenhagen last week when they agreed to review their military, political and economic relations in light of an international situation vastly different from the one that gave birth to the Alliance twentyfour years ago.

title: Asparagus Fit for a Queen
description: SWEDESBORO Aspara gus farmers in southern New Jersey always knew that their product was fit for a queen. And for the last three years, Her Royal Highness, the Queen of England, has proved them exactly right.

title: Mother's Day Is Over
description: When tennis star Margaret Court accepted an unctuous bouquet of roses and a stunning defeat from Bobby Riggs (the overthehill men's champion), The Times report of the match included the following: Mrs. Court's Mother's Day began on an ominous note when her 14month old son, Danny, threw her only pair of tennis sneakers into the toilet of their hotel room.

title: Italian, and Rewarding
description: IT is not trued that the Renaissance discovered personality, the Ger man cultural historian, Oswald Spengler, maintained. What it did. was to bring persoonality up to a brilliant surface, whereby it suddenly became visible to everyone.

title: Westinghouse and Four Unions Come to Tentative Agreements
description: PITTSBURGH, June 16 (AP)  The Westinghouse Electric Corporation and Its four major unions reached a tentative agreement on a new 37month contract today, averting a strike by 68,000 Workers.

title: Music in Review
description: Freed from the tyranny of the conventional symphony concert format and the con servative subscription audi ences that demand it, Pierre Boulez and the New York Philharmonic have been able to make splendidly diverse programs for their week of Rug Concerts, and the Fri day event was a good ex ample.

title: HOLMES MUSEUM IS SOLD TO SWISS
description: LUCENS, Switzerland, June 15Sherlock Holmes has lost his Swiss home.

title: Angels Beat Dobson, 52
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., June 16The Yankees anticipated the trouble they would have with Nolan Ryan's wicked fastball tonight in the shadows that ac company a twilight game, but their defense caused even more trouble by acting as if it were in a twilight zone.

title: A new anthology of oldfashioned modern poetry
description: The Oxford anthologies of poetry are public institutions, semiofficial monuments visited by the dutiful or by those who simply like to climb about. Anyone who visited W. B. Yeats's collection of 1936, The Ox ford Book of Modern Verse, found curious Babel indeed, with the voices of Walter James Turner and Wilfrid Scawen Blunt competing most earn estly from the loftier tiers with what Yeats, in his noble, passionately rap id and frequently unlucky introduc tion, called (not altogether wrongly) T. S. Eliot's grey, cold, dry art. And from the whole one could im agine a Saul Steinberg pennant stick ing stiffly out, with a series of in creasingly large question marks leading incredulously to the margin

title: Coalitions, Chaos
description: ROMEItaly, plagued with labor militancy, runaway inflation and:. tremist violence, is having! political problems too. She is ab'cnit. to be presented with her 35th government since the fall of faSeism in 1943, and the change is coming at a time when disillusion with the ability of govern ment to rule is growing in a country which already has a reputation for political cynicism.

title: Paul Adams Marries Christina Bacalakis
description: TENAFLY, N, J., June 16In St. John's Greek Ortho dox Church here this after noon Miss Christina A. Ba calakis and Paul Frederick Adams, students at the Uni versity of Cincinnati, were married by the Rev. Socrates Tsamutalis.

title: New &Novel
description: It's an old, old storythe corruption of primitive peoples by civilization  but Hans Ruesch tells it as if it had never been told before. His theme is the last stand of the Polar Eskimos, the subject of his earlier, widelyread novel (Top of the World). In this sequel, Papik and Vivi are a pair of diehards who exemplify the incredible survival skills of their kind. They live in the midst of pain and death, but discourage crying. (They are afraid their tear ducts will freeze and burst in subzero weather.) Vivi has a successful childbirth in a freezing gale, unattended except by slavering huskies. Papik builds an entire sled rig out of things you wouldn't believe, and hunts bears with homemade spear.

title: MEXICO TO SEEK FARM LABOR PACT
description: MEXICO CITY, June 16Mexico is expected to ask theUnited States next month for new protection for Mexican na tionals who cross the border to work for American farmers.

title: Sporty MediumPriced Cars Said to Incur High Repair Bills
description: WASHINGTON, June 16A study sponsored by the auto mobile insurance industry gives low crashworthiness rank ings to sporty cars such as the Chevrolet Camaro, Ford Mus tang, Plymouth Barracuda and Ainerican Motors Javelin.

title: Stein Sees Phase 4 Tight Enough to Bar Explosion in Prices
description: WASHINGTON, June 16 The Nixon Administration will make its Phase 4 system of wage price controls tough enough, to prevent another price explosion after the 60 day freeze expires, the President's chief economic adviser says.

title: PIRATES 4HITTER BEATS REDS BY 50
description: CINCINNATI, June 16 (AP)Rennie Stennett and Willie Stargell slugged home runs and Nelson Briles pitched Pitts burgh to a 50 victory over Cincinnati today, ending a five game Pirate losing streak.

title: SPACE SCIENTISTS TO BUILD NEW CITY
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 16 The country's newest new town will be a product of the space age.

title: Victims of Federal Cutbacks Allowed Early Retirement
description: WASHINGTON, June 16 (AP) A law authorizing voluntary retirement of Federal employes rom agencies undergoing ma jor personnel cutbacks was signed Wednesday by President Nixon.

title: A Concert for Arabs and Jews In Israel Is Gift of Milwaukean
description: MILWAUKEE, June 16Be cause of a gift by a Milwaukee philanthropist, Jews and Arabs will be able to enjoy a free outdoor concert together in Bethlehem later this month.

title: The Aristocrat of American Museums Has a Birthday
description: BORNrich and beautiful just fifty years ago, the Freer Gallery of Art in Washington is the aristocrat of American museums. Like all true pa tricians who have neither lost their money nor gone to seed, the Freer is so secure in its station that any hint of snobbism, the first symptom of decline from high places, is out of the question. But at the same time, the Freer is aware that the democratic ideal is acceptable only with in limits that one observes but does not define for the hoi polloi. It is not so much that the democratic levelling process reduces the privileges of an aristocratic position, as that the aristocrat's contribu tion to society is nullified when spread too thin. The Freer is a museum of oriental art and its avowed purpose from the outset has been the promotion of the finest ideals of beauty as seen in the civil izations of the East, and you don't do this by selling plas tic backscratchers, joss sticks, wind chimes, and those little rolled up paper flowers that glass of water but never do.

title: Jamaican Soldiers Help Police To Fight Surge of Gang Crimes
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, June 16  Soldiers have been as signed to help Jamaica's hard pressed policemen combat a wave of robberies and other crimes by gangs of gunmen. Last week 10 persons were shot, six fatally.

title: TAMERLANE WINS YONKERS FUTURITY
description: YONKERS, June 16Tamer lane, who had earned only $1,650 in his career and never before raced on a halfmile track, won the $93,242 Yonkers Futurity tonight at Yonkers Raceway. It was the first leg of the triple crown for 3yearold trotters. The other legs are the Hambletonian, on Aug. 29 at DuQuoin, III., and the Kentucky Futurity, on Oct. 5, at Lexing ton.

title: JUNGLE SOIL SAID TO LACK FERTILITY
description: In the world's great tropical jungles, appearances can be de ceptive. The vast and luxuriant vegetation is a facade, an out ward magnificence cloaking the poverty beneath.

title: A Team School Is Evaluated
description: MONTCLAIR  The Mont clair Team School, an experi mental project that started with 122 students and six teachers, is concluding its first year.

title: Gottliebs Have Child
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 9 A daughter was born May, 22 to Dr. and Mrs. David S. Gottlieb at Norwalk Hospital.

title: Bridge
description: Offenders against the basic rules of bridge hygiene, like people in need of mouthwash, often remain unenlightened by their best friends. They per sist in their unpleasant hab its, and in the process often exasperate total strangers.

title: Aaron May Be Served 715th on Silver Platter
description: Henry Aaron has worked very hard for his home runs but if some pitchers have their way, No. 715, the one that breaks Babe Ruth's ca reer mark, will be his easiest.

title: Palmer Loses PerfectGame Bid as Rangers'
description: BALTIMORE, June 16 (UPI)  Jim Palmer, coming within two outs of pitching the first perfect game in the major leagues in five years, settled for a twohitter tonight as the Bal timore Orioles beat the Texas Rangers, 91.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: State Sifts Evidence of Plot By Republicans for Votes
description: State investigators were re ported yesterday to have un covered evidence of an intricate series of printing subcontracts suspected of concealing the connection between campaign funds for Assembly Republicans and a plot to siphon off votes from Democrats last year.

title: Witch trials and ant tales; The Visionary Girls; By Marion Starkey, 176 pp. Boston: Little, Brown & Co. $5.50. (Ages 12 and Up)
description: A few years back, I was spell bound by The Devil in Massa chusetts, Marion Starkey's carefullyresearched and mas terfullywritten documentation of the Salem witch trials. So am perhaps predisposed to view with favor her recent rewriting of the material. Be that as it may, I feel certain that The Visionary Girls will need no favorable predisposition in order for it to enthrall readers.

title: El Cinema de CocaCola
description: WHAT'S so funny about a pa thetic troupe of strictlyfrom llunger entertainers trying to make it big in a sleazy South Amer lean nightclub? Plenty, according to the, crowds who throng nightly to Off Broadway'S Mercer Arts Center, where"El Grande de CocaCola opened to happy reviews last Februaryinclud ing that of Clive Barnes, who called the show outrageously silly and beauti fully done.

title: Soaring Prices Bring New Gold Rush to the West
description: CRIPPLE CREEK, Colo., June 16 Sassy and proud, she had fought the rot for years.

title: SEOUL IS SUCCEEDING ON POPULATION CURB
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 16South Korea, a heavily populated country whose econ omy has long been burdened by high birth rates, is making significant gains in population control.

title: L.I. Wedding for Miss Langmore
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., June 16Miss Elizabeth Woodhull Langmore, daughter of Mrs. William Langmore and the late Mr. Langmore, was mar ried here this afternoon to Robert Birchenough Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Birchenough of Slingerlands, N. Y.

title: Harvard Outrows Yale By 11 Lengths in Finale
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., June 16 In a regatta that may mark the end of a crewracing era, Harvard early tonight swept the river against Yale for the seventh straight year in the 108th meeting between the two Ivy League schools.

title: FRANCIS, FARUOLO REACH GOLF FINAL
description: UPPER BROOKVILLE, L. I., June 16A pair of Wheatley Hills Golf Club aces, Gene Francis, who twice won the title, and 21yearold Frank Faruolo, advanced to the fi nal round of the Long Island Golf Association amateur cham pionship today at Mill River Club. The 36hole final will be played tomorrow.

title: Olympic Trials Are Being Held in Woodside, Queens, for Athletes in Wheelchairs
description: Howard Thaxton has been involved in athletics most of his life. Until 1968, when he lost the use of his legs in an automobile accident, he was involved in baseball, basket ball and track.

title: Brooklyn Renewal Slowly Advances
description: Three major urban renewal pro gramsfanning out like the jagged pieces of a huge pie from the inter section of Atlantic and Flatbush Ave nuesare slowly changing the face of downtown Brooklyn.

title: James Polk Jr., Medical Student, Marries Priscilla L. Stevens
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., June 16Miss Priscilla Lucas Ste vens, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Byam Kerby Stevens Jr. of Kerby Hill, Jericho, was married here this afternoon to James Robert Polk Jr., son of Mr. end Mrs. Polk of Creve Coeur, Mo.

title: Nixon Agrees to Meet Australian Chief in July
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., June 16 (Reuters)President Nix on has agreed to meet the Australian Prime Minister, Gough Whitlam, when Mr. Whitlam makes a private visit to Washington late next month, a White House spokes man said today.

title: Study on Rights Under Marcos Is Asked at U.N. by ExOfficial
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 16  A former official of the Philippine Government has asked the United Nations Human Rights Commission to investigate alleged violations of human rights by the Govern ment of President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: National Guard Is Recruiting
description: The National Guard announced today a special summer re cruting program in the metro politan area. The program will be directed at men 17 to 35 years of age. Information can be obtained by writing or visit ing the Coast Guard at 80 Cen tre Street or by calling 9642100.

title: Multinationals Universal
description: The offer by the Britishowned Brown & Williamson Tobacco Corporation to buy all the common stock Gimbel Brothers, the New Yorkbased retail chainthe $200million deal to be financed through a Eurodollar loan from the London office of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Companydemonstrates that multinational invest ment is no oneway street.

title: TEA CONCERT SHIFTS FOCUS TO COMPOSER
description: The weekly West End Tea Concerts at the Esplanade Hotel changed format yester day afternoon, concentrating on a composer rather than a performer. Lee Holdridge, best known In pop circles for his work with Neil Diamond (in cluding the film score for the forthcoming Jonathan Living ston Seagull), presented five recently composed works: Fan tasy Suite for Cello and Piano, Ocean's Poem (a suite of songs to Whitman poetry), Ser enade for Oboe and Strings, Concertino for Cello and Strings and Antigone's final speech from the Sophocles play.

title: Personal Finance: Consumer Praised
description: The First National City Bank last week offered a happy vision of the con sumer. In its monthly eco nomic letter the bank said: Like Atlas holding the world up through sheer muscle power, the consumer keeps the economy aloft with his spending power.

title: Miss Shoolman Net Victor
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., June 17 Pat Shoolman of Fairport, N. Y., won the New Jersey State girls singles champion ship for the second straight year today at the Westfield Tennis Club. Miss Shoolman, 15, scored a 6.4, 61 victory in the final over Ruta Gerulaitis of Howard Beach, Queens.

title: The Normalcy Caper
description: A month ago some Watergate tele visionwatchers were talking about how awkward the hearings might be for President Nixon while Leonid Brezhnev was in Washington. No, said one, the President would somehow work things out with the Senate com mittee so that it would hold off any ,dramatic public hearings during the Brezhnev visit.

title: A Preview of Campaign
description: TRENTON, June 17Al though New Jersey's campaign for Governor has barely begun and the major candidates have yet to bear the lassitude and indifference that marks the summer political doldrums in state elections, a number of trends and stratagems already seem apparent to political leaders from both parties.

title: Hulme Takes Grand Prix Race
description: ANDERSTORP, Sweden, June 17 (UPI)Denny Hulme of New Zealand swept his McLaren past the ailing John Player spe cialLotus of Ronnie Peterson today with just one lap to go and snatched victory in the first Swedish Grand Prix.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: JAZZ Maxine., Sullivan, best known perhaps for her singing of Claude Thornhill's arrangement of Loch Lo mond back in the nineteen thirties, will be one of three in an intimate jazz show to night at 7:30 and again at 10:30 at the Astor Place The ater, 434 Lafayette Street (2544370).

title: PARTYLINE SHIFT TRIPS UP PRAYDA
description: MOSCOW, June 17The Soviet party line on the Unite States is shifting so rapid!: these days that even the au thoritative newspaper Pravda was caught off balance today.

title: HISS BOURASSA AHEAD BY STROKE
description: MONTREAL, June 17 (UPI)Jocelyne Bourassa shot a par 73 today for a onestroke lead over Mrs. Judy. Rankin after the second round of the $50, 000 La Canadienne golf cham pionship.

title: 2 Key Oil and Gas Pipelines Inaugurated in Soviet Union
description: MOSCOW, June 17The So viet press today announced the formal inauguration of two key oil and gas pipelines in Si beria in an apparent effort to bolster the offer of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party lead er, of big natural resource pro jects in talks with American businessmen this week.

title: Justice Harold Crawford, 72, Of State Supreme Court Dies
description: Harold J. Crawford, a State Supreme Court Justice since 1960, died Saturday night at Boulevard Hospital, Astoria, Queens. He was 72 years old and lived at 18230 Wexford Terrace, Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Report Tying Buffalo Concern to Crime Splits Unit
description: WASHNGTON, June 17The House Select Committee on Crime is split over accusa tions that Emprise Corporation of Buffalo, the nation's largest sportsconcessions company, is tied to organized crime.

title: RADCLIFFE IS FIRST IN WOMEN'S ROWING
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 17Radcliffe swept down the 1,000meter Schuylkill River course in 3 minutes 15.4 sec onds and won the heavyweight eightoared title today in the eighth annual national wo men's rowing championship re gatta.

title: Gregory Gilbert Gallo Marries Deborah Gille
description: TEANECK, N. J., June 17Miss Deborah Jean Gille and Gregory Gilbert Gallo, a sportswriter with United Press International in New York, were married here this afternoon.

title: Miller's Record 63 For 279 Total Wins U.S. Open Golf Title
description: OAKMONT, Pa., June 17While his peers fell back, John ny Miller took over today for the new generation in golf with a record closing round of 63 that brought him the United States Open championship by a onestroke margin.

title: Alphonse Moyse Jr., 75, Dead; Leading Contract Bridge Figure
description: Alphonse Moyse Jr., one of contract bridge's leading fig ures, died yesterday at his home, 360 East 72d Street, af ter a heart attack. He was 75 years old.

title: Handbags For Men Popular In Italy
description: ROMEA couple strolling along a street in Florence...

title: ELLIS AND SHAVERS AT GARDEN TONIGHT
description: Jimmy Ellis will earn about $25,000 tonight when he fights Earnie Shavers. But the money will be little compensation if Ellis loses because it would !probably finish him as a heavy weight contender.

description: NFW ORLEANSTraded Mike Cram]le, de. frnsive end, In Oakland tor draft choke to he named.

title: Profiles of Key Men With Brezhnev Here
description: A career pilot in Soviet airline Aeroflot and Minister of Civil Aviation since May, 1970... of Ukrainian descent... born in 1923 . During World War II, served as instructor in a civilian pilots school in Ak tyubinsk in Kazakhstan... From 1943 to 1966, rose in the hierarchy of Aeroflot, serving as an airline pilot in Ukraine and gradually assuming administrative re sponsibility in regional divi sions... After end of flying career, assigned to Ministry of Civil Aviation, first as a Deputy Minister, then Min ister... has held military rank of lieutenant general in air force since 1969.

title: Former Monetary System Called a Cause of Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, June 17The former international mone tary system was itself a major, though largely unrecognized, cause of the global inflation of recent years, a leading Euro pean monetary authority said over the weekend.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: It was round up time yesterday in Coram, L. I., for Suffolk County Patrolman Hary Bavinka, who was rou tinely patrolling a strip along the Jericho Turnpike at about 4 A.M. when he came across five cows and a bull grazing at the edge of the road.

title: Miller's Record 63 For 279 Total Wins U.S. Open Golf Title
description: OAKMONT, Pa., June 17While his peers fell back, John ny Miller took over today for the new generation in golf with', a record closing round of 63 that brought him the United States Open championship by a onestroke margin.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Phillies, at Philadelphia. (RadioWHN, 7:30 P.M.)

title: HULICK'S MOUNT WINS GRAND PRIX
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 17 Willie Wonderful, unsung if not unknown, won the Boyden In ternational Grand Prix in a tense jumpoff against Idle Dice today at the Ox Ridge Hunt Club horse show.

title: U.S. Marines Beaten In a Peking Regatta
description: PEKING, June 17 (Reu ters)  American marines competed with Canadian and Australian diplomats today at an unusual regatta in the Chi Chu Park here.

title: Roundup. Brewers Whip White Sox for 9th in Row
description: The Milwaukee Brewers are no longer a team to be laughed at., For the first time in more than a decade, Mil waukee is again caught up in pennant fever and no longer needs to live in the past glory days when Henry Aaron, Eddie Mathews and Warren Spahn were the he roes and the Milwaukee Braves were winning andbat tling for National League pennants.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ST. THOMAS, Virgin Islands, June 17 (AP)The body of Jim Counsilman Jr., son of the highly successful Indiana University swimming coach, was found at the bottom of a gully yesterday. The Virgin Islands police said he appar ently had fallen from a trail above the gully. He had been missing since last Wednesday. He was 23 years old.

title: Recently Published Books
description: After, by Robert Anderson (Ran dom House, $7.95). What hap pens to a man when his wife dies.

title: Emotional Return to Russia Buoys Chagall
description: PARIS, June 17Marc Chagall raised his arms to shoulder height and squeezed his biceps appreciatively.

title: JERSEY DRAFTING POLLUTION CURBS
description: TRENTON, June 17  New Jersey environmental officials said today the state would have ready next month a plan to reduce hydrocarbon emis sions that was more realistic than the stringent controls pro posed Friday by the Federal Government.

title: KISSINGER MEETS NIXON, THEN FLIES TO SEE BREZHNEV
description: WASHINGTON, June 17President Nixon prepared for the start of talks with Leonid II. Brezhnev tomorrow by con ferring with Henry A. Kissinger at the Florida White House to day and then sending him a thousand miles north to discuss lastminute matters with the Communist party leader at Camp David.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE DOLPHIN. By Robert Lowell. 78 pages. $6.95.

title: DIABETES GROUP PLANS FUND DRIVE
description: The recently formed National Juvenile Diabetes Foundation added eight chapters to its ranks over the weekend and prepared to start a national fundraising campaign to help conquer this littleunderstood and often devastating disease.

title: NIXON ABANDONS KEY SCHOOL GOAL
description: WASHINGTON, June 17 Faced with hostility from Con gress and the education com munity, the Nixon Administra tion has abandoned for the time being its major program for public schools and retreated on other educational fronts as well.

title: Lyons Wins French Cup
description: PARIS, June 17 (UPI)Lyons won the French Soccer Cup today by defeating Nantes, 21.

title: Jennifer Boretz Bride
description: WOODMERE, L. I., June 17Miss Jennifer Lisa Bo retz and William Mark Kahn welter, graduates of Wash ington University in St. Louis, where they also re ceived master's degrees in counseling, were married here this afternoon. Cantor David Benedict performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Boretz. Mr. and Mrs. Louis Kahnweiler of Highland Park, Ill., are the parents of the bride groom.

title: MRS. JOHN BOOKMAN
description: Mrs. Ruth Lowe Bookman, sculptor and the wife of Dr. John Bookman, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. Her age was 52 and she lived at 21 East 87th Street.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Arrives In Canada for a Visit
description: OTTAWA, June 17 (AP)Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India arrived here today for an eightday visit, her fourth to Canada and the first since she became Prime Minister.

title: BurglaryInsurance Plans Of U.S. and State Ignored
description: NEWARK, June 17New Jersey is doing less than landslide business as the first state to offer its resi dents not one but two gov ernment plans for burglary insurance.

title: Conflict on Takeover
description: Libya's Col. Muammar el Qaddafi gave the United States a sharp slap in the face last Monday with the nationaliza tion of Nelson Bunker Hunt, an American independent oil company.

title: Dibbs of U.S. Beats Meiler in Four Sets In German Net Final
description: June 17 (AP)Eddie Dibbs of Miami, who ranks 20th in the United States, won the men's singles title in the 67th German international tennis champion ships today, beating Karl Meiler of West Germany, 61, 36, 76, 63.

title: U.S. Opens Small Post in Indian Ocean
description: WASHINGTON, June 17The Navy has opened a com munications station on the small Britishheld island of Diego Garcia in the middle of the Indian Ocean to help con trol the future movement of American ships and plane! through the area.

title: Savage's Condition Is Said To Have Worsened Slightly
description: INDIANAPOLIS, June 17 (AP) David (Swede) Savage has apparently lost some ground in his fight to recover from his violent crash at the Indianapo lis 500mile race last month.

title: American League Monday, June 18, 1973
description: California 8, New York 0 (1st). New York 5, California 1 (2d). Baltimore 5, Texas 4 (16 inn.). Boston 4, Oakland 2. Detroit 6, Minnesota 0. Kansas City 6, Cleveland 3 (1st). Kansas City 6, Cleveland 2 (2d). Milwaukee 15, Chicago 5.

title: 2 WOMEN MUGGED WITHIN 6 ROCKS
description: Two suspects were arrested by a team of two police offi cers after they had allegedly mugged, robbed and injured two elderly women in broad daylight yesterday six blocks apart near Times Square.

title: Big Board Sets New Test On Candidates for Brokers
description: A new comprehensive test for registered representatives is being developed by the New York Stock Exchange in con junction with the Educational Testing Service, Inc., of Princed ton, N. J., it was made known over the weekend. The test will be given to all persons hired by member firms to handle customers orders to buy or sell securities.

title: 6 Intrepid Voyageurs Paddling Into History
description: PRAIRIE DU CHIEN, Wis., June 17Fog blurred the tree covered islands all around them and the towering bluffs to the west could barely be seen. But Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet had no doubts that the dark, rolling waters beneath their two slender birch bark canoes was the Great River.

title: Carol Herman Wed To Martin Averbuch
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., June 17 Miss Carol Anne Her man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur A. Herman of Long Beach, was married here this afternoon to Martin Averbuch, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Averbuch of Bald win. Rabbi Ephraim Kolatch performed the ceremony at the Sephardic Temple.

title: Excerpts From Addresses To College Class of 1973
description: Following are comments excerpted from addresses to members of the college class of 1973:

title: Gunga Dean
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Thomas Curtis Is Married Here To Fran Ashley
description: Miss Fran Ashley, who is studying for a master's de gree in public relations at Boston University's School of Public Communication, was married here yesterday after noon to Thomas F. Curtis, a senior at the New England School of Law in Boston.

title: Ballet: Contrasting Balanchine and Tudor Works
description: It would be difficult to imagine two more totally dif ferent ballets in the current repertory of New York City Ballet than George Balan chine's Concerto Barocco and Antony Tudor's Dim Lustre, which shared the program at the New York State Theater Saturday night.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: A New Jersey woman sug gests that somebody bop the new food critic on the head.

title: Advice on Business Offered by Sony
R. B. Greenwald Weds Sherry Axelrod
description: Miss Sherry Michele Axel rod, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert E. Axelrod of Engle wood, N. J., was married here yesterday evening to Robert Bruce Greenwald. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Joel Green wald of Fort Lee, N. J.

title: Bridge:
description: An unusual double was recorded by Metropolitan Life in the Metropolitan Commer cial Bridge League during the last season. Their teams won both the A and B divisions, while the C division title went to Otis Elevator. Com panies interested in compet ing next season should cone tact the league's president, Constant Queller (Telephone 5786346 during working hours).

title: WORLD BANK WOOS CHINA AND SOVIET
description: Special to The New York Time4

title: Black Lung Aid Plan Asked
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., June 17 (AP)  A $1 tax on each ton of coal mined in the na tion to help pay for black lung benefits has been proposed by Dr. I. E. Buff, longtime cru sader for victims of the respira tory disease. In a letter to Sen ator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, Dr, Buff said the levy could raise $650million annually.

title: DR. ABRAHAM BUNIN
description: Dr. Abraham L. Bunin, a fam ily physician in the Bronx for more than 50 years, died yes terday in Lebanon Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at 2055 Anthony Avenue, the Bronx. Dr. Bunin was a 1914 graduate of the Fordham School of Medicine.

title: Yiddish Music Fete Hails Anniversary Of Birth of Isreal
description: Yiddish songs and orchestral music resounded for more than three hours on the Mall in Cen tral Park yesterday afternoon to the approving applause of more than 20,000.

title: MRS. LILLIAN G. ARROW
description: Mrs. William G. Arrow, mother of Kenneth J. Arrow, a cowin ner in 1972 of the Nobel Prize in economics, died Saturday at her home, 749 West End Avenue. She was 74 years old.

title: New Jersey Sports,
description: Approximately 260 players representing 66 colleges and universities will participate in the 89th National Col legiate Athletic Association tennis championships starting at Princeton this morning and continuing through Satur day afternoon.

title: U. N. Is Reported to Set New Assessments
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. June 17 (AP)East and West Ger many will reportedly be asked to pay about 8 per cent of United Nations expenses when they become members.

title: Radcliffe Awards Given
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June 17 (AP)The Radcliffe College Alumnae Association gave awards yesterday to Represent ative Elizabeth Holtzman, Dem ocrat of Brooklyn; Phoebe Cutler Greene of Nashville, a teacher and former medical missionary in China, and Eleanor MacDonald, of Houston, a medical researcher.

title: U.S. and India Taking Up BlockedRupees Problem
description: NEW DELHI, June 17The United States is seeking to remove a key barrier to good relations with India by trying to settle the complex and politi cally emotional rupee prob lem, in which millions of rupees meant to pay back food loans of the nineteensixties are piling up in an American bank account here.

title: McCoy, Far From Ocean Hill, Keeps Aura of Controversy and Adds a Ph.D.
description: AMHERST, Mass.  Rhody A. McCoy's crewcut is now a short Afro, and his sideburns are flecked with white, but there is that familiar oversized pipe clenched between his teeth, and anyone who knew him during the turbulent days of the Ocean HillBrownsville school controversy in New York five years ago would rec ognize him.

title: Soviet Union's Chairman of the Board Leonid Ilyich Brezhnev
FruitPicking Growing As a Pastime Upstate
description: RED HOOK N. Y., June 15 Do it yourself fruit pick ers turned out by the thou sands this week in the mid Hudson Valley as the 1973 crop of strawberries ripened into a luscious red.

title: CORNING IS LIMITED ON FAIRTRADE RULE
description: WASHINGTON, June 17 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion announced today a deci sion limiting fair trading, a pricefixing practice that has been estimated to inflate prices on a variety of consumer goods by WAbillion a year.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Nixon prepared for the start of talks with Leonid I. Brezhnev today by con ferring with Henry A. Kissinger at the Nixon home in Key Biscayne, Fla. Mr. Kissinger then flew to Camp David, the Presidential retreat in Maryland, to discuss lastminute matters with Mr. Brezhnev, who has been staying at Camp David since his arrival on Saturday. Official welcoming ceremonies for the Soviet leader will be held at the White House this morning. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Step Taken in View of Embarrassingly Large Surplus of Trade With U.S.
description: Mitsui & Co, opened a repre sentative office in the United States more than 20 years ago. Yet the giant Japanese trading company limited its activities mostly to thattrading. Tier, the foreign ministry in To kyo commissioned Arthur DJ Little, Inc., to study Ameri can views of JapanUnited States economic relations.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Former Representative Cornelius E. Gallagher will sur render this morning to a United States marshal to begin serving a twoyear prison term for income tax evasion. The exlegislator and war hero was sentenced to jail and fined $10,000 by United States District Judge Leonard Garth Friday. Th6 judge, whom Gallagher once sought remove from the case, also fined the Bayonne Democrat $500 for contempt in filing a document in open court after Judge Garth had ordered materials in the case sealed.

title: SPACE RECORD SET BY SKYLAB'S CREW 24TH DAY IN ORBIT
description: A world space endurance record was set early today by the Skylab 1 astronauts as they went into their 25th day of liv ing and working in the nation's giant earthorbiting space sta tion.

title: Beame and Badillo Clash in TV Debate
description: Waggling documents at each other and at the pointing ca meras, the two candidates in the city's Democratic mayoral runoff criticized each other's policies and personalities yes terday during the first televi sion confrontation since they ran one, two in the initial pri mary.

title: U.S. Sets Up a Buffer Zone for Cambodia
description: HONOLULU, June 17Amer ican planes bombing Cambo dia are being kept out of a twomilewide buffer zone on the Cambodian side of the Vietnamese border, according to highranking United States military officials here. The aim is to reduce the chances of the planes violating the Vietnam truce agreement by straying over South Vietnam.

title: KISSINGER MEETS NIXON, THEN FLIES TO SEE MOM
description: WASHINGTON, June 17President Nixon prepared for the start of talks with Leonid I. Brezhnev tomorrow by con ferring with Henry A. Kissinger at the Florida White House to day and then sending him thousand miles north to discuss lastminute matters with the Communist party leader at Camp David.

title: The Fear of Secret Diplomacy
description: STARA FUZINA, YugoslaviaThere Was snow in the fields around my house until April this year, and since then the villagers have been busy mak ing up for lost time in weeding their potatoes and corn. The fields do not provide enough bread and most of these farmers have to be at work in nearby factories at six the next morn ing. They have no time for newspapers.

title: COSMOS DEFEAT OLYMPINES, 20
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., June 17The faultless goalkeeping of Jerry Suiarz, Randy Horton's best game of the season and Josef Jelinek's improved play were the main ingredients to day in the New York Cosmos 20 victory over the Montreal Olympiques at Hofstra Stadium.

title: Barker Upset in Jersey Net
description: KEARNY, N. J., June 17Thirdseeded Bob Barker of Sands Point, N. J., was upset by Randall King of Dobbs Ferry, N. Y., 6.2, 64, in secondround play in the New Jersey State men's singles championships today at the Arlington Players Club.

title: Mao, Brezhnev and Nixon
description: An old diplomatic proverb holds that a nation has no permanent friends or permanent enemies, only permanent interests. The wisdom of this aphorism is pertinent to this week's Nixon Brezhnev meeting, and it provides direct link between the scheduled ne gotiations at Camp David and those which took place there almost fourteen years ago between Dwight D. Eisen hower and Nikita S. Khrushchev.

title: Andrew Delbanco Marries Dawn Ho
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., June I7In the Memorial Church at Harvard University this morning, Miss Dawn Ho, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. WaiKam Ho of Cleveland Heights, Ohio, was married to Andrew H. Delbanco, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kurt Delbanco of Larchmont, N. Y.

title: Fanfani Is Named to Head Italy's Christian Democrats
description: ROME, June 17  Former Premier Amintore tanfani was today elected political secretary !of the Christian Democrats, Italy's dominant partk. Mr. Fan fani was chosen by the party's 120member national council.

title: Rockefeller Center Nearing Showdown On Its Land Lease
description: Rockefeller Center and Co lumbia University, which owns about half of the land on which the center is built, are heading for a showdown over renewal of the lease on the property.

title: Approval Expected Today On Westinghouse Contract
description: PITTSBURGH, June 17 (AP) Final approval was expected tomorrow on a new 37month contract worked out over the weekend between the Westing house Electric Corporation and its four major unions.

title: Car Explodes in Rome, Injuring 2 Arabs
description: ROME, June 17Two Arabs were seriously injured today when an automobile with West German license plates was wrecked by an explosion in the Piazza Barberini here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Special Committee on Co lonialism3 P.M.

title: SPACE RECORD SET BY SKYLAB'S CREW 24TH DAY IN ORBIT.
description: A world space endurance record was set early today by the Skylab 1 astronauts as they went into their 25th day of liv ing and working in the nation's giant earthorbiting space sta tion.

title: Kent State Scrutiny
description: In ordering the Justice Department to take a fresh look at the May 1970 shootings at Kent State University, Attorney General Elliot L. Richardson seems to be taking a fresh look at the Justice Department itself. His directive to subordinates to determine whether the Government's hasty exit from the case was properly founded may be a hopeful sign of a new approach.

title: Miss Wattenberg Is Bride of Banker
description: The marriage of Miss Francine Ellen Wattenberg, daughter of Mrs. Richard Marshak of New York and the late Sidney William Wat tenberg, to William Percy Klingenstein took place here last evening. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman performed the ceremony at the St. Regis Sheraton Roof. The bride groom is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Percy Klingenstein, also of New York.

title: Minisubmarine, 4 Aboard, Is Trapped 360 Feet Down
description: KEY WEST, Fla., June 17Navy divers in pressure suits, working against a deadline of noon tomorrow, began a 360 foot descent to the bottom of the Atlantic tonight to try to free a tiny research submarine trapped with her fourman crew under the cable of a scuttled destroyer.

title: Lee ChangKil Ring Victor
description: PUSAN, South Korea, June 17 (AP)  Lee ChangKil of Korea, stripped of his junior welterweight title by the Orient Boxing Federation in January, regained the crown last night with a 12round decision over Lee JungBok, also of Korea. Lee ChangKil vacated his Ori ent title a month after his knockout loss to the former world lightweight champion, Ken Buchanan of Scotland, at Madison Square Garden.

title: BARBARA RITTENBERG
description: Barbara Rittenberg, a script supervisor for motion pictures and television, died Saturday at. Beth Israel Hospital. She was 42 years old and lived at 160 West 96th Street.

title: Ingersoll Reaps Profits of Soviet Deal
description: The Ingersoll Milling Machine Company believes that it pays to do business with the Rus sians.

title: The Gothic Novel Genre Has Stylized Attributes
description: After its early blooming in 18th century England, the Gothic novel has ranged across the globe, penetrating as far as the drugstore book racks of middle America.

title: 73 Commencements, Free of Unrest, Dominated by Theme of Watergate
description: In the quietest commence ment season in years, the class of 1973 has emerged from the nation's colleges and univer sities amid exhortations to its members to become involved enough in the American sys tem to help repair it.

title: Robert Deak Marries Robin Schwartz
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., June 17  Miss Robin Lynne Schwartz and Robert LeSlie Deak were married here this afternoon by Rabbi David Greenberg. The ceremony Was performed in the shade of a 70foot pine tree that Stands in the garden at the home of the bridegroom's parents,.Mr. and Mrs. Nich olas L. Deak. Mr. and Mrs. Jerrold Michael Schwartz, the parents of the bride, held the reception at their home about a mile from the Deak's place.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Red Smith
description: John Unitas is a restaurateur in Towson, Md., who has been throwing footballs professionally since Pete Rozelle was a press agent for Pan American World Airways run ning American cigarettes and New York newspapers to Australia for the Olympic Games. Recently Unitas agreed to throw footballs for the San Diego Chargers next fall and the autumn after for a salary reported as $500,000, or $250,000 a season, Cut the figure by half, and it is still more for a 40yearold quarterback than Rozelle makes 47 as commissioner of the National Football League. Unitas also has a piece of paper employing him to perform unspecified duties for the Baltimore Colts for 10 years at $30,000 a year. This may or may not be more than Harland Svare gets for coaching the Chargers, but it is almost surely more than their em ployer, Eugene V. Klein, got when he played end for New York University.

title: Chess:
description: LENINGRAD, June 16Viktor Korchnoi, of the Soviet Union, playing Black in the 10th round, drew an English Opening with Wolf. gang Uhlmann of East Ger many to maintain the lead in the Interzonal Tournament with 7 points.

title: Kenya Study Grant Given
description: CHICAGO, June 17 (AP)Melvin Hardy, 23 years old, of Philadelphia, has received a oneyear grant to study in Ken ya, former United States Chief Justice Earl Warren told a meeting of some 150 black leaders yesterday. Mr. Hardy was one of three Americans chosen for a program intended to increase minority roles in in ternational affairs.

title: A Vegetable Garden Takes Up Half of His Front Lawn
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y.Benjamin S. Wiener finds no splendor in the grass. Grass is dumb, he muttered from his deck chair the other day. It's a lot of green, nonedible stuff that costs me money.

title: Irene Schaffel Bride Of Lawrence David
description: Miss Irene Schaffel, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Schaffel of New York and Long Beach, L. I., was mar ried here late Saturday night to. Lawrence H. David, son of Morris David of New York and the late Mrs. David. The ceremony was performed in the Grand Ballroom of the Plaza by Rabbi Louis C. Gerstein.

title: Al Vann, 73, Song Writer, Publisher of Music Journal
description: Al Vann, song writer and pub lisher of Music Journal maga zine, died yesterday at his home. 400 East 56th Street. He was 73 years old.

title: MRS. MITCHELL SAYS VIXON ALWAYSKNEW
description: WASHINGTON, Monday, June 18 (UPI)Mrs. John N. Mitchell said today that President Nixon always knew what was going on about the Watergate af fair.

title: Mrs. Meir Will Run For Premier Again; Party Split Averted
description: TEL AVIV. June 17 Pre mier Golda Meir announced to day that she would run for re election in October.

title: Brezhnev to Meet Pompidou in France After His U.S. Visit
description: PARIS, June 17Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Commun ist party leader, will stop in France to confer with Presi dent Pompidou at the end of his visit to the United States, it was announced here tonight.

title: ALLISON IS VICTOR IN NASCAR RACE
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif. June 17 (AP)Bobby Allison ended his 1973 driving famine today by winning the $90,000 Tuborg 400 stock car race at Riverside In ternational Raceway as misfor tune befell many of his leading rivals:

title: City to Ask Antitrust Study Of Nation's Oil Companies
description: Milton Musicus, Municipal Services Administrator and chairman of the Mayor's public utilities committee, announced yesterday that the city would ask the Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Com mission to investigate possible antitrust violations by the country's oil companies.

title: Patty Cake's Return Home Is a Tender Occasion of Shrieks of Maternal Joy
description: In a dramatic and intensely tender reunion, Patty Cake, the baby gorilla, has rejoined her parents at the Central Park Zoo.

title: Meat Plant Filth Found in Federal Study
description: WASHINGTON, June 17Conditions that could endange consumer health have bee found in 43 per cent of mea and poultry plants checked in a random survey by the Agri culture Department's Office of the Inspector General, accord ing to an internal report com pleted late last year but never made public.

title: Theater: On Liberation
description: A tiny, Off Broadway show, case called the Night House (at 249 West 18th Street) is playing a novel, rewarding double bill linked with a lib eration theme.

title: Fred Farr, Sculptor, Dies at 58; Known for Mythological Bronzes
description: Fred Farr, an art teacher and sculptor known for his bronzes of mythological figures, died Saturday of cancer at Trafalgar Hospital. He was 58 years old and lived in the Westbeth artist residence at 463 West Street, where he also had his studio.

title: G.M. Says Smog Device May Last for Car's Life
description: DETROIT, June 17 (AP)The General Motors Corpora tion has designed a catalytic converter for emissions control that is intended to last for the life of the car, the company's president, Edward Cole, said today.

title: Garden Resounds to Johnny Winter and Chicago
description: Johnny Winter and the Jazz rock group Chicago are com parative rarities on the New York rock scene. Chicago plays here only once a year, and Winter has not appeared in the city for several years. Madison Square Garden played host to both of them last week.

title: 26 Records Established As Wheelchair Games End
description: Julius Duval of Rochester was responsible for three of the, 26 records established in the windup of the 17th annual National Wheelchair Games yesterday at Buleva Park, JaCK son Heights, Queens.

title: 7 Soviet Jews Appeal for Worldwide Support
description: MOSCOW, June 17Seven Jewish scientists who are on a hunger strike because of Soviet refusal to let them emigrate ap pealed today for worldwide support in their attempts to leave for Israel.

title: A New National Policy
description: Heraclitus said, You never swim in the same river twice. The reason is twofold: The river has changed and you have changed.

title: Strachan Reportedly Gave Bugging Plan to Haldeman
description: WASHINGTON, June 17An attorney for Gordon C. Strachan, the former White House aide, has told the Sen ate's Watergate committee staff that his client forwarded in formation about the Watergate bugging plot to H. R. Haldeman before the operation was dis covered a year ago today, ac cording to committee lawyers.

title: Edward Ishmael Dolnick Marries Lynn I. Golden
description: LOOKOUT MOUNTAIN, Tenn., June 17Miss Lynn Iphigene Golden was married here this afternoon to Ed ward Ishmael Dolnick of Marblehead, Mass., on the lawn of the Scenic Highway home of her stepfather and mother, Mr. and Mrs. A. Wil liam Holmberg Jr.

Strachan, the former White House aide, has told the Sen ate's Watergate committee staff that his client forwarded in formation about the Watergate bugging plot to H. R. Haldeman before the operation was dis covered a year ago today, ac cording to committee lawyers.
