It even sees its great scientist (quite well played by Kirill Lavrov) as something of a dedicated monster and all of Moscow's honors as a rather paltry substitute for life. In the context of Soviet cinema week, this seems like the stirring of some real air to breathe.

title: Bank Says Poor Nations Invest Loans in Europe
description: PARIS, June 22With ample supplies of money, espe cially dollars, international banks have been lending more and more to developing countries and to the countries of Eastern Europe. However, substantial amount of the funds lent to poorer countries has flowed right back to the European markets through in vestments made by their cen tral banks to earn high rates of interest.

title: ASTRONAUTS BACK, WEAK AND WOBBLY
description: HOUSTON, June 22  The Skylab 1 astronauts, weak and wobbly and suffering some diz ziness, returned to earth today after a record 28 days aboard the nation's first orbiting space station.

title: Paris Is Clearing Away Debris Of Clash of Leftists With Police
description: PARIS, June 22 (UPI)Work men cleared wrecked cars, broken glass, teargas canisters and barricades from Parisian streets today as doctors fought to save the life of a badly burned police officer, one of 76 injured in clashes last night be tween leftist and rightist young people.

title: Excerpts From Kissinger Briefing on U.S.Soviet Plan to Avert Nuclear Clash
description: Following are excerpts from a news briefing in Washington yesterday by Henry A. Kissinger as re corded by The New York Times through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: Harp Devotees Pay Homage to Storied Instrument
description: MONTCLAIR, June 22Hom age is being paid here in a five day meeting of performers, teachers, students and lovers of the ancient stringed instru ment, the harp.

title: U.S. Ban Lifted on G. E. Plan
description: PARIS, June 22The White House, reversing the thrust of an earlier ban, has ruled that the General Electric Company may collaborate on the produc tion of a new jet engine sys tem in partnership with a ma jor French company, according to sources here.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE, THEN FALL BACK
description: The stock market advance sharply in the first half hot of trading yesterday and the steadily simmered down to fin ish with a modest gain.

title: Crisis Center Studied in Coed Slaying
description: GREENVALE, L. I., June 22 The Nassau County chief of detectives, Edward F. Curran, said today that the most active focus of the investiga tion into the murder of Patricia Sullivan, a C. W. Post College junior, was the college's crisis center, where the 21yearold student worked as a volunteer counselor.

title: Pompidou and Brandt Emphasize Unity
description: BONN, West Germany, June 22 (UPI)West German and French leaders agreed today that the European community must retain its identity in rela tionships with both the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: One Abortion to Four Births
description: HONOLULU, June 22 (AP)A ratio of the abortion to every four live births in Hawaii has been reported in a Univer sity of Hawaii study. About 13,000 abortions have been per formed in the state since the Hawaii Legislature legalized abortion in March 1970, accord ing to the report issued yester day by the Haiwaii Pregnancy, Birth Control and Abortion Study Team.

title: Dave Anderson
description: When he was in the first grade, Marty Howe returned I rum school one day and approached his father.

title: PROGRESS IS SEEN ON SOVIET CREDIT
description: PARIS, June 22The first credit the Soviet Union has sought to raise through a syndi cate of international banks ap parently will be granted, but in an amount much less and at an interest rate much higher than Moscow had sought.

title: WHITE HOUSE LISTS QUESTIONS FOR DEAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The White House has submitted to the Senate Watergate committee a list of questions it wants put to John W. Dean 3d, according to committee staff members.

title: 78 Boycott Wimbledon; Nastase Seeded No.
description: LONDON, June 22Ilie Na stase meets Roger Taylor to morrow in the final of the Queen's Club tourney and these are two of the more recogniz able names left in the watered down Wimbledon that opens Monday.

title: McCord Says He Alerted C.I.A. To Scapegoat Plan in BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, June 22James W. McCord Jr., one of the convicted Watergate con spirators, said today that he had alerted the director of Central

title: U.N. Admission of 2 Germanys Approved by Security Council
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 22The Security Council recommended today by unani mous agreement that the two Germanys be admitted as the 133d and 134th members of the United Nations.

title: Border Service Accused Of Discriminatory Policy
description: LOS ANGELES, June 22 (AP3 The American Civil Liberties Union filed suit today against the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service, al leging discrimination against MexicanAmericans.

title: Business Briefs
description: A 7 per cent prime rate became general as virtually all the major banks that had not done so earlier this week moved up by  point yesterday.

title: B.O A.C. Posts a Profit For Its Atlantic Routes
description: The British Overseas Air ways Corporation reported in London yesterday net profit of just under 200,000 ($514, 000) for the year ended March 31 on its Atlantic routes to the United States and Cana da, The company had earlier. estimated a loss of 12m1l lion ($30.8million) on the routes.

title: Radio
description: 6.6:55 A.M., WNYCFM. Perfect Fool Ballet Music, Hoist; Cello Concerto No. 1, Shostakovich; Hungarian Sketches, Bartok.

title: DOLLAR IN EUROPE CONTINUES TO SLIP
description: LONDON, June 22 CAP)The United States dollar ,dropped to a record low against the West German mark in Frankfurt today and weak ened in other European centers.

title: E. LE ROY FINCH, 84, AUDITOR, IS DEAD
description: CENTERPORT, L. I., June 22 E. Le Roy Finch, editorial auditor of The New York Times from 1919 until his retirement in 1955, died today at Hunting. ton Hospital. His age was 84, and he lived here.

title: TV Review
description: Armchairsportsmen these hotweather weeks would do well to catch a diverting series called The American Adventure. The latest half hour segment of this syndi cated program of 13 units, titled Underwater, goes on tonight at 8 over WNEW Channel 5.

title: Apollos Lose in Soccer
description: ATLANTA, June 22 (AP) Francisco Gomez and Saban Romanovic scored one goal apiece and assisted on another tonight in leading Vera Cruz of Mexico to a 30 triumph over the Atlanta Apollos in a North American Soccer League international match.

title: Some Stores Here Raise Food Prices Higher Than Ceiling
description: Some food markets in New York, northern New Jersey and Connecticut have raised the prices of a substantial num ber of food items above their ceilings  the highest levels at which the items were sold during the week of June 1 to 8  it was found yesterday in a study by The New York Times of state retailprice re ports.

title: Weightlifter Is Strangled As Bar Falls Across Neck
description: SOUTH CHARLESTON, W. Va., June 22 (UPI)Douglas Forth, 32 years old, a local weightlifter, was benchpress ing 380 pounds in his basement weight room last night when his strength gave out on him.

title: Salesman for Soviet Nikolai Semyonovich Patolichev
description: MOSCOW, June 22When Nikita S. Khrushchev toured the United States in Septem ber, 1959, he left his Foreign Trade Minister at home.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LONDON, June 22 (Reuters)New Zealand's captain, Bev Congdon, scored 100 runs today and left his team strongly placed at 200 for three wickets in reply to Eng land's firstinnings total of 253 on the second day of the second cricket test at Lord's. Congdon and Brian Hastings put on a thirdwicket stand of 190 after New Zealand had lost its openers, Glenn Turner and John Parker, with only 10 runs on the board.

title: Pipeline Funds Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)The House Appropriations Committee recommended today that $7.4million earmarked for supervision of transAlaska oil pipeline construction be cut from the budget for the fiscal year 1974. The committee said it was denying the funds with out prejudice because Con gress had not yet passed legis lation clearing the way for pri vate construction of the $3.5. billion pipeline.

title: Fezler Posts 65 for 132 and 4Shot Lead
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 22 Until he came here this week, Forrest Fezler's only view of the Firestone Country Club had been on television. But he scored a fiveunderpar 65 here today, only one above the course record, to tie the 36hole tournament mark of 132 and gain a fourstroke lead in the $160,000 American Golf Clas sic.

title: KEY TO THE MINT 2LENGTH WINNER
description: Key to the Mint showed his excellent racing qualities to a rainyday crowd of 15,307 at Aqueduct yesterday. The Rokeby Stable's colt competed in a 1 18mile event against three others, and he scampered to a twolength success over Rule by Reason.

title: JOSEF ZIMANICH
description: Josef Zimanich, who was ac tive in the recording business and also helped develop com munity singing in film houses during the silentmovie era, died June 11 at the Motion Picture Country House Hospital in Los Angeles, it was learned here yesterday. His age was 84.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev signed an agreement to try to avert con frontations that could lead the United States and the Soviet Union into a nuclear war either with each other or with any other country. The accord, negotiated in secret for more than a year, was disclosed yesterday morning, shortly before Mr. Nixon and Mr. Brezhnev signed the document. [Page 1, Cnlumn 8]

title: Peter Klemm Weds Miss Joan M. Levy
description: Miss Joan M. Levy, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Levy of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married in Brooklyn at noon yesterday to Peter Klemm, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fritz Klemm of Dayton, Ohio. Sur rogate Nathan R. Sobel of Kings County performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: List of U.S. Businessmen Invited to Brezhnev Talk
description: WASHINGTON, June 22The following is the list United States businessmen invited to this morning's meeting with Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Football Transactions
description: ATLANTASigned Rickey Lake, Georgia fullbackIinebacker, free agent.

title: DeLury Says Any Pension Cuts Would Prompt Wage Demands
description: Leaders of publicemploye la bor unions warned yesterday that any reductions in pension benefits would result in greater wageand fringebenefit de mands at the bargaining table.

title: 23 Die in Argentine Bus
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 22 (UPI)  A bus skidded off a road and plunged into a river near here today, killing 23 of the 28 passengers, the police reported.

title: Dean Witter Posts Sharp Drop in Net For Fiscal Quarter
description: Dean Witter & Co., one of the nation's major securities firms, reported yesterday a steep decline in earnings for the three months ended May 31.

title: Device Freezes a TV Picture for Viewing at Leisure
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Television viewers will be able some day to press a button and freeze for later study a single picture from a program being broadcast. Denis P. Dorsey, a member of the technical staff at RCA Laborato ries, Princeton, N. J., was grant ed Patent 3,740,465 this week for the imagestoring appa ratus. The RCA Corporation, which expects eventually to incorporate the equipment in home television sets, has made prototype consoles with two screens, one for the program and the other to show the single picture.

title: Housewives Planning Retail Boycott in U.S.
description: LOS ANGELES, June 22 (AP)Organizers of the na tional meat boycott an nounced today plans for oneday nationwide boycott of all retail markets, shop ping centers and gasoline stations.

title: Amtrak Scores Penn Central's Reports
SHOP TALK
description: Twentyfive dollars for an old tire that's been recycled, isn't even meant as a spare anymore and in fact has been ripped open?

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:
Mets Win, 54, to Stop Slide
description: PITTSBURGH, June 22One big scoring outburst in the sec ond inning that produced all their runs plus a rare route going pitching effort by George Stone enabled the New York Mets to end tonight their los ing streak at four games.

title: Experts Agree Prosecutions Will Rise, But Differ on the Overall Impact
description: The Supreme Court's new antiobscenity rulings provoked massive confusion and contra diction yesterday, with lawyers and prosecutors agreeing on only one thing: Prosecution of pornographers will increase.

title: New Formula for Records
description: The Richardson Company said yesterday that it had developed a new plastic formula for the injection molding of phono graph recordings. The company said that the new plastic, called R600, effectively doubled the life of such recordings.

title: Festival Highlights: Wheres and Whens
description: The musicians and singers who will be heard during the 10 days of the Newport Jazz Festival in New York, cover the full spectrum of jazz from its earliest days to contemporary experi mentation.

title: Tickets Available For Some Events; Listing of Phones
description: If you had hoped to see the reunion of the original Benny Goodman Quartet at Carnegie Hall next Friday, you're out of luck. The event is sold out.

title: YANKEES, SUBWAY AND CITY TRAFFIC TURNBACK TIGERS
description: New York was no summer festival to the Detroit Tigers last night.

title: INCREASE PREDICTED IN COTTON DEMAND
description: Demand for cotton is ex pected to continue strong in the immediate future even though the longrange prospects for the fiber are bearish, according to Eugene M. Grummer, chairman to the New York Cotton Ex change.

title: Miss Brohard Is Bride
description: CORNWALLONHUDSON, N. Y., June 22Miss Char lotte Clark Brohard, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas W. Brohard Jr., was married here this afternoon to Capt. David Lee McGinnis, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Glen F. McGinnis. The Rev. Richard Mills performed the cere mony in the Cornwall Pres byterian Church.

title: JAMES H. NOONAN
description: NEWTON, Mass., June 22 (AP)James H. Noonan, who retired in 1961 as assistant managing editor of The Boston Record American, died yester day. He was 78 years old.

title: Ethics for Superpowers
description: Presumably Leonid I. Brezhnev and Richard M. Nixon did not approach their summit meeting worried that either was of a mind to declare nuclear war. Yester day's solemn agreement for mutual forbearance on this score, like the agreed principles for arms control the day before, does not solve any immediate problems, nor is it really addressed to any specific issues. But diplo matic instruments such as these are not necessarily meaningless just because in themselves they don't change anything.

title: JUDGE BANS ARTIST; SALANT IN PROTEST
description: Richard S. Salant, president of C.B.S. News, yesterday pro tested United States District Judge Winston Arnow's deci sion to keep an artist from sketching activity in court dur ing the conspiracy trial of eight antiwar protesters.

title: Pentagon Shifts 35 Men From Ceremonial Guard
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) Thirtyfive members of the Naval Ceremonial Guard, in cluding 13 men who took part in Monday's White House cer emony welcoming Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, have been transferred because of alleged marijuana use, Pentagon spokesman said today.

title: Blackout in Queens Area
description: A 35minute blackout last night that the Consolidated Ed ison Company said was caused by trouble in a small aerial wire hit a foursquare block area of Flushing, Queens, be ginning at 9:25 P.M., and af fecting 900 consumers. Current was restored at 10 P.M. The affected area was from 136th Street to Main Street and from the Long Island Expressway to 59th Avenue.

title: Brother Held for Murder In Apparent Mercy Killing
description: NEPTUNE, N,J., June 22A young man was charged today with slaying his older brother, who had reportedly begged to be killed after having been paralyzed in an accident.

title: Kennedy Wants Rent Curb
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, said today he would propose adding a rent freeze to the 60 day price freeze now in effect. He said the proposal would be offered as an amendment to a bill that would extend the debt limit.

title: Horsemen Debate Artificial Breeding
description: Semen from famous race horses such as Secretariat could be frozen and used after their deaths to improve the breed, a leading New York breeder acknowledged yesterday.

title: Opening Day for Recreation Area
description: CLINTON, June 22The Spruce Run Recreation Area, a $5.3million, 115 acre recreational facility, is scheduled to be opened officially tomorrow by the State Department of Environmental Protection.

title: Experts Agree Prosecutions Will Rise, But Differ on the Overall Impact
description: The Supreme Court's new antiobscenity rulings provoked massive confusion and contra diction yesterday, with lawyers and prosecutors agreeing on only one thing: Prosecution of pornographers will increase.

title: Last Scott Crew Member On Antarctic Voyage Dies
description: SHEERNESS, England, June 22 (Reuters)  Edward Mc Kenzie, last surviving crew member of the ship that took Capt. Robert Scott on his final, illfated exploration of the Ant arctic, died in the nearby vil age of Minster today. He was 85 years old.

title: Team Tennis League Set For 16City Competition
description: Brimming with optimism, the former owner of the Har lem Globetrotters announced yesterday the formation of the first professional team tennis league, 16 teams that will begin play next May.

title: Secret Lists of Early Donors to Nixon on Way to Prosecutors
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Secret lists of early contribu tors to President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign have been sent to the Senate Watergate committee and are on their way to the special Watergate prosecution force and. the United States Attorney's office in New York, which is investi gating the contributions made by Robert L. Vesco, the fi nancier.

title: Hudson Bay Mining Makes Bid For Western Decalta Petroleum
description: The Hudson Bay Mining & Smelting Company, Ltd., a lead ing Canadian metal producer, announced yesterday plans to purchase control of Western Decalta Petroleum, Ltd., Can ada, for $30million. The pro posed threeway transaction in volves the AngloAmerican Cor poration of Canada, Ltd., and Charter Consoli dated, Ltd. Hudson Bay would emerge with a 37.8 per cent equity inter est in, plus $5 million in convertible deben tures of Western Decalta Petro leum, Ltd., Calgary.

title: Hockey Transactions
description: PHILADELPHIASigned Bernie Parent, goalie, to multiyear contract.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HELLO, COLUMBUS Peter Caesar Alberti, the Venetian, the first Italian to settle in our town, in 1635, founded the first tobacco plantation in the East, in Brooklyn, in 1642. Paolo Busti was a founder of the city of Buf falo. Charles J. Bonaparte was a founder of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: SULLIVAN ASSAILS U.S. PLAN ON AUTOS
description: JERSEY CITY, June 22With the statement that we will not recommend that vehicular traffic be reduced by two thirds, the state's Environ mental Protection Commis sioner, Richard J. Sullivan, set the stage today for a major clash with the Federal Govern ment over the state's airpol lution controls.

title: U.S. Clarifies Its Policy on Canadian Oil
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Government announced today a clarified policy for crudeoil imports from Canada, designed to provide Ottawa with guidelines for allocating Canadian oil to United States customers and to prevent Amer ican orders from swamping Canada's supplies.

title: Woman Who Joined the Marines
description: WASHINGTON  Ruth Johnson has been a staff sergeant in the Marine Corps for about a month now, and she still can't tell the differ ence between a lieutenant and a private first class.

title: IRVING BROUDE DIES; MUSIC PUBLISHER, 63
description: Irving Broude, music pub lisher, died last night in his sleep at his home in the River dale section of the Bronx. He was 63 years old.

title: TALK BY BREZHNEV
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Leonid I. Brezhnev delivered a 90minute discourse to some of the most powerful business men of American capitalism to day, telling them that the cold war is over and that expanded trade relations will be a boon to both countries.

title: Chess: Korchnoi Takes Pawn, Game And Keeps Interzonal Lead
description: LENINGRAD, June 21 Viktor Korchnoi retained first place in the Interzonal Tournament here in the Dzerjinsky Palace of Culture by taking a pawn to defeat Ivan Radulov (Black) in a 36 move Queens Gambit Ac cepted in Round 13. The Leningrad grandmaster now has 10 points.

title: Workers on Welfare
description: The Supreme Court decision affirming New York State's right to order ablebodied relief recipients either to take jobs or get off the rolls changes nothing funda mentalleast of all the continuing scarcity of opportu nities for those on welfare to obtain either employment or job training.

title: Peron Aides Under Fire From Left Wing of Party
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 22Left wing Peronists today de nounced some of the closest aides of Juan D. PerOn in what appeared to be a rapidly grow ing split among followers of the former President and dic tator.

title: Tickets Available For Some Events; Listing of Phones
description: If you had hoped to see the reunion of the original Benny Goodman Quartet at Carnegie Hall next Friday, you're out of luck. The event is sold out.

title: Confusing Reports on Burundi Stall Action by U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 22United Nations offi cials are considering whether they should send a representa tive to the small East African country of Burundi, where mass killings have been reported. But they say a decision has been held up because, of conflicting reports about the situation.

title: Decisions Protested by Nation's Media
description: The Association of American Publishers, which represents more than 250 bookpublishing concerns, said yesterday that it would fight the effects of Thursday's Supreme Court ob scenity decisions, and it took the first steps toward forming an alliance with librarians, booksellers, magazine publish ers and moviemakers.

title: Excerpts From the Proposals for the European Security Conference Next Month
description: BONN, June 22Following, in unofficial translation from a German version, are ex cerpts from the final rec ommendations for the con ference on security and cooperation in Europe that is to begin in Helsinki, Finland, on July 3:

title: Jesse Cray Is Evicted For Not Paying Rent
description: Assemblyman Jesse Gray, who led the Harlem rent strikes in the nineteensix ties, was evicted from his apartment today for non payment of rent.

title: 3 ASTRONAUTS FIT AS MISSION ENDS
description: HOUSTON, June 22  The Skylab 1 astronauts, looking fit but a little stooped and wob bly, returned to earth today after a record 28 days aboard the nation's first orbiting space station.

title: Brezhnev Yet to Win Main Goals of Visit
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 22The genial euphoria that has enveloped the daily agree mentsigning during the visit of Leonid I. Brezhnev obscures the fact that the gregarious Soviet leader still has not clinched the deals that matter most to him. For all his quiet lobbying with members of Congress, he has no assurance yet that the Senate will pass the Adminis tration's trade bill, which proposes fa vorable tariff treat ment for Soviet imports.

title: Senate Votes Financing Bank For U.S. Agencies Borrowing
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Senate passed a bill to day to establish a Federal Fi nancing Bank to centralize borrowing activities of Federal agencies.

title: Costa Rican Court Rejects U.S. Plea to Return Vesco
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, June 22A judge here refused today a United States request that Robert L. Vesco be extradited in a fraud case connected with his secret donation of $200,000 to President Nixon's reelection campaign.

title: Notes on People
description: It needn't be blue, only O negative. Officials at Peel Memorial Hospital in Bramp ton, Ontario, are seeking 10 pints of O negative blood for storage at the hospital in the name of Queen Elizabeth II in preparation for possible emergency in connection with her visit to Canada next week. Similar donations are being sought by four other hospitals in the Toronto area.

title: Tougher Smut Laws Foreseen in City Area
description: Tougher obscenity laws and a renewed assault on allegedly pornographic films, books and publications in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut were forecast yesterday by prosecu tors, religious leaders and leg islators, who applauded the Su preme Court's new ruling on standards of obscenity.

title: For the Visitors, a Scene Right Out of the Westerns
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 22  Leonid Brezhnev finally got in some sightseeing todayby air.

title: High School Notes
description: School will end for most students next week, but many will be back in class rooms, workshops and laboratories this summer to take advantage of summer programs that range in pur pose from giving youngsters a little help toward college admissions to simply pro viding something to do.

title: Text of Accord on Avoiding Atomic War
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Following is the text of the agreement signed today by the United States and the Soviet Union with the aim of preventing nuclear warfare:

title: Mercedes Recalls Cars
description: MONTVALE, N. J, June 22 (UPI)MercedesBenz of North America said today that it was recalling 6,114 cars because of safetyrelated defects, includ ing the possibility of a partial loss of braking on some cars.

title: MRS. ALBERT D. MIZZY
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 22Mrs. Ruth Wool Mizzy, formerly of New York City, where she had been active in the Society for Ethical Culture and the League of Women Voters, died here Wednesday at the Miller Nursing Center. The widow of Albert D. Mizzy, founder of Mizzy Inc. a dentalmanufactur ing firm, she was 88 years old.

title: U.N. Admission of 2 Germanys Approved by Security Council
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 22The Security Council recommended today by unani mous agreement that the two Germanys be admitted as the 133d and 134th members of the United Nations.

title: MRS. MITCHELL SAYS HUSBAND AIDS NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (UPI)Mrs. John N. Mitchell said today that her husband would go to jail for Richard Nixon.

title: Bonus Measure Backed
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Senate approved today a oneyear extension of authority to offer enlistment bonuses up to $3,000 to certain skilled per sonnel entering the Army and Marine Corps. Bonus entitle ment was limited, in a bill deal ing with allowances for military personnel and dependents, to to those enlisting in certain skills in combat infantry, armor and artillery fields. The bill was passed as amended by the Senate Armed Services Com mittee.

title: A Tenor Sings and a Cellist Listens
description: Just about any concert Pablo Casals attends these days is likely to contain works by composers he either knew or could have known, and on Thursday night the 96yearold cellist sat in a box at Carnegie Hall bringing that rare perspec tive to Borodin, Verdi and Puccini. They, along with Haydn and Mozart, made up the second of three programs being offered here by the Festival Casals of Puerto Rico.

title: Rhodesia Hangs Three Blacks Found Guilty in Weapons Case
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 22 (Reuters)Three blacks who admitted bringing weapons into Rhodesia to kill white people were hanged in Salisbury prison today, the Government announced.

title: Franklin Stones Names Head
description: Allan R. Tessler, chairman and president of Slater Walker of America, Ltd., has been elec ted chairman and president of the Franklin Stores Corporation, which was recently acquired by Slater Walker, Six new di rectors were also elected.

title: Energy Job Reported Going to Gov. Love
description: WASHINGTON, June 22John A. Love, the threeterm Governor of Colorado, will be named Federal energy czar, according to Administration and oil industry officials.

title: SISTER ALICE HOWLAND
description: CANTERBURY, N. H., June 22 (AP)Sister Alice M. How land, one of the last five mem bers of the Canterbury Shaker religious community, died yes terday after a long illness. She was 86 years old.

title: VIDEOTAPE TRIAL HEED IN VERMONT
description: BENNINGTON, Vt., June 22 (AP)When a judge tells jury, Disregard that statement, everyone knows that they don't disregard that statement, says R. Grant Brady.

title: Some Stores Here Raise Food Prices Higher Than Ceiling
description: Some food markets in New York, northern New Jersey and Connecticut have raised the prices of a substantial num ber of food items above their ceilings  the highest levels at which the items were sold during the week of June 1 to 8  it was found yesterday in a study by The New York Times of state retailprice re ports.

title: TALK BY BREZHNEV
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Leonid I. Brezhnev delivered a 90minute discourse to some of the most powerful business men of American capitalism to day, telling them that the cold war is over and that expanded trade relations will be a boon to both countries.

title: From the BombmasterGeneral
description: Can it really be that the U.S. mail is going to raise stamp prices yet again? Indeed it can be. Yes indeed. Have you ever wondered what it would be like if the U.S. Air Force operated on the same principles as the U. S. mail?

title: ARMY CHOOSES TWO IN HELICOPTER TEST
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Army today chose the Bell Helicopter Company of Forth Worth,,Tex., and Hughes Helicopters and the Hughes Aircraft Company of Culver City, Calif., as competitors in a multimillion dollar flyoff to decide who will eventually pro duce a new superattack heli copter.

title: Stewart Mills Reid Marries Vivian Green in the Suburbs
description: P URCHASE, N. Y., June 22 Miss Vivian Green, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Green of New York, was mar ried here today to Stewart Mills Reid, son of Representa tive Ogden R. Reid, Democrat of Westchester County, and Mrs. Reid. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bridegroom's parents by the Rev. Joseph Bishop of the Rye Presbyterian Church and Rabbi Abraham J. Klausner of Temple EmanuEl in Yon kers.

title: Mandatory Exhaust Exhaust Tests Put Off 7 Months by Cahill
description: TRENTON, June 22  Gov ernor Cahill today approved a sevenmonth delay in the man datory inspection program for automobile exhaust emissions, which was scheduled to begin July 2. He said he did so to prevent the program from be coming embroiled in this year's election campaign for Governor and thus put in jeopardy of being killed out right.

title: U:S. Steel Told to Clean Up
description: CHICAGO, June 22 (AP)The Environmental Protection. Agency issued an order against the United States Steel Corpora tion today asking for complete cleanup of dust emissions from the concern's Gary Works and its Universal Atlas Cement divi sion of Gary.

title: Heart Drug May Aid Narcotics Addicts
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 22  The accidental dis covery that a drug used to treat irregular heart perform ance is also apparently useful in combating drug addiction has been reported here.

title: SENATOR SUGGESTS WIDER N.A.S.D. ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. suggested today that the National Association of Secu rities Dealers assume much greater power in regulatory ac tivities at the expense of stock exchanges.

title: Merrill Lynch Is Charged With Fraud by the S. E. C.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced yester day fraud charges by its Divi sion of Enforcement against Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., the world's largest stock brokerage house.

title: G.E. Seeking to Join Suit As Defendant for A.E.C.
description: The General Electric Com pany has filed a motion with the Unite States District Court in Washington to intervene as a defendant in the lawsuit re cently brought against the Atomic Energy Commission by Ralph Nader and the Friends of the Earth.

title: Jane Leary's Nuptials
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., June 22In St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church here this evening, Miss Jane Frances Leary, daughter of Mrs. John V. H. Leary and the late Mr. Leary, was married to Paul Michael Frank, son of Mr. and Mrs. Otto H. Frank. The Rev. Edward T. fowling per formed the ceremony and concelebrated the nuptial mass with the Rev. Timothy J. Healy, the Rev. Eugene J. O'Brien and the Rev. Law rence M. Orson.

title: Race Ruling Called Pattern for North
description: WASHINGTON, June 22A number of government officials, civil rights leaders and educa tors agreed today that the Su preme Court's ruling in a Denver desegregation case yes terday was a major decision that would probably set a pat tern for school racial litigation throughout the North.

title: Educational Post Filled
description: Dr. John Tyler Caldwell, the chancellor of North Carolina State University at Raleigh, has been elected chairman of the trustees of Educational Testing Service for 197374. He succeeds Dr. George F. Baugh man, the president of the Col lege Foundation, who just re tired from the board of the testing service after a four term.

title: The President
description: WASHINGTONSeldom in the tory of Congressional hearings the testimony of one man been anxiously awaited. John W. Dean who for almost three years was Presi dent Nixon's chief counsel, will go fore the Senate Watergate committee and on millions of television screens tomorrow. What he has to say could well decide the future of the Nixon Presidency.

title: Summer Theater Is Alive, Not Well
description: Summer theater is alive, but not too well on Long island. And while playgoers from Garden City to East Hampton will still find some hot weather diversion this year, chances are the theatrical experience will dime from nonprofessional community and college groups or from festivals offering potpourris of drama, music and dance.

title: Badillo Calls Foe's Ad Appeal to Fear Beame Says It Was Unauthorized
description: Representative Herman Ba dillo charged yesterday that Controller Abraham D. Beame was making a blatant appeal to fear in his campaign for the Democratic mayoral nomi nation in Tuesday's primary.

title: So the U.S. Wants New Housing Policies? Well, here are some opinions during this of restudy on what the policies should be
description: The time for pieinthesky housing program advocacy is over. For one thing, there is no longer a national housing constituency. Pockets of real housing want dot _the coun try but only the Northeast has a regional shortage. Most Americans are much more fearful of losing their hous ing or neighborhood ameni ties than they are hopeful of achieving significant progress through a broad, sweeping program.

title: NEW DEAN CHARGE ON NIXON AWAITED
description: WASHINGTON, June 23John W. Dean 3d will tell the Senate Watergate committee next week that President Nixon indicated to him in midMarch that he had discussed executive clemency for E. Howard Hunt Jr. with Charles W. Colson, sources close to Mr. Dean said today.

title: Photography
description: THE last time I was in Paris, which was only a few weeks ago, I saw someone straight out of a photograph by Brassai, and they current exhibition of Brassai's work at the Witkin Gallery (to Aug. 19), made me think of her. She ins an old clocharde camping out in an elegant doorway right in the heart of the aristocratic old Fauberg Saint Germain.

title: Myths and Realities of Wall Street
description: The securities industry di rectly touches the lives of virtually all Americans. Yet very few peopleincluding many in the industry itselfunderstand what really hap pens and why.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: DHJ Industries, Inc., a textile manufacturer, has leased 55,395 square feet of office space in Burlington House at 1345 Avenue of the Americas.

title: The Works and Workings of E. Howard Hunt
description: Some years ago, when we were all more innocent, I read a novel whose name and author I cannot remember. A Kennedytype liberal uncovers a plot to assassinate the President. He tries to warn the President, fails, is almost killed himself, goes underground to fight this rightwing coup.

title: Wagner Opens Course in Sailing
description: James Hudson has found a solution to a problem. He wished to continue his studies this summer at Wag ner College on Staten Island, where he is entering his sen ior year and also wanted to learn to sail. So Hudson en rolled in Wagner's newest and perhaps most unusual course, Sailing in Great Kills Harbor.

title: Susan L. McGlothlin Is Bride Of Elliott Detchon 3d in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Susan Louis McGlothlin. to Elliott R. Detchon 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Detchon Jr. of New York. The Rev. Michael Jennings performed the cere mony. He was assisted by the Rev. Craig E. Eder of St. Albans Episcopal Parish.

title: Kissinger and Kissinger
description: BELFASTAlthough Michel Jobert, who became French foreign minister this spring, is married to an American girl and has traveled extensively in the United States, his visit this coming week will afford Washington its first chance to receive him as a Cabinet member and head of France's diplo matic establishment.

title: Deborah Haines Merrick Wed On L.I. to George Truett Tate
description: LLOYD HARBOR, L. I., June 23  Miss Deborah Haines Merrick was married to George Truett Tate this afternoon by the Rev. T. Carleton Lee, rector of St. John's Episcopal Church in Cold Spring Harbor. The wed ding took place at Wayout, the home here of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Herbert DuPudy Merrick.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: At vacation areas across the country, culture has be come as much a part of the scene as motels and ham burger stands. And in some instances, the cultural festi vals are as much a lure for visitors as the natural scenic attractions.

title: BOXING GROUPS REACH AGREEMENT
description: SEATTLE, June 23 (AP) Officials of the World Boxing. Association and World Boxing Cdurioil agreed today to take steps to recognize a single champion in each division and to issue joint ratings for top contenders.

title: Is There a Doctor in the House? Yes, and His Name Is Frankenstein
description: THE day's call sheet re quirements make it sound like any other horror movie, but this one is different. For a start, it's longer. The script may be called: simply Dr. Franken stein but it's 271 pages thick and the writers names on the inside are Christopher Isher wood and Don Bachardy.

title: Taiwan Poisoner Executed
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 23, (Reuters)  A Taiwanese sailor, who killed 22 of his ship's crew by poisoning them with ammonia, was executed here today.

title: Transit Bond Issue Replaces the Bridge
description: Governor Rockefeller ap parently is hoping that his dramatic turnaround on the Long Island Sound bridge pro posal will prompt a com parable change of heart by residents and environmental groups for a renewed trans portation bond issue.

title: JERSEY POLICE SEEK 34 ON DRUG CHARGES
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 23The police continued their search today for 34 suspected drug pushers after they round ed up 43 others in a raid yes terday.

title: Suspended Chilean Paper Wins Appeal and Is Back
Miss Kinnicut Golf Victor
description: BLOOMFIELD, Conn., June 23 (AP)Lida Kinnicut cap tured the Connecticut Women's Golf Association title today at the Tumble Brook Country Club. She defeated Marcia Dolan, and 2, in the raindelayed final.

title: C.A.B. Orders Binding Reservations
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The Civil Aeronautics Board is flexing its regulatory mus cle on behalf of air travelers who make reservations by telephone and are later told at the airport ticket counter that no more space is avail able on the plane.

title: The principal hero or villain is memory
description: Readers familiar with Mavis Gal lant's essay on the Gabrielle Russier affairthe persecution and prose cution of a French schoolmistress who fell in love with one of her pupils and after painful consequences com mitted suicideknow both the sym pathetic intelligence and ironic pene tration of her judgment. The grasp of a society, the refusal to treat it as freakishly unrelated to other societies and the rest of life, is admirable throughout. A similarly ironic intel ligence presents itself on every page of her fiction, most recently embodied in the novella and short stories of her new collection. Yet, though all the stories are serious and crafted, with one distinguished exception they do not command full, responsive belief of the sort elicited by her essay.

title: Cottons that keep their cool
description: A long, hot summer's evening dress is pink and green knitted cotton with pink dots woven in. By Walter Albini for Zama Sport. $80. Cachet, Bendel's. AU sandals on this page are by Charles Jourdan.

title: Chartists Are Having No Easy Time
Federal Aid In Nassau To Be Used For Services
description: MINEOLA, L. I. Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso announced last week that the county would use its $7million Federal revenue sharing allocation for the first six months of 1973 to help maintain and expand services to the taxpayers in seven major program areas.

title: Soviet Specialists Survey Ancient City From the Air
description: MOSCOW, June 23 (UPI) Archeologists surveying from the air recently traced a de tailed plan of the streets and squares of the ancient Russian city of Bilyar, according to the Government newspaper Izves tia.

title: RUTH GIVES VIEWS ON CRIME COUNCIL
description: One week from tomorrow Henry S. Ruth Jr. will trade the Lindsay administration and New York for the Justice De partment and Washington, tak ing office as special deputy prosecutor in the investigation into the Watergate affair.

title: Indian Mob Loots Food
description: NEW DELHI, June 23 (UPI)  The police fired into the air today to disperse a hungry, stonethrowing mob that had looted food trucks at Cumbum, about 250 miles east of Madras the Press Trust of India reported.

title: ANGELS BEAT TWINS IN 11TH ON HOMER
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 23 (AP)  Mike Ep stein's tworun homer in the 11th inning today powered the California Angels to a 31 vic tory over the Minnesota Twins.

title: Saigon to Admit Tourists For 3 Days Without Visas
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 23 (AP)  Some foreign travel ers stopping over in South Vietnam will be allowed to stay in the country for up to three days without an entry visa, ac cording to a report by the offi cial Vietnam Press.

title: Idle Dice's Performance At Ox Ridge Is Mystery
description: When the most successful show jumper in the past dec ade goes through three class es and fails to score a point, is something amiss?

title: Future Dim for Atlantic City Lighthouse
description: ATLANTIC CITY  The Absecon Lighthouse, a sen tinel for the South Jersey coast, has watched over ships and seamen for more than a century.

title: Stamps
description: THE Isle of Man, fol lowing the pattern of its brethren of the Channel Islands, will begin putting out its own stamps on July 5, adding one more stampissuing area to the philatelic map of the world.

title: Crenshaw of Texas Takes N.C.A.A. Golf 3d Year in Row
description: STILLWATER, Okla., June 23 (AP)Ben Crenshaw of Texas became the first player to win three straight National Colle giate golf championships today.

title: A High School Prom That Seemed Like a Posh Society Ball
description: MANHASSET, L. I., June 23 In the years ahead, when the members of the class of 1973 run into each other and begin recalling the memor able moments of their years at Manhasset Highthe time Doug Melichar and some oth ers stole the massive school bell, the Senior takeover day when Tom Charbonneau was ambushed by a barrage of waterfilled balloons, and the Senior Beach Day when one group passed up the bus ride to the beach in favor of tap ping a keg of beer around Ronnie Maura's poolno one will need to be reminded of the 1973 Senior Frolic.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: We are shocked by Mrs. Roiphe's reckless portrayal of our personal lives in her arti cle Another American family: Struggle over two sisters (June 3). We have never met Mrs. Roiphe, yet she demonstrated neither restraint nor common decency as she dredged up intimate details of our lives, mixed up their sequence in time, and pro ceeded to blast them across the nation.

title: FUGER CARDS 70 AND LEADS BY 2 ON 202 AT AKROI
Dr. Noah Finkel to Wed Risa Rosenthal
description: GREAT NECK, L.I., June 23  Prof. and Mrs. Irving Ros enthal have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Risa Rae Rosenthal, to Dr. Noah Scott Finkel, son of Mr, and Mrs. Daniel Finkel of Englewood, N.J.

title: A FRESHAIR CAMP GEARS FOR SEASON
description: FISHKILL, N. Y. June 23Things are beginning to stir at Camp Pioneer, an isolated woodland retreat, as Tom Palmgren, its new director, and his assistants prepare for the expected arrival Thursday of 90 boys from slum areas in New York City.

title: A'S 19 HITS ROUT WHITE SOX BY 143
description: CHICAGO, June 23 (AP)Reggie Jackson and Deron Johnson drove in three runs each today to lead the Oakland A's and Jim (Catfish) Hunter to a 143 victory over the Chicago White Sox.

title: Travel Notes: Advice On Foreign Exchange
description: AMERICAN tourists are having to watch their pennies these days. Those carefreesummers when the strength of the dollar made living it up abroad relatively easy are just a memory nowand not only be cause of the revaluation of the dollar. Inflation overseas is also shrinking pocket money. So how can Americans make their dollars go farther, aside from, steering clear of threestar restau rants? One man who has a few tips is John J. Conlin, a vice president of the First National City Bank and an expert on foreign exchange.

title: HEALTH OFFICIALS SAY NIXON'S CUTS WOULD HURT POOR
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 Health officials in New York New Jersey and Connecticut warned today that President Nixon's proposed cuts in funds for health programs, estimated at $1.2billion, would curtail and terminate vital health services to the urban poor.

title: A GENETIC DISORDER, LINKED TO CIRRHOSIS
description: BOSTON, June 23 (AP)A genetic defect found in some people could he a significant factor in their susceptibility to cirrhosis of the liver if they drink alcohol, researchers re port.

title: Hugh Wilkens Levey Marries Wendy Flink
description: Miss Wendy Flink and Hugh Wilkens Levey were married here last evening by Rabbi Ronald Sobel at TavernontheGreen.

title: Pilic Case: Pros Attack at the Net
description: Even if a compromise can be reached in the latest tennis crisis involving Nikki Pilic and the AllEngland Tennis Club, the longrange impact of the action by the Association of Tennis Professionals has re shaped the power structure of the sport.

title: A bad boy, an old genie, a good dreamer; No Kiss For Mother; By Tomi Ungerer. Illustrated by the author. 40 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $5.95. (Ages 5 to 9)
description: You can tell right away, the min ute you see him glaring from the jacket: A sweetheart he isn't.

title: Mable Ferguson Wins A.A.U. 220 And 440 in Upsets
description: IRVINE, Calif., June 23 (AP) An Olympian, Mable Ferger son, swept to upset victories n the 220yard dash, the 440 rard dash and anchored the West Coast Jets to victory in he 880yard medley relay to light in the Amateur Athletic Jnion women's trackandfield championships.

title: Bergen Museum Will Add Film Section
description: PARAMUSWhat is said to be the first Department of Photography and Film to be housed in a New Jersey mu seum will be opened to the public on July 11. The mu seum is the Bergen Commu nity Museum, at Fairview and Ridgewood Avenues.

title: SOVIET PUBLISHES NEW POLICE CODE
description: MOSCOW, June 23The So viet Union, in an apparent ef fort to enhance the authority of the police in the fight against crime, has published a law codifying its rights and duties in enforcing law and order.

title: 6 U.S. Jews Leave Soviet, Charge Illegal Detention
description: MOSCOW, June 23 (UPI) Six young American Jews who said they had been illegally detained by Soviet authorities at a Moscow airport transit ho tel, left Moscow today and were flying to Istanbul en route to Israel a United States Embassy source said.

title: Wisconsin Death Trip
description: History passes over them like the angel of death: not only these people of Jackson County, Wisconsin, the occupants of this book, alive and dying in Black River Falls and en virons during the two decades around which the century turned, but also the enormous anonymous mass of men who have perished that we might be here, in our turn, to perish too.

title: Home Improvement
description: QUESTION:

title: Architecture
description: HISTORY doesn't just repeat it self, it also reverses itself, and you don't have to wait around very long to see it happen. In the 1940's the architectural textbooks celebrated the neat rows of twotofour story dwellings that had been devised during the previous two decades by the pioneers of modern ,architecture in Holland and Germany. They were hailed as experiments in the design and soci ology of housing.

title: HONG KONG A LURE TO MANY IN CHINA
description: HONG KONG, June 23From villages and communes along the South China coast the bright lights of Hong Kong can be seen as a red glow in the night sky. For many Chinese especially the young, the com bination of the distant lights and the rock music of the col ony's radio stations is an irre sistible lure.

title: J.S. Jets Raid Communists At Village Near Phnom Penh
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, June 23 (UPI)U.S. Air Force jet aircraft flew almost con tinuous raids today against Cambodian Communist force that seized the village of Dey Kraham, 12 miles south of Phnom Penh, last night.

title: Cox Conquers Dominguez In South of England Final
description: EASTBOURNE, England, June 23 (UPI)Mark Cox of Britain beat Patrice Dominguez of France, 62, 26, 6.3, for the South of England tennis title today.

title: Presidents in the Capitol?
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Howard Baker of Tennessee is not asking all those questions about the motivations of the Watergate committee witnesses out of idle curiosity. He wants to know not merely what happened, but whywhat caused men to act as they did.and what can be done to see that such circumstances never recur.

title: Soviet Official Gets A Basket of Foods From the 50 States
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP) The Soviet Union's Fdreign Trade Minister is taking home some Wisconsin cheese Florida oranges, Virginia ham and Ken tucky bourbon.

title: Dance
description: WE are all accustomed to moderndance companies having a very specific style. By this I mean, not only does the Paul Taylor company dance very differ ent choreography from the Merce Cunningham company, but it also dances it in a dis tinctly different style. Danc ers and the dance audience notice this and indeed I wonder whether at times we do not place too much emphasis on it. After all a Cunningham dancer could dance with Taylor, and both could dance with Graham, or with, for that matter, Ailey. And yet there is something indefinably called company style. It is to be reflected in such unimportant things as the way the girls do their hair, their practice dress, or Moreover it shows in the way they dance.

title: YUGOSLAVS SEEM LESS TENSE NOW
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 23The removal of a shadowy security general, Ivan Miskovic, from President Tito's Govern ment appears to be linked with a notable relaxation of the tension and uncertainty that gripped Yugoslavia during the winter.

title: Maverick of Ledger Land
description: CHICAGOUp until a few days ago, accountants wrote financial reports about prac tically everybody but them selves. Then Arthur Andep sen & Co., the big Chicago based firm that's regarded as something of a maverick in the profession, broke with tradition and issued an an nual report for the fiscal year ended March 31.

title: State Hearing on Dr. Jacobson Delayed Until Next September
description: The hearing before the New York State Board for Medicine to determine whether Dr. Max Jacobson should be allowed to continue practicing medicine has been adjourned until Sep tember.

title: 2 Stars in Hartford Golf
description: HARTFORD, June 23 (AP)Gary Player and Lee Elder have been added to the Greater Hart ford open golf tournament Labor Day weekend, officials said today.

title: Japan Looking Abroad For Help
description: TOKYOPremier Kakuei Tanaka of Japan, the head of a nation that has remained politically insular long after it became a major economic power, is preparing an undertaking that is un usual for a Japanese leader: a grand tour of foreign capitals.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: THE epochal summit meeting between Premier Brezhnev and President Nixon in Washington last week temporarily distracted the nation from its myriad political and economic problems while underscoring the supreme interest of world leaders pushing the advance of international trade.

title: Fumii of Japan Is Victor In World Title Judo Tourney
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, June 23 (AP)  Shozo Fumii, the defending middleweight champion from Japan, threw Morten Yggeseth of Norway in 13 seconds today, the second day of the World judo cham pionships that included early rounds of the middle and light middleweight categories.

title: GIEREK TROUBLED BY NEW ACCORDS
description: BERLIN, June 23The Com munist party leaders of East Germany and Poland met here for three days this week to work out programs providing for closer political and eco nomic cooperation and to pro claim a new phase of social ist friendship.

title: Revson Sets Lap Records in Qualifying For Schaefer 500Mile Auto Race July 1
description: MOUNT POCONO, Pa., June 23Peter Revson, a handsoome New York bachelor, led an as sault on speed records today when time trials opened for the July 1. Schaefer 500mile auto race.

title: 17 Indians in Truck Killed
description: NEW DELHI, June 23 (UPI)Seventeen persons were killed and 31 injured when a truck in which they were traveling skid ded and overturned at Kheri, about 250 miles south of here in Uttar Pradesh state, the Press Trust of India reported today. The news agency, quot ing a report received at the dis trict police headquarters at Allahaban, said that the truck was carrying 60 laborers, in cluding 15 children, on their way to Kheri to receive their wages.

title: ... With The Rest
description: WASHINGTON: It was almost an anticlimax last week when the Bureau of Labor Statistics announced yet an other large increase in consumer prices in May. With a new price freeze in effect and much speculation about controls in the forthcoming Phase 4, thoughts were on the present and future rather than the past.

title: Too good to be true, at least too good to be interesting
description: The Buddhist doctrine of rebirth provides the underlying structure of the first half of Yukio Mishima's tetralogy, The Sea of Fertility. In fact, the second volume, Runaway Horses, is the reincarnation of the first, Spring Snow. To the Buddhist, of course, reincarnation does not mean the continued existence of the same old soul in the new skin but rather the taking up of a previously unrelieved moral burden. And so the second book is the consequence, not the repetition, of the first.

title: Cedar Grove: A New Game in Town
description: CEDAR GROVEEarly in May, a woman resident of this sportsminded community telephoned John Maher, the Recreation Director, and asked: Do you suppose we could get enough women out to field a softball team?

title: N.Y.C. Schools
description: There were 42 items listed under New Business on the calendar of last week's public meeting of the New York City Board of Education. Item 35 was headed: Authorization to enter into contract for employ ment of Chancellor.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In a listing in this section on June 10 of those nomi nated by the Republican and Democratic parties to run for the State Senate and Assem bly in the Nov. 6 election, Paul Patti was named as one of two Republican candidates for the Assembly in Bergen County's 38th District. Ralph W. Chandless and.Charles Reid are the Republican can didates.

title: E. A. Dunn Marries Sandra MacArthur
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., June 23In St. Mary the Virgin Episcopal Church here at noon today, Miss Sandra Lea MacArthur, a 1973 graduate of Simmons College, was mar ried to Edgar Ainsworth Dunn, who graduated from Boston University in 1970 and will study at the Institute of Criminology at Cambridge University in England this fall. The Rev. Herbert G. Draesel Jr. performed the ceremony.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: Right Now: Benjamin J. Malcolm of the Department of Correction and District At torney Eugene Gold of Brook lyn are the guests, Channel 9, 9:30 A.M.

title: Addict Treatment Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP) A top Government specialist on alcoholism said this week that too many addicts of alco hol and other drugs were being treated by dehumanized pro grams which process sick peo ple like raw meat. The spe cialist, Dr. Morris E. Chafetz, director of the National Insti tute on Alcohol Abuse and Al coholism, also said that alcohol related problems had reached a state of crisis in America and some other parts of the world.

title: Good Old Modern
description: When Abby Rockefeller, Lizzie Bliss and Mary Sullivan decided in the late 1920's that New York was ripe for a museum of avantgarde art, they got right down to business. Socially sweetsmelling (Abby was the wife of John D. Jr., and mother of the Rockefeller boys) and equipped with the kind of ;money that gives clout to cultural evangelism, The Ladies, as they, were patronizingly dubbed by their male con freres, assembled a committee and set about finding a director. Thanks to Paul J. Sachs of Harvard, whom they had cleverly named a committee mem ber, they lo cated one of geniusAlfred H. Barr Jr., a young scholar who was teaching the history of art at Wellesley.

title: DEFEATS RUTGERS OARSMEN
description: The New York Athletic Club crew caught the RutgerS inter mediate eight with 600 meters to go and won by half a length yesterday in a 2,000meter race on the Orchard Beach Lagoon.

title: PRISONS DISPUTE STIRS BAY STATE
description: BOSTON, June 23Violence plagued Walpole State Prison claimed its latest victim this week: Massachusetts Correc tion Commissioner John O Boone.

title: Two Historic Churches in Princeton Becoming One Today
description: PRINCETON  This uni versity town was founded by Scottish Presbyterians in the 1680's and nurtured by Irish Protestants from Ulster in the 1700's. And today it will celebrate the merger of two of its historic churches.

title: Linda Taft Is Married
description: WESTPORT, Conn., June 23 Miss Linda Taft, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Henry Taft Jr. of Fairfax, Va., and Michael Howard Solomon, adopted son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph M. Frank fort of Hawthorne, N.Y., were married here this morn fling. The ceremony was per, formed by Judge Robert Anstett of the Probate Court at the home of the bride's uncle and aunt, Mr. and Mrs. Walter Whitman Bregman.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The doctors had given Frank Leahy only six months, to live. But that was five years ago. I'll win this fight, he said then, almost as if he could lick leukemia by sheer willpower and determination. He gave it a gallant try and kept postponing the inevitable until death hauled him down a few days aga at the age of 64.

title: A New Neighbor Is Dwarfing St. Patrick's
description: The twin Gothic spires of St. Pat rick's Cathedral will soon be reflected in the glass facade of a new 51story building, the first to be erected under the city's special Fifth Avenue zoning district regulations.

title: Art
description: BETWEEN Easter and the end of the school year, seasonal flux turns the Metropolitan Museum into an operational field given over to the logistics of getting crowds of kids into the place, deployed through the galleries, out again, and back into the same bus they arrived in with a minimum of casualties to the collec tions and the troops. Although the pur pose of these maneuvers is to provide the intellectual stimulus and spiritual inspiration for which art is famous, we all know that these elevated experiences, like so many others we hope for in life, cannot be attained if you are hun gry or need to go to the bathroom. In order to observe procedures, and also because of some letters of objec tion from readers (The children don't get anything out of it and they make it impossible for the rest of us to see anything), I tagged along one day early this month behind a group of 35 sixthgraders, which means 12year

title: Cincinnati Wins Opener, 41
description: LOS ANGELES, June 23 (AP)Fred Norman came within one out of his third straight shutout and finished with sevenhitter that gave the Cin tinnati Reds a 41 victory over Los Angeles tonight in the first game of a doubleheader and snapped the Dodgers sevengame winning streak.

title: Last Week: Brezhnev Comes ACalling
description: WASHINGTONThe thing that has been different about the summit con ference between Richard Nixon and Leonid Brezhnev has been its relaxed, if carefully staged, normality. For week, the two most powerful leaders in the world bantered and bargained, announcing minor agreements and po tentially major ones. Through it all, they behaved as if their summitry was the ordinary discourse of two nations who have in their arsenals enough nuclear power to destroy the world.

title: Air Pollution The Hidden Cost of Life On Wheels
description: The New York City metropoli tan area is in a better position to clean out the air pollution it generates than, say, Los Angeles, where the geography creates a bowl to trap the pollutants.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Physicians' publications, the most crowded and richest category in the trade press, have seen 22 new titles so far this year.

title: A Different Sound Out of Brooklyn
description: A little more than three years ago seven young men began to hone out a special type of popular soul music in a small beauty shop in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: ?? Price Violations Found
description: LOS ANGELES, June 23 (UPI) Federal revenue agents con ducting a threeday spot check of gasoline station prices in Southern California have found that of 300 stations checked, about 55 had priced their fuel from one to six cents higher than permissible under Presi dent Nixon's price freeze.

title: Brezhnev and Nixon
description: History teaches us that enmities between nations, as between individuals,. do not last forever. However fixed our likes and dislikes may seem, the tide of time and events will often bring surprising changes in the relations between nations.

title: Pharmacist Dies After Being Shot In Bronx Holdup
description: A 65yearold pharmacist died yesterday several hours after he was shot in a strug gle with two men who tried to hold up his drugstore on the Grand Concourse in the Bronx.

title: Martha Robinson Wed to A. H. Sherman
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The chapel of the American University was the setting here at noon today for the marriage of Miss Martha Vir ginia Robinson, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Myles. Elliott Robinson of Rockville, Md., to Andrew Harry Sherman. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert H. Sherman of Ar monk, N. Y.

title: DENVER EXPECTS NEW SCHOOL FIGHT
description: DENVER, June 23Another long court battle, a redrawing of school boundaries, a large scale busing program and an increasing exodus of whites from the city are being forecast here in the wake of the de cision by the United States Supreme Court Thursday on school segregation in Denver.

title: The World
description: BONN  Thirtyfive years ago, Neville Chamberlain flaw back to Lon don from Munich with peace with honor, achieved at the expense of dismembering Czechoslovakia to sat isfy the demands of Adolf Hitler. Last week, a new German leader, Willy Brandt, saw the initialing of a treaty between West Germany and the Czech Socialist Republic, whose first article declared the Munich pact of Sept. 29, 1938, void.

title: Drive for Library Opens in Teaneck
description: TEANECK A drive has begun here to commemorate the nation's bicentennial with the dedication of a new $2 million library on July 4, 1976.

title: For Minish, Mass Transit Is a Key Issue
description: ORANGEFor Representa tive Joseph G. Minish, there is really only one piece of legislation in Congress these days: his transportation fund ing bill.

title: PACE AT SARATOGA TO OTARO HANOVER
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., June 23Herve Filion drove Otaro Hanover to the third fastest pacing mile in a race over a halfmile track tonight at Saratoga Raceway and won the $25,000 Battle of Saratoga Pace.

title: SHOP TALK
description: CLIFFSIDE PARKA visit to the Marburn Stores ware house is like returning to the early days of discount retail ing. That is when merchan dise was sold right out of packing cases to customers so eager to buy that you would think they were get ting something for nothing.

title: SKYLAB 1 CREW WILL VISIT NIXON
description: HOUSTON, June 23 (AP)Skylab's astronauts were de scribed as much, much im proved today after a good night's rest, and doctors ap proved them for a visit with leaders of the world's two ma jor spacefaring nations tomor row.

title: Leonia Pondering Housing for Aged
description: LEONIAThings that are taken for granted in most communities do not exist here, and the residents of this Bergen County borough are delighted to tell visitors about them. For example, they report with some en thusiasm that there are no bars in Leonia, that it is a dry town despite an abun dance of pack ageliquor stores. They also note that there are no hospitals, no funeral homes and no cemeteries hereYou can't be born in Leonia and you can't be buried here, as one man put itand they explain that there is no local weekly newspaper, a rarity in New Jersey towns, because there is no need for one.

title: Skylab And Now To Sift The Data
description: HOUSTONSpace flight is still new enough for seemingly little things to loom important, like the way the Skylab 1 astronauts walked away unsteadily from their space craft Friday morning on the deck of the U. S. S. Ticonderoga.

title: Shostakovich If My Dreams Cease...
description: OVERPOWERING tension emanates from Dmitri Shostakovich, charg ing the atmosphere with wildly alternating currents. The 66yearold Russian musician, perhaps the world's greatest living composer, ap parently wants to be polite, patient and even sporting. But nerves override his good intentions.

title: ALEXANDER SACHS ECONOMIST, DEAD
description: Alexander Sachs, a Russian born economist and the man who first interested President Franklin D. Roosevelt in the possibilities of the atomic bomb, died yesterday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 79 years old and lived at 1200 Fifth Avenue.

title: BULLDOG CAPTURES MIDHUDSON PRIZE
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y., June 23J. Don Jones, dean of student activities at Emory University in Atlanta, changed hats today and took charge of the activi ties during the final of the Mid Hudson Kennel Club at the Dutchess County Fairgrounds. The educator selected a bull dog, Ch. Westfield Flying Col ors, owned by Charles and Vir ginia Westfield of Huntington, L. I., as best in a field of 1,547, the largest event in the club's 31year history.

title: A Bartender Joins the Battle Against Alcoholism
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I.Training to help alcoholics traditionally attracts a stu dent body from among phy sicians, teachers, psycholo gists and priests. But where could you find a more apt student than the proprietor of I J. Clarke's?

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX in May rose to 131.5 per cent of the 1967 base, up 0.06 per cent from April. Food prices rose a full percentage point from the April level... The prime rate was raised to 7% per cent by major banks. The First National City Bank announced summer reduction in rates for auto and personal loans.

title: Blacks and Hispanics Now Exceed Half of Students in Essex
description: NEWARKBlack and His panic children now account for more than half of the publicschool enrollment in Essex. County and nearly half of the Hudson County total, the state's Department of Ed ucation has disclosed.

title: In Quogue, a Satisfactorily Posh Dream House
description: QUOGUE, L. I.Until re cently, James S. Shapiro never had a home. It was not that the chairman of the board of the Simplicity Pat tern Company was exactly homeless. A Fifth Avenue apartment and Westhampton Beach and Quogue slimmer rentals provided more than ample roofs over his head.

title: Gail P. Seidman Bride Of Kenneth Fieldston
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., June ?? Miss Gail Patricia Seidman, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Miss Gail Patricia Seideman, Thomas Seideman of Hew lett, was married there this evening in Temple Israel to Kenneth Charles Fieldston, son of Dr. and Mrs. Jacob Finkelstein of Teaneck, N. J. Rabbi Joel Zion performed the ceremony. He was as sisted by Cantor David Benedict.

title: Dance: Charles Weidman
description: One of the few skills that improves throughout a danc er's career is the quality of gesture. What might have had a certain rude vigor in the artist's youth is refined to sensitive precision in ma tire years. Charles Weidman, now in his 72d year, demon strated his skill Saturday evening at Spencer Memorial Church in his version of the St: Matthew Passion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Besides its menacing economic ef fects, the present energy crisis has also a political, potentially virulent aspect: A worldwide competitive bid ding for Arabian (and Iranian) oil could lastingly envenom the relations between the regions of the industrial ized nonCommunist worldNorth America, Western Europe, Japan and Oceania.

title: BLUE RIBBON WON BY DREAMY SAN
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J. June 23Jesse Rouson, an 18. yearold graduate of Curtis High School on Staten Island, who never has owned a horse of her own, rode Lotus Farms Dreamy Sam to victory today in the open jumper time class at the Middlesex County Horse Show.

title: Picture Credits
description: 1SAMPLER DESIGN BY WOOLWORKS; NEEDLEWORK BY SARAH SCHULTE

title: Updating Of Job Laws For Minors Is Sought
description: TRENTON  With the school year ending, thousands of New Jersey teenagers will be looking for jobs this summer. For many, there will be some unusual obstacles.

title: Hope for Meat Price Cuts Fades Despite the Freeze
description: CHICAGO, June 23  Ten days after President Nixon's newest price freeze was im posed there are signs from the farms and processing plants that within a month eggs may be hard to find and that all hopes that the Nixon Admin istration had for easing meat prices this fall have been de stroyed.

title: The F.B.I. The New Man Talks Tough
description: WASHINGTONThe legendary F.B.I., with its Gmen, snapbrim fedoras and always gets its man credothe creation and creature of 3. Edgar Hooveris gone. What no one knows, and many were wondering aloud this week, is just how the shattered pieces that remain can be reassembled into the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Son Born to Mrs. Meyer
description: A son was born June 4 to Mr. and Mrs. Edward Meyer of Scarsdale, N. Y., in Doc tors Hospital. Mrs. Meyer is the former Miss Barbara Levy. The child, whose father is chief of staff to Mayor Lindsay, has been named Christopher Michael.

title: Japanese Police to Visit U.S.
description: TOKYO, June 23 (UPI)Five Japanese police officers will leave for the United States tomorrow to study methods of enforcing pollution control, The officers will visit Los Angeles to study antismog measures and New York, Houston Wash ington and other cities.

title: Dad's Footsteps Lead to Majors
description: Gary Blaylock Jr., a 21yearold first baseman select ed on the 11th round of the recent freeagent draft, has been signed to a contract by the New York Mets and as signed to their Batavia affi liate in the New YorkPenn League.

title: Mailbox
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Historic Barn in Suffolk Is Moved and Restored to Show Life as It Was
description: HUNTINGTON, L. A cow barn built the year Ben jamin Franklin died stands renovated and pristine here today only yards from rumb ling '20thcentury traffic.

title: Cincinnati Is Seeking $400,000 to Save 14 Union Terminal Murals
description: CINCINNATI, June 23 A few oldtimers here still re member Mayor Russel Wil son's accepting the gold key to Union Terminal from a railroad executive on March 31, 1933, the day this rail road terminal was dedicated.

title: Lane Gets Football Post
description: XENIA, Ohio, June 23 (AP)Dick (Night Train) Lane, a former professional football star, was appointed assistant football coach at Central State University today. Lane, who played for the Los Angeles Rams, Detroit Lions and Chi cago Cardinals, had been as sistant coach at Southern Uni versity in Louisiana.

title: Napoles Batters Menetrey and Retains Ring Title
description: GRENOBLE, France, June 23 (AP)Jose Napoles continually beat Roger Menetrey to the punch with left hooks and short, sharp rights and scored a onesided 15round decision in defense of his world welter weight championship tonight.

title: Detroit's Dilemma. Gas Hogs or Fuel Savers
description: Detroit has begun to re ceive vibrations from the only source it really listens tonewcar buyers.

title: News Summary and Index SUNDAY, JUNE 24, 1973
description: The United States and the Soviet Union announced an agreement that will increase air passenger service between the two countries. Secretary of Transportation Claude S. Brinegar and Soviet Minister of Aviation Boris P. Bugayev signed the formal protocol at the State Department. It was the ninth SovietAmerican agreement made public dur ing the current visit of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader to the United States. The air travel accord will provide what a State Department official described as a modest expansion in current air service between New York and Moscow by Pan American World Airways and Aeroflot. [Page 1, Cols. 78.]

title: HELICOPTER MAKES A FORCED LANDING
description: A helicopter owned by the HelAire Copters Limited, a sightseeing service, made a forced landing yesterday in the Harlem River near the Third Avenue Bridge between Man hattan and the Bronx. The two passengers and the pilot were uninjured and the Bell Ranger, copter, which was equipped with floats, was undamaged in the landing.

title: Sports Week
description: BASEBALL

title: France's ABomb
description: PARIS  Before the month is out, France is expected to explode its 27th atomic bomb since 1966 in the atmos phere over Mururoa atoll in the South Pacific, undeterred by the biggest fall out of indigation elsewhere since this nation became a nuclear power.

title: Miss Rhapsody Still Sings at 70
description: NEWARK  At the age of 70, Viola Wells Evans is sev eral different persons.

title: Research Rescuing A Trapped Minisub
description: KEY WEST, Fla.At 3:22 A.M. last Monday, as the Skylab 1 crew was establishing a space endurance record 270 nautical miles above the earth, a more intense drama was being played out 360 feet below the surface of the sea off the Florida Keys.

title: Article 2  No Title
Recordings
description: AGENERATION or so ago, the rarely performed early works of great composers were usu ally considered to be of in terest only to the scholarly musicologist. Well, times have changed and as we plunge deeper into this age of re vivals the layman is now in vestigating the fledgling at tempts of young genius for himself. This is particularly true in opera and recordings of composers youthful ef forts are plentiful nowadays. There are stage revivals, too, of course, but most of these operas, often flawed and un certain for all the occasional flashes of latent genius, are perhaps best studied and en joyed at leisure via the phon ograph.

title: Roads to Kennedy Face Record Jams
description: Severe road congestionpossibly the worst everis being forecast by airline and government officials for Ken nedy International Airport this summer.

title: F.T.C. Moves to Force Sale Of a Dog Food Company
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion said today that the dog food industry was threatened with domination by a handful of manufacturers, and it pro posed legal action to force one big company to sell one of its subsidiaries.

title: Janet Hall Is Wed
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., June 23  Miss Janet L. Hall, daughter of Kenneth Hall, advertising director of ITT, Community Development Cor poration, and Mrs. Hall of Garden City, was married here this afternoon to Mi chael D. MacDonald, son of Mrs. Marjorie MacDonald of Braintree, Mass., and Daniel MacDonald of Palm Beach, Fla. The ceremony was per formed in the Garden City Community Church by the Rev. James N. Gettemy, pres ident of the Hartford Sem inary. He was assisted by the Rev. Charles Collins of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic.

title: Pearl Bailey in Hospital
description: LONDON, June 23 (AP)Pearl Bailey was under observation in the intensivecare unit of a London hospital today for a re currence of the heart trouble she has lived with for eight years. The 55yearold jazz singer complained of sharp chest pains just before she was to appear at a nightclub here last night. A spokesman said she had not had a heart attack.

title: Birrell, British Driver, Dies After Crashing in France
description: ROUEN, France, June 23 (AP) Gerry Birrell of Scotland was killed today in an accident dur ing practice for a Formula Two auto race tomorrow on the RouenLesEssart Circuit in Western France.

title: Weeksville Buys Historic Houses'
description: Landmark houses of Weeksville, a longforgotten black colony in the Bedford Stuyvesant section of Brook lyn, have been purchased from the owner, thus mark ing an important advance in the campaign to restore the buildings as a museum and to preserve part of the his tory of blacks in Brooklyn.

title: Football Blows In From Canada
description: Why wait til September? the pitch goes. See American college football stars in action every Wednesday on Pro Football From Canada. It's the only football game in town during the baseball season.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Former P.O.W. Divorced
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., June 23 (UPI)  Air Force Col. Fred Cherry, a prisoner of war in North Vietnam for eight years, was granted a divorce yester day from his wife of 19 years.
