The decree, granted in Ports mouth Circuit Court, denied alimony payments to Mrs. Cherry and left unresolved the custody of the couple's two youngest children.

title: Astronauts Fixits on Earth, Too
description: HOUSTON, June 23Jane Conrad, Shirley Kerwin and Suzanne Weitz have unusual husbands. Not only can the men take a hammer, pruning shears and a parasol and fix $294million spaceship in orbit, but they can also be pretty handy when things go wrong around the house.

title: Greenwich Holds Onto Past
description: GREENWICHMost small towns in New Jersey, like small towns everywhere in America, take pride in being modern and tuned in to the future. Progress is their watchword.

title: Knights From Philadelphia Win Mixed Pairs Canoeing
description: MUOTATHAL, Switzerland, June 23 (AP)Dwight and Carol Knight of Philadelphia and Norman and Barbara Hol combe of Fairview, N. J., fin ished one, two in the Canadian mixed pairs event today at the world canoe championships.

title: SAIGON PLANNING INDUSTRIAL ZONE
description: TOKYO, June 23A major Japanese trading concern is drafting a program for the con struction of a gigantic indus trial zone in the Cam Ranh Bay area of South Vietnam.

title: 3:59.2 Mill RUN BY SCHILLING, 18
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., June 23 Mark Schilling, an 18yearold freshman at San Jose State, ran the second subfourminute mile of his career tonight in winning the event at the Na tional A.A.U. junior track and field championships at the University of Florida.

title: Sketch Made of Man Sought In Death of C. W. Post Coed
description: GREENVALE, L.I., June 23Nassau County detectives today prepared a sketch of a young man sought for questioning in the murder this week of Patricia Sullivan, a, junior at C. W. Post College here.

title: Nobel Prize Winner Joins University of Miami Faculty
description: Dr. Earl W. Sutherland Jr., the 1971 Nobel Prize winner for medicine and physiology, will join the faculty of the University of Miami School of Medicine July 1.

title: Dock Contract Proposed
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Arne 23 (UPI)  Copies of a proposed twoyear contract providing a 70centanhour pay rise, have been sent to West Coast long shoremen's locals for ratifica tion. The International Long shoremen's and Warehouse men's Union distributed the pact yesterday after the union negotiating committee recom mended ratification.

title: Admiral Hogan And Mrs. Briggs Have Nuptials
description: WIL LIAMSTOWN, Mass., June 23 Mrs. Laura Manly Briggs, widow of Walter O. (Spike) Briggs Jr., former owner of the Detroit Tigers baseball club, was married here today to Rear Adm. Bar tholomew W. Hogan, U.S.N., retired, Surgeon General of the Navy from 1955 to 1961.

title: Pakistan Moves to Curb Criticisms of the Military
description: KARACHI, Pakistan June 23 (AP)The Government plans to introduce a bill making any sort of interference and unde sirable criticism of the mili tary punishable by up to 14 years in prison, the ruling People's party has announced.

title: AUSTRALIA EASES SOME SEX TABOOS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 23A pair of highschool lovers appeared on a television talk show here recently with Ger maine Greer, the Australian born feminist and writer.

title: Price Posting Takes Effect at 11 :59 P.M.
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The Cost of Living Council issued a reminder today to the general public and busi ness enterprises that price posting requirements under the price freeze program will go into effect tomorrow at 11:59 P.M.

title: Beame Stepping Up Drive In the Runoff With Badillo
description: Once rated the strong front runner for the Democratic may oral nomination, City Controller Abraham D. Beame is running scared in the city's first runoff primary on Tuesday.

title: Audubon Courses Offered
description: The Connecticut Audubon Society will sponsor a series of weeklong and daily nature courses starting July I0. The course subjects include sea shore life, bird banding, ecol ogy, nature crafts, and wild animal pets. Fees range from $3 to $17.50. The society's head quarters are at 2325 Burr Street in Fairfield.

title: Renee P. Knapp Is Bride of Peter Collins
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., June 23Miss Renee Pindter Knapp and Peter Hooper Collins were married here this afternoon in St. Michael's Lutheran Church by the Rev. Grant Morrill, an Episcopal clergyman, who was as sisted by a Roman Catholic priest, the Rev. James Dennis.

title: Governor Signs Bill For Housing Court To Open Here Oct. 1
description: ALBANY, June 23Gover nor Rockefeller signed a bill today that will permit New York City's new Housing Court to start operation next fall, but he warned Mayor Lindsay's ad ministration that his office would keep a close check on costs.

title: Pepitone's a Hero in His Tokyo Debut Before 40,000
description: TOKYO, June 23 (AP)Joe Pepitone, the former major leaguer, made his Japanese debut today and singled home the winning run in the sixth inning as the Yakult Atoms edged the Yomiuri Giants, 21, before a sellout crowd of 40,000 at Korakuen Stadium.

title: Oil Companies Warn of Shortages for Home Heating Next Winter Despite Stocks Larger Than Last Year's
description: Oil companies are now sound ing warnings about shortages of home heating fuel next winter.

title: P.U.C. Confronting Major Issues in State's Energy Crisis
description: NEWARK  The state is confronting what the Board of Public Utility Commis sioners calls an energy crisis.

title: Wimbledon's Dropout Total Is at 82
description: LONDON, June 23Two more players pulled out of the Wimbledon tennis championships today in protest of the ban imposed by the International Lawn Tennis Federation against Nikki Pilic of Yugoslavia.

title: Miss Allen Is Bride Of F. C. Craigie Jr.
description: MERIDEN, N. H., June 23 Miss Elizabeth Tripp Allen and Frederic Charles Craigie Jr. were married here this afternoon at True Farm, the home of a family friend, Mrs. Jean Webber. The cou ple was married in a Quaker ceremony.

title: 62 Seized in Dawn Raid on Fancy Duplex Used by Prostitutes
description: The police arrested 42 men and 20 women yesterday morn ing in a lushly appointed West Side duplex allegedly used as an afterhours club by pimps and their prostitutes.

title: South Brunswick to Get New Role as Classroom
description: SOUTH BRUNSWICKBeginning next fall, high school students here will spend four days a week in class and the fifth day in community involvement and personal education de velopment in a pilot project that the Superintendent of Schools calls a culmination of attempts to define what school is.

title: Party Conventions Hear Urgent Plea To Halt Corruption
description: TRENTON  Common Cause, the nonpartisan pub licinterest lobby, has called on the Democratic and Re publican candidates for Gov ernor and the Legislature to reverse the bipartisan tradi tion of corruption in New Jersey and enact compre hensive legislation restricting the pernicious influence of money and secrecy on the political process.

title: F.B.I. Informer Is Linked To RightWing Violence
description: SAN DIEGO, June 23A lead er of a rightwing, paramilitary organization that harassed young leftists here for more than a year says that the group was partly organized and fi nanced by an informer for the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion. Law enforcement officers and others familiar with the sit uation corroborated his account.

title: Burning On, $11.40, Captures $55,300 Washington Park Handicap
description: CHICAGO, June 23 (AP)Burning On, owned and bred by Dan W. Scott 2d of Lexington, Ky., charged from far back to win the $55,300 Washington Park Handicap before 20,738 at Arlington Park today.

title: North Korea Opposes Seoul's Proposal That Both States Enter the U.N.
description: HONG KONG, June 23 (Reu ters)President Kim II Sung of North Korea today opposed the admission of two Korean states to the United Nations and suggested they join as a single federated state the North Korean news agency reported.

title: U.S. Set to Restrict State Hiring Plans
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 The Department of Labor is se to issue a directive that would prohibit strong local effort to force contractors and unions to put minorities in construction jobs, according to sources high in the department.

title: More Jobs for Veterans
description: TRENTONRecently discharged Vietnam war veterans are finding it easier to get jobs in New Jersey than a year or two ago, although the new entrants into the state's labor market are asking for better positions and better pay.

title: Neurology Chief Selected For Downstate Department
description: Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn has created a new Department of Neurology and appointed Dr. Henry S. Schutta to head it. Dr. Schutta, a 44yearold neurologist, has been an associate professor of neu rology at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medi cine.

title: Dreams Of Victory; By Ellen Conford. Illustrated by Gail Rockwell. 121 pp. Boston: Little, Brown & Co. $4.95. (Ages 9 to 13)
description: The crowd burst into cheers again, and it was a moment or two before she could go on.

title: News Summary and Index SUNDAY, JUNE 24, 1973
description: The United States and the Soviet Union announced an agreement that will increase air passenger service between the two countries. Secretary of Transportation Claude S. Brinegar and Soviet Minister of Aviation Boris P. Bugayev signed the formal protocol at the State Department. It was the ninth SovietAmerican agreement made public dur ing the current visit of Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader to the United States. The air travel accord will provide what a State Department official described as a modest expansion in current air service between New York and Moscow by Pan American World Airways and Aeroflot. [Page 1, Cols. 78.1

title: PRISONS DISPUTE STIRS BAY STATE
description: BOSTON, June 23Violence plagued Walpole State Prisoin claimed its latest victim this week: Massachusetts Correc tion Commissioner John O. Boone.

title: Will nine more states approve?; The Sexual Equality Amendment
description: The Equal Rights Amendment, a sort of civil rights bill for women, was first proposed in 1923 by the National Women's party, and over the years, it has popped up and been batted down with regularity. But by the nineteenseventies seemed to be an idea whose time had come. It won approval by a receptive, if somewhat acquiescent and trendy Congress in the spring of 1972, and quick spurt of approval by 22 states and a con sequent bandwagon effect made ratification look quite possible in 1973.

title: How to be absolved of Vietnam: a personal and national program
description: Robert Jay Lifton is a research psychiatrist at Yale who is best known as the author of Death in Life: Survivors of Hiroshima, which won the National Book Award for science in 1969. He is also one of Erik Erikson's most prolific and in telligent disciples in the muchpub licized field of psychohistory the application of psychoanalytic knowledge to the lives of great men (as Erikson has done with Luther and Gandhi) or to the study of groups of men in great historical and social stress (as Lifton has done with vic tims of Chinese brainwashing and with survivors of Hiroshima).

title: the traveler's world
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.Thomas Jefferson died full of honors and years (83) on the Fourth of July, 1826, and almost immediately early American tourists began vandal izing Monticello. By 18,33, the first pur chaser of Monticello from Jefferson's family gave up the battle with the in creasing flow of uninvited visitors, who poked through the house by themselves if no one was there to show them about.

title: Miss Holmes Wed To Louis Jones Jr.
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., June 23,In Our Lady of Mount Carmel Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Patricia Ann Holmes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Almont Holmes of Saddle River, was married to Louis Bernard Jones Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Jones of Ridgewood. The Rev. Stanley Adamczyk performed the ceremony.

title: Canucks Name Laycoe
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, June 23 (AP)The Van couver Canucks of the National Hockey League announced yes tefday that Hal Laycoe had been given a multiyear con tract as general manager. No terms were disclosed.

title: A Transplanted American Suburbia in Laos Provides Comforts for Families of U.S. Aid Mission
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, June 23 (AP)More than 125 American families in Laos live in a trans planted suburbia complete with Little League baseball Fourth of July barbecues and a big $55,000 swimming pool.

title: ASTROS TRIUMPH OVER GIANTS, 63
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 23 (AP)Jerry Reuss pitched six strong innings and belted a run scoring single, leading the Hous ton Astros to a 63 victory over the San Francisco Giants today.

title: Congress Beginning To Fight Back
description: WASHINGTONFor a time last Tuesday it looked as if the White House had proclaimed Be Kind to Congress Week.

title: Kirby Strikes Out 13
description: SAN DIEGO, June 23 (AP)Clay Kirby pitched a threehit ter and struck out 13, leading the San Diego Padres to a 20 victory over the Atlanta Braves tonight. in the first game of a doubleheader.

title: Miss Hooker Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Suzanne Butler Hook er, who is descended from President Thomas Jefferson and the Rev. Thomas Hooker, founder of Hartford, plans to be married here Sept. 13 to Ames Braga.

title: Newport in New YorkHarmony in Black and White
description: JAMES DuBOISE looked at the shiny new trumpet gleaming in its immaculate case. He gleamed right back at it. It's the first new trumpet I ever had in my life, he grinned, and I started playing more than 35 years ago, back in Pittsburgh with Art Blakey and Erroll Garner and Tommy Turrentine.

title: L.I.'s Flying Seminar on China Praised
description: I feel I learned more in that week than I could have in a year in school, Mrs. Muriel Kane said recently of a Flying Seminar on China in Great Neck. The whole thing was like open ing a window into a room that had been darkened for a very long time.

title: State of Siege Speaks A Warning to Us All Movies
description: COSTAGAVRAS'S State of Siege is a provocative, disturbing film that will shake most viewers out of their slumbering indifference to Latin America and make them think. For that reason alone, it is worth seeing. Although it relies too heavily en blat ant oversimplification to be a great film, it is nevertheless an important one.

title: A.M.A. Meets Here, Facing New Pressures
description: The American Medical Asso ciation opens its 122d annual convention here today facing steppedup governmental pres sure on the professional privi leges and pocketbooks of its 193,000 members.

title: Economy Labor's. Price May Go Up...
description: The price of labor peace began to climb last week as workers got fresh official confirmation of what they al ready knew: Wages have been losing the race with living costs. But Ad ministration officials hope that Presi dent Nixon's 60day price freeze will bring enough reassurance to keep the collective bargaining table from turn ing into a merrygoround again.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: IT IS hart to figure out, in the interview by Donal Henahan, whether Leon Kirchner's disparagement of universities (The univers ity really has become a ghetto for composers.) is a form of selfcriticism. He fears that, although he is able to compose music that he wants to in a university, he might lose sight of the outer community.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION

title: Miss Herman Plans Nuptials
description: WAYNE, N. J., June 23The engagement of Miss Lauren Herma'n to Mark Grossinger Etess has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Philip Herman, parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Dr. and Mrs. A. David Etess of Grossinger, N. Y., and New York.

title: MYER CAPTURES FINAL IN N.C.A.A.
description: PRINCETON, N.J., June 23Sandy Mayer of Stanford cap tured the National Collegiate tennis crown today with a 6.3, 64, 64 victory over Raul Ramirez of Southern Califor nia in the final.

title: Skylab Success
description: Precisely on time and on target, the three Skylab astronauts returned to earth Friday after having spent a record 28 days in space.

title: Into the middle class
description: Blackness is another issue entirely apart from class in America. No matter how affluent, educated and mobile [a black person] becomes, his race defines him more particularly than anything else. Black people, therefore, have a common cause that requires attending to, and this cause does not allow for the rigid class separation that is the luxury of the American whites. There is a sense in which every black man is as far from liberation as the weakest one if his weakness is attributable to racial injustice.

title: Biking Through Burgundy and Pushing 40 (But Not M.P.H., You Understand)
description: COTED'OR means ridge of gold in French, and as we entered the section of Burgundy which goes by this name, it seemed just that: a golden ridgeline of vineyards stretching across the country. Many tourists whizz past, little noticing, but we were not whizzing anywhere. If anything, we whirred, astride brand new 10speed Peugeot bicycles that gleamed in the brilliant sunlight. There were four of us  Ginger and I, Bob and Michele  and we were starting off on a twoweek cycling tour.

title: O Lucky Man! Ran Out of Luck
description: WRITERS of movie scripts shouldn't keep diaries, or, they do, they should not allow them to be published for at least 50 years.

title: L.I. Choral Group Will Sing Thursday
description: MASSAPEQUA, L. I.The Canticum Novum Youth Chorale, a mixed chorus of Massapequa High School will present a benefit concert this Thursday at 8:30 P.M. to help finance a European tour.

title: MORE MINORITIES ORDERED IN UNION
description: A Federal judge hal ordered Steamfitters Local 638, one of the area's major construction unions, to end what he viewed as a pattern of discrimination against blacks and Puerto Ri cans and to increase minority membership in the highestpaid job group from the present 4.5 per cent to 30 per cent by July 1, 1977.

title: Letters: On Pepa, the Hermit Innkeeper
description: To the Editor: I was completely delighted with Howard Whitman's article about the tiny but marveolus Caribbean island of San Andres (Discovering Colombia's Gem of the Ocean, Travel Section, May 27). I knew that sooner or later an article would appear in your section about La Isla, and that would be the beginning of the end. There are so few places like San Andres left on this unhappy globe of ours. You see, for years I have been seeking out just such a place. I lost Cuba to Castro, Greece to the Colonels, San Feliu (de Guixols) to North Europe's nouveau riche, Lahaina to the Hippies, and so on. could go on listing oncebeautiful, inter esting and friendly places that have become tourist traps, being oversold, overpriced and overexposed. I am sure his list.

title: RULING ON JOB ADS DISMAYS PAPERS
description: Newspaper executives and their lawyers around the coun try have reacted with alarm and dismay to the Supreme Court decision upholding a Pittsburgh ordinance prohibit ing newspapers from printing sexdesignated employment ad vertising.

title: Susan Williams, Teacher, Is Bride
description: Miss Susan Williams, a teacher at Trinity School, was married here yesterday after noon to John O'Sullivan, who is on the staff of the consum erprotection division of the Corporation Counsel of the City of New York, The cere mony took place in the sculp ture garden at the New School for Social Research and was the first wedding on campus in the institution's 54year history.

title: Chances for Survival Of Rare Ibis Improve
description: BERECIK, Turkey, June 23 (Reuters)The first half dozen young of one of the world's rarest birds have hatched allaying fears that the baldheaded ibis was doomed.

title: POINT OF VIEW; How Selfish Are Speculators?; A Currency Shift Isn't Always All Their Fault
description: Webster's dictionary gives the origin of the word spec ulate as the Latin specu lari to spy out, observe. In present common use the word means to enter into a trans action or venture, the profits of which are conjectural or subject to change; specifi cally to buy or sell with the expectation of profiting by fluctuations in price.

title: Maine Nuptials For Miss Hart, Winslow Myers
description: NEWCASTLE, Me., June 23Miss Charlotte Josephine Kenner Hart, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Harrison Hart, and Winslow F. B. Myers, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward A. Myers of Clarks Cove, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Samuel Henderson performed the ceremony in St. Andrew's Episcopal Church.

title: Nastase, Miss MorozovaVictors
description: LONDON, June 23 Antici pating what could be the Wimbledon final in a fortnight, a sellout crowd jammed the Queen's Club in brilliant sun shine to see Ilie Nastase face Roger Taylor for the London grasscourt tennis champion ship today.

title: Shearwater Wins Turf Stakes
description: Hardly noticed in the large field throughout most of the running, Shearwater of the Darby Dan Farm flashed a powerful closing rally to win the $59,350 Sheepshead Bay Handicap at Aqueduct yester day.

title: Expansion, Drugs and Blackouts on Agenda When N.F.L. Owners Meet Here This Week
description: Pro football's club owners and top management will meet here this week with expansion, drugs and televi sion policy among the main topics of conversation. The meetings will be preceded by the annual dinner of the New York Chapter of the Pro Football Writers As sociation tomor row night in the Americana Hotel. A committee ap pointed at the league meeting in April to deal with expan sion will deliver its first report. The owners will have to decide first if they wish to expand the league from 26 teams to 28 or even 30 32.

title: Peron The Leader Rejoins the Movement
description: BUENOS AIRES  After 18 years, Juan Domingo PerOn came back to Argentina, still el lider. For despite Mr. Peron's absence, Peronism has re mained the dominant force in Argen tine life.

title: Desert Vixen and Coraggioso Score in Post Deb
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., June 23Desert Vixen equaled the stakes record in winning the Second Division of the Post Deb today, at Monmouth Park and Corag gioso captured the First Divi sion as a crowd of 25,302 turned out for the racing pro gram.

title: Katherine Jacobs Wed to Robert Eyre
description: BELMONT, Mass., June 23 Miss Katherine May Jacobs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul M. Jacobs of Belmont and Gloucester, was married here this afternoon to Rob ert Carnes Eyre, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin M. Eyre of Islip, L,I.

title: Supreme Court Reversing Field on Obscenity
A Year After the Flood, WilkesBarre Is Still Troubled
description: WILKESBARRE, Pa., June 3It has been one year to to day since the tropical Corm Agnes pushed the Susquchanna over its dikes and sent it rampaging into the streets and homes of this quiet city. So terrible was the destruction that, to this day, many people here can not speak of the river with out spitting out the gentle syllables of its name.

title: Pope Opens Vatican Gallery of Modern Art Holding 600 Works
description: ROME, June 23Pope Paul VI today opened a new Vati can gallery of modern art, con taining a vast collection of works by contemporary Amer ican painters and sculptors, and two ceramics by Picasso.

title: The author's subject is his rage and fear
description: There are those rare novelsHenry Roth's Call It Sleep is onefor which the label of masterpiece always seems slightly beside the point. Both Antoine Bloye and Call It Sleep suffered the similar fate of being lost literary classics that had to wait a generation or so after their publication before being restored to their rightful literary place. Antoine Bloye, although of an entirely dif ferent literary tradition than Call It Sleep, has the same obsessive, wounding power.

title: Pirates Beat Mets, 32, On Sanguillen Hit in 10th
description: PITTSBURGH, June 23  It took 10 innings and some alert play by the Pirates to return the. New York Mets to their losing ways tonight. A line single by Manny Sanguillen with the bases loaded gave Pittsburgh a 32 victory.

title: Social Announcements
description: Weddings

title: Philharmonic T raveling Players Strongly Led by Zinman at Pace
description: The New York Philharmonic's Neighborhood Concerts Orches tra traveled to Pace University in lower Manhattan Thursday night. With 50 Philharmonic musicians participating, the concert was held in Pace's Schimmel Center for the Arts, a warm, intimate, woodpaneled auditorium that provided focused acoustical clarity the orchestra never enjoys on its home ground at Lincoln Center.

title: U.S., SOVIET SIGN PACT TO STEP UP AIRLINE SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The United States and the Soviet Union announced cm agree ment today to increase air pas senger service between the two countries.

title: Louise Potts Bride Of Paul Thibodaux
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 23  Miss Louise Ruprecht Potts, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter B. Potts of Locust Valley, L. I., was married here this afternoon to Paul Thomas Thibodaux, a staff engineer in Birmingham with the South Central Bell Tele phone Company. The Rev. Dr. Robert McClure performed the ceremony at the Inde pendent Presbyterian Church.

title: Picatinny Arsenal Undergoes Change
description: DOVERWhen the 37 people employed by the Pica tinny Arsenal's communica tionselectronics center re port to work on July 2, they will have a new emblem and a new command channel.

title: A FRESHAIR CAMP GEARS FOR SEASON
description: FISHKILL, N. Y. June 23Things are beginning to stir at Camp Pioneer, an isolated woodland retreat, as Tom Palmgren, its new director, and his assistants prepare for the expected arrival Thursday of 90 boys from slum areas in New York City.

title: Dragon on Wings
description: Despite such rural names as devil's darning needle, horse stinger and snake feeder, the dragonfly is harm less as a butterfly. But even its official name conjures up visions of a scaly, firebelching winged dragon. Small wonder that many country folk, who should know better, dislike and ,even fear the dragonfly and that city young sters often think of it as something like a flying adder.

title: The New Nicol, or the Tiger Tamed
description: THE pale blue eyes can still flash cold fire from under sad, slanting brows, and the full lips occasionally pout and curl lovingly around a Midlands snarl, but the chill gone. Nicol Williamson, the terribletempered tiger of the English stage, smiter of David Merrick, scourge of critics, accused assassin of Hamlet, carouser, brooder, pubcrawler and brawler, has been turned into a pussycat by... a woman.

title: Art Form Evolves From IconPainting
description: PALEKH, U.S.S.R.Art be longs to the people, a wide spread slogan in the Soviet Union proclaims, but most of the art produced by this ancient Russian handicraft village 200 miles northeast of Moscow ap pears to belong to the select few with dollars and other foreign currency in their pock ets.

title: IMPACT ON NATURE CITED IN RAIL CASE
description: A Federal judge has ruled that the Interstate Commerce Commission must determine the environmental impact of plans to abandon rail lines before it can hold abandonment hearings.

title: $100,000 IN JEWELS ARE FOUND IN QUEENS
description: A collection of antique jew elry with an estimated value of $100,000 was recovered yesterday by two detectives when they arrested a suspected fence in his apartment in Elm hurst, Queens.

title: On ShanghaiPeking Express: Politics and OldWorld Comfort
description: ON THE SHANGHAI PEKING EXPRESS, China, June 20Our aim is to serve the people wholeheart edly and never for a moment to divorce ourselves from the masses. The high pitched voice in impeccable Peking dialectChina's na tional languagefloods into the OldWorld compartment on the 46 Express.

title: Campaign Scandal A Strain On Liberal Credibility
description: For three decades, the Liberal party has held out the promise that politics can be a moral experience.

title: Miss Quarles, Teacher, Wed
description: PRINCETON, N. J., June 23 St. Andrew's Presbyterian Church was the setting here this morning for the mar riage of Miss Marjory Eliz abeth Quarles to Edward Curtis Douglas. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. William L. Tucker, who was assisted by the Rev. David Beck.

title: Ringwood Awaits A New Playhouse
description: RINGWOOD  The paint will hardly be dry when the new Melody Top Playhouse opens for its first summer season on Tuesday with a production of I Do! I Do!

title: Simple but sublime
description: The unknowing may scoff at meat and potatoes meals, but the fact is that they are wonderfully satisfy ing. One such mealand a rather in expensive oneis detailed here. It consists of braised flank steak filled with a meat stuffing and served with potatoes Dauphinois, which may well be the most sublime way of prepar ing the humble potato. A specialty of Grenoble, it is well known throughout the Rhone Valley. Like all specialties, it provides a certain amount of con troversy. In Grenoble, it is considered heretical to sprinkle cheese over the potatoes, but in Lyon, it is perfectly permissible. The cheese (which I use in the recipe below) is necessary when more milk than cream is used, for it helps the gratin achieve its golden color. If one uses cream alone, then the potatoes color beautifully, with out any cheese. Both the flank steak and the potatoes are good served cold. Hot or cold, their appropriate accom paniment is a green salad seasoned with oil vinegar and lots of garlic.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
Suit for U.S. Library Aid
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, June 23 (UPI)  Oklahoma and New Mexico will join in a Federal court lawsuit to attempt to force the. Nixon Administration to release impounded Federal library aid funds, it was dis closed this week by Joe Lock hart, an assistant to the Okla homa Attorney General.

title: Baker Gets Pole Position
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., June 23 (AP)  Buddy Baker will have the pole posi tion for tomorrow's $80,000 Motor State 400 stockcar race at Michigan International Speed way.

title: Wash. Helps Phila.
description: THERE was one season when Philadelphia cre ated a great deal of excitement in the oper atic field. In 193435, the Philadelphia Orchestra spon sored productions of Tris tan, Meistersinger, Car men, Rosenkavalier, Bo ris, Falstaff, Peileas, a double bill of Hansel and Gretel and Stravinsky's Ma vra, Shostakovich's Lady Macbeth of Mtsensk and Gluck's Iphigenia in Aulis. (The Stravinsky and Gluck were American premieres.) The conductors were Fritz Reiner and Alexander Smal lens; the stage director, Her bert Graf. Even before that, Stokowski had led in Phila delphia the American pre mieres of Wozzeck in 1931 and of Schoenberg's Gliick liche Hand in 1930. And the Metropolitan Opera had been a regular visitor at the Acad

title: BQLI Bulletin Board
description: BellmoreWorks by Marion P. Repsis at the Bellmore Memorial Library, 2288 Bedford Avenue.

title: 56% OF FALSE RX'S FILLED IN A TEST
description: WASHINGTON, June 23A nationwide test of the diligence of pharmacies in spotting drug abusers who try to fill fraudu lent prescriptions has aroused concern among Federal nar cotics officials.

title: PHILIP J. ROCHE
description: LOS ANGELES, June 23Philip J. Roche, founder and chairman of the board of the Sound Shipbuilding Corporation of New York, died yesterday at the U.C.L.A. Medical Center. He was 68 years old and lived in Ojai.

title: Vassar Gets $3Million Gift From an Anonymous Donor
description: Vassar College has received an anonymous gift of more than $3niillion: the largest gift made to the college by a living donor, accordingto a spokes man for the college.

title: EFFECT OF NEW OIL ON PRICE ASSAYED
description: BOSTON, June 23  Full exploitation of all potential oil and natural gas reserves on the Atlantic Continental Shelf will have no effect on the price of petroleum products on the East Coast, according to several petroleum economists.

title: Ann Irvin Wins Title Golf
description: CARNOUSTIE, Scotland, June 23 (Reuters)  Ann Irvin, 30 years old, won the British women's amateur golf cham pionship today when she de feated the defending champion, Michel Walker, 3 and 2, in the 18hole final. Both are Britons.

title: Judge Overturns the Conviction Of Doctor in an Abortion Death
Child to Mrs. Payne Jr.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 23A daughter was born June 7 to Mr. and Mrs. Joe E. Payne Jr. in the Green wich Hospital. Mrs. Payne is the former Miss Elizabeth Ritchie.

title: Luther T. Clark Weds Miss Camille Jackson
description: Miss Camille Colleen Jack son, an alumna of Boston University, was married yes terday morning to Luther T. Clark, who is in his third year at Harvard Medical School. The Rev. Melvin Wil liams performed the cere mony in the Springfield Gar dens United Methodist Church in Queens. He was assisted by the Rev. Joseph Morrison.

title: WELLS STEPS INTO EVENING'S WALTZES
description: An Evening's Waltzes, Je rome Robbins's newest work for the New York City Ballet, is not his best ballet, but it has some tricky partnering that requires topflight execution. Bruce Wells came up with what the choreographer ordered Fri day night at the New York State Theater, when he stepped into the role created for Jean Pierre Bonnefous, who dropped out because of an injury.

title: School Buses Set In Union County
description: SPRINGFIELD  Summer school transportation to David Brearley Regional High School in Kenilworth and Governor Livingston Re gional High School in Berkeley Heights will be provided without charge for Union County students.

title: CHINA STRESSING FOOD PRODUCTION
description: HONG KONG, June 23China is apparently shifting consider able manpower and capital from small industries to agriculture because of concern over pos sible serious crop shortages this year.

title: Jerseyans Intent on Keeping All OutofState Garbage Out
description: KEARNY  Despite a warning last week that a New Jersey ban on the dump ing of New York City gar bage would cause a massive and disruptive burden, New Jerseyans seem determined tostop, as soon as possible, outsiders trash from coming into the state.

title: BEN H. REESE JR.
description: SPRING LAKE, N. J. June 23 Ben H. Reese Jr., founder of the John Robert Powers Cos metics Company and a vice president of Borden, Inc., died yesterday at Memorial Hospital in New York, He was 60 years old and lived here at 110 Pit ney Avenue.

title: 2 Sisters Attend Mary E. Hume At Her Nuptials
description: STAMFORD, Conn., June 23Miss Mary Elise Hume, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Hume of Stamford, was married here this after noon to David Ray Papke, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ray mond Papke of Milwaukee.

title: Child to Wohlgelernters
description: A daughter was born to Rabbi Israel Wohlgelernter of Young Israel of Fifth Avenue and Mrs. Wohlgelernter on June 2 in Beth Israel Hospital. Mrs. Wohlgelernter, who is known as Dr. Devera Xasach koff is a professor of mathe matics at the Baruch School of Business and Public Ad ministration.

title: Coin Bill Advances
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP)  A Senate committee app proved a bill this week author izing the Treasury to make 120 million special bicentennial gold and silver coins and to rede sign the backs of the Eisen hower dollar, Kennedy 50cent piece, and quarter for the oc casion.

title: Bonnie Lauer's 75 for 305 Takes College Golf Crown
description: SOUTH HADLEY, Mass., June 23 (UPI) Bonnie Lauer of Michigan State shot a oneover par 75 today to win the wom en's national intercollegiate golf championship by three strokes with a 305 total.

title: BENNETT TAKES DECATHLON LEAD
description: PORTERVILLE, Calif., June 23 (UPI)Favored Jeff Bennett, smallest man in the field at feet 8 inches and 150 pounds; won the 400meter dash in 47.2 seconds yesterday to pass three competitors and take the first day lead in the National Ama teur Athletic Union..Decathlon championship with 4,128 points.

title: Man, 22, Stabbed to Death By Gunmen at Times Sq.
description: A 22yearold man was stabbed fatally early yesterday in the Times Square area and another man with him also was knifed by two men who were armed with handguns they fired during the assault.

title: Bridge
description: The psychology of lesser players is a fascinating study largely ignored by bridge writ ers. The supreme authority in this area was. Skid Simon, an Englishman of Russian origin who was not only master player but a master writer who produced a series of entertaining novels.

title: Jersey Slayer of Paralyzed Brother in Hospital Called a Hero and a Villain by Shore Neighbors
description: NEPTUNE, N.J., June 23I don't think he should ever serve a day in jail, said a policeman.

title: Camera World
description: AN automatic 35mm sin gle lens reflex camera first shown at Photo kina last year is now being introduced in the Unit ed States by Braun North America, 55 Cambridge Park way, Cambridge, Mass. 02142. Called the Ricoh Auto TLS EE, it is the first fully auto matic EE camera to use a standard screwthread lens mount in a shutterpriority model (the user selects the shutter speed desired; the camera then automatically adjusts for the correct aper ture). Priced at $309.95 with 50mm f/1.7 lens ($40 more with an f/1.4 lens), the cam era offers full aperture read ing as part of its, automatic exposure system (with the Auto Rikenon EE lenses), or the matchneedle, stopdown system with other standard Screwmount lenses.

title: United Church of Christ Elects First Black Woman Moderator
description: ST. LOUIS, June 23  Mar garet A. Haywood, an associate justice of the Superior Court of the District of Columbia, was elected moderator of the United Church of Christ here today, becoming the first black woman to hold a position of top leadership in an American biracial denomination.

title: M. Y. Meganck Fiance Of Kathryn Hubshman
description: Miss Kathryn Leigh Hubsh man and Michael Yvon Me ganck, students at Tufts Uni versity, plan to marry Aug. 18 in Cap d'Antibes, France.

title: WEST WINS, 206, IN COACHES GAME
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., June 23 (AP)The running of Long Beach State's Terry Metcalf, the clutch defense of Southern California's John Grant and bizarre 59yard touchdown on a tipped pass helped the West to a 20.6 victory over the East tonight in the Coaches all America game.

title: Bridal Is Held For Miss Breg
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., June 23Miss Elizabeth Anne Breg and Paul Robert Leon Masson were married here this afternoon in the United Church of Christ, by the Rev. Henry Yordon, assisted by the Rev. William Wagner.

title: World News Briefs
description: SYDNEY, Australia, June 23 Australia and New Zealand have announced a joint naval demonstration against French nuclear tests in the South Pa cific at Mururoa Atoll, about 800 miles southeast of Tahiti.

title: Crash Raises RollerCoaster Inspection Issue
description: MOUNT ARLINGTONOnMay 30, hundreds of paro chialschool youngsters from the metropolitan area were at Bertrand Island Amuse ment Park, at Lake Hopat cong, for their annual outing.

title: Numismatics
Nixon's Fringe Benefits
description: WASHINGTONOne optimistic the ory about the Watergate scandals was that they would lead to a little more candor in the conduct of the public business, but the lying, chiseling and deceiving still go on.

title: Chess: Korchnoi Retains His Lead By Drawing With Smejkal
description: LENINGRAD, June 22 Viktor Korchnoi of the Sovi et Union kept his lead in the interzonal chess tournament by drawing quietly as Black in an English Opening with Jan Smejkal of Czechoslo vakia in Round 14 here in the Dzerjinsky Palace of Cul ture tonight. Korchnoi has now amassed 10 points.

title: Miss Brenda Lee Abbot Married
description: POTOMAC, Md., June 23Miss Brenda Lee Abbot, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Waldo Mack Abbot Jr. of Rockville, was married here this afternoon to Alexander McGregor Anderson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Bennett Anderson Jr. of Sands Point, L. I. The Rev. Edward Live say, the rector, performed the ceremony in St. Francis Epis copal Church.

title: LAKE IS CREATED, THEN DRAINED OFF
description: SCRANTON, Pa., June 23A lake created by a dam built by the Army Corps of Engineers on Aylesworth Creek at Jer myn, about 10 miles from here, is now just a 7acre bed of mud.

title: Garrett List Plays Trombone Works With Exotic Effects
description: At its best, the concert Garrett List gave Friday night at Acme Productions, 28 Greene Street, indicated an inventive ear for exotic sound effects. But at this stage of his career as a com poser, Mr. List, who is also an active freelance trombon ist around town, seems still to be looking for a focus. The diversity among the three pieces on Friday's pro gram, and even within one of them, suggested a highly variable eclecticism more than a healthy diversity of interests; once Mr. List nar rows himself down to ex plore an idiom he can con fidently call his own, he may have something important to say.

title: Marilyn King, D. B. Bellaire Have Nuptials
description: GREENSBURG, Pa., June 23Miss Marilyn Anne King and Douglas Bryan Bellaire were married this afternoon in the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Robert L, Emrich, The Rev. Thad deus Kaczmarek of Our Lady of Grace Roman Catholic Church here, assisted.

title: 38 Are Hurt on Jet at Kennedy As Engine Falls Off on Landing
description: Thirtyeight persons were in jured, none seriously, early yesterday when one of four jet engines of an Icelandic Airlines DC8 burst into flames and dropped off as the craft made what authorities called a hard landing at Kennedy Internation al Airport.

title: How times have changed
description: Renovating a coop of nineteen twenties vintage dramatizes the change in lifestyles over the last 50 years. In the twenties (for those who weren't there), apartments were warrens of rooms linked by tunnel like corridors; dingy kitchens were meant to be seen only by domestics, and the servants themselves were housed in cubicles. It was a style, in other words, little suited to a family of the nineteenseventies with an interest in modern art. Architects Robert A. M. Stern and John S. Hagmann opened up the rooms and eliminated the period atmosphere of this duplex altogether. They replaced manypaned windows with panels of glass and transformed the gloomy corridors with curving walls. At the front of the apart ment, a spectacular new staircase connects the two floors.

title: Bridgehampton Seeking BigTime Racing Again
description: Remember the glory days Of Bridgehampton, when that congenial road course was running CanAm, TransAm and Vanderbilt Cup races? The management of Arthur Schmidt bravely poured money into it through the 1970 season, but the pro moter simply could not at tract enough pay ing customers in to that agreeable park in the dunes overlooking Sag Harbor in East ern Long Island.

title: Criminals At Large
description: It's easy. Sprinkle symbols like AVH, DAAD, FBN, M.I.6, PSE, SIS and Z2 throughout the book. Refer to them as though you're on a firstname basis with their top officers. Discuss the Pete& Circle and Bosque Mojado. Work up a plot that seems to be going there when it is not going there. Al lude to the most sophisticated secret agencies in the business. Dwell painstakingly on the latest in electronic devices. Bring in sex, of course (that is mandatory). Have agents from various services of various countries get in each others way, to a point where they are as bewildered as the reader. Shift the action from Belgrade to Los Angeles, with stopoffs here and there. What will re sult is a book named THE HUNGARIAN GAME, by Roy Hayes (Simon & Schuster, $7.95).

title: DR. EDWARD COSTELLOE
description: SUN CITY, Ariz., June 23Dr. Edward C. Costelloe, a family physician in Garden City, L. I., for 51 years, died today in Valley View Commu nity Hospital in Youngstown. He was 81 years old.

title: Kung Fu and Sanford Praised As Aids in Teaching of Reading
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 23Nine hundred innercity public school students are using class room time to watch Sanford and Son, Kung Fu and other popular television shows here in what educators regard as a breakthrough in motivat ing children to read.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated.

title: P.B.A. Urges Officer's Reinstatement
description: The president of the Police man's Benevolent Association called yesterday for the lifting of the suspension or an im mediate departmental trial of a policeman who was a wit ness in the fatal shooting last, April 28 of a 10yearold boy in Queens.

title: Bridge Sunk for New Fish Playground
description: HAMPTON BAYS, L. I.Fish that frequent the waters off the Shinnecock outlet have a new playgroundthe old Shinnecock Canal Bridge. Replaced this winter by a new span that carries Montauk Highway over the canal, the 65yearokl bridge was towed out to sea this week and sunk some 4,700 yards due south of the inlet to become the latest link in a chain of artificial fishing reefs that dot the Atlantic Coast.

title: Cody Homes May Be Razed
description: LONG BRANCHAt the turn of the century, William F. Cody (Buffalo Bill) came to North Long Branch to build The Reservation, nine summer mansions of rambling Jersey shore archi tecture. The houses stood on broad lawns that bordered on a sloping, wide Atlantic Ocean beach.

title: On the outsideinside looking in
description: WASHINGTON. There was an atmosphere of serenity, almost of seclusion, about the neat rec tangular office with its white walls, blue carpeting and heavy blue draperies. The large, polished wooden desk was uncluttered save for two small stacks of papers and the four elephants and single walrus that adorned the marble base of a pen set. An oldfashioned pretzel jar sat halfempty and hushed on the credenza. Two whitemarble gar goyles stood quiet guard over The Book of Presi dents, Modern Guide to Synonyms, Bartlett's Familiar Quotations, Webster's Biographical Dictionary. The neat man with the graying hair and white flecked eyebrows accenting his sun tanned face might have been anywherea cor porate executive's office, perhaps, or a tycoon's private sanctuaryas he sat in the leather arm chair, his neat, mutedplaid suitcoat buttoned over his neat white shirt and neat gray tie. He spoke softly. He spoke of a desire to open it up, more than ever, to try to be a little more forthcom ing, to let the listener know more of what was in his mind.

title: Did the Great American Underdog get to the Top of the World?; Winner Lose All; Dr. Cook and the Theft of the North Pole. By Hugh Eames. Illustrated. 346 pp. Boston: Little, Brown & Co. $8.95.
description: It is perhaps impossible for us to appreciate the public interest there was in the year 1909 when Comdr. Robert E. Peary was making his celebrated dash for the Poleor to have any idea of what it meant to wake up on the morning of Sept. 9, 1909, and discover in the morning edition of The New York Herald that somebody else, somebody who had gone virtually all alone, with no fan fare, and no official backing, had reached there before Peary. It would be a little as though some small, privately financed, unadvertised ex pedition to the moon had suddenly appeared on the screen and touched down a day or so before Neil Arm strong.

title: Zen Temple and Gardens Bloom Quietly in Brooklyn
description: The Brooklyn Botanic Garden last week officially reopened its Ryoanji Temple Stone Gardena rep lica of a 500yearold Zen meditation garden Kyoto, Japan.

title: Here Comes the Metric System, America
description: An expanded engine plant of the Ford Motor Company in Lima, Ohio, is ready to produce the first metric dimensioned engine ever built in the United States.

title: Mrs. Delmonico Rewed in Jersey
description: BEDMINSTER, N. J., June 23Mrs. Linda Day Del monico and Paul Edward Ogle of Stonington, Conn., were married here this after noon by the Rev. Leon Glad ish, a Presbyterian minister, at the home of the bride's brotherinlaw and sister, Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Johnson Grymes 3d.

title: Wounded Knee To Aid Indians
Storing Gas in Garage Called Unsafe Practice
description: Any temptation to keep an extra supply of gasoline in a garage as a hedge against the present shortage should be stoutly resisted because it could cost a life, the Ameri can Insurance Association warned this week, United Press International reported.

title: Ballet: A Haunting Work
description: The Mary Anthony Dance Company, which tonight ends its week's engagement at the Theater of the Riverside Church on Claremont Ave nue; lacks any very consider able creative personality. In place of this it substitutes a kind of corporate image of and taste and elegant danc ing.

title: Television
description: THE Columbia Broad casting System has halted the practice of instant analysis fol lowing Presidential speeches on television, and the result is neither good journalism nor good television. The change in policy was an nounced by William S. Paley, CBS chairman, on June 6, tacked on with curious casu alness to a declaration that the network would provide time after a major Presiden tial address, preferably with in a week, for responsible opposing views.

title: Cost of Living Rose 3% in '72 For LowIncome Families Here
description: Incometax relief gave lower income families in the New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area a break last year. As result, their family living costs rose only 3.5 per cent as against 5 per cent increases for middleand upperincome fam ilies.

title: POLITICAL ILLS BESET MOROCCO
description: RABAT, Morocco, June 19Morocco, a country contending with grave economic and social problems, is once again being forced to turn her attention to a political struggle that has un derlain most of her recent history.

title: 1,536 Dogs to Occupy Fort Wadsworth Today
description: Fort Wadsworth, the old est continuously manned mili tary installation in the United States, will be invaded today by 1,563 dogs. Heading the pack at the 33d annual show of the Staten Island Kennel Club, will be 91 massive Great Danes.

title: Harvard Plan for Minorities Is Rejected Again by U.S
description: BOSTON, June 23 (AP)Har vard University's plan for re cruiting women and minority group members as employes has been rejected for the third time in a year by the regional office of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Bennett Won't Run Again
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP) Senator Wallace F. Bennett Republican of Utah, announced today that he would not seek reelection in 1974. Senator Norris Cotton, Republican of New Hampshire, announced Thursday that he would retire when his current term ends in January, 1975.

title: She Is Woman, She Is Helen Reddy
description: THE traffic in and out of the blue and gold Sherry Netherland sitting room is worthy of a French farce by. Feydeau. The doors forever opening and closing lead to the outside hall, the bedroom, and an adjoining suite. But the leading lady is all wrong for the part.

title: Now Playing as the Villain: High Costs
description: The approach of the fire works season heralds also that other annual summer phenomenonthe lighting up of summer theaters across the land. Indeed, though the strawhat theater circuit may be in a semicoma on Long Island, the condition hardly is symptomatic of the rest of the country.

title: WEPNER AWARDED DISPUTED DECISION
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 23 (AP) Ernie Terrell, former World Boxing Association heavy weight champion, lost a con troversial 12round decision tc Chuck Wepner tonight than touched off a nearriot at ring side.

title: POP
description: STEELEYE SPAN is a charming British quintet that has been around since 1969 and whose latest record, Parcel of Rogues (Chrysalis CHR 1046), deserves more attention than it seems to be getting.

title: Sugarman Calls for an. Inquiry Of Award of Contract to Perot
description: Jules M. Sugarman, the city's Human Resources Ad ministrator, called yesterday for an investigation of the awarding by the state of a $125,000 consulting contract to H. Ross Perot, the Texas computer millionaire.

title: Miss Leddy, Teacher, Wed to N. P. Curran
description: NORWOOD, Mass; June 23 Miss Eileen F. Leddy, who teaches at the Sacred Heart High School in Yonkers, was married here this afternoon to Nicholas P. Curran of New York, director of public rela tions for the National Basket ball Association.

title: Primary Biaggi Still Holds The Key
description: Like Marley's ghost, Mario Biaggi won't go away. The Bronx Democratic Congressman and his credibility prob lem dominated the Democratic mayoral primary three weeks ago. Now, In the final hours of the runoff campaign, out of the mist comes Mr. Biaggi even though he isn't even a candidate in Tuesday's balloting.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodayDrag racing at Madi son Township Raceway Park, Pension Road, Englishtown, N.J. Gates open at 1 P.M., elimina tions at 6 P.M.

title: Miss Barbara Brooke Baldwin Married to John Francis Dowd
description: OLD BROOKVILE, L.I., June 23  Miss Barbara Brooke Baldwin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Titleston Baldwin, was married here to day to John Francis Dowd, son of Dr. and Mrs. Robert J. Dowd of Hamden, Conn.

title: Toronto Sun on Sundays
description: TORONTO, June 23 (AP)The Toronto Sun has announced that it will publish a Sunday edition beginning in September.

title: Students Gather Hispanic History
description: Pier 35, near the now de funct Hamilton Avenue fer ry in Red Hook, is what Ramon Colon calls the Puerto Rican bridgehead in Brooklyn. Here, the early Puerto Rican arrivals in Brooklyn emerged from the ships after 1918 to shiver on the bleak waterfront and to face a hostile world.

title: Frances Reid Will Be Bride Of Peter Picoli
description: MILL NECK, L. I., June 23Mr. and Mrs. Cornelius J. Reid Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Frances Eliz abeth Reid, to Peter Picoli, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Picoli Jr., of Upper Brook ville, L. I.

title: A New Soviet Consulate Opens in San Francisco
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 23 (UPI)The Soviet Union, marking the warming Ameri canRussian friendship, today officially opened its first con sulate in the United States in 25 years.

title: State Suing Utility to Pay Damages in Fish Kill
description: TOMS RIVERIn what has been described as a highly unusual legal move, the state's Department of Envi ronmental Protection will go into Superior Court here Thursday in an effort to get a New Jersey utility to pay for assertedly killing thou sands of fish last year.

title: SPY SAYS HE HEARD M'GOVERN'SADVISERS
description: ST. LOUIS, June 23 (AP)The St. Louis PostDispatch said in its Sunday editions that a Republican spy managed to penetrate the innermost sanc tum of Senator George McGov ern's presidential headquarters at the Democratic National Convention last July.

title: J. A. Whiteside Weds Holly Whittelsey
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., June 23Miss Holly Edgar Whit telsey, a junior at Clark Uni versity in Worcester, Mass., was married here this after noon to John Alexander Whiteside, an assistant pro fessor of psychology at Clark. The Rev. David B. Water mulder performed the cere mony in the Bryn Mawr Presbyterian Church.

title: Australia and Philippines Set Easier Visa Procedures
description: MANILA, Philippines, June 23 (AP)  Australia and the Philippines have agreed to sim plify their visa requirements to ease travel for tourists, stu dents and immigrants, accord ing to an announcement by the Australian Immigration Minis ter, Albert J Grassby.

title: Middlesex Plays in Park to Open 11th Season
description: EDISON  Come Tuesday, hundreds of Middlesex County residents will flock to Roosevelt Park here to see the first Plays in the Park production of the sea son, The Me Nobody Knows. They will unroll their blankets, unfold assort ed beach chairs, spray them selves and their children with bug repellent and sit back and enjoy free theater.

title: U.S. Rice to Mindanao
description: MANILA, June 23 (AP)The Philippine Government is ship ping United States rice to Min danao to avert a food crisis caused by drought and a Mos lem uprising, a spokesman said this week. The shipments will ;o to Cotabato city, Pagadian city and Dipolog city.

title: Seton Hall Adding Arts Center
description: SOUTH ORANGE  The restoration of a 19thcentury carriage house will add new wrinkle to the ever changing face of Seton Hall University's campus, now balanced blend of old and new buildings.

title: Headliners
description: It had all the earmarks of oneupmanship. Last September, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, one of Japan's giant family controlled corporations, donated $1million to the Harvard University Law School. Last week, one of Mitsubishi's chief competitors, the Sumitomo Group of banking, mining and manufacturing interests, gave $2million to Yale University and $1million to the Japan Society in New York. In both instances the stated motive was to promote JapaneseAmer ican cultural understanding in light of recent economic and political friction between the two countries. Perhaps our gift will stimulate other contributions, said Koji Asa', who announced the Sumitomo gifts. While officials denied that rivalry was involved, a Japanese correspondent noted that the big corporations in his country compete in all things.

title: New Zealand Rolls Up 239Ran Cricket Lead
description: LONDON, June 23 (Reuters) New Zealand's cricket team reached a monumental total of 492 runs for six wickets at Lord's today on the third day of the second cricket test against England.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  An ob scure negotiation in Geneva, seemingly so technical that even its existence is not widely known, may have a major influence on the whole future of the world's trading relations, particularly on the global trade bargaining due to begin next fall.

title: Mann Takes Hurdle Race, With Koskei 2d in Finland
description: KOURTANE, Finland, June 23 (AP)Ralph Mann of the Southern California Striders won the 400meter hurdles race in 49.5 seconds today at an in ternational track and field meet.

title: FEUERBACH SHOT PUT PACES HELSINKI MEET
description: HELSINKI, Finland, June 23 (AP)Al Feuerbach in the shot put, Dwight Stones in the high jump, and Randy Williams in the long jump, all United States Olympians, scored victories to day in an international track and field meet.

title: William Stewart Weds Miss Jean MacGregor
description: Miss Jean Laura Mac Gregor of New York was married here yesterday after noon to William Stewart of Coral Gables, Fla., where he is assistant to the president and board chairman of the Tropics International Corpo ration. The Rev. James Craw ford performed the ceremony at the Central Presbyterian Church.

title: Greek Orthodox Dedicate Church
description: Pomp, tradition and deep religious meaning are blend ing together today at the of ficial consecration of the Holy Cross Greek Orthodox Church in the Bay Ridge sec tion of Brooklyn.

title: Posie Pickers vs. Chain Saws and Ronald Reagan
description: Alluvial flats, upon which redwoods have flourished with an annual resup ply of nutritious sediment, are now in danger of being carved away by changing water flows.

title: Geological Observatory To Get New Director
description: Dr Manik Talwani, who ?? the last year has been interim director of Columbia University's LamontDoherty Geological Observatory, has been named fullfledged di rector of the institution.

title: Chinese Magazine Terms Farm Yield Still Inadequate
description: PEKING, June 23 (Reuters)A Chinese journal has acknowl edged that the nation's agri cultural performance is still in adequate without suggesting whose fault it is.

title: Elouise Conway Bride Of Duncan Forbes Will
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., June 23  Miss Elouise Wright Conway, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Conway, was married here this afternoon to Duncan Forbes Will, son of Mr. and Mrs. D. Forbes Will of Osterville, Mass. The Rev. Charles Scott performed the ceremony in Christ Epis copal Church, assisted by the Rev. Christopher Webber.

title: Life Signs
description: This lively chronicle of four days in the life of 25yearold Camilla Ryder constitutes an abbreviated version of Anne Richardson Roiphe's Up the Sandbox and shares many of the same problems. Camilla, pregnant with her second child, is mother of sweet Jacob and wife of nice Alec. Proper, hu morous, acquiescent, she is freaking out as the birth of her child approaches: frighten ing dreams about her longdead father and unseemly screaming in her sleep have landed her on the couch of the immaculate Dr. Manos, whose arsenal of clichs seems only to add to her burden. He also administers medication.

title: Gallup Poll Shows Approval of Nixon At 44% a 2d Month
description: The Gallup Poll's index of President Nixon's popularity, which had dropped substan tially in the midst of Watergate disclosures, leveled off early this month following the Pres ident's meeting with President Georges Pompidou of France.

title: Dean Lawyers Indicate Strategy
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 In a place of some honor or a picturecluttered wall in ?? office on H Street N.W. in downtown Washington is smiling portrait of John W. Dean 3d.

title: A British Noah Shelters Rare Species Preferably in Pairs
description: I'VE always wanted my own zoo, ever since I was a youngster carrying toads around in my pocket. Now it's here. My wife is sure I'm mad. So is my bank mana ger. It has meant a life of tranquilizers and overdrafts.

title: Rev. Jan Maas, Miss Shepherd Married Here
description: Miss Georgia Louise Shep herd, a Ph.D. candidate in comparative literature at New York University, was married here yesterday after noon to the Rev. Jan Alfred Maas, assistant to the Rev. John A. Bell, rector of the Episcopal Church of the In carnation.

title: New Tidal Waves Follow Earthquake In Northern Japan
description: TOKYO, June 24 (Reuter)Tidal waves struck northern Japan today for the second weekend in a row after a strong earthquake in the northern island of Hokkaido.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Without New York's liberalized abortion law, there would be 24,000 additional children on the city's welfare rolls, according to a study of the impact of abortion reform released yesterday by the Health Services Administration. According to the study, the average number of children a welfare mother has declined from 2.77 in 1970, when the new law went into effect, to 2.54 in 1972, a much sharper decline than in states where abortion was not available.

title: Elizabeth McC. Mueller Is a Bride
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., June 23 Miss Elizabeth McCut cheon Mueller, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Muth Mueller of New York and Nantucket, was married here this afternoon to Thomas Crane Wales 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Wales of South boro, Mass., and Vinalhaven, Me. The Rev. Alfred Bing ham performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church.

title: Acrostic puzzle
Peter Doelger Weds Miss Milbank
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 23Miss Victoria Milbank and Peter Woodbury Doelger were married here this after. noon in the garden of the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jeremiah Mil bank. The bridegoom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. William E. P. Doelger of Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In an era when television projects sportscaster as a face, Mary Albert is throwback. He's primarily a radio voice.

title: I Won't Lie About It Carole's a Lovely Liar
description: IMAY have to take up lying, Carole Shelley makes it seem so attractive. Miss Shelley is playing Margery Pinchwife  who else?  in the American Shakespeare Theater's pro duction of Wycherley's The Country Wife these warm summertime nights, and Margery Pinchwife is a creature who normally does not lie. Marry her to an old man and she'll promptly con fess to inclinations to vomitit is a deep pleasure to hear Miss Shelley refine the phrase into something like birdsongor tell her, innocent country bred thing that she is, that a town rake loves her and she'll flap her wings like a gosling in June morning ecstasy. Whatever she's thinking comes straight out of her, as naturally as pure water from a freshly popped spring, and the delight she takes in kissing every new man who asks her is something it would not occur to her to conceal. She can't be credited with candor, you see, be cause she doesn't employ cunning.

title: LEGISLATIVE NOTES
description: TRENTON  The Legisla ture finally adjourned last week after the State Senate confirmed more than 100 ju dicial and governmental ap pointments. For the most part, the appointments repre sented Governor Cahill's last chance to dispense patronage and favors during his remain ing seven months in office.

title: Leaks in Recess Increase Interestin Dean Evidence
description: WASHINGTON, June 23The weeklong pause in the Senate's Watergate hearings, called in deference to the SovietAmeri can summit talks, has produced so many leaks of information that interest in the testimony to be given Monday by John W. Dean 3d has been sharply heightened.

title: How Many Trees Do You Need to See? Said the Governor
description: ORICK, Calif.The Avenue of The Giants was shrouded in a cool mist, Ribbons of fog threaded up the narrow coastal canyons, enveloping majestic, lofty spires in their path. Nowhere else on earth is there such a boulevard, nor at its terminus more auspicious tabernacle than the Redwood National Park. It is one of the newest and most impressive of our national parks.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: On June 3 you had a most interesting article about Kodak and the Lilliputians.

title: Religion
description: Since the days of Pharaoh, Jews have been accustomed to living as a cultural mi nority and facing the threat of assimilation. A basic de fense has been a network of religious laws and social cus toms that make marriage to a nonJew tantamount to ab dication of Jewish roots.

title: The Genie of Sutton Place; By George Selden, 175 pp. New York: Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $4.95. (Ages 10 to 14)
description: A tale of fantasy whose cast of characters includes a 1000yearold genie with an eye for the girls and petshop owner who is himself an exdog must surely be characterized as promising. Yet the sum of this story's occasionally inspired parts leaves a disappointing hole in the reader's ultimate pleasure.

title: Still on the Side Of the Boy Scouts But Why Not?
description: NORMAN ROCKWELL: A Sixtyyear Retrospective at the Bernard Danenberg Gallery is the abbreviated remnant of huge Rockwell show that, in the last year and a half, has made the rounds of museums in nine cities, including Brooklyn. Organized by Danenberg, this touring retrospective has been the cli max of a phenomenal Rockwell re vival of recent occurrencephenomenal considering that Rockwell. hasn't known a moment of unpopularity in his long career.

title: Wheat for an Anxious World
description: The period from now un til the end of September is the critical one, during which we shall continue to live in an atmosphere of troubled uncertainty, assuming that uncertainty is not brutally cut short by a sudden disaster.

title: Beating the Summer Heat
description: Summertime is the time for informality. and as this June ends the informality is busting out all over as never before.

title: Waldheim Hails Astronauts
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., June 23 (AP)Secretary Gen eral Waldheim, in a telegram to President Nixon today, said the three Skylab astronauts deserve the full recognition of the international community for their record 28day space flight.

title: Speaking at MitchellLama Project, He Lauds New Laws Aiding Elderly
description: With Tuesday's mayoral pri mary runoff rapidly approach ing, Controller Abraham D. Beame continued yesterday to speak to his strength among middleincome voters by ap plauding recent legislation aid ing residents of MitchellLama projects and by promising city administration sensitive to the special needs of the 100,000 tenants.

title: Baseball Kills Young Fan
description: FORT WAYNE, Ind., June 23 (UPI)Clifford Knight, 8 years old, was struck in the chest by a baseball while watching a game here last night and was dead on arrival at Lutheran Hospital.

title: A Salesman Works the Territory
description: WASHINGTONFor a man who has risen through the cloistered ranks of the Soviet Communist party, Leonid Brezhnev proved himself surprisingly adept at courting the multiple power centers of the American political system.

title: Allende Confronting The Copper Strikers
description: SANTIAGO  President Salvador Allende Gossens Government is in the midst of its first clash with blue collar workers since the Marxist co alition took office two and a half years ago. And the twomonthold strike at El Teniente, the largest underground copper mine in the world, has brought the bitter polari zation between Marxists and anti Marxists in Chile to open confron tation.

title: Moses Calls Bridge Over Sound Inevitable
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I.the broad rhetorical brush of Rob ert Moses swept across a sedate aural canvas formed by the members of the South ampton Garden Club last week, delineating the master builder's ascerbic views on a number of current concerns along with his gentler rem inisences of earlier battles won and lost during six dec ades of public service.

title: Duluth Stoically Awaits Tests for Cancer Risk in Its Water
description: DULUTH, Minn., June 23The 100,600 residents of this port on Lake Superior, who have prided themselves on the purity of their drinking water, are stoically awaiting the re sults of scientific tests to de termine whether asbestos fi bers detected in the water preesnt a risk of cancer.

title: FUND TO REWARD EMPLOYES OF CITY
description: A program has been set up to give taxfree annual cash awards of $5,000 to at least six outstanding career civil servants in the employ of the City of New York.

title: Ross, Defender, Gains Final In Jersey State Tennis
description: KEARNY, N. J., June 23Steve Ross of Brooklyn, seeking his fourth straight New Jersey state men's singles champion ship, moved into the final round today at the Arlington Players Zlub with a 6.0, 75 victory over Randall King of Dobbs Ferry, N. Y.

title: Gardens
description: LIKE most gardeners, learn things the hard way, often through sad experience. A few summers ago, for example, stood and surveyed a battered vegetable plot after what the weatherman called the fringes of an offshore tropical storm.

title: Englishtown's Flea Market: A Glorious Junkheap With Infinite Possibilities
description: THE junk hound is a special type of earlymorning fanatic. In the dead of the A.M., every Satur day, he will drive through the slum bering New Jersey countryside to Eng lishtown, site of what has variously been described as the biggest flea market on the East Coast, east of the Mississippi, in the world  some 25 arable acres under intensive highyield junk cultiva tion. Serious junk buffsthose double dealers who turn antiques buyers for the day, usually stocking city shops depart New York by 2 A.M. and arrive in Englishtown, 45 miles away, around 3. Slightly less urgent are the antique gun and coin collectors; they come be tween 4 and 5 A.M., flashlights in hand. Blue, bottle collectors arrive with the dawn. Housewives hustle over as soon as the chores are done. Poor people stretching their dollars are there by mid morning, As the hour latens, the ar rivals are less and less specialists in the fine arts of junk, more and more gen eralists, people in search of cheap thrills, connoisseurs of the bargain hunt. All mill about among the Englishtown mar ket's 700 stalls (200 indoor, 500 out door), which sell everything from antiques that cost thousands of dollars to plastic items that go for pennies.

title: Sunday Observer
description: June brings us honeysuckle, brides, lightning bugs, sun burn, iced tea and mosquitoes, but most of all it brings us summer reading. Let us then put aside that heavy itchy old winter reading and slip into something with ice cubes and lemon peels. Here, for starters, is a sample of the cooling matter now in your bookshop which should start all true summer readers shivering with dread:

title: Miss Flanagan Wed at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., June 23  Miss Maureen Patricia Flanagan, daughter of Maj. Luis J. Flanagan, U. S. A., re tired, and Mrs. Flanagan, was married here this morning to Michael Gerard Melaugh, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward G. Melaugh of Needham Heights, Mass.

title: Errant Businesses Facing Stiffer Fines
description: A new city law provides tough penalties for business that fail to obtain licenses or that violate regulations of the Consumer Affairs Department.

title: The Pure Science
description: HARROW, England  In the bus tling mercantile world which gave birth to the first great professional scien tific societyThe Royal Society Londonits two leading spokesmen, Sir Francis Bacon and Thomas, Sprat, had to plead that not all scientific search should be done for immediate practical use. In addition to experi ments of use there were to be ex periments of light. This was the first plea that pure science should not submerged by the insistent and urgent demands of practical application.

title: Emily Norwood Trevor Fiancee Of Roy Tomlinson Van Vleck
description: Miss Emily Norwood Trevor and Roy Tomlinson Van Vleck will be married Aug. 18 in St. John'sinthe Wilderness Episcopal Church in Paul Smiths, N. Y.

title: JEWISH UNIT CALLS MOVIE INSIDIOUS
description: An organization representing nine major Jewish groups and 93 local human relations agencies charged yesterday that the film Jesus Christ Superstar, which is to be re leased shortly by Universal Pictures, would revive relig ious sources of antiSemitism.

title: Letters To the Editor  Corruption Is Not Compulsory
description: To the Editor:Herbert Mitgang's Guest Word column, Babbitt in the White House, notes the omi nous topicality of Sinclair Lewis's novel It Can't Happen Here. It closes with a judg ment of Henry James's con cerning the Washington of his day: the triumph of the super ficial, the apotheosis of the raw.

title: JOSEPH OTTENSTEIN
description: WASHINGTON, June 23Joseph Ottenstein, founder and president of the District News Company, distributor of maga zines, books and newspapers in this area, died yesterday at the Washington Hospital Cen ter. He was 76 years old.

title: Youths Help Police Chase and Seize 2 In a Bronx Robbery
description: Two alleged robbers of a 70yearold Bronx woman were arrested after neighborhood youths and police officers chased them down, the police reported.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number Yester day was:
NEW FACE COMING TO TIMES SQUARE
description: Grant's restaurant and bar, for decades a popular Times Square landmark and more recently a symbol of the neighborhood's decline, has been leased to Kentucky Fried Chicken, which plans to open a 24houraday familystyle restaurant there in about four months.

title: Dobson Not At Home in Stadium
description: When Pat Dobson beat Detroit the other day, it had to alleviate some of the discomfort Yankee Stadium used to produce in him when he pitched there as a visitor.

title: First Japanese Steel Mill In U. S. to Be Built Upstate
T.J.Kepford France Of Poppy de Garmo
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 23Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. John de Garmo of the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Louise de Garmo, to Timothy J. Kepford, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ira C. Kepford of Weque tonsing, Mich., formerly of Greenwich.

title: Times Square The Action Will Be On Camera
description: Last week, in what its admirers called a multipronged attack on crime but what its detractors termed mere cosmetics, the New York City Police Department went through a series of organizational and operational changes and said some encouraging things about New Yorkers.

title: GOAF LEAD TAKEN BY MRS. BERNING
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., June 23 AP)Mrs. Sue Berning carded threeunderpar 70 today and noved into a twostroke lead after two rounds of the Ladies Professional Golf Association 630,000 Heritage Village Open. Her total was 138 for 36 holes.

title: Nuptials Held f or Mrs. Grant And Dyer Jones, Boat Builder
description: NEWTOWN SQUARE, Pa., June 23Mrs. Linda Ryan Grant of Flourtown, daughter of Mrs. Diana Dodge Ryan of Portsmouth, R.I., and the late George F. Ryan, was married this evening at Happy Hill Farm, the home of Mr. and Mrs. Cortright Wetherill here, to William H. Dyer Jones of Providence, R.I., son of the Rev. Theodore F. Jones and Mrs. Jones of Duxbury, Mass.

title: Jane L. Friedlaender Is Betrothed
description: The engagement of Miss Jane L. Friedlaender to Wolf gang J. Neumann, son of KarlAugust Neumann and Mrs. Archimbold Skjolde brand, both of Stockholm, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Helmut N. Fried laender of New York.

title: 2 Charged in Case That Caused Maudling to Quit
description: LONDON, June 23The for mer head of an international architectural company and a former Government official were charged with conspiracy today in obtaining Government contracts. The charges were the first to result from an investiga tion into allegations that the company paid large sums to, Government officials.

title: SHANE GOULD WINS MEDLEY ON COAST
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., June 23 (UPI)Shane Gould snapped out of the doldrums today after three mediocre performances to win the 400meter individual medley at the Santa Clara in ternational swimming and div ing meet.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: The stock market continued in ill health last week. Not even the news that dividends likely would be in creased restored it to the kind of cheery good health that brokers and the customers alike are longing for these days.

title: 2 Guards Are Killed In a Surprise Attack At Prison in Arizona
description: FLORENCE, Ariz., June 23 (UPI)Two Arizona State pris on guards were stabbed to death last night in what the acting warden, Bud Gomes, called senseless killings.

title: A TV dynasty
description: Spraying ashes from his dime cigar over the arms of his prized wing chair

title: City Action May Aid Brooklyn Waterfront
description: In Board of Estimate ac tions last week, businesses on the Brooklyn waterfront got an economic shot in the arm with the city's purchase of the old Bush Terminal Railroad yard, and Queens got approval for the con struction of a 20story office building that will be the pivot of redevelopment of the Jamaica business district.

title: A Dentist Is Fiance Of Miss Bronsther
description: HEWLETT BAY PARK, L. I., June 23Dr. and Mrs. Burton Bronsther have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Fredrika Bronsther, to Dr. Alan G. Schemaille of New York and Hewlett Bay Park, son of Dr. and Mrs. Ned Schemaille, also of this community.

title: Austen Gray Jr. Plans to Marry Lynn Merrill
