description: SYOSSET, L. I., June 23The engagement of Miss Lynn Merrill to Austen Townsend Gray Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Gray of Roslyn Harbor, has been announced by her par ents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert G. Merrill. A summer wedding is planned.

title: 31 Hurt at Royal Game In Elevator Malfunction
description: KANSAS CITY, June 23 (UPI)An escalator crowded with cub scouts leaving the Kansas City RoyalsTexas Rangers game at the Royals new stadium today speeded up suddenly and then lurched to a halt.

title: Oyster Bay Bridge Rockefeller Gives Up
description: The RyeOyster Bay Bridge has be come a lightning rod in this period of evolution.... It is clear that the people want to take a more careful look at decisions which affect the face of their land. Governor Rockefeller was understating the case last week as he finally abandoned his fight for new bridge over Long Island Sound. In one of the region's longest and hardest fought battles over a major public construction proposal, the Gov ernor had been left almost alone on his side of the argument.

title: Smalley and Huizenga Lead U.S. Nine to a 62 Triumph
description: LOS ANGELES, June 23 (AP) Ken Huizenga's grandslain home run in the 11th inning powered the United States to a 62 victory over Japan yester day in the opener of their seven game college allstar series.

title: COURT CLEARS WAY FOR PARKS IN MAINE
description: AUGUSTA, Me., June 23 (AP) The State Supreme Court has ruled that Maine can put its 400,000 acres of public lots to any use that would benefit all of the people of Maine.

title: Methadone Clinic Finds Home
description: HACKENSACK  The Monsignor Wall Methadone Clinic has finally found home, thanks to the efforts of a Bergen County official who does not believe in the methadone treatment for drug addicts.

title: Javits and Buckley View Collusion Issue Calmly
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 New York's two Republican Senators viewed with equanim ity this week the allegations of collusion between the Repub lican and Liberal parties in the state to siphon off votes from local Democratic candidates.

title: New Vietnam Accord Brings Reduction In the Fighting but Little Other Change
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 23In the week since the Vietnam ceasefire was reaf firmed fighting across the country has dipped to about the same level as in late May Little else has changed.

title: Yankees Down Tigers On Murcer Homer, 32
description: The Detroit Tigers solved their New York traffic prob lems yesterday but not their New York baseball problems as they dropped their third game in a row to the Yankees, 32.

title: Cosmos Hire an ExCommuter
description: Ask any of the hundreds of the 8yearolds who have played before or at halftime of the Cosmos home games this season and they will tell you that the New York ers, although an offense minded team, don't score enough goals. The Cosmos know it themselves, of course, and have searched every where for a striker except in the want ads in the newspapers. Last Friday morning they went as far as signing a for mer Gaelic football player and they will start him against Veracruz of Mexico at Hofstra Stadium this af ternoon.

title: Tenure The Battle Escalates.
description: The continuing battle in higher education over academie tenure went well beyond the talking stage last week. In what is believed to be the first move of its kind at fouryear college, Bloomfield Col lege in New Jersey decided to abolish tenure for its faculty. While Bloomfield is a small institution, its action nevertheless could set precedent for others to imitate.

title: Senate vs. Court
description: The American public has been confronted with the conflicting opinions of Senator Sam J. Ervin and Special Prosecutor Archibald Cox concerning the difficult and vital question whether the Senate hearings on the Water gate scandals jeopardize the judicial proceedings. The two antagonists are honorable men, both respected con stitutional authorities and unquestionably dedicated the search for truth and punishment of the culprits.

title: BIG CONCERNS FACE CHECK OF PROFITS
description: WASHINGTON, June 23A Profit check of all companies with annual sales of more than $50million has begun across the country, according to the Cost of Living Council.

title: Stern Asks Balance In Scales of Justice
description: NEWARK  Herbert J. Stern, United States At torney for New Jersey, sum marizing his philosophy of law enforcement, said that a major problem today was that in the mind of our fel low citizen, the scales of jus tice do not weigh true.

title: DAVID GORDON
description: David Gordon, since 1970 cultural editor of The Daily World in New York, formerly The Daily Worker, died Thurs day at St. Luke's Hospital of a massive heart attack. He was 64 years old and lived at 412 West 110th Street.

title: 8 CENTERS ON CANCER SET UP IN HOSPITALS
description: WASHINGTON, June 23 (AP)  The Government has an nounced the establishment of eight comprehensive cancer centers as key elements in a $500millionayear drive to conquer cancer.

title: New &
description: Can an exfighter pilot (single engine) take the con trols of a commercial airline after a hiatus of 13 years? And equally to the point, can a 15yearold adventure novel (which this is) retain its zing in a new edition? The answer to both questions is yes, yes.

title: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yester day was:
Bracing for Phase 4
description: How high can your hopes be for Phase 4 when the President kicks it off by tell ing you how much he de tests controls, and the nature of the current inflation doesn't lend itself to treatment by even the bestplanned controls and you can't even be sure that the President will still be President when Phase 4 starts?

title: Brokers in City Moving Toward Rise in Fees
description: A combination of Government pressure and eco nomic factors appears to be destroying the uniformity among commissions charged by real estate brokers in the city.

title: Vast Famine Toll Is Feared in Africa by October
description: AZZAL, Niger, June 16Suleman Aji sat in the shade of a palm tree with other Bouzou and Tuareg tribes men until the merciless sun went down last night and this oasis was engulfed in cooling darkness. It was clear that the supply of millet and powdered milk was not com ing from town.

title: Library Group Will Seek Rehearing on Smut Ruling
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 13Officials of the American Library Association, alarmed at a littlenoticed footnote in Thursday's Supreme Court ob scenity decisions, laid plans to day to petition the Court for rehearing for all six cases in volved.

title: Shorter Reviews
description: It's a fact that every Wednes day P.M. in the basement of an outwardly respectable commu ter's home on Long Island coven of naked male and female witches make merry over steaming skull; it's true that there's a similar club in which every member must have served time; and another of 42nd St. freakshow performers; and, of course, there are the Young Lords and Hell's Angels; also a topless cellist who once played her instrument in a balloon over Central Park. Michael Kauf man's pieces about these and other farout creatures ought to be as good as updated O. Henry with a dash of Runyon, but they don't shake down to real people. Although Mr. Kauf man was there, he hasn't found, or communicated, their humanness.

title: Oddities Marked the 11 Assembly Elections Being Investigated by the State
description: The 1972 selections in 11 Assembly districts that are be ing investigated in the state were significant because in each there were circumstances that made them different from the usual election.

title: Sandra B. Etherington Affianced
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., June 23  Mr. and Mrs. Roger B. Etherington of Up per Montclair and Verbank, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sandra Bennett Etherington, to N. Lawrence Aspden 3d, son of N. Law rence Aspden Jr. and Mrs. John F. O'Connor of Wor cester, Pa. A September wedding is planned.

title: What's New at the Movies?
description: O LUCKY MAN!, directed by Lindsay Anderson from a screenplay by David Sher win and starring Malcolm McDowell, Ralph Richard son and Arthur Lowe, got 7 favorable reviews (Kath leen Carroll, News; Archer Winsten, Post; Rex Reed, News; Penelope Gilliatt, New Yorker; Judith Crist, New York; William Wolf, Cue; Jay Cocks, Time), 7 mixed (Frances Taylor, Newhouse Newspapers; Jo seph Gelmis, Newsday; Bernard Drew, Gannett News Service; Andrew Sar ris, Village Voice; Gene Shalit, NBC; Jeffrey Lyons, WPIXTV; Paul D. Zimmer man, Newsweek) and 5 negative (Vincent Canby, Times; Howard Kissel, Wo men's Wear; St anley Kauffmann, New Republic; Robert Hatch, The Nation; John Simon, New Leader).

title: Fay Holden, Actress, Dead; Was Mother in Hardy Films
description: LOS ANGELES, June 23 (UPI)  Fay Holden, who was best remembered for her role as Ma Hardy in Mickey Roo ney's Andy Hardy movies, died today of cancer at the Motion Picture and Television Hos pital. She was 79 years old.

title: Shibatato Defend RingTitle
description: TOKYO, June 23 (AP)Ku niaki Shibata of Japan will de fend the World Boxing Associa tion junior lightweight cham pionship against Ben Villaflor of Honolulu in October, Shi beta's manager, Kenji Yone kura, said today.

title: Slow As a Snail's Pace
description: MOST every garden has its share of stray rabbits which may or may not be considered cute depending upon what they nibble! Miranda, that beautiful black and yellow spider, graces many a summer gar den as it lays in wait for the unwary fly.

title: HOUSINGFUND All IS SOUGHT BY CITY
description: In an approaching showdow with the Nixon Administration City Council leaders said Fri day that they had appealed to New York's Congressional delegation for help in fighting a Federal ultimatum that the city make controversial changes in its construction laws by next Saturday or lose $77.5million in Federal aid.

title: Homosexuals March Down 7th Avenue
description: Singing, chanting, clad in fes tive and arresting garb. thou sands of homosexuals and sup porters of homosexuals rights marched through midManhat tan yesterday, past smiling policemen, wideeyed tourists and blas New Yorkers who passed it off with a liveand letlive shrug.

title: JewishGentile Marriages: As Number Grows So Does Debate
FOOD PROCESSORS PREDICT SHORTAGE
description: WASHINGTON, June 24A number of food processors and canners are raising the specter of food shortages with dis closures over the last few days that they have already cut or are considering cutting delivery of some products because of the Nixon Administration's price freeze.

title: Chess:Korchnoi Korchnoi Victory Expected In Resumption With Torre.
description: LENINGRAD, June 23 Viktor Korchnoi of the Soviet Union, leading the interzonal chess tournament with 101/2 points, adjourned his 15th round game tonight with Eugenio Torre of the Philip pines (Black) in a Benoni Defense that reached an end game. The Leningrad grand master can count on winning when play is resumed to morrow.

title: Six Films Are Seized In Two Jersey Counties
description: Lawenforcement authorities in New Jersey seized four por nographic films in Passaic, and two in Caldwell over the week end as a result of new obscen ity guidelines handed down by the United States Supreme Court.

title: Becky U Registers Upset. In Open Fire Handicap
description: STANTON, Del., June 24 (AP) Mrs. Carl Udouf's Becky U, a member of the mutuel field with Suzi Sunshine, scored an upset victory in today's $32,450 Open Fire Handicap before 15,729 fans at Delaware Park.

title: Queen Due in Canada Today
description: TORONTO, June 24 (UPI) Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip are to arrive here to morrow for a 12day tour of 20 Canadian cities for celebrations marking two 100th anniver sariesthose of the province of Prince Edward Island and of the Royal Canadian Mounted Folice.

title: S. I. Cricketers Lose
description: The St. Thomas Cricket Club defeated the Staten Island C.C. by 81 runs yesterday at Walker Park, Staten Island. The fi nal score was St. Thomas 132 for nine wickets and Staten Island 51 runs.

title: Bill Signed to Let Liquor Be Sold in HalfGallons
description: ALBANY, June 24 (AP) After July 29, or just in time for the hot August days, the sale of halfgallons of liquor will be permitted in New York State.

title: A.M.A. Speaker Declares Manic Phase Helps Gifted
description: The manic phase of the milder forms of manicdepression may be a positive energizer that drives some of the most crea tive and productive overachiev ers in current society, a psychi atrist told an American Medical Association symposium yester day.

title: EVANGELISM HELD NO PERIL TO JEWS
description: A representative group of major and local Jewish human relations agencies said yester day that it did not perceive in the current wave of evan gelistic proselytizing a major threat to the security and in tegrity of the American Jewish community or to Judaism.

title: Personal Finance
description: George Gino and his wife, Emilie, told the United States Tax Court in Newark recent ly that they spend about two hours at home each night preparing for the next day's teaching chores. Mr. Gino teaches drivers education courses and his wife teaches science in a high school.

title: ARIZONA JUDGE BARS FULL FARM BOYCOTT
description: PHOENIX, Ariz,, June 24 (AP) The United Farm Workers Union has been blocked from completely boycotting Safeway Stores, but a Maricopa County Superior Court judge said the union could continue urging customers not to buy grapes and lettuce picked by the members of the teamsters union.

title: MISS ELDER TAKES THIRD SWIM EVENT
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., June 24Kornelia Ender of East Ger many outkicked Shane Gould of Australia in the freestyle leg of the 200meter individual medley today to win her third title in the Santa Clara swimming and diving meet.

title: Mrs. Meadow Marries Here
description: In the BethEl Chapel of Temple EmanuEl yesterday, Mrs. Barbara Meadow of Scarsdale, N.Y., daughter of the Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Peril man and Mrs. Perilman of New York, was married to Dr. Martin Neschis of White Plains, son of Mrs. Irving Naschis of New York and the late Mr. Neschis. The bride's father, who is rabbi of Con gregation EmanuEl, per formed the ceremony.

title: HOUSE ARMS UNIT KEEPS JET FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 The House Armed Services Committee cut up the Defense Department pie last week and left an absent member, Repre sentative O. C. Fisher of Texas, with half a slice.

description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 24President Nixon's willingness to use a Soviet interpreter throughout his private conversations with Leonid I. Brezhnev has raised questions among newsmen and American officials here over whether Mr. Nixon granted his guest an unusual advantage.

title: RACISM IS CHARGED BY FOES IN RUNOFF IN CITY TOMORROW
description: Their scowling faces inches apart and their voices strident with anger, the two candidates in the Democratic mayoral run off traded accusations of rac ism during a raucous, disorder ly town meeting last night.

description: DDr. Norbert Snder of the Millrose Athletic Association won a 20kilometer run spon sored by the Staten Island Ath letic Club yesterday at Clove Lake Park, Staten Island. Sand er covered the course in 1 hour 5 minutes 6 seconds. The Millrose A.A. won the team title.

title: Mrs. Gandhi Leaves Canada; Review of Relations Planned'.
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia, June 24 (UPI)Prime Minister Indira Gandhi of India com pleted a weeklong visit to, Canada today and departed with an agreement between the two Governments to review a range of bilateral relations.

description: Transportation: Coopera tion in the solution of prob lems in transportation in cluding railroads bridges, aviation shipping and auto traffic.

title: LIBRARIANS VOTE SMUT RULING FUND
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 24 Booksellers are already re turning thousands of unsold books to their suppliers for fear of prosecution in the wake of the Supreme Court's new guidelines on obscenity, an executive of the 30,000member American Library Association reported today.

title: Events Today
Work on Nixon Homes Latest in Series of Disputes Over Money in His Political Career
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 The General Services Adminis tration has placed responsibility for the spending of more than $2.2million in public funds to improve President Nixon's per sonal homes on the Secret Service, which has accepted it with a few reservations.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The hard landing early Saturday morning of an Ice landic Airlines jet at Kennedy International Airport that re sulted in the injury of 38 people may have been caused by premature activation of the plane's spoilers, an in vestigator for the National Transportation Safety Board said yesterday. Some of those injured were hurt when the aircraft was evacuated.

description: A powerful retriever, with a, coat of rich gold, added some silver to his owner's rapidly growing store when he was named best of 1,556 dogs at the Staten Island Kennel Club Show on the parade grounds of Fort Wadsworth yesterday.

title: $7.7Billion Spent on Travel Abroad in 1972, U.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (UPI) The Commerce Department said today that 6.8 million Americans spent nearly $7.7 billion on foreign travel last year.

title: NIXON, BREZHNEV END SUMMIT, DECLARE WEEK'S TALKS MOVED WORLD NEARER A STABLE PEACE
description: SAN CLEMENTE Calif., June 24President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev parted today with mutual declarations that their week of talks had moved not only the Soviet Union and the United States but the entire world further toward a durable, stable peace.

description: PLUMELEC, France, June 24 (AP)  Bernard Thevenet won the French cycling champion ship today, covering a 155.mile circuit in 6 hours 26 minutes 25 seconds.

title: Writers Guild Ends A 16Week Walkout Against Producers
description: LOS ANGELES, June 24 (AP) The Writers Guild of Amer ica ended its 16weekold strike against movie and television producers today, voting to ac cept a new contract that will allow production to resume immediately.

title: Folk Fete Mixes Song and Crafts
description: MIDDLETOWN, June 24A spreading grove in Bodman Park was filled with the sound of music and the displays of craftsmen who work in leather, silver, ceramics, wood, and stained glass this weekend at the sixth annual Middletown Folk Festival.

title: Beame's Son Runs the Campaign
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame has long been identi fied with the Brooklyn organization but the man who is running his campaign for the Democratic mayoral nomination in tomorrow's runoff primary is not a pro fessional politician but his 37yearold son, Bernard Beame, better known as Buddy. City Hall The younger Mr. Notes Beame has no title in the cam paign organiza tion and little political ex perience outside his father's three previous campaigns for Controller and Mayor, but he is clearly running the cur rent campaign. City Hall Notes

title: Dance: Of the Philippines
description: The Kayumanggi Philippine Dance Company was formed here in 1968 by Oil Padiernos, formerly a member of a uni versity dance troupe in Manila. Composed of Philip pine residents of the New York area, the group obvi ously takes as its model the wellknown Bayanihan Com pany.

title: Kennedy Road, 41, Gold Cup Victor
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., June 24 Bill Shoemaker scored one of the most satisfying victories of his 24year jockey career today in riding Kennedy Road to a nose victory over Quack in the $150,000 Hollywood Gold Cup.

description: PARIS, June 24France's conservative Minister of Cul ture has picked an avant garde Swedish curator to head a fabulous but as yet nonexistent new museum of modern art here.

title: Weld Takes Net Final
description: WESTFORD, Mass., June 24 (AP)Secondseeded Ned Weld of Weston won his eighth New England men's tennis cham pionship today by defeating Ted Hoehn of Jeffersonville, Vt., 64, 67, 63, 64. The match took place at the Westford Swim and Tennis Club.

title: Biggest Ship Built in U.S. To Be Floated Saturday
description: The largest merchant ship ever to be built in a United States shipyard, the 1,094 foot, 230,000ton tanker Brooklyn is scheduled to be launched Saturday at the Brooklyn Navy Yard. She is under construction there at former Navy facilities taken over by Seatrain ShipbuildingCorporation, a subsidiary of Sea train Lines. The tanker is being built for another Seatrain sub sidiary, Langfitt Steamship Corrporation.

title: Red Smith
description: Many admirers of Secretariat, of Lucien Laurin and or Mrs. John Tweedy feel unhappily that the tinselly work out, Arlington Park has contrived for next Saturday is a comeon unworthy of the horse, his trainer and his owner. They are correct, and Mrs. Tweedy shares their unhappi nen. She has given. her word to deliver the Triple Crown winner to Chicago, and she will keep her promise. The least Arlington can do in return is bend every effort to build the event into a race that Meadow Stable needn't be ashamed to win. For a horse that wins the Belmont Stakes by 31 lengths, there may be no such thing as a suitable encore, but a romp with the hardused Our Native and the barely useful Blue Chip Dan is down right slumming. And if this splendid colt should lose in such company or be injured, it would be a Catastrophe.

title: Lion of Daktari Roams Soviet's Televisionland
description: MOSCOW, June 24  A crosseyed movie lion named Clarence, a policeman who was not swinging a night stick and a decorative weather girl from a southern Califor nia TV station were among the odd bits of Americana included in Soviet television fare last week as the zuthoni ties sought to create an at mosphere in keeping with the BrezhnevNixon summit meet ing.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
Concert
description: One of the many nice things about the Caramoor Music Festival is that it does not play down to the public. In the last 27 seasons of its ex istence, this summer festival on the Westchester County estate of the late Walter and Lucie Rosen has clung reso lutely to artistic standards that attract audiences more interested in fine music than in the grandiosity and hoopla of the larger summer opera tions around the country.

title: Devaluation Draws Waves of MiddleClass Foreign Tourists to U.S.
description: Hundreds of thousands of middleclass foreign tourists are on their way to the United States this summer, their pockets lined with bonus dollars because of de valuation and rising wages abroad.

title: MRS. BERNING'S 207 WINS BY 4 STROKES
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., June 24 (UPI)Mrs. Sue Berning shot a fourunderpar 69 today to win the Heritage Village open by four strokes with a 12under par 207, the lowest 54hole score of the year on the Ladies Professional Golfers Association tour.

title: Quake in Japan Injures
description: TOKYO, June 24 (AP)  Au thorities said that only one person was injured and no major damage was done in the strong earthquake that rocked Hokkaido, the northernmost of Japan's main islands, today. The quake was accompanied by a twofoot tidal wave at Nem uro in the northeast.

title: BURGLARY SUSPECT IS SUICIDE IN LOCKUP

The Government's attempt, only temporarily successful, to close down the conservative but widely respected Santiago newspaper, El Mercurio, for carrying a National Party advertisement accusing Dr. Allende of violating the Constitution, is a case in point.

description: There is no reason for an insurance policy to read like Shakespeare but it does not have to be incomprehensi ble; either in the view of Pennsylvania's Insurance Commissioner Herbert S. Denenberg.

title: Books of The Times
description: Surely every reader must be familiar with the essential details of the famous Donner Party incident. (As Daniel S. Boor stin succinctly summarizes them in his current history, The Americans: The Democratic Experience: In November, 1846, the Donner Party of eightyseven emigrants on their way from Sangamon County, Ill., to California were trapped in deep snow while camp ing at Truckee Lake in the Sierra Nevada moun tains. According to the familiar story, they would all have starved to death, had not the survivors sus taped themselves by eating the flesh of those who had died. The rescue parties from Cali fornia managed to bring out forty seven survivors.

description: MOSCOW, June 24The So viet Union announced today the start of operation of the world's first nuclear station within the Arctic Circle.

description: CAIRO, June 24In uni versities all over the Arab world thousands of young men have just passed their final examinations and are pondering what may be the most vital questions of their lives: whether to go on to graduate school, what career to choose, where to live, whether to marry and start a familyin short, what kind of person to become.

description: FORT McMURRAY, Alberta In a sudden reversal of a traditional trade relationship, Canada is serving notice on her energy starved American neigh bors that they are going to have to look elsewhere for new sources of oil.

Total ship ments for the month amounted to $141.7million, continuing this year's strong growth tread. It was the highest shipping rate for the year to date, and has brought shipments so far in 1973 to $579million.

description: PARIS, June 24Europeans have welcomed the new agree ments between President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev with caution and a certain skepti cism.

title: Chilean Mine CaveIn Kills 3
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 24 (AP)A cavein and fire today in a small copper mine about 30 miles west of the Chilean capital killed three miners. Seven miners were rescued after being trapped, officials said. Policemen said that the fire apparently started in one of the galleries and that the cavein occurred as wooden supports weakened.

title: G.A.O. Finds IllegalAliens Probleni Worsened by Lax Enforcement
description: WASHINGTON, June 24A yearlong study by the General Accounting Office concludes that inadequate enforcement the immigration laws has signi ficantly contributed to the in creasingly serious problem of illegal entries into the United States.

description: Maria Callas, who has not sung in public for eight years, will make a two month recital tour of this country and Canada begin ning next February.

description: STAMFORD, Conn.  During this year, I will be among 1,848,000 Amer icans who will be divorced.

title: 6 Killed in Bus Near Dacca
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 24 (AP)A passenger bus skidded into a ditch in heavy rain, to day near Dacca. Authorities re ported six persons were killed and 75 injured, 14 of them seriously.

title: Philip B. Duffy, ExOfficer Of St. Regis Paper, Was 64
description: PITTSBURGH, June 24  Philip B. Duffy, from 1967 to last January a senior vice pres ident of the St. Regis Paper Company of New York, died, apparently of a heart attack, yesterday afternoon at his home in suburban Fox Chapel Manor, Pa. He was 64 years old.

title: Womack and Temptations Serve Up Ringing Soul
description: Soul actsthe best kind, anywayreally muscle in on, an audience and work them hard. Scarcely a minute goes by without urgent requests to clap hands, say yeah, signify and testify. Bobby Womack, an expert at all this, was forever asking the audience to testify for him on Saturday at Madison Square Garden. It cheerfully complied. Much of Womack's wellreceived material follows the same jabbing patternhe ignored the tune, for instance, on Bessie Smith's Nobody Knows You When You're Down and Outwhich is not some thing you can say about the headliners, the Temptations. Their version of The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face typifies that group's approach: The song is drawn out by the lead singer, Richard Street, while the other four members swoop and glide around him, switching tempo and interject ing phrases. And yet the essen tial mood of the song remains unbrokenno mean feat. They play imaginary basketball games and whirl around in mysterious kung fu gestures but never miss either beat or phrase. It is an impressive vocal and gymnastic perform ance, assuredly confirming the Tempts position as one of the top soulvocal groups.

description: MOSCOW, June 24  Six Jewish scientists declared an end today to their twoweek old hunger strike over Soviet refusal to let them emigrate. They affirmed that they would continue their struggle to leave the Soviet Union.

description: SAARIJARVI, Finland, June 24 (AP)John AkiiBua of Ugan da, the Olympic champion, lunged past Jim Bolding, the United States champion, today and won the 400meter inter mediate hurdles at an inter national track meet. A photo was needed to determine the winner.

title: Dearth of Channels Held Key Problem in TV Study
Search for Suspects in Slaying of Policeman Provides Classic Example of Detective Work
description: The massive police effort to find the four suspects in the slaying of an offduty patrol man three weeks ago was textbook example of detective worka case with no heroes but involving relentless team work.

title: New jersey Sports
description: RIDGEWOOD, June 24Is it hard being married to baseball manager?

title: Trout Farmers in Idaho Beset by New Problems
description: BUHL, Idaho, June 19  It has long been a country gentleman's dream  crystal springs feeding cool water into willowfringed ponds full of rainbow trout, all tucked into an unspoiled canyon, nestled in nature and seemingly exempt from the world's woes.

title: 63 Falls on His Birthday
description: MIDLAND, N.C., June 24 (AP) Joe Biederbecke of Charlotte says he celebrated his 63d birthday yesterday with 63 parachute jumps. On the 59th jump, his main chute failed to open and he fell l,500 feet be fore getting the auxiliary de ployed at 1,000 feet high.

title: CLIFF ABERSON
description: VALLEJO, Calif., June 24 (AP)  Cliff Aberson, who played both professional base ball and football, died yester day after a long illness. He was 51 years old.

title: Services Scheduled Today For Man Slain in Hospital
description: NEPTUNE N.J., June 24 Funeral services will he held to morrow for George Zygmaniak, the 26yearold paralytic who was slain in the Jersey Shore Medical Center here last week after allegedly pleading with his younger brother to kill him.

title: New World Symphony Is Host to Duke
description: The Symphony of the New World, which was founded and continues to flourish as a racially integrated orches tra, had as a guest yesterday afternoon at Philharmonic Hall, that pioneer integrator of jazz and symphonic tradi tions, Edward Kennedy El lington, known in some cir cles as Duke. Mr. Ellington and his big band shared the program with the orchestra, which was under the baton of Everett Lee until Mr. El lington took charge for sev eral of his own compositions.

title: Fundamentalist Plans to Set Up Pirate Radio Station off Jersey
description: CAPE MAY, N. J., June 24 The Rev. Carl McIntire, the controversial fundamentalist minister, said today that he planned to set up Radio Free America, a pirate radio sta tion on a ship anchored three miles off Cape May, and begin broadcasting to the East Coast by July 19.

title: Sacred Music Institute To Open at Yale in 74
description: NEW HAVEN, June 24 (AP)  Yale University will open a multimillion dollar Institute of Sacred Music in Septem ber, 1974, with graduate courses in composing, teach ing and related fields, the university announced today.

title: Flash Fire in New Orleans Kills at Least 32 in Bar
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 24At least 32 persons were re ported killed in a flash fire in a French Quarter bar tonight. Another 15 were injured, nine of them seriously. The figure of 32 dead was not an official estimate, but was reported by an ambulance company that was helping the coroner's staff remove the bodies.

title: Fay. Holden, Actress, 79, Dead; Played Mother of Andy Hardy
description: LOS ANGELES, June 29 (UPI)Fay Holden, known tc a generation of movie buffs as Andy Hardy's mother ir. Mickey Rooney's Andy Hardy series, died yesterday of cancer at the Motion Picture and Tele vision Hospital. She was 7. years old.

title: Shira Adina Nadich Married To James L. Levin, a Student
description: Miss Shira Adina Nadich, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Judah Nadich, was married yesterday afternoon to James Loren Levin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Seymour Levin of Poughkeepsie, N. Y.

title: Hotel's Switch to Medical Center Lags
description: More than a year after the last guest checked out of the New Yorker Hotel to make way for its immediate conversion in to a medical center, the massive structure on Eighth Avenue and 34th Street is still largely empty and essentially unchanged in appearance from that of its 43 years as one of the city's lead ing commercial hotels.

title: U.S. Says Farm Population Gained Slightly Last Year
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (AP) The nation's farm population increased slightly last year, the first time since 1967, but the Government said today that the increase did not appear to be a statistically significant.

title: Mutual Cooperation
description: In his State of the World Message last month President Nixon told Congress he had long been convinced that we needed major improvements in our foreign assistance program. The President cited progress already made toward refocusing bilateral aid into such key areas as population planning, agriculture, health and education. He further stressed the need for increased coordination of aid efforts and for dealing with recipient nations partners.

title: TRADE CONTROLS DRAW A WARNING
description: BASEL, Switzerland, June 24 A confidential working paper of the Organization for Eco nomic Cooperation and Devel opment warns of the danger of a proliferation of trade and market controls that will sooner of later affect world business if nations do not tread carefully during the socalled monetary transition period.

title: OHIO PATH CLEAR IN GOVERNOR RACE
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 24 The Ohio Supreme Court has cleared away a major ob stacle in the comeback trail. former Gov. James A. Rhodes, a Republican, by de claring his only announced competitor, State Senator Donald E. Lukens, a conserva tive, ineligible to run for office until 1978.

title: BLOCK ISLAND FOG DELAYS FEEDERS
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., June 24A fleet of 231 yachts, the largest number in the history of this biennial event, is poised for the first of five days of racing in the Storm Trysail Club's Block Island Week to morrow, providing the weather takes a turn for the better.

title: WEPNER VERDICT IS UNDER REVIEW
description: ATLANTIC CITY, June 24 Chuck Wepner's controversial 12round decision over Ernie Terrell here last night will be reviewed by A. J. Green, the NeW Jersey State Athletic Com mission chairman.

title: A $750,000 CENTER FOR RETARDED OPENS
description: NORWALK, Conn., June 24 A new care center for the men tally retarded from the Fair field County area was opened here today. The $750,000 center was financed by private dona tions.

title: CHOU SUPPORTS KIM ON UNIFICATION ISSUE
description: PEKING, June 24 (Reuters) Premier Chou Enlai tonight expressed full support for the latest proposals of the North Korean leader, Kim Il Sung, for the peaceful reunification of Korea.

title: WALTER F. CHAPPELL, EXNAVY OFFICER, 74
description: WASHINGTON, June 24  Walter Franklin Chappell, a re tired naval officer and State Department official, died today at Sibley Memorial Hospital. He was 74 years old.

title: Gunman in Carolina Slays 2, Wounds 3 AtMilitaryHospital
description: GOLDSBORO, N. C., June 24 (UPI)A young man walked into a military hospital emer gency room today and shot five persons with a semiautomatic rifle, the authorities said. Two of the five persons died.

title: Sculling on the Schuylkill Is a CenturyOld Tradition in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 24 From the grassy banks of the river, sculling on the Schuyl kill is a scene from an Eak ins dream. Gliding under an arched bridge, a long, needle light eight, nimble as a water spider, sweeps past a loafing single, delicate as a thistle.

title: SENATE RENEWS HEARING TODAY; DEAN ON STAND
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 John W. Dean 3d goes before the Senate Watergate committee tomorrow for his first public testimony on the roles of Presi dent Nixon and other high level officials in the bugging of the Democratic National Corn mittee's headquarters last June in the Watergate complex.

title: Oregon Fish Bill Advances
description: SALEM, Ore., June 24 (AP) Oregon would try to regulate commercial fishing for 50 miles offshore under a bill passed by the Mate Senate. The House has passed the bill but the two bodies, must concur on amend ments before it becomes law.

title: Sheraton Sells Some Hotels
description: NIAGARA FALLS, Ontario, June 24, (Canadian Press)A group of Sheraton Hotels at the entrance to the Rainbow Bridge have been sold for an estimated $10million to Arthur White of White Holdings, Ltd., a spokes man for the ITTSheraton Cor poration of America announced.

title: Samuel I. Rosenman, 77, Dies; Coined New Deal for Roosevelt
description: Samuel Irving Rosenman, a State Supreme Court justice who became an influential ad viser to Presidents Franklin D. Roosevelt and Harry S. Truman, died in his sleep early yester day morning at Lenox Hill Hos pital, where he had been ad mitted for treatment of lung congestion and a heart ailment. He was 77 years old.

title: AIR FORCE ACADEMY PLANS P.O.W. CAMP
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (UPI) The Air Force Academy plans to build on its Colorado cam pus a twoacre prisoner of war camp with guard towers, iso lation cells, interrogation rooms and a fenze topped by barbed wire, to train cadets in sur vival and resistance techniques. Officials said there would be no torture, however.

title: Poland Tries to Break BoomBust Cycle
description: WARSAW, June 11Edward Gierek, the Communist chief, has watched Poland go through cycles from repression and economic hardship to street riots and ebullient reforms, and then a slow and despairing slide again into repression and hardship, followed by another outburst of rioting.

title: Fundamentalist Has Plan For Pirate Radio Station
description: CAPE MAY, N.J. June 24  The Rev. Carl McIntire, the controversial fundamentalist minister, said today that he planned to set up Radio Free Anierkca, a pirate radio sta tion on a ship anchored three mile's off Cape May, and begin broadcasting to the East Coast by July 19.

title: DRUG STAND TAKEN BY N.F.L. PLAYERS
description: CHICAGO, June 24 (AP) The National Football League Players Association voted to day to oppose any ownerim posed drug program that it viewed as an invasion of the athlete's privacy.

title: Transcript of Farewell Speech by President and Brezhnev Reply
description: Following as transcribed by The New York Times are President Nixon's farewell speech to Leonid I. Brezhnev at San Clemente yesterday and the translation of Mr. Brezhnev's reply made by Victor M. Sulthodrev the So viet leader's interpreter:

title: City to Cut Parking Space Given to Special Vehicles
description: Special parking privileges in midtown for diplomats, doctors, reporters and the handicapped would be curtailed under plans being formulated by the city's Traffic Department, Transpor tation Administrator Constan tine SidamonEristoff said yes terday.

title: Miriam Scott Married
description: VALLEY STREAM, LI., June 24  Mrs. Miriam Scott Du berstein, a soprano known professionally as Miriam Scott, was married at her home here this afternoon to Carl M. Levine, who is gen eral manager of the Brandt 42d Street theater chain in New York. Rabbi Ralph Sil verstein performed the cere mony. Previous marriages for the couple ended in divorce. Elinor Ross, a Metropolitan Opera soprano, attended the bride. Robert L. Levine was best for his brother.

title: SENATE RENEWS
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 The indirect and sometimes John W. Dean 3d goes before the Senate Watergate committee tomorrow for his first public testimony on the roles of Presi dent Nixon and other high level officials in the bugging of the Democratic National Com mittee's headquarters last June in the Watergate complex.

title: Stritzl's Banana Special Goal Ties Veracruz for Cosmos, 22
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., June 24 Siggy Stritzl, who carried the heaviest load at midfield for the New York Cosmos the last two seasons but had seen limited action because of injuries this season, scared his banana spe cial today to tie Veracruz of Mexico, 22, at Hofstra Stadium before a soccer crowd of 6,805.

title: American Travelers Help To Widen Payments Gap
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 The travel deficit in the nation's balance of payments increased by $600million last year to reach a record level of $32billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: 3 U.S. Women Canoeists Win World Slalom Title
description: MUOTATHAL, Switzerland, June 24 (AP)The United States, which won the Canadian mixed pairs Saturday, added another gold medal in the world canoe championships today with triumph in the women's slalom downstream team event.

title: OHIO PATH CLEAR IN GOVERNOR RACE
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, June 24 The Ohio Supreme Court has cleared away a major ob stacle in the comeback trai of former Gov. James A Rhodes, a Republican, by de claring his only announced competitor, State Senator Donald E.. Lukens, a conserva tive, ineligible to run for office until 1978.

title: Third of A.M.A. Doctors Polled Would Boycott National System
description: A majority of American doc tors are disgruntled by Federal health programs and onethird would boycott a nationalized health system if it were set up, according to a survey of al most 100,000 physicians that was made public yesterday.

title: FOOD PROCESSORS PREDICT SHORTAGE
description: WASHINGTON, June 24A number of food processors and canners are raising the specter of food shortages with dis closures over the last few days that they have already cut or are considering cutting delivery of some products because of the Nixon Administration's price freeze.

title: La Prevoyante, 120, Loses 12Length Lead. Finishes 3d
description: TORONTO, June 24 (Cana dian Press)La Prevoyante, the 120 favorite, finished third yesterday in the $60,325 Cana dian Oaks Stakes at Woodbine. race track,

title: Presley Mixes His Early Hits With More Recent Safe Songs
description: Elvis Presley, onstage in 1973, is the old rock revolu tion made respectable, the machinery taken over, the ap pearance and posture counting as much as the music. Presley at the Nassau Coliseum on Long Island Saturday was safe as milk.

title: PRUDENTIAL FORMS REINSURANCE UNIT
description: The Prudential Insurance Company, the world's largest insurer, disclosed yesterday that it had formed a new sub sidiary, the Prudential Reinsur ance Company.

title: Miss Bacon Has Nuptials
description: ITHAN, Pa., June 24Miss Elizabeth Hope Bacon, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. S. Allen Bacon of Philadelphia, was married here this afternoon to Sanderson Caesar, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry A Caesar 2d of New Canaan, Conn.

title: ISRAELI PRICE FREEZE IS SET FOR 3 MONTH
description: JERUSALEM, June (Reuters)The Israeli Govern ment, in an effort to suppress inflation, announced a three month price freeze today wit immediate effects over im ported and manufactured goods.

title: MONTCLAIR TRIES TO SAVE STATION
description: MONTCLAIR, June 24 Crowds of people came to a twoday 60th birthday cele bration this weekend for the ErieLackaWanna railroad sta tion here as part of an effort to preserve the state and na tional historic site whose exist ence has been threatened by urban renewal.

title: Brian Gibbes Weds Florence Weitzner
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 24Miss Florence Gail Weitzner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence Weitzner of Stamford, Conn., was mar ried here this evening to Brian Peter Gibbes. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Gibbes of Elmsford and Fripp Island, S. C.

title: De Valera Retires Where It All Began in '16
description: Special to The New York TimessDUBLIN, June 24Eamon de Valera ended his public career this evening where he began it 57 years ago: at Boland's bakery, just across from the gasworks.

title: Pearson Triumphs in Motor State 400
description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., June 24 (AP)  David Pearson took the lead with 22 laps to go today and won the National Association of Stock Car Racing's Motor State 400 at Michigan International Speed way.

title: Seaver Defeats Pirates, 52, on EightHitter
description: PITTSBURGH, June 24 As Tom Seaver goes, so go the New York Mets.

title: Children Simulate Horses to Put On Their Own Show
description: OSSINING, N. Y.One of the horses lost a tail in the middle of the ring, called the announcer at the Silver Snaffles 4H Club's horseless horse show the other night. Aw, rats, yelled a boy without a tail.

title: RHODESIA BISHOPS MEETING DISSENT
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, June 24Some Roman Catholics have voiced opposition to a campaign by Rhodesia's bish ops and clergy against recent legislation that they say inter feres with freedom of worship.

title: Radio
description: 8:05.10 A.M., WNCN. Viola Con certo in D, Vivaldi; Polovtsy March from Prince Igor, Boro din; Trio in B flat (G. 154), Beethoven; La Poupee de Nurem berg: Overture, Adam; Antar: Symphonic Suite, RimskyKor sakov; Symphony No. 5, Men delssohn.

title: Soviet Says Brezhnev Met U.S. Communists
description: MOSCOW, June 24  The Soviet Union disclosed today that Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party chief, met in Washington Friday with leaders of the United States Communist party.

title: Samuel I. Rosenman, 77, Dies; Coined New Deal for Roosevelt
description: Samuel Irving Rosenman, State Supreme Court justice who became an influential ad viser to Presidents Franklin D. Roosevelt and Harry S. Truman, died in his sleep early yester day morning at Lenox Hill Hos pital, where he had been ad mitted for treatment of lung congestion and a heart ailment. He was 77 years old.

title: Israeli Draws 10 Years for Contact With Al Fatah
description: TEL AVIV, June 24The son of a member of the Israeli Par liament was sentenced today to 10 years in jail for having had contacts with an agent of Al Fatah, the Arab guerrilla organization.

title: LEAHY'S RITES DRAW MANY OF HIS STARS
description: PORTLAND, Ore., June 24 (UPI)Frank Leahy, the/former football coach of the University of Notre Dame, was buried in Mount Calvary Cemetery here yesterday after a requiem mass in St. Mary's Chapel attended by many friends and proteges, Mr. Leahy died Thursday at the age of 64.

title: EDWIN C. EWALD
description: Edwin Coyne Ewald, an exec utive in the contract division of W. & J. Sloane, Inc., before his retirement several years ago, died yesterday at Bellevue Hospital after a heart attack. He was 73 years old and lived at 541 Madison Avenue.

title: Colonial Battle Is Restaged on S.I.
description: King George's troops and the American colonists fought it out again over the week end as the Brigade of the American Revolution staged an 18thcentury encampment and tactical demonstration at the Richmondtown Restora tion on Staten Island the white flag.

title: Devaluation Draws Waves of MiddleClass Foreign Tourists to U.S.
description: Hundreds of thousands of middleclass foreign tourists are on their way to the United States this summer, their pockets lined with bonus dollars because of de valuation and rising wages abroad.

title: Solomon and Sheba Provide Inspiration For Harlem Opera
description: Solomon and Sheba, those two lustful Biblical rulers, hay( provided ideal material for composers over the years, but they have probably never beer so charmingly recreated as it the AfroAmerican Singing The ater production of Sam Rivers'; improvisational opera, Solo mon and Sheba. Presented by the Harlem Opera Society at the Clark Center Auditorium, the opera received perform. antes last Saturday and Sunday nights.

title: CLAUDE C. REECK
description: WEST LAFAYETTE, Ind., June 24 (AP)  Claude C. Reeck, who retired as. Purdue University wrestling coach in, 1968, died at Home Hospital here yesterday. He was 71 years old.

title: Freedom and Obscenity
description: The Supreme Court has reversed its previous stand on the nature and permissibility of pornography. Chief Justice Burger underscored the deliberate break with previous standards by prefacing the delivery of a series of 5to4 rulings with the observation that a majority of the Court had for the first time in sixteen years agreed on concrete guidelines to isolate hard core pornography from expression protected by the First Amendment. The dissenting justices, however, view this decision not as a judicial triumph but as an invita tion to stateordered regimentation of our minds.

title: Millionaire, 28, Plays Host to 90 At Bridal Afloat
description: Steven Levy, a 28yearold brokerage executive reputed to be one of the few self made millionaires younger than 30, yesterday married Michele Guechgache aboard the Copy Cat, a recreation of the paddlewheelers that plied, the Mississippi River during the eighteeneighties.

title: Belfast Man Shot Dead Answering Door Knock
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, Monday, June 25 (UPI) A gunman shot and killed a man when he answered a. knock at his door late last night in a Protestant neigh borhood of Belfast.

title: World Bank Plans Loan
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (UPI)The World Bank said it would lend $32.5million to the East African Poshs and Tele communications Corporation operated jointly by Kenya, Tan zania and Uganda.

title: FIGHT ON TO SAVE A SUBURBAN LAKE
description: LEWISBORO, N. Y., June 24 Five years ago, Wayne Van Tassell, a school principal in Somers, began to notice changes in Lake Waccabuc, one of three lakes clustered near here in the northern part of Westchester County.

title: Bridge: Methods of Signaling Help The Italian Players to Win
description: One small factor contribut ing to the Italian successes at the highest level is that their methods of signaling are more sophisticated than those of their rivals. The rank of the card, high or low, is not the only consi derationeven spot cards are given one meaning, and odd spot cards another.

title: Brezhnev Leaves the West On a Note of Informality
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., June 24Shortly before he left the Western White House today, Leonid I. Brezhnev received gift of two Colt.45 sixshoot ers and a cowboy hat from the Western actor Chuck Connors.

title: Randalle Smith Is Wed
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 24  Miss Randalle Elizabeth Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ving Smith of New Rochelle, was married here this after noon to Stephen Thomas Austin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Fletcher Austin of Glenview, Ill, The Rev. Dr. Harold San som performed the ceremony in the Unitarian Church.

title: Issue and Debate
description: With an increasing number of Wall Street firms facing financial trouble, the bread and butter issue of broker age fees is now on the line. Hundreds of millions of dol lars In annual commission revenues are at stake.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: The Sun King
description: LONDON, June 24The American Presidency has grown so dramatically in powttr over this last generation in part because of the facts of interna tional life. Leonid Brezhnev's visit to the United States has demonstrated as much.

title: RATE RISES SEEN IN BOND MARKED
description: Interest rates seem headed still higher over the next month or two before peaking out at levels shy of the records set in 196970, Wall Street market men and economists agree. Longterm rates, now about 7 Per cent for tripleA Bell System securities, are not ex pected to be very much over 8 per cent. In mid June, 1970, New Credit Jersey Bell mar Markets keted an issue re turning 9.35.

title: BABY CHICKS KILLED AND COOKED FOR FEED
description: JOAQUIN, Tex., June 24 (UPI)Workers at the East Texas Hatchery here drowned and cooked 43,000 newly hatched chicks yesterday so that they could be ground into chickenfeed.

title: The Yonlanders
description: MISSOULA, Mont.Montana, like the rest of the Rocky Mountain states, is presumably undergoing rapid urban ization but all things are relative. The fact is that the state is huge (147,000 square miles) and people rattle around in its enormity because there are only 4.7 persons per square mile. None of Montana's cities has yet reached 60,000.

title: EMIL N. HADDAD
description: Emil N. Haddad, a private investment consultant for 20 years, died Wednesday of I heart attack, He was 49 years old and lived at 5 Tudor City Place,

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Retail clerks and the management of Two Guys dis count department stores reached a tentative agreement yesterday to end a twoweeklong strike at 48 stores on the East Coast.

title: Roundup: Blue Spins a 70 Smoke Ring
description: When Vida Blue pitches well and wins, as he did yes terday, talk is revived of his showing signs of returning to his spectacular form of 1971. He posted a 248 won lost record that year, had a 1.82 earnedrun average and was one of the biggest at tractions in baseball.

title: Beat Tigers, 32 and 21, Before 62,107 Here
description: With 62,107 screaming fans supplying the inspiration and Gene Michael and Graig Nettles the gamewinning hits, the Yankee juggernaut rolled on yesterday, completing a sweep of a fivegame series with the Detroit Tigers and a seven game stand with 32 and 21 victories.

title: Group Excludes Women
description: ATLANTA, June 24 (AP)A proposal to open the member ship of Sertoma International to women was defeated at the organization's 50th convention here. The club's name is de rived from its themeservice to mankind.

title: PHNOM PENH GETS SUPPLIES BY TRU}
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia June 24 (UPI)A 200truck supply convoy reached Phnon Penh from the seaport of Kom pong Som last night without meeting resistance from Com munist forces, the Cambodia] command said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
Chief Judge
description: The least qualified of the four candidates in the Demo cratic primary for the highest judicial office in the State of New Yorkchief judge of the Court of Appealshas been finally named winner, by 755 votes out of nearly 800,000 cast.

title: Janet Zetkov Married
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y., June 24 St. Theresa Roman Catholic Church was the set ting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Janet Lynne Zetkov to John David Almstead. The Rev. Forbes J. Monahan performed the ceremony. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs, Thomas Edward Zetkov of Briarcliff Manor and Mr. and Mrs. Harold Storm Almstead of Pleasantville.

title: TRANSIT POLICEMAN KILLS MAN IN QUEENS
description: An off duty transit patrol man shot and killed a 22yearold man who, the police said, had assaulted him in the early morning hours yesterday in a Queens subway station.

title: Violent Drug Raids Against the Innocent Found Widespread
description: WASHINGTON, June 24In nocent Americans around the country have been subjected to dozens of mistaken, violent and often illegal police raids by lo cal, state and Federal narcotics agents in search of illicit drugs and their dealers.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev, at Mr. Nixon's home in San Clemente, Calif., parted with mutual declarations that their week of talks had moved not only the Soviet Union and the United States but the entire world toward a durable, stable peace. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: News Summary and Index MONDAY, JUNE 25, 1973
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Sculling on the, Schuylkill: CenturyOld Tradition in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 24From the grassy banks of the river, sculling on the Schuyl kill is a scene from an Eak ins dream. Gliding under an arched bridge, a long, needle light eight, nimble as a water spider, sweeps past a loafing single, delicate as a thistle.

title: Andrew Price Weds Michelle J. Schwartz
description: Miss Michelle Janet Schwartz, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. George Schwartz of Brooklyn, was married yes terday afternoon to Andrew N. Price, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin F. Price of Pleas antville, N. Y. The civil cere mony took ,place at La Per ville in Brooklyn.

title: Free Phone for Complaints
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., June 24 (AP)Gov. Milton J. Shapp said today that a tollfree telephone line to his office was being set up for Pennsylvanians who have problems with state gov ernment.

title: A Greek Royalist Group Urges Military to Overthrow Regime
description: ATHENS, June 24A royalist underground grout) calling it self Free Greeks called upon the Greek military today to use its arms to revolt against the armybacked Government.

title: City to See Youngsters Of Bolshoi
description: Tomorrow night, dancers of the Bolshoi Ballet will open a month's season at the Metropolitan Opera House. It will not be the full com panyfor the Bolshoi is also appearing in Japan during this periodand there will be no major productions. But there will be one significant difference between this and the Bolshoi appearances in the past.

title: ROGERS SAYS PACT COVERS WIDE SCOPE
description: WASHINGTON, June 24 (Reu ters)Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers said tonight that the agreement to avoid force signed by the Soviet Union and the United States on Friday applied to conventional as well as nuclear conflicts.

title: Form For Business Tax Is Simplified by State
description: TRENTON, June 24 (UPI) Some 50,000 small corpora tions may be eligible to fill out their business tax re turns on a simplified form this year, the State Division of Taxation said.

title: Violent Drug was Against the Innocent Found Widespread
description: WASHINGTON, June 24In nocent Americans around the country have been subjected to dozens of mistaken, violent and often illegal police raids by lo cal, state and Federal narcotics agents in search of illicit drugs and their dealers.

title: SPINDLETOP SIN CITY VICTOR IN JUMPOFF
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., June 24Spindletop Sin City, with Tony D'Ambrosio Jr. riding, won the Johnson park Special for jumpers against 33 rivals today at the closing ses sion of the fourday Middlesex County Horse Show.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Check off anotherfashion fad that died just as it was beginning to crawl. Tortoise shellthe real stuff, that is used for jewelry is likely to come from the hawksbill turtle, a species listed by the Federal Endangered Species Conservation Act of 1969.

title: Terminal's Night Closing to Disrupt Lives
description: Two job printers, both reg ular postmidnight commut ers on the Penn Central, are about to be squeezed off the railroad and into the used car market. Another rider may quit his job as a dinner time violinist at a midtown restaurant. And a cab driver will be forced to catch an earlier train back to West chester County before earn ing his nightly goal of $50.

title: Crampton Wins at Akron, Leads in Golf Earnings
description: Bruce Crampton won the Amer ican Golf Classic today for his fourth tour victory of the year and became the year's leading moneywinner after receiving AKRON, Ohio, June 24 $32,000 as his share of the $160,000 purse.

title: Peron Has Friendly Meeting With an Old Political Enemy
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 24 (UPI)Former President Juan D. Peron met with his old political opponent Ricardo Bal bin, head of the Radical party, for two hours today in what was described by Mr. Balbin as a climate of cooperation.

title: Italians Enjoy Yet Another Cabinet Interregnum
description: ROME, June 25Italians are once again savoring the familiar joys of having no cabinetwell, almost noneand hardly seem eager to get a new one quickly.

title: Witness Tells of Efforts To Block Senate Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, June 25President Nixon and his top White House aides, expressing fear of the uncontrollable, if not hostile, forum of the Sen ate, repeatedly attempted to ob struct and delay the proposed Senate Watergate investigation early this year, John W. Dean 3d testified today.

title: Excursion Steamer Agrees To Follow Pollution Guides
description: The excursion steamer Bay Belle, which carries up to 2,400 passengers daily on trips up the Hudson River, has agreed to in stall pollutioncontrol devices, Attorney General Louis J. Lef kowitz announced yesterday.

title: Bridge: A Minor Suit and Little Else Brings 3NoTrump Opening
description: Some modern conventions can result in the contract being played from an abnor mal side of the table. An ex ample is the gambling three notrump opening, based on a long solid minor suit and little else. The other players can often work out which suit the opening bidder has and adjust their actions ac cordingly.

title: JOHN E. DAHLQUIST
description: John E. Dahlquist, former president of the Swedish Amer ican Athletic Club in Brooklyn and secretary of the John Erics son Society, died Sunday at the Jewish Hospital in Brooklyn. He was 74 years old and lived at 209 Underhill Avenue, Brook lyn.

title: Ziegler, Two Others Implicated by Dean In CoverUp Effort
description: WASHINGTON, June 25At least three present or former White House staff members, in addition to those long linked to the Watergate scandal, were implicated in the coverUp of, the case today by John W. Dean 3d.

title: Ruble Diplomacy
description: During his entire visit here, Leonid I. Brezhnev repeat edly underlined his enormous interest in largescale American credits for the longterm development Siberia's resources. It remained for Mr. Brezhnev's pub lic spokesman, Leonid I. Zamyatin, head of Tass, underline the political significance of what the Soviet leader had in mind.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Mixed at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, June 25Yields on United States Treasury bills moved in op posite directions in the Gov ernment's weekly competi tive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: DR. G. H. B. NICHOLSON
description: Dr, Gertrude Halcro Brown Nicholson, pediatrician and car diologist died Sunday in St. Luke's Hospital Center. Her age was 80. She lived at 55 East 76th Street.

title: Tracks Here in T.R.A.
description: Fewer than half the flat tracks in North America are members of the Thoroughbred Racing Associations, a 58 member group that has as its protective arm the Thorough bred Racing Protective Bureau.

title: Commodity Prices Rise; Latest Freeze a Factor
description: Prices of cattle, hogs, poultry and their byproducts rose sharply yesterday on the big Chicago commodities ex changes.

title: Philip Rhinelander 2d Dies; Owned Real Estate Firm
description: Philip Rhinelander 2d, who retired in 1962 as board chair man of the Rhinelander Real Estate Company, died yester day at Roosevelt Hospital. His age was 78 and he lived at 580 Park Avenue.

title: Secretariat to Race Saturday at Arlington Park
description: Secretariat had a gallop around the main track at Bel mont Park yesterday, an ac tivity that took on much im portance as it marked a step toward the next race for the people's horse, the $125,000 Invitation at Arlington Park outside Chicago this Saturday.

title: Tender Offer Is Planned By Greyhound Corp. Unit
description: The Greyhound Leasing & Financial Corporation, a unit of the Greyhound Corporation, said yesterday that it intended to make a cash tender offer of $4.50 a share for shares of its subsidiary, the Greyhound Computer Corporation.

title: ArgentinaEast German Tie
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 25 (AP)  Argentina and East Germany established formal diplomatic relations tonight. East Germany was the second Communist country to be recog nized by the new Peronist Government ,which took office here May 25. The first was Cuba. President Hector J. Campora has said his adminis tration also plans to establish relations with North Korea and North Vietnam.

title: 10 Tourists Defied a Ban
description: The American swimmers and divers who toured China did not receive approval from the International Swimming Federation, which prohibits even exhibitions in nonmember countries. However, all the Americans have said that they do not intend to compete further in international events so the threat of disciplinary action is academic.

title: WHITE HOUSE BARS REPLY TO CHARGES
description: SAN CLEMENTE Calif., June 25The White House said to day President Nixon would have no comment this week on charges by John W. Dean 3d that the President was in volved in the coverup of the Watergate case.

title: Thousands Questioned in Search for Coed's Slayer
description: MINEOLA, L. I., June 25Thousands of people have been questioned by the police in six states in the search for the slayer of Patricia Ann Sullivan, a student at the C. W. Post Center of Long Island Univer sity, Edward F. Curran Nassau County chief of detectives, said today.

title: EDWARD MITTON, 77, OF JORDAN MARSH CO.
description: NEWTON, Mass., June 25 (AP)  Edward R. Mitton, for mer president and board chair man of the Jordan Marsh Com pany, died today at his home here. He was 77 years old.

title: Warrant Issued for Hecht in Vase Sale
description: Italian authorities have is sued a warrant for the arrest of Robert E. Hecht Jr., the American expatriate who sold a 2,500yearold Greek vase to New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art last year for $1 million.

title: Fiat Sells Citroen Shares
description: TURIN, Italy June 25 (UPI) In a joint announcement Fiat Auto Works of Italy, the world's largest auto maker outside Detroit and Citroen of France, said today that Fiat had sold its 49 per cent in terest in Pardevi, the holding company which controls Cit roen, to the Michelin Tire Company, which held the re maining 51 per cent.

title: HOUSE APPROVES CUTOFF OF FUNDS TO BOMB CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, June 25The House of Representatives, in its strongest antiwar action to date, voted today to cut off all funds for United States bomb ing in Cambodia.

title: New Snag Delays an Agreement On Vietnam Prisoner Exchange
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, June 25 (Reuters)An agree ment on plans to exchange military and civilian prisoners was announced today by the Vietcong after a meeting with Saigon Government representa tives. But a new deadlock soon developed, and further talks on the issue were scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Aleksei A. Lyapunov, 61, Soviet Mathematician, Dies
description: MOSCOW, June 25Aleksei A. Lyapunov, a mathematician, died here Saturday at the age of 61. An innovator in mathe matical education, Mr, Lyapu nov helped found an experi mental school for gifted children in mathematics and physics in the Siberian science city of Novosibirsk.

title: PETERSEN CALLED CONDUIT FOR DATA
description: WASHINGTON, June 25 Henry E. Petersen, while head of the Justice Department's criminal investigation of the Watergate case, passed infor mation on grand jury testi mony to the White House and arranged for high White House aides to be questioned outside the presence of the grand jurors, the Senate's Watergate committee was told today.

title: bjector's Case Assigned To Naval Records Board
description: The case of the Navy's re ?? to grant a conscientious objector an undergraduate de gree is expected to come up soon before the Navy's Board for the Correction of Naval Records.

title: 3 Convicts Release 4 Hostages Unhurt After 17 Hours and Get Transfer
description: EDDYVILLE, Ky., June 25 (AP)Three young convicts won a temporary transfer to a lessstrict prison today af ter they released four hos tages they had held for 17 hours in the Kentucky State Penitentiary.

title: Donald Harper, 36, Director Of Arts Council Programs
description: Donald Harper, director of special programs for the New York State Council on the Arts, died yesterday in a hospital in Downey, Ill., after a long Hi tless. He was 36 years old.

title: HOUSE APPROVES CUTOFF OF FUNDS TO BOMB CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, June 25The House of Representatives, in its strongest antiwar action to date, voted today to cut off all funds for United States bomb ing in Cambodia.

title: Furniture Trade Rides Cycle's Crest
description: After a decade of nowup, nowdown fortunes, the do mestic furniture industry is on the crest of an up cycle. The symptoms are heavy factory backlogs, sharply in creased prices instituted be fore the recent freeze, and, unfortunately for the con sumer, longer delivery delays than ever.

title: Jersey Democrats Vow To Reform State Taxes
description: TRENTON, June 25  Bren dan T. Byrne, the Democratic candidate for Governor, pledged himself and his party today to a tax reform program that almost certainly would include a state income tax to resolve the constitutional crisis sur rounding the financing of pub lic schools in New Jersey.

title: Karpov Overtakes Korchnoi to Share Lead in Interzonal
description: LENINGRAD, June 24Ana toly Karpov of the Soviet Union overtook his compatriot Viktor Korchnoi today to share the lead in the Interzonal Tourna ment. He did so by winning his pawn ahead rook and knight against rookandbishop ending with Svetozar Gligoric of Yugo slavia and accepting the resig nation of the Yugoslav Josip Rukavina without play.

title: Mayors on the March
description: SAN FRANCISCOIt was a slight ly irreverent story that Mayor Moon Landrieu of New Orleans told to set the theme for the annual meeting of the United States Conference of Mayors held here last week. The story suggests the skepticism of the meet ing.

title: MAJOR POLITICIAN KILLED IN ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Tuesday, June 26 (AP) Paddy Wilson, a leading Rom an Catholic politician, was assassinated early today and his body left in a car beside that of a murdered woman.

title: Billon Housing for Elderly Is Vetoed by Rockefeller
description: ALBANY, June 25Governor

title: Coin Exchange Held Up
description: A lone gunman held up a Rockefeller Center coin ex change yesterday and fled with about $16,000, the police reported. The gunman entered the groundfloor offices of Manfra, Tordello & Brookes on West 49th Street, and forced six persons to lie face down on the floor. He took the cash from several drawers and a safe.

title: Fleming Wins Jersey Title
description: ARLINGTON, N. J., June 25 Peter Fleming, an 18yearold junior, won the New Jersey State men's tennis champion ship yesterday by defeating Steve Ross of Brooklyn, the de fender, in the final, 2.6, 64, 63. In the morning semifinals Fleming, from Chatham, beat Art Carrington of Elizabeth, 6.2, 36, 6.4.

title: Bernstein Lauds U.S. Ensemble Presenting His Mass in Vienna
description: VIENNA, June 25 (Reuters)Leonard Bernstein choked back tears under a barrage of con gratulations tonight after the European premiere of his pro vocative Mass.

title: Sports Today
DEAN TELLS INQUIRY THAT NIXON TOOK PART IN WATERGATE COVERUP FOR EIGHT MONTHS; HE ALSO NAMES HALDEMAN AND EHRLICHMAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 25 John W. Dean 3d, asserting that President Nixon had failed to heed a warning that the Watergate case was a cancer growing on the Presidency, testified today that the Presi dent had taken part in, the Watergate coverup for as long as eight months.

title: Ziegler,Two Others Implicated by Dean In CoverUp Effort
description: WASHINGTON, Tune 25At least three present or former White House staff members, in addition to those long linked to the Watergate scandal, were implicated in the coverup of the case today by John W. Dean 3d.

title: Warrant Issued for Hecht in Vase Sale
description: Italian authorities have is sued a warrant tor the arrest of Robert E. Hecht Jr., the American expatriate who sold a 2,500yearold Greek vase to New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art last year for $1million. The warrant charges Mr. iecht with purchasing the vase, a calyx krater by the master painter Euphronios, in violation of Italian law and with exporting it illegally from Italy.

title: PENN CENTRAL SAYS U.S. SUIT IS WEIGHED
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 25 (AP) The Penn Central Company, parent company of America's biggest railroad that threatens to shut down this summer if it does not get massive financial help, wants to sue the United States for taking private prop erty for public use.

title: Big Underground Coal Mine To Open in Alabama in 1975
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 25 (UPI)  A major underground coal mine, producing about million tons annually, will be gin operation in Alabama by November, 1975, officials of two companies said today.

title: Private School Aid in State Upset by Supreme Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 25 The Supreme Court struck down today as unconstitutional four programs of Governor Rockefeller and the New York Legislature to provide financial assistance to private schools, principally those of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Quotas Reallocated by U.S. For 1973 Imports of Sugar
description: WASHINGTON, June 25 (UPI)The Agriculture Depart ment announced today it has proclaimed a deficit in the 1973 sugar supply quota for the West Indies and Haiti and has reallocated to other coun tries the 67,891 tons of quota sugar which the two Caribbean countries will be unable to ship.

title: Writer Responsibility
description: PHILADELPHIAThe Nixon speech writers, it appears, like to be heard in their own name.

title: BANKER DENIES GUILT IN G.O.P. FUND CASE
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 25Blagden H. Wharton, treasurer of a Republican fundraising committee in Maryland, pleaded not guilty today to charges that he filed false financial reports on a dinner honoring Vice President Agnew.

title: CENTRAL MARKET ASSAYED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, June 25  A member of the Securities and Exchange Commission warned stock exchanges and thirdmar ket makers today against du plicating existing hardware and communications equipment for reporting lastsale prices in the projected central market sys tem.

title: Sweden Upsets Brazil
description: STOCKHOLM, June 25 (UPI)Roland Sanberg led Sweden to a 10 victory over the world champion, Brazil, in an exhibi tion soccer game tonight. Sand berg hit the winner in the 79th minute.

title: Hotel Worker Is Sought In Threat to President
description: MIAMI, June 25 (AP)The Secret Service said to day it was seeking a former Miami hotel worker with a history of mental illness for threatening the life of Presi dent Nixon.

title: PHILIP DANA HOLDEN
description: Philip Dana Holden, a re tired investment banker, died yesterday in Stamford Hospi tal after a brief illness. He was 64 years old and lived in New Canaan and Old Black Point, Conn.

title: Few Mercy Killers Draw Full Penalties
description: Robert Waskin's mother was in a Chicago hospital dying of leukemia. One day in 1967, just before he was to graduate from college, he went to her room and fired three shots. He made no attempt to hide his action, saying; She's out of her misery now. I shot her.

title: New Effects Theater Designed to Dazzle Senses
description: A special theater, rigged un like any other in the city, wil open here by midSeptembe to house a new form of enter tainment in which most of fill senses will be saturated with effects, beyond their capacity to take them in.

title: JERSEY SUSPENDS FIGURE IN INQUIRY
description: Herbert J. Relkin, the former Queens Liberal whose role in a suspected votesiphoning scheme is under investigation by New York State officials, was suspended yesterday from his job as an accountant with the New Jersey State govern ment.

title: MRS. GORDON M'LINTOCK
description: WASHINGTON, June 25Mrs. Wynne Russell McLin Lock, wife of Vice Adm. Gor don McLintock, former super intendent of the Merchant Marine Academy at Kings Point, L. I., died yesterday at Georgetown University Hospi tal. Her age was 70.

title: Banker Gets Seven Years
description: BOSTON, June 25 (AP) Daniel D. Moore, former presi dent of the defunct Surety Bank and Trust Company in Wakefield, was sentenced to seven years in Federal prison today after pleading guilty to misuse of $8.1million in bank money. He is 40 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Food boycotts failed to bring down high prices. Price controls are needed stopgap. But this and pressure on the Federal Reserve to tighten credit and raise interest rates are of only temporary benefitpalliatives, not a cure. It is time we dig deeper to find what is behind high prices.

title: FLORIDA GAS WEIGHS PIPELINE EXTENSION
description: The Florida Gas Company said yesterday it was investi gating the possibility of adding to its TexastoFloridanatural gas pipeline to develop a new petroleumproducts pipeline.

title: Arson Suspected in Deaths of 29 in New Orleans Bar
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 25The police were investigating today the possibility of arson by a disgruntled bar customer in a French Quarter fire that killed 28 men and a woman last night.

title: Appeal at Helsinki Parley Asked for Soviet Historian
description: MOSCOW, June 25 (UPI) The wife of Andrei A. Amalrik, an imprisoned Soviet historian, has appealed to East and West European leaders to consider her husband's case at the Euro pean Security Conference opening in Helsinki July 3.

title: BREZIINEV LEAVES U. S. FOR FRANCE
description: WASHINGTON, June 25 Leonid I. Brezhnev's visit to the United States ended today with a joint communique extolling his talks with President Nixon as a further milestone to ward a major improvement in relations but indicating that, in such areas as the Middle East, differences remained.

title: News Summary and Index
description: John W. Dean 3d, asserting that President Nixon had failed to heed a warning that the Watergate case was a cancer growing on the Presidency, told the Senate Watergate committee that the President had taken part in the Watergate coverup for as long as eight months. Mr. Dean, who had been dis missed as the White House counsel, said that he still clung to a belief that Mr. Nixon did not realize or appreciate at any time the implications of his involvement. Mr. Dean read a 245page statement to the com mittee about his role and that of others in the Watergate case; taking almost all day. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Radio
description: 8:0510 A.M., WNCN. Trumpet Sonata in D, Torelli; Lisle Joy euse, Debussy; Le Cid: Ballet, Massenet; Le Calife de Bagdad: Overture, Boieldieu; Serenade in E for Strings (Op. 22), Dvorak; Cantata Comica, Paisiello.

title: Brezhnev's TV Speech Stirred Strong Reaction From Viewers
description: A large number of people wanted him off the air because he was a Communist, One man thought it a sign of peace and said he was a lot better than Stalin or the man who waved his boots.

title: Canada's Payments Deficit Widened in the Quarter
description: OTTAWA, June 25 (Reuters) Canada's balance of payments showed a seasonally adjusted deficit of $293million in the first quarter, up from a $53 million deficit in the fourth quarter last year and a deficit of $304million in the yearago period, Statistics Canada report ed today.

title: Equity Financing
description: The McDonald's Corporation postponed yester day a secondary offering of about 600,000 common shares announced on May 17, with a market value of about $36.1million, due to general market con ditions. The hamburger chain's stock closed at 53 down 2 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Orthodox Jews Scored on Rivalry
